name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Seven Ronin
description:
Seven masterless samurai join forces to defend the innocent.

The characters represented in this box are designed to be used together in games of Test of Honour, and if commanded well they form a powerful force. However, they are armed only with swords, and so can be vulnerable to bow fire and muskets.

For a particularly characterful battle, we recommend you use only the Skill cards in this box to form your Fate deck.

Box contains 18 gaming cards for Test of Honour and 7 metal character miniatures plus bases.

Miniatures supplied unpainted and unassembled.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Blood Red Skies: Allied Ace Pilot – Witold Urbanowicz
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes RAF Polish ace pilot Witold Urbanowicz and additional accessories to add to the core game.

Witold Urbanowicz flew with the RAF and was a Polish fighter ace of the Second World War. According to the official record, Witold Urbanowicz was the second highest-scoring Polish fighter ace, with 17 confirmed wartime kills and 1 probable, not counting his pre-war victory. He was awarded with several decorations, among others the Virtuti Militari and British Distinguished Flying Cross.

Components included in this expansion are:
1 Hawker Hurricane aircraft
1 Advantage Flying Base
1 Aircraft Card
2 Aircraft Trait Cards
2 Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Witold Urbanowicz Ace Card
2 Ace Skill Cards
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ritter Trenk: Erbsenschiessen mit Thekla
description:
In this game of skill from the Knights Trenk universe, players have to balance two green balls (peas) into the appropriate holes using four different cards of each color (red, blue, yellow, green). If you have met one of the people on the card with the peas (the balls holed), you get the card. Otherwise, the next player's turn. If you have all four cards of a color at the end, you have won.

—user summary

name: Adventure Party: Les Compagnons du Roi Norgal
description:
Adventure Party is an initiation role-playing game whose scenarios will fascinate all ages. To discover with friends or family.

Save the realm of evilness, roam the legendary sites in search of elemental treasures, visit the empire above the clouds to complete the forgotten quest, resist the oppressor and rescue the king ... Answer the call of adventure!

In Adventure Party: The Companions of King Norgal, choose your character and go on an adventure: Thorin the dwarf warrior, Ithilienne the elf archer, Oloris the magician, Ser Eldarion the knight, Ikanne the spy and many others.

Adventure Party offers cooperative scenarios: in each plot, the group of players is entrusted with a mission that he can not accomplish without helping each other. The game will be successful if this quest succeeds and all characters survive.

—user summary

name: Robot Barbarossa:  Russian Front 1941
description:
This would be a very conventional 11 hexes Warsaw to Moscow monthly turns corps-to-army level Barbarossa game ... except for its either-way solitaire and unknown OVERALL Russian tank and strengths and order of battle mechanic, which can throw either Axis or Russian plans and play to the wind.

Before the game, you sort the Infantry and Tank units into 3 separate upside-down/secret arrays each and pull one each out (not knowing which one) so you have left (for each branch):

a Strong + Weak = Medium - "Historical," sort of :-) - overall or
a Medium + Weak = Weak overall or
a Strong + Medium = Strong overall strength.

OR you can just blindly Bell-Curve select 36 (of the 54) Russian rifle/infantry armies and 18 (of the 27) tank/mechanized korps and tally up their strengths at the end of the game to find out how strong over all they *were*.

Of course, in one game the tanks may be Strong and the infantry Weak, etc., etc.
And even a live Russian player doesn't get to know his overall infantry strength until the game is over ... although after the 4th or 5th month he may have a good idea.

At the end of the game when the strengths are discovered (and/or suspicions confirmed) compensatory victory points are awarded if the Russians are found to have been Strong or Weak in their rifle/infantry and/or tank forces.

The point of this being that the Axis historically didn't know the overall strength(s) of the Russian units when they invaded - how hard to push and take risks - and an Axis (or Russian) player shouldn't in a Barbarossa *game* either.

There are 3 army group - Army Group North, Army Group Center, and Army Group South - and front - Northern, Western, Southwestern - sectors, to keep the robots' advancing/attacking and defending operations in line. A team can therefore be as many as 3 (cooperating) players.

It still can be a good little 2-player (or 2-team) game or you could even have the game play itself and move the pieces for it. :-)

(Writing the rules - Robot Directives - for a solitaire hex-and-counter game is VERY challenging ... a designer's holy grail.)

If you are the/a "live" Axis player, watch out for the 2-factor ("T-34&KV-1") Russian mechanized corps, which by the rules take down the German panzerkorps in the exchanges - even on an X/2 result - and you don't know whether you'll be facing 2, 4, or 6 of those. :-)

Note the stand-up mechanized korps pieces for "live" Russian players.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Dragon Brew: Promo Pack
description:
A 17 card expansion adds two additional player races.

Each race in this expansion has 8 race cards.


8 Highborn race cards
8 Dragon Folk race cards
Promo Pack power summary card


Highborn
You may clear the drafting pool without paying one gold. You may clear the drafting pool before or after performing your draft action.

Dragon Folk
The gold cost for event cards drafted during the drafting action is reduced by one gold. There is no minimum drafting cost for an Event or Brewery card.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: Blood Red Skies: British Ace Pilot – Douglas Bader
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes British ace Hurricane pilot Douglas Bader and additional accessories to add to the core game.

Douglas Bader joined the RAF in 1928. He was already infamous as a daredevil flyer when he survived a serious crash in 1931 with both legs amputated. Although declared an invalid, the indomitable Bader was back flying again in six months. During the war, he was credited with 22 aerial victories, four shared victories, six probable, one shared probable and 11 enemy aircraft damaged.

Contents:
1 Hurricane Mk II Plane
1 Advantage Flying Base
1 Set of Double-sided Pilot Skills Discs
1 Aircraft Card
2 Aircraft Trait Cards
1 Douglas Bader Ace Card
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Les Aigles du Danube
description:
—description from the publisher

The Eagles of the Danube

March 1809, for months Austria has been arming itself to take its revenge on Austerlitz. The major foreign powers have refused to follow and so Austria must go to war alone. The time is propitious because the Great Army is at the other end of Europe, in Spain, facing a combattive people, and Austria hopes that the German peoples will rise up against France as well. On March 30, its armies, led by the Archduke Charles, invade Bavaria with no declaration of war in hopes of surprising the French army dispersed in Germany before their reinforcements can arrive. Will it be able to hold out until the arrival of the Emperor or will the Archduke push it back north of the Danube in disorder?


Les Aigles du Danube

Mars 1809, depuis des mois l’Autriche s’arme pour prendre sa revanche d’Austerlitz. Les grandes puissances étrangères ayant refusé de la suivre, elle devra donc partir seule à la guerre. Le moment est propice car la Grande Armée est à l’autre bout de l’Europe, en Espagne face à un peuple en lutte et l’Autriche espère que les peuples allemands se soulèveront contre la France eux aussi. Le 30, ses armées, menées par l’archiduc Charles, envahissent la Bavière sans déclaration de guerre, espérant surprendre l’armée française d’Allemagne dispersée, avant que ses renforts n’arrivent. Tiendra-t-elle jusqu’à l’arrivée de l’Empereur ou l’archiduc la rejettera-t-elle au Nord du Danube en désordre ?

—description from the publisher (French)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Fireworks
description:
Today is Fireworks Festival day. You are a skilled fireworks pyrotechnician. After making various colorful firecrackers, blow up different shapes of fireworks in the sky! After the game, you can enjoy the fireworks you created in the sky.

The player puts the elements in the powder keg to make firecrackers. Because the color of the flame depends on the color of the element, the player must make firecrackers to match the pattern of the element. When the firecrackers are completed, they are gathered on the firework cards and then the firecrackers are set off. When all firecrackers are fired, the fireworks end, and the player with the highest points wins.

—description from the designer

name: Creature Features!
description:
A fast and fiendish card game of stolen body parts and mad scientists!

Creature Features is a card game for 2-3 players where you play mad scientists creating creatures from assorted body parts. You swap parts onto the "Slab" where your monster is assembled, steal parts from other players and, once your monstrosity is ready to wreak havoc, summon the lightning and throw the lever!

The scientist with the most valuable monster receives points, as does the fiend with the most cohesive beast. Additional players can also be added by incorporating an additional deck of the game or expansions.

—description from the publisher

name: Dust 1947: IJN Gembu/Basan Medium Walker
description:
The Empire of Japan has started its VK powered walker program after every other Bloc on the planet. It therefore possess the most modern walkers, capable of holding their own against any foe. The Genbu is armed with two artillery rocket launchers, capable of delivering their payload at long range. The Basan variant is specialized in close-assault. It mounts a revolutionary Phosphorous flamethrower as well as an impressive short range heavy mortar.

This reference allows you to build one of these two variants. Please note that IJN decals are included.

This item comes with two Dust 1947 Unit Cards.
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Pokémon TCG: Team Up Expansion
description:
Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon—Team Up is the name given to the ninth main expansion of cards from the Sun & Moon Series of the Pokémon Trading Card Game (the Sun & Moon Era in Japan).
The expansion includes over 180 cards.

Theme Decks: Relentless Flame (Fire), Torrential Cannon (Water)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Think: Krypt
description:
This is one of the Ravensburger "Think" games, a brainteaser/mental exercise game-series.
These games are good for mental training, e.g. in creativity, concentration, imagination, logic and so on.

name: Bernard: Total irre!
description: "Bernard: Total irre" is a quick card game in a nice silver box with the famous character Bernard. The winner is the one who is the first one to get rid off all his cards.

name: 1066: Year of Destiny
description:
1066 is a three player game covering the various claimants to the crown of England following the death of Edward the Confessor in January 1066.

The players fulfill the roles of Harald Hardrada, Harold Godwinson and William of Normandy. The game is split into 4 phases each of which is designed to illustrate a key component in determining who takes the crown.

Firstly there is a Pre-Invasion Political Event phase (PIPE) which is designed to showcase the political intrigue that took place prior to the death of Edward. During this phase the players can gain additional support from other leaders and regions and, crucially, they can gain additionally legitimacy from various monarchs, religious bodies and events. Many events are outside their control; death of the Aethling, Scandinavian Wars and the activities of Tostig but they will also be crucial. This simple game preamble will provide an infinite variety of starting points to be played out on the map itself. In addition this phase can be a time of acquiring operational and tactical chits to use advantageously later.
Legitimacy is central to the game. Unless a player gains an automatic victory then a players legitimacy level will be key in determining who has won the war. As well as during the PIPE phase it can also be changed by winning and losing battles and by taking controlling of areas on the map.

However before the Operational phase there are the perils of the sea crossings. When to sail is a crucial decision by both William and Hardrada. Go early and the weather should be kinder, go later and you can recruit more troops. Lady luck, in the form of stormy seas can destroy the best laid plans, in addition the prevailing winds can prevent you invading, even when you are ready to go (as occurred to William). If a crossing goes badly wrong, or you lose an early decisive battle your claim lies in shreds. Don’t despair – ‘Become a Dane’. A player can abandon their attempt, as William or Hardrada, and instead take up the cause of Sweyn of Denmark and try and gain the throne for the Danes (they historically invaded in 1069). It won’t be easy winning as the Danes but it means you are still in the game.

The first week in September is a dangerous time for Harold as the Fyrd stand down to collect the harvest, is this the time to strike? , will the weather conditions be in your favour.
In the operational players move around the map of England to gain control of areas and improve their legitimacy as well as deciding when to strike to win a decisive battle against one of the two opponents. The operational phase is a real ‘rock, paper, scissors’ problem. How to square the problems of keeping your forces concentrated to win battles, spreading them out to take control of areas whilst keeping them feed without turning areas into wastelands.

When battle is joined them the action is transferred to a battle board where the individual characteristics of the differing armies is highlighted. The longer you stay on the battlefield the bigger the loss if you are defeated; often the losses from pursuit are greater than the losses from the battle itself. Winning and losing battles result in big legitimacy swings which can decide the game.
Never before has this iconic campaign been gamed with all four key facets illustrated (politics, invasion, operational campaign and battles)
There are a number of very good battle games but not much for the operational phase and nothing showing the political interplay or the perils of the sea crossings themselves.
The victory conditions for each player differ slightly, requiring differing strategies for each side.
Sweyn of Denmark is waiting in the wings. If no one ‘Becomes a Dane’ then the system takes over the game system will determine if he arrives or not. Leave London inadequately protected and he will take it and without it neither William or Harold can win a decisive victory.

The game is easily playable in a single session (4-5 hours)
4 Kings 1 Crown – have you got what it takes to become the undisputed King of England.

—description from the designer

name: Paths of Peril: A Mysterious Island Card Game
description:
Paths of Peril: A Mysterious Island Card Game is a standalone game in which players will try to be the first to reach an objective point while facing dangers along the way. Play solo or up to 4 players.

A 7x7 grid of Explore cards becomes the "board". Players start with four Craft cards in hand and must cross the board using these items to keep you moving and out of danger... but the cards also count as life points, so don't run out!

This competitive game will have you strategizing your path and forcing other players to use up all their Craft cards. The first player to get to the other side of the board wins!

This is a card-based, COMPETITIVE adventure for survivors! Mysterious Island is not required to play Paths of Peril.

-description from designer

name: MP-44
description:
A tactical WWII wargame that was published in the first issue of JagdPanther magazine. Eight generic scenarios were included for portraying conflicts involving German, American, and Russian forces. MP-44 is currently available in PDF format as Amarillo Design Bureau has digitally rereleased all fifteen JagdPanther issues.

—user summary

Mp44 [sic] is a squad level (10-12 man) game of infantry combat in WWII. In many ways it is the illigitemate [sic] child of Panzerblitz and Grunt. But it is distinctive and in many ways superior to both ... In this game we have squads of 14 men, and we have teams of two ... Some may complain that the game is too close to Panzerblitz. Well, part of that us intentional. I saw no reason to require the gamer to learn a new game system when most are familiar with Panzerblitz. For that reason, I left the factors where they were on the counter, and used, for all practical purposes, the same CRT ... Besides, this game is sort of a companion to PzB, allowing you to get closer to the action. Basically, we had to contend with Bolt-action rifles, semi-automatic rifles, machine pistols, and machine guns. Assault rifles are also included, and the heavier fire factors are indicative of the fire-generation of these weapons. The Vietnam type infantry provided for the Americans include not only assault rifles, but Grenade Launchers - pocket cannon ... German paratroopers might carry rifles, smg, or assault rifles ... Any differences in the relative intelligence or training or minor differences in weapons are reflected in reduced or increased range, reflecting more or less disciplined fire.

—description from the publisher
categories: Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation
publishers: (Web published), Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., JagdPanther Publications

name: The Dark
description:
The Dark is a dungeon-crawler card game for 1-7 players, currently in it’s print-and-play beta version. It’s free to download.

This very early version is in black-and-white with very simple graphics.

The Dark features a classic group of adventurers exploring a dungeon. One player lays out the dungeon cards, while the others control the adventurers. Adventurers leave torches to light the way through the dungeon as they explore, and for each torch placed the character player gains a point. Roles are then rotated, and scores compared to determine the victor!

This set contains:
1 double sided dungeon entrance card.
6 adventurer cards, each with their own deck of 7 cards.
47 dungeon master cards, including 4 instant cards.
1 deck box.

The Adventurers:
Guard: Loves a scrap. Good at the stabby-stabby. No so good at the hygiene. Scared of water, so cannot cross the many and varied puddles dotted around the dungeon.

Librarian: Great at magic. constantly coughs up warp-points. Carries a lot of books around, and is scared they’ll get destroyed by the bonfires in the dungeon, so cannot cross doorways blocked by fire.

Miner: Intent on ignoring the normal passageways of the dungeon and blasting new tunnels through the place. Spends most of his time underground so is terrified of heights, and cannot cross the cracks in the floor.

Vampire: Here for a long time, not for a good time. Hated by the other adventurers, but kind of useful. Can’t go through doorways without being invited and there’s no one around to invite them.
Aversion to silver.

Explorer: Jack-of-all-trades kinda person. Bit of a coward. Rubbish at fighting monsters.

Zombie: Barely alive. Probably still braindead. Rarely does anything, but oh so great at this adventuring business when they wake up and start smashing heads together.

The Decks:
Instants: Most adventurer deck cards and some dungeon master cards are Instants. Reveal the card, do what it says, then discard the card. Simples. Instants only affect cards in play, not cards in the decks.

Permanents: These cards stay on the table until the end of the game or until another card causes them to be discarded.

Dungeon cards: These make up the dungeon for your adventurers to explore. They’re played dark side up with the nasty stuff on. To win the game the character player needs to flip these cards over to their light side, revealing nicer stuff.

“Misplaced” cards: The dungeon deck contains 4 instant cards. Some of the adventurer decks contain cards that can be played as part of the dungeon as if the character player were the dungeon master.

When placing cards that form part of the dungeon:
• Cards must be played adjacent to another dungeon card forming a grid. Cards should meet along the full length of a long or short
side of the card.
• Cards may not be placed corner-to-corner.
• Cards may be rotated 180 degrees, but not 90 degrees, they must always be in “portrait” orientation, not landscape.
• Cards can be placed in a way that rubble or other obstacles make the dungeon impassable in the next turn, but cards cannot be entirely blocked by rubble.
• Cards cannot be placed further back than the dungeon entrance, otherwise the table gets very messy very quickly.

Reach:
At many points during the game you’ll need to check if an adventure can “reach” a monster or chest. Checking this is simple, just draw a line with your finger through the dungeon from the entrance card to the monster or chest in question. If you’re not blocked by items that your adventurer is afraid of, or by more doors than you have keys, your character can “reach” the monster or chest in question.

The Adventurers will be blocked by:
Rubble: Impassable. Find another way around.
Locked doors: Can only be opened with a key.
Kind of like locked doors in real life. Vampires have trouble with these.
Puddles: Easy to walk through, unless your adventurer card states otherwise.
Bonfires: Easy to jump over, unless your adventurer card states otherwise.
Cracks in the floor: Easy to jump over, unless your adventurer card states otherwise.
Open Passage Ways: All characters can freely pass between rooms with open passage ways.

In the dungeon you might find such varied items as:
Monsters: The dream-team for any dungeon master. They look different but all do the same thing: cause the character player to lose cards until the monster is defeated. Don’t hate the monster; hate the game.
Wooden chests: Like silver chests, only made of wood.
Silver chests: Like wooden chests only made of silver. Vampires really don’t like silver that much, so can’t travel through rooms containing silver chests.
Warp Points: Any adventurer can travel from any warp point to any other warp point.
Mine Shafts: Any adventure can travel from any mine shaft to any other mine shaft.
Keys: For opening doors. All doors in the dungeon can be opened with any key, but you need as many keys as doors you want to open on a single character route. For example, if in order to reach a monster, the Guard needs to travel through 3 doors, you need 3 keys. No, you can’t just take the key with you along the way
because… I don’t know why not. But that’s not how the game works, okay?
Bombs: Classic little bomb type bombs. When a bomb is revealed, the dungeon master can instantly discard a card from the top of any adventurer deck that can “reach” the bomb. If the bomb is on an instant the dungeon master can pick any adventurer deck.
Torches: This is how you win the game. As dungeon cards are flipped, torches will appear. The more torches, the higher your score.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Copagol
description:
Copagol is a board game for two people that recreates a soccer match between two national teams (among 16 countries). It is mainly based on dice rolling although it also has cards that are played instantly. This board game lets the players enjoy the main actions of a soccer match (goals, attack, defense, offside, corner kick, penalty shoot, foul, yellow card, red card, individual actions, etc.) It has a basic playing mode and a more advanced one to enrich the players' experience.
The game has its own time control on the board and it can be played in its full time length or depending on the desired duration agreed by the players. A complete soccer match of two halves can last 30 minutes. You can include extra time and penalty shoot out if the game ends tied.
—description from the designer

Copagol es un juego de mesa para dos personas que recrea un partido de fútbol entre dos selecciones nacionales (de 16 países diferentes). Se basa principalmente en lanzamiento de dados aunque también cuenta con tarjetas que se juegan inmediatamente. Este juego permite que los jugadores disfruten de la emoción de las principales acciones de un partido de fútbol (goles, ataques, defensa, fuera de juego, tiro de esquina, remate al arco, penales, tiro libre, faltas, tarjetas amarillas y rojas, etc.) Tiene un modo de juego básico y otro avanzado para enriquecer la experiencia del juego. El juego cuenta con un mecanismo de cronómetro propio en el tablero y puede jugarse en su duración completa o la duración que acuerden los jugadores. Un partido de tiempo completo puede durar 30 minutos aproximadamente. En caso de terminar el partido empatado pueden jugar tiempo extra o definición a penales.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

name: Stationeries (ブングス )
description:
User summary
ブングス (Bungusu) Stationeries is a Japanese card game, with the 'butting' mechanic (equal values cancel).

At the beginning of the game, all players receive an identical set of six cards valued 0-5. Players then choose one from their hand each turn, and place it face down in front of themselves. All of those cards are then simultaneously revealed. Typically, the player who chose the card with the highest value will score a point. However, duplicate cards cancel each other, '1' beats a '5', and '0' can be any value between 0-5. After all six cards have been played once, each player picks up their entire hand and play another set of turns.

The game ends one of two ways: The first player to score 9 points immediately wins, or after 3 complete sets. In the latter case, the player with the highest score wins.

Publisher's summary
文房具をモチーフにした6枚のカードでバトルするバッティングゲームです。
原則数字の大きいカードが勝利しますが、１は５に勝利します。また０は、
１～5までの数字をコピーすることができるので、戦略的なバトルが楽しめます。
publishers: Circle Cross (サークルクロス), Smart500 Games (SMART500ゲームズ)

name: Lords & Servants: Medieval Skirmish Rules
description:
Lords & Servants is a game system designed to recreate skirmish games with 28, 20 or 15mm miniatures. It covers the Medieval period and it shares the mechanics of our popular system Smooth & Rifled.

In the Appendix you will find all the information that you need to create your games, from simple clashes involving a few men per side to bigger encounters with 60-80 miniatures per side. This system is ideal for multiplayer games.

You’ll need a few miniatures for the period (based singly, both 2x2cm or 1-inch diameter round bases are ok), some rulers or other measuring sticks and a few 6-sided dice, which we’ll call d6. You’ll also need markers to show who is “Shaken” and a figure’s weapon reloading status. Some markers are available
in the appendix.

The game can be played on 90x90cm or 120x120cm tables with 28mm miniatures or 60x60cm when using 15mm.

The scale of the game is: 1 figure = 1 man; 1cm is equivalent to 2m in real-life when using 20mm or 25/28mm miniatures, while it is 4m when using 15mm models. A turn represents 10-20 seconds. You can halve the distances when using 15mm miniatures. All measurements are taken from base to base. A miniature can shoot with a 180° arc, Groups with a 90° arc (45° per side). In order to simplify the rules we ask players to use their common sense to decide shooting priorities. There must not be any intervening miniatures on the shooting line unless they are in base contact as in a 2nd rank (only) shooting. In theory, you should give priority to the target that is in front of you rather than one that is behind. You can always target a mounted miniature behind a foot figure.
Additionally rules are provided for: Cavalry, Artillery, Religion, Weather all manner of Medieval Things!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: A Mighty Fortress: Defending the Reich Summer 1944 to 1945
description:
A Mighty Fortress is one of the Wings at War series from Tumbling Dice.
A Mighty Fortress is a game of Second World War aerial combat and comes with a selection of Tumbling Dice's 1/600th scale aircraft models representing USAAF bombers and fighter escorts along with their German fighter opponents.

The game is designed to be quick to setup and play with most games lasting 1-2 hours.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Monopoly: IT
description:
Want a balloon? Immerse yourself in the horror that fills the town of Derry in this IT-inspired rendition of Monopoly.

Monopoly: IT features custom Losers' Club currency and tokens sculpted after significant items from IT. As one of six iconic tokens, travel around locations found in the dangerous town of Derry to defeat your opponents.

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Anag-run
description:
Anag-Run is a dexterity PnP game.

In the game, the players have to try to take the right tokens before the others, as soon as all letter of the 4 colors of the game (GOLD, RED, GREY and GREEN) are in the field.

But... attentive to the mole!!!

If the letters of word “MOLE” are on the field, when the letters of a colour appeared, you have to take all token, except the color on field!!!

You win a coin for each right tokens you take in round, but if you mistake, you lost all your coins!

When a player have 8 coins or all 14 coins have been distributed, the game ends. The player with more coins win!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Tamsui Monuments
description:
There is another English name of the game called TamGu, which is the tranliteration of the Chinese name 淡古.

You are a group of tourists on a 3-day (72 hours) trip to Tamsui. In the game, you have to utilize limited time and money to visit the Monuments and taste the local food in Tamsui to gain "knowledge points". After finishing the game, the player with the most points will win the title of "Master of TamGu".
(This paragraph of description comes from the English rulebook.)

The game proceeds clockwise during the first round. On every turn the active player may choose either to visit a site or to earn money. To visit a site, the player chooses an available Traveling Card to buy (with both money and his limited time) and moves his pawn to the corresponding zone. If the player has insufficient money or he wants to gain the traveling fee, he can instead move back to the starting zone to convert any amount of time to money. After the first round, the game proceeds like the well-known game Patchwork.

The game continue till all players have moved for no less than 72 hours. The player with the highest knowledge points wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Territories in Flames Collector's Edition
description:
Territories in Flames is Australian Design Group's newest World in Flames Collector's edition expansion that dramatically expands the scope of World in Flames in all those parts of the globe that were vital to the economies of the great powers but peripheral to the major theaters of combat.
World War II was just as much the field of diplomacy and politics as it was industry and mighty armies, and from the jungles of Burma to the mountains of Kilimanjaro people across the globe had to choose sides in this global struggle.

Although the Axis powers only had sporadic plans for overseas empire, there were many yearning to throw off the yoke of the colonial powers and only too glad to help their supposed liberators.

Territories in Flames includes all the locally raised overseas troops, city based volunteers, (the ultimate fantasy Christmas present scenario, Japan conquers Singapore then China liberates it, easy peasy), warlords, Siberians, the Ukrainian national army, forts, coastal forts, roads, rails, facilities and saved oil & build points.

Territories in Flames is playable with Patton in Flames or America in Flames as well as World in Flames.
Territories in Flames includes 400 full-colour counters that turn World in Flames from a great into an unforgettable experience.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Men In Black: Undercover
description:
Aliens exist! But what will you do with that knowledge?

In Men In Black: Undercover, you play as a member of three different groups with three very different goals. The Men In Black are a secret organization who supervise alien activity on Earth and work to keep their existence hidden from the general population. Meanwhile, members of the Shadow Government are doing everything in their power to capture aliens and weaponize them. Lastly, there are the Conspiracy Theorists who are working toward proving the existence of aliens to the world.

Which side will come out on top? That's where you come in! Join a team and influence the aliens to join your cause, but make sure you aren't too obvious with your goals. After all, you'll need to stay undercover to win...

name: Chess Unbound
description:
Chess Unbound is a two-player game based on traditional chess. The unique concept in Chess Unbound is that each piece's movement is indicated by the space it occupies on the chessboard. Each space on the game board contains a modular tile that shows a movement style from traditional chess (pawn, knight, rook, etc.). When you move a piece, follow the movement style on its current space. When the piece comes to rest, the space it lands on will indicate how it moves next turn.

The object of the game is to capture your opponent's king. The king piece is the only unique piece in the game, in that it never follows the movement rules of the spaces it occupies (it only moves like a king in traditional chess).

—user summary

name: Kiwi Scrabble
description:
Kiwi Scrabble is just like the classic brain-teasing word game, but features a twist designed especially for the Kiwis. Using the slang one can only learn by being a proud New Zealander. Just like classic Scrabble, players earn points by forming interlocking words, cross-word fashion, using letter tiles with various score values. In a fun twist, the specially designed Kiwi Scrabble game board features "YEAH NAH" spaces -- if a player forms a word crossing one or more of these, they'll get to draw a "YEAH NAH" card that offers an advantage over their opponents. Also included is a Kiwi Word List, displaying heaps of Kiwi-specific slang and definitions to help you get creative with your word play. Play any word on this list to earn extra points that could help you win the game!

Includes game board, 100 letter tiles, 36 cards, 4 racks, cotton tile pouch (Which is Black only for the Kiwis), word list and rule book.

name: Your Mother Is A Whore
description:
The logical gamification of the age old insult that’s been traded in bars, man-caves and on Shakespearean stages for centuries, Your Mother Is A Whore is a fast paced, interactive and hilarious game where you get to defend your Mother’s honor by handing out Whore Points™ while dodging them yourself.

Build out a hand in Blonde, Brunette, Redhead or Raven to tell all your friends: Your Mother is a Filthy Whore! Maybe dive into someone else’s hand with a Threesome, or if someone is trying to dish out Whore Points to you, Cockblock them. Still, sometimes there’s just nothing left to do but resort to Because Fuck You, That’s Why! This game has a deck just for that too.

If you love the hilarious inappropriateness of Cards Against Humanity, but also like a more structured, social game as well, Your Mother Is A Whore will deliver tons of laughs along with its fun, highly interactive 'take that' gameplay.

—description from the publisher

name: Big Bang
description:
Big Bang is one of several games playable with the Katarenga board and pieces. This game is invented by the author of Katarenga.

In this game the pawns move from the centre of the board to the edge squares. Each player tries to be the first to occupy all edge squares of one colour, each player chosing a different colour.
Play ceases as soon as one player wins and the winner scores 1 point for each opposing pawn still wandering elsewhere in the universe.

name: Third Wheel
description:
Third Wheel is a trick taking game played with the Decktet for exactly 3 players where 2 players (referred to as Setters) are always set against a rotating dealer (referred to as Dealer). The 2 Setters will get to call trump and whether the hand is played with high or low cards winning tricks, and then the dealer must bid a number of tricks they will take, with the goal being to make their bid exactly. The other players will get the most points for setting the dealer, but the player who took fewer tricks will then score the most points for doing so.

—user summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Divers Weights
description:
Divers Weights is a "silent auction" style game that uses the Decktet in which players speculate on "scrums" in order to try and win the most points.

Each hand, players are dealt 5 cards, one for each Scrum. A scrum is then started by turning over face-up cards to the center of the table, one fewer than the number of players. Players then pick a card to play into the scrum, revealing all at once. If players play cards that sum above the Scrum value of the cards on the table, then the low card will win the trick. If players play below the scrum value, then the high card will win the trick. Thus, players must carefully wager their odds, considering both the cards in their hand as well as the cards their opponents might play, in order to try and win the most scrums over the course of the hand.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Trick-taking

name: Etenstijd!
description:
When kids in the Netherlands hear their mom or dad yell out “Etenstijd!” ("Dinner time!"), they race to the kitchen to find out what’s for dinner today. And racing to see what’s for dinner is what this table-top card game is all about!

Etenstijd! is a quick, fun and strategic table-top card game for 2-6 players. To win the game players have to mix and match ingredients as fast as they can, while avoiding Wild Cards that mess up their plans.

Quick - Learning to play the game only takes a few minutes. After one practice round everyone is ready to cook! Total gameplay is 15-30 minutes.

Fun - Sixteen wacky Ingredient Cards are waiting to be turned into four different meals that everyone around the world will recognize. Fun enough? Well, we spiced things up by adding Wild Cards. Better watch out or you might find your meal burned or stolen!

Strategic - The four meal combinations vary in difficulty. Are you cooking for less points with an easy combination or more points with a harder to get combo? Players have to decide fast and must be ready to switch strategies when a situation suddenly changes.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Dice Diner
description:
Welcome to Dice Diner, where we serve the best dice in the world!

Dice Diner is a dice drafting and manipulation game for 2-5 players. Take dice from the kitchen, manipulate them to suit the customer's orders and take the tips from the tables.

Players have 2 actions per turn, they can 3 add dice to the 'kitchen', take a die from the kitchen, manipulate the dice in their reserve, fulfill customer's orders, or reserve an order to be fulfilled later.

Each order has different a different 'tips' value. You get more tips for fulfilling more difficult orders.

The first player to complete 4 orders ends the game and the player with the most tips wins!

-description from designer

name: Piggy story
description:
A game of skill to play from 2 to 6 players from 3 years. The goal of the game is to be the first to build his three houses as in the tale of the 3 little pigs.

Help the 3 little pigs to build their house using the 3 dice. But beware of the wolf!

—description from the designer

name: Chronicles of Crime: Dice Tower 2019 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of Promo Pack D from Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter Campaign.

Adds 3 New Suspects for missions in Chronicles of Crime.
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: TMNT HeroClix: Heroes in a Half Shell
description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles HeroClix is packed with “Turtle Power” featuring fan favorite characters including Leonardo, Donatello, Michelangelo and Raphael, along with their greatest allies and enemies.

The system is the same as the original HeroClix. The game plays much like a miniatures game, but without the measure-and-move system or the constant consultation of hit charts. Rather, most of the vital statistical information is directly on the base of the characters, which can be rotated as characters take damage from hits.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bukiet: Notesy
description:
A set of three notepads for Bukiet, featuring different themes: the original flowers, monsters, and crystals.

Other than the different graphic design, there is a new sheet layout lettered F. (E is skipped, but is included in Bloom).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Thalassa
description:
Thalassa is a rule of ancient naval warfare.
It has been published as a bonus game in Vae Victis n°11 and can be played either with miniatures, or with the counters provided in the magazine (6 ships).

Thalassa V2 was published in Vae Victis n°139 (May/June 2018) with addenda.

name: Simple Wargame
description:
This game dates back to the Persians, who played a crude version in which the board was thirteen feet across. The counter was made of stone and took forty slaves to lift; as a result, play was slow. Modern gamers have speeded play, but have not modified the basic futility of the system.

First published in The Space Gamer (Issue 62 - Apr 1983), under Famous Game Designers' School.

name: Pixel Tactics: Holiday Heroes Promo Set
description:
Pixel Tactics: Holiday Heroes is a special Pixel Tactics minipack that features Holiday Heroes! Featuring new characters with new abilities.

Includes:

Leader Name - Hero Name


==================================Ded Moroz - Dread Sorcerer
Easter Bunny - Bunny
Guy Fawkes - Revolutionary
Krampus - Grump
La Calavera Catarina - Skeleton
Lord of Misrule - Fool
Santa Claus - Saint
Uncle Sam - Personification
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers

name: Pixel Tactics: Historical Heroes Promo Set
description:
Pixel Tactics: Historical Heroes is a special Pixel Tactics minipack that features Historical Heroes! Featuring new characters with new abilities.

Leader Name - Hero Name


=====================Archimedes - Mathematician
Clara Barton - Nurse [PTHST]
Julius Caesar - Dictator
Lucy - Precursor
Marie Curie - Radiologist
Nikola Tesla - Electrician
Sitting Bull - Chieftain
Tokugawa Ieyasu - Shogun
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers

name: Gangster Dice: New Blood
description: First expansion for Gangster Dice, New Blood, which adds 6 dice and 4 bid cards for a 5th player, 12 favor cards, and 8 new characters not in the basic game.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Mafia

name: Dominance: Renaissance Rules 1494-1529
description:
A set of miniature war game rules dealing with battles in Western Europe from 1494 to 1529. Includes rules for moving miniatures, firing weapons, morale and fighting in melee. The goal is to defeat your opponent through superior tactics. There are several army lists provided. The Army Lists are: Early English, Late English, Florentine, Early French, Late French, Holy Roman Empire,
Spanish Holy Roman Empire, Irish, Italian Independent City State, Milanese, Neapolitan, Borgia Papal, Papal, Scottish, Early Spanish, Late Spanish, Swiss Confederation and Venetian.

—user summary

name: Mad Dogs & Englishmen: Colonial Wargaming in Times When the Sun Never Set
description:
Originally conceived as a set of “large scale skirmish” rules for the Indian Mutiny, MD&E is easily adapted for other theatres and periods. These rules will easily manage skirmishes and battles between European and any native forces. The rules will even work if you want to pit a colonial German force against the French Foreign Legion, or for that matter, the British in South Africa against the Boers.

For the most part, the disparity in weapon technology offsets the fact that the Europeans are often heavily outnumbered, even though newer rifles meant superior range and firepower, in each theatre these new weapons were not universal. In fact, the British and other colonial powers often relied on locally raised allies, or levies, to do most of the fighting for them. The British had a habit of issuing local troops with weapons that were one or two developments behind their European counterparts. In far flung theatres, the replacement of seemingly obsolete weapons took some time.

The game mechanics are straightforward. All movement is randomized by using dice and you lose movement dice for bad terrain. It is easier to move and control units if there is a commander present. Firing and combat is based on the number of figures, plus or minus relevant factors. Damage either kills a figure or inflicts terror on the unit. Morale tests are triggered by extreme situations, or the gradual buildup of terror.

The rules are designed to be quick, capable of handling battles from forty or fifty figures a side to several hundred. They have worked well on a standard home-sized 10 x 6 or a monstrous 45 x 6 and have been “crash tested” by over 100 wargamers from a dozen different countries.

—description from publisher

name: Sparkle*Kitty: Team Tokens
description:
10 team tokens for the Sparkle*Kitty games.

In a battle of SWEET vs SOUR which team will be first to break out of their tower?

These tokens introduce team play rules to your Sparkle*Kitty games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: INTERACTION: No more boredom! – DIY Expansion
description: DIY Expansions extends Interaction base game with 600 new tasks and new Mini-Games with topic Do-it-yourself.

name: The Four Brothers of Paradise Square
description:
The game is part of a short story of the same name.
It was developed in unison with the short story to add a thematic element to the game. All of the actions and mechanics correspond to elements in the story.

It is a bluffing/deduction game that takes the push your luck element from blackjack.
Every player chooses a card to secretly determine the amount that will be the “bust” number.
Every turn you play a new card from your hand of two and take any actions on the card. You are constantly taking cues from other players to see how far to push.

name: Poetica
description:
In Poetica, players will compose poems using the illustrations of the Decktet as the source of inspiration for the nouns, verbs, and adjectives of a three-line poem. Then, players will award style points to the other players.

First, you will receive six cards, arranged in a row. You must compose a line of poetry, using some aspect of the illustration from each card as the source for one word. You may make free use of conjunctions, prepositions, article, pronouns, forms of "to be" and forms of "to have". After your line is complete, players rotate seats; you will then write the second line of your poem in the same way with the new set of 6 cards now in front of you. Players rotate seats one more time to write the third line of their poems, and then execute scoring.

You will distribute 5 points among your favorite poem(s), and then evaluate the 6-card row for which you did not compose a line, awarding 4 points among the players for the best line(s), and 1 point for the best use of each card.

The player who receives the most points has composed a poem for the ages!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Rainbow Cats
description:
In Rainbow Cats, players compete to claim as much space in the house as possible for their favorite cat while making sure their least favorite cat's objects are nowhere to be seen.

At the start of play, players draw two cat cards to establish their favorite and least favorite cats, information they need to keep secret! If a player somehow draws the same cat for both their favorite and least favorite cats, that player will not have a least favorite cat. The house consists of a 5x5 grid made up of items from seven different cats, each representing a color of the rainbow.

The Seven Cats:
Phoenix
Ginger
Daisy
Jade
Azul
Iris
Violet

Contents:
14 Cat Identity Cards
140 Cat Item Cards
9 Grid Goal Cards
25 Starting Grid Cards
Last Played Card Token

There are 7 cats total and 20 item cards for each specific cat within the item deck. During game play, players will take turns placing item cards on a 5 x 5 grid. Players will also have secret guide showing anywhere from 1-5 points for each spot on the grid. The player earns points for every preferred item card placed and loses points when their least favorite cat’s items are on the grid. Each player has a different guide, meaning each player can gain or lose points for different spots. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Types of Cards:
Cat Identity: Each player gets 2 of these. Keep them secret.
Grid Goal: Each player gets 1 of these. Also keep this secret.
Cat Items: Players will get a lot of these throughout the game.

Set Up:
To start the game , first distribute the starting grid cards face up on the table, revealing 25 colorful spaces where players can play item cards. Then shuffle and give each player 2 Cat Identity cards, 1 Grid Goal card, and 5 Item cards. Play will start with the person who has the most cats. If there is a tie then rock paper scissors should suffice. Players DO NOT select a favorite and least favorite cat at this time.

During the beginning stages of the game, players will take turns drawing 1 item from the items deck and playing 1 item within the 5 x 5 grid, not placing any cards on top of existing Item cards within the grid.
They also must place cards at least 2 spaces from the last card played if able.

When they place an Item card on the grid, that player will also place the token to show the last played Item card. If there are no spaces available 2 spaces from the last card played then place anywhere an Item card has not been placed. Once 25 item cards are placed on top of all starting grid cards, players must select their favorite cats by placing it face down in front of them and adjacent to the 5 x 5 grid. The cat card left in their hand is their least favorite cat. Remember that if both are the same then they do not have a least favorite cat.

How to play:
At this time shuffle the remaining item deck and deal each player 10 additional item cards in order to build individual decks. From this point forward, players will draw and play from their individual decks. Players will continue to draw 1 item card and place 1 item card on top of existing item cards until all players have no cards left in their individual item decks. There is no limit to the number of cards that can be stacked on top of other cards.

Don’t forget: Players can only place item cards 2 or more spaces from the last played item card.

End of Game:
After all item cards have been played from the players’ individual decks, players will reveal their favorite cats and calculate their points based on their secret grid card, giving positive points for each item of the cat on the grid. Players will then reveal their least favorite cat and referring to their goal grid card, deduct points from their total for each item on the grid from their least favorite cat. The player with the highest total points wins.

Single Player Variant:
In the single player variant of Rainbow Cats, you will shuffle all 140 cards and make a 5 x 5 grid with 5 item cards in each space. The remaining cards will become your deck. You will then shuffle your deck and deal yourself 5 cards. Next, you will shuffle and deal yourself two cat cards.

Unlike the multi-player version, you cannot have the same favorite and least favorite cat and will need to draw another cat card.

The goal of this game is to remove all 20 items for the favorite cat. You remove 2 items from anywhere on the grid as long as they belong to same cat. The only items you cannot remove are from your least favorite cat. You can also peak at as many item cards on the grid as you’d like to help plan where you want which cards to move. You can however move any item card from 1 space to another when you collect 2 of your favorite cat’s items.

For example, if Phoenix is your favorite cat and there are 2 red items for Phoenix showing, you will remove those 2 items and the items make a pair. When you remove a pair of items from your favorite cat, you can also move . Cards in hand can also be used. When cards in hand are played, it is replaced with a card from the remaining deck. The goal is to get all 20 items for your favorite cat.

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Destroyers Lords of Cthul Monster – Yasheth
description:
The Lords of Cthul are enigmatic creatures of nightmare and madness, drawn from unknown nether regions to plague the world, aided by cultists who revere them like gods. Yasheth stands at a place of prominence in the blasphemous texts of the cults, an entity of negation and death, an invoker of antilife that transforms the world around it into whatever crawling horror the Cthul see as paradise. His shrieks alone have been known to rend the sanity from witnesses, and all living things quail and soon perish in his presence.

—description from the game box

name: Blam!
description:
A 'Blam!' is a set of 3, 4, 5 or 6 cards where the number on each card in the set represents an attribute of that particular set. [Many cards contain a number, a shape and a color.] For example, a '2' on a card could represent that there are 2 RED cards. The '3' on a card could represent that there are 3 SQUARES in the set. A '5' might represent that there are 5 CARDS in the set. No repeats are permitted.
Points are awarded based on the number of cards in each set, and the game end when a player reaches the target score. Highest score wins!

—description from the publisher

name: The G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T. Compendium
description:
The G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T. Compendium is a compilation of the original G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T. miniatures game rules with various supplements, including Battles by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T., To Be Continued... by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T.,and Adventures and Expeditions by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T. Also included are new rules for aerial and undersea combat.

The rules cover the Victorian Science Fiction and Pulp genres, and allow for small skirmish games to large battles.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Pitman
description:
There are 10 dice sitting on the table. The high bidder gets to roll the dice to see if they can match or beat what they have bid. You look at your cards, which let you know how many dice you can roll. One of your opponents says, 34!

You don't think you can beat them so you let them take the bid. I can roll 9 dice, they say but are they telling you the truth or not? If they roll 9 dice and get a total of at least 34 on all the dice they get all the points for that round. If they dont make their roll then you and the other opponents split the points and they get nothing.

You could call their bluff forcing them to show their cards. If they were telling the truth they get the points for the round without having to roll the dice. If, in fact, they were bluffing and could not roll 9 dice, you and anyone else that called their bluff get to split the points for the round and they get nothing.

But if you call their bluff you also run the risk of someone blocking that action which knocks you out for that round then youll get nothing. Do you take that risk?

To win at Pitman you're going to need to out bid, out bluff, and out roll your opponents to be the first to reach the designated score.

—description from the publisher

name: Spacial Nine
description:
Ever wanted to fly your own starship? Tackle space pirates? Interact with unusual aliens or visit strange new worlds?

Well now you can!

The game is played with a 3x3 'Galactic' grid of cards. Plan and move your player card around this grid mining asteroids, gaining equipment and overcoming numerous threats in order to survive.

As you move the grid moves and more Galactic cards are revealed. Can you survive a whole year by going through the entire Galactic deck?

There's only one way to find out...

—description from the designers
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Fashion Show
description:
Take on the designer and prepare best outfits that will become a hit at the upcoming Fashion Show! Decide where you will be looking for inspiration - in the burnt reds of the Spanish style, oriental Japanese motifs, or maybe you bet on French simplicity, chic and elegance? To win you will need: a large dose of creativity, amazing ideas, knowledge of fashion trends and a sense of style.
The show is getting closer and the big machine has started - you need to do shopping, order designs and complete the entire collection! The designer will win, who will do everything on time!
Fashion Show is a competitive card game for the whole family.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Wciel się w projektanta i przygotuj niezwykłe stroje, które staną się hitem na nadchodzącym pokazie Fashion Show! Zdecyduj, gdzie będziesz szukał inspiracji – w spalonych czerwieniach stylu hiszpańskiego, orientalnych motywach japońskich, a może postawisz na francuską prostotę, szyk i elegancję? Do zwycięstwa potrzebne będą: duża dawka kreatywności, niesamowite pomysły, znajomość modowych trendów i wyczucie stylu.
Pokaz coraz bliżej, wielka machina ruszyła – trzeba zrobić zakupy, zamówić projekty i skompletować całą kolekcję! Wygra ten projektant, który ze wszystkim zdąży na czas!
„Fashion Show” to rywalizacyjna gra karciana dla całej rodziny.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Jazz Nights 54
description:
Today, fame can come swiftly on the heels of a Top Twenty record, but there was a time when musicians had to prove themselves to other musicians in cutting sessions, jamming through the nights.

You are one of the, hard working, hot playing, jazz musicians, the cool cats, playing on the street corner, plinking in the piano bar, playing at that jazz café, singing in the studio, jamming at the club, drumming away that solo performance, on the stage, in the music hall, cutting sessions and winning the nights.

Jazz Nights is the 54 cards jazz-themed card game, where you stack cards and make patterns. You stack the cards at a personal tableau, which score you points at the end of sessions. The player with the highest point total of a session cuts the session. Be the first to cut three sessions and win the whole game.

Now it ain't the melody and it ain't the music, there is something else that makes the cuts complete. Gather your ensemble, choose the best location, gather the crowd, do that solo. Do the best performance at the right place. Activate your performers. Look for sets of treys. Give that rhythm everything, everything you got doo aah, dooo ah, doo ah, doo aaaah …

Gameplay

Each session one at the time, beginning with the player to the left of the dealer the players will place cards face up in front of them. You are building your own tableau of the jazz night for the current session. This tableau of stacked cards will at the end of this session be how you score. You must stack the cards as you play, cover parts of cards lain or the card you are placing. You may slide the new card under previous lain cards.

You score, by forming matched sets consisting of groups of three or more of a kind, of items, numbers, locations and musicians, or by building ensembles of three or more different musicians, or by building up a scoring crowd with sequences of coloured squares of your highest ranking location.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Music, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Combat Veteran: Bonus Scenario
description: Modern War #32, Nov-Dec 2017 provides 52 bonus counters for Modern War #31 - Combat Veteran. Rules and Bonus Scenarios specific to the additional counters are provided in a PDF online. The Rules add 3 pages with 1 additional page covering 2 Scenarios. The primary addition of the Rules/Scenarios/Counters are vehicles, which were not present in the original Combat Veteran.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: The Search for the Northwest Passage
description:
From Wikipedia: In 1845 a lavishly equipped two-ship expedition led by Sir John Franklin sailed to the Canadian Arctic to chart the last unknown swaths of the Northwest Passage. Confidence was high, as they estimated there was less than 500 km (310 mi) remaining of unexplored Arctic mainland coast. When the ships failed to return, relief expeditions and search parties explored the Canadian Arctic, which resulted in a thorough charting of the region, along with a possible passage. Many artifacts from the expedition were found over the next century and a half, including notes that the ships were ice-locked in 1846 near King William Island, about halfway through the passage, and unable to break free. You need to do better!

In The Search for the Northwest Passage you'll try to find a sea route from mid-19th century Britain to the Pacific Ocean via the Canadian Arctic Archipelago, make discoveries along the way, and return home to tell the story.

On a player's turn, he/she has a choice of two actions. He announces whether he wants to navigate or explore. Then he draws the top card of the deck. Players alternate turns until one of the end game conditions occurs. The player with the most VPs wins the game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building

name: 公国のペレストロイカ (Koukoku no Peresutoroika)
description:
User summary
公国のペレストロイカ (Koukoku no Peresutoroika) (it actually says something like перестройки e Княжество on the box), means Principality of Perestroika.

In the game of Principality of Perestroika (Rebuilding Principality), you are the prince of a Russian principality in 13th century, trying to rebuild your principality which is being attacked by the Tatars.

By playing cards, you may collect wooden building components (foundation, body, and rooftop) and construct buildings such as town, city, and church, using the collected components.

If you collect many components, you have a chance of constructing large buildings and scoring big points. But there's some possibility of Tatar invasion each round. You will suffer severe component loss if you are attacked while having many components. Each turn, you will have to consider if it's time to construct or time to collect.

The game uses a combination of building blocks and card display, with a good deal of text on the cards, which will make it more language dependent.

Publisher's summary
13世紀のロシアの諸公国を舞台に、公(ク ニャージ)となって、タタールによって壊された公国を再建(ペレストロイカ)ゲームです。
カードで資材の木製パーツを獲得し、集めた資材で積み木の様に、町や都市、正教会を組み立てて得点を稼ぎます。
でも、ゲーム中にタタールの侵攻が発生すると、多すぎる資源は持っていかれてしまいます。如何に、タタールによる略奪を防ぎながら、資源を溜めて、町を作るか手腕が問われます。
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, City Building, Medieval

name: China 2030
description:
Players are looking for the best strategy for Germany to meet China's future development. The development is represented by cards of different color in the middle of the table. Players draw and play cards that define their strategy, trying to collect points in line with what they reckon to be the current scenario at the end of the game. Whoever then has the most points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Peacock Block: "Dirty Bird" Expansion
description:
The "Dirty Bird" Expansion is a Not Safe For Work expansion adding a 6th player and all the needed components, PLUS 54 interchangeable cards of the most over the top, cringe-worthy, "no filter" dirty goodness.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – T-55 Tank Expansion
description:
Following in the tracks of the T-34 of World War II fame, the T-55 was the end product of Soviet design efforts. It combines fool-proof reliability with a powerful 100mm gun. While it is now a dated design, when used in numbers the T-55 is still highly effective. The T-55AM2 features extra armour and the ability to fire anti-tank guided missiles from its main gun.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Read My Mind
description:
Read My Mind is the game of clues and creative connections.

In this game like minds battle rapid thinkers. Write your own ending to a given statement, then try to communicate it to just one other player.

Beware! Your opponents will try to second-guess you and grab your points. Can you get your message across without being robbed by rivals? Can you hijack their efforts and add to your score? Think fast, think smart to make the connection - and don't get lost for words!

The winner is the first to reach the target score. You win points by getting a nominated opponent to be the only player to guess the answer you have devised, or by being first to correctly guess the answer another opponent has devised.

—description from the designer

name: Brook City: Max Promo Card
description:
Ally / Rival card handed out at GenCon 2018.

RIVAL
Difficulty: 6
Resistance: Aggressive 2, Standard 1, Cautious 1
Location: K29 (Brickway Warehouses)
Before encountering this target, a cop near this target may suffer 1 stress to reduce this target's resistances by 1.
Activate: Move 6 spaces towards the nearest cop. Then, each cop within 3 spaces suffers 1 stress.
Bust: Discard 1 stress.

ALLY
Health: 6 stress
Aggressive
Exhaust: This ally may move 6 and encounter 2 dice. During this encounter, this ally may suffer 1 stress to gain +1 die.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Whatever Happened to Pizza at McDonald's? (The Board Game)
description:
Based on the award-worthy investigative journalism program (IJP), Whatever Happened to Pizza at McDonald's? (The Board Game) simulates the battle between the Friends of Truth (those who would seek to uncover the true reason why McDonald's stopped serving pizza) and the Enemies of Truth (those who would keep this foul secret at all costs).

2-4 players will command their factions in a fierce competition that includes tactical movement around the dual-ringed board, risky management of resources, and clever card play using both "Tricks of the Trade" and "Undercover Ops".

Whatever Happened to Pizza at McDonald's? (The Board Game) combines the simple strategy of classic games with the diabolical intrigue of journalistic potboilers such as "All the President's Men".
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Deeproot Strongbranch – Star Player
description:
A classic Star Player is reborn, or rather he's so ancient he just grew a bit larger and more imposing. He's one of the largest Big Guys available to any team, and the fact he stands with Halflings only makes him more impressive. Though his services don't come cheap for an up-and-coming team, if you want to win with the Greenfield Grasshuggers you'll find his strength and toughness too tempting to pass up.

This finely-detailed resin model is supplied in 25 components, including a 40mm round base. You'll enjoy looking for tiny details tucked away in various nooks and crannies, hinting at both his venerable history, and the forests he calls home. Deeproot Strongbranch is only available to play for Halfling teams. You can find all the rules you need to use him in your games of Blood Bowl in the 5th issue of Spike! Journal.

(from publisher)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Lord Borak the Despoiler – Star Player
description:
Lord Borak the Despoiler is one of Blood Bowl’s most popular Star Players – and not just for his bone-crunching skills on the pitch. After all, he’s been Spike! Journal’s favourite agony uncle for longer than anyone can remember, always willing to offer his ultra-violent advice in his regular column, 'Ask Lord Borak'. However, this Hall of Famer forged his legend on the gridiron, cracking skulls and tearing off limbs with nothing more that brute strength and a hyper-belligerent attitude.

Lord Borak is an excellent all-rounder on the pitch, with a Strength to rival Big Guys and an Agility that means even ball-handling isn't out of the question. The miniature sees Borak giving a thumbs up to his adoring fans. Around his neck is his lucky set of talismans, displaying the symbols of the four Dark Gods and a Chaos Star.

Lord Borak the Despoiler is a 10-part resin miniature and is supplied with a 32mm Blood Bowl Round Base and a resin Blood Bowl token, with Lord Borak's icon on one side.

Coaches of Chaos Chosen and Nurgle teams can recruit Lord Borak the Despoiler using the rules found in the Blood Bowl Almanac 2018.

Key Features:

One of Blood Bowl’s most (in)famous Star Players
Can be included in Chaos Chosen and Nurgle teams
A strong but well-rounded player


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports

name: エレガンツ (Elegantu)
description:
User summary
エレガンツ (Elegantu) is a Japanese card game in the style of Mao, with players trying to play the game within unknown rules of etiquette. In this case, the rule cards are "manner" cards, and when someone violates the manners you can play the manner card on them and claim points.

Players gradually discover the rules in force as the game progresses. For example: "you must raise your pinky finger when drawing a card". The player calls out OGEHIN!, which means 'how rude!' when playing a manner card on another player. The game also has points cards, 1,2 and 3 pts.

The first edition sold out, and the designer has produced a second edition with some English on the cards. A crib sheet might help with accurately understanding the etitquette rules.

Publisher's summary
Pull cards from the deck while practicing your best etiquette and collect point cards. If another player breaks one of the rules written on a Manner Card in your hand, say "how rude!" and play it on the table. Then the player with bad manners loses points, and the player who revealed the Manner Card gets points. At the end the player with the most points wins.

お上品にデッキからカードを引いていく。点数カードを集める。
もしプレイヤーが手札のマナーカードに違反したら、「お下品！（OGEHIN!）」と宣言しながらマナーカードを開示する。
違反したプレイヤーは点数が減り、カードを開示したプレイヤーは点数が上がる。
最後に点数の高いプレイヤーが勝つ。
categories: Card Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers
publishers: ボボン・ボン・ボジワーイ連邦 (The Bobon Bon Bojiwaai Union)

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Soviet BMP Tank Expansion
description:
The Soviet BMP (or Boyevaya Mashina Pekhoty) is a capable reconnaissance vehicle. The BMP-1 mounts a 73mm gun capable of knocking out close range targets whilst the more modern BMP-2 sports a more spacious turret and a 30mm automatic cannon easily capable of eliminating light vehicles and helicopters. Both have the capability to mount powerful anti-tank guided missiles.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Plastic BMP Tank
1x BMP-1 Tank card
1x BMP-2  Tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Seal The Ghosts
description:
Seal The Ghosts is an action game using some paper cups with a colored seal.
The goal of the game is to seal as many ghosts as possible and to minimize ghosts in your hand when the game is over."Ghost" is a paper cup, and "Seal" means to put the cup inside of "Ring for Sealing". You can put "Ghost" on the other ghost, but if you want to do it, there must be at least one ghost of the same color under it to be placed on top of it.
The player who sealed all his hand-held ghosts is not the winner, and the one who broke the sealed ghosts is not the loser, but the player who has less ghost in hand at the end of the game is the winner.

—user summary
publishers: サラダ館白鳥店 (Salad-kan Shiratori Branch)

name: 108: The Game That Is Won with the Universe
description:
If you enjoy Sudoku or play Mahjong, 108 could be your new favorite game! 108 has a special game board that evolves into a unique number puzzle during game play. The solution to the puzzle will be restricted by two groups of numbers which cannot be moved or removed from the game board once set by the players:
A) Any number on a black “Shadow” square placed during game play.
B) Any number on a white “Tiger” square placed during game play.

To win the game, you must be the first player to fill all twenty-one squares in your row, column and block, each with the numbers 1 through 9, solving your piece of the puzzle. Like Sudoku, no number can be repeated in your row, column or block. Additionally, your numbers cannot repeat any black number in the same row or column. Designed for 4 players,yet playable with 2 or 3 as well.

—description from the designer

name: Dicey: Drinking Game
description:
We were sick of playing the same boring, lackluster, and uninspiring drinking games.

We set out on a quest to revolutionize the drinking game industry by creating a game with real substance and the highest quality of materials.

The basics:
The rules of Dicey are simple! Roll our signature 12-sided die and draw the color card that corresponds with your roll. Read the card out loud to the group and follow the directions to the mini-game that is on the card. Winners and losers are determined on a per card basis (each card is its own drinking mini-game). If you can successfully collect 5 cards you are the winner of the game!

More details:
Dicey is a collection of 83 mini-games split into four different color categories:

Group Play cards are the color green and are mini-games that the whole group will play together.

Face Off cards are the color orange and are mini-games that are a one-on-one competition between players. If you draw this card you are responsible for picking your opponent from the group to compete against.

Rule cards or "Rules" are the color yellow and are fun variations to the game that last a full turn (one complete lap around the circle) or until someone else draws a rule card. Only 1 rule card can be active at a time!

Wildcards are the color purple and are the most ridiculous of the Dicey mini-games! Get ready for belly-aching laughs as these cards are an assortment of Dicey's most wild creations.

We worked for over 3 years on creating Dicey. We made hundreds of mini-games, played with thousands of people, and ultimately narrowed the cards down to what people truly had fun playing.

We want you to share in the crazy shenanigans, lifelong friendships, and timeless memories Dicey has given to us.

—description from the publisher

name: Carmen Sandiego USA Junior Edition
description:
The object of Carmen Sandiego USA Junior game is to be the first to catch Carmen Sandiego four times.

Each player gets an ACME Detective card and a hand of Landmark cards. Spin the spinner and move that many states around the map. When you get to a state shown on one of your cards, show the other players, set that landmark to the side, and draw a new card.

The first player to collect four landmarks wins.

This version of the familiar Carmen Sandiego game is made for pre-readers.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Who would you choose?
description:
Who would you choose...

... to be stuck in a lift with...?
Lady Gaga? ...or George Clooney?
...surely not Simon Cowell?
...but possibly Harry Houdini?

It's the ultimate game of elimination where you interact with a crazy mix of people: the rich, the powerful, the incredible & the infamous!
From a mixed and unlikely set of celebrities, everyone selects the one that they feel is most suited to the given situation.
Taking turns, personalities are discarded one by one - removing the individuals thought to be least suitable - until only one remains. And, if the last celebrity standing is the one you've chosen, then you'll be the winner!
Fascinating, thought-provoking fun, it'll provide any social gathering with instant and captivating entertainment.

—description from the publisher

name: Deadly Disclosures: Murder in Chocville – A Murder Mystery Dinner
description:
