A murder has happened and any player in this game could be the perpetrator. Everybody is suspicious, has a shaky or no alibi and at least one motive.

Your job now is to identify the killer. You may ask each other anything that comes to mind. At the same time, you will receive various clues or evidence in different rounds of the game, which the players have to use skilfully. This makes it possible to track down the perpetrator and at the same time distract from yourself.

For this crime game you need 8 players. As a game arbitrator you can play along and assign yourself one of the roles. It is easily possible to prepare the murder mystery game without knowing the solution.

All information and material to run the game are free to download at www.hannover.de/en/murder-mystery.

The game perfectly combines the desire for criminal investigation and Fair Trade!

name: ハタイロ (HATAIRO)
description:
ハタイロ (HATAIRO) (旗彩) is a flag collecting game from Japan.

Let's draw the national flag. How many paints do I need to paint the flags of the world?

With five colors of red, blue, green, yellow and black, it is possible to draw 70% or more of the flags of the world. And if you add orange, sky blue and brown, you can paint almost all flags of the world.

Hatairo is a game that brings together the necessary colors, completes many national flags, and makes more valuable collections. The value of the national flag differs depending on the kind of color and the number of colors, and adding the national flag along the theme will add value to the work.

Make good use of paints and complete the watercolor paintings of flags around the world!

All you have to do is (A) Preparation for production, (B) Only one piece of work completed.

(A) In preparation for production, select one flag card to be produced, and use the production cube to collect the necessary colors.
(B) In work completion, complete the national flag, place it in the gallery, and get a production cube or theme token.

The game ends when a player completes 9 flags or a total of 5 themes.

The winner is the player with the most points. Players get points from the victory points on flags, bonus points for themes, and a game end bonus (difference in the number of completed cards). Unfinished and discarded cards lose points.
publisher's summary
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement
publishers: iop games (イオピーゲームズ)

name: Arkham Relic Hunt
description:
Arkham Relic Hunt is a competitive card game employing item collection and gotcha mechanics set in H.P. Lovecraft's Arkham, Massachusetts. Players take on the role of a Cult Acolyte who has been tasked with going into Arkham to collect Relics and new Initiates for their order. All of these Relics and Initiates are worth a varying amount of points. The Acolyte with the most points at the end of the game wins! Arkham Relic Hunt includes Rituals and Spells with which players can use to help themselves achieve their goals, or sabotage the other Acolytes' actions.

Arkham Relic Hunt is a game for 2-4 players; games average about 45-60 minutes in length. Good for players ages 14+, new players and ancient alien gods.

—description from the publisher

name: Dojo: le duel des maîtres
description:
In a world where everybody is born with elemental powers, the Dojos have been created so that Masters can teach their Prodigies how to live in harmony with their powers. Over time, rivalries between Dojos have appeared, and now is the time to determine who, of you or your opponent, is the greatest Dojo Master.

Dojo: le duel des maîtres is a card game, hand management and bluff game in which players will have to build and oppose their Prodigies teams to determine who is the greatest Dojo Master.

To win, you will have to use your resources to make your Prodigy win as much elemental Paths as possible among the 4 available. At the end of the 4 rounds of a game, the players with the most remaining Life Points will be declared the greatest Dojo Master.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic Flow
description:
In Magic Flow, each player assumes the role of a rapper and needs monsters at the base of the rhyme.

Using the alternate turn, each time you can kill a monster, but care for who you have, another can attack your turn and get a pen to it.

name: Tanto Cuore: Mimoza
description:
Promo card originally released with various kickstarter campaigns.

She allows you to chambermaid one Chambermaid or Chambermaid chief from your hand to draw a card.

This is PR15.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Monster Decoy
description:
Monster Decoy is a abstract strategy game with simple rules and black and white territory tiles design,available for 2 or 4 players.

As a member of Black/White Ghost Buster Team, you need to capture the monster all around the city.
Surround and capture the monster that you found in your territories, the team which get the higher points wins the game.

Players take on the role of a white and black Ghostbuster team to capture the ghosts that fill the city. Surround and capture the ghosts on your own territory, and the team with the most points in the end wins.

—description from the designer

name: BattleTech: Historical – Wars of the Republic Era
description:
Historical: Wars of the Republic Era is Catalyst Game Labs' sourcebook outlining three conflicts that began in the late thirty-first century and spanned early half of what was known as Early Republic Era prior to the Gray Monday event in 3132. These includes the 2nd Combine-Dominion War (3098-3101), Victoria War (3103-3105), and Capellan Crusades (3111-3113).

The book goes into details of what began these conflicts, political leaders and their motivations, and actions taken by various military formations in these wars. Also included are game tools, special command abilities for regiments and important leaders during these wars and Random Assignment Table for two of the conflicts.

From the back cover Edit

“ Local Disputes
In 3081, the Republic of the Sphere was born from the ruins of the Word of Blake Protectorate. For an Inner Sphere devastated by the horrors of escalating war, the Republic was a beacon of hope for a brighter, more peaceful future…For a time, it almost was.

Historical: Wars of the Republic Era describes the border conflicts that inevitably erupted in the decades after the Word of Blake Jihad. Covering the largest of these conflicts in particular—including the Second Combine-Dominion War, the Victoria War, and the Republic of the Sphere’s own war against the Capellan Confederation—this book provides a hard look at the early years of what would come to be known as the Dark Age Era.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Chaos Battletome – Khorne Bloodbound
description:
Chaos Battletome: Khorne Bloodbound is the  guide to fielding a Bloodbound army for Age of Sigmar.

This book contains a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules, battleplans and warscrolls for fielding your Bloodbound army in games of Age of Sigmar.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Tres trenes
description:
Two-player domino game (for a double-six set) in which players must, in each turn, add a piece into a common line of play in the centre of the table and a piece into a line of play of their own. Failure to do both steps in a turn means defeat. If all pieces are used up, the extremes of the lines of play are used to compute scores which will determine the winner.

Players start with a hand of seven pieces; in each turn they draw one piece and play out two, so that the number of available pieces for each turn shrinks during the game.

—description from the designer

name: Nutfall
description:
You are a squirrel in the forest and winter is fast approaching. Unfortunately for you, due to some harsh life circumstances,you cannot climb trees. You must wait for nuts to fall to the forest floor and then race to collect the nuts before the other squirrel beat you to it. Watch out for Mother Nature though, as she often has plans of her own.

Nutfall is a pick-up-and-deliver gateway game with variable turn order and variable player powers. Spend your allotted actions wisely as you choose to either play safe and protect what you have or target the other players with carefully planned action card combos. This game has a healthy amount of 'take that' gameplay but is well balanced so you never feel out of the game.

Be the first squirrel to collect 9 nuts, or be the squirrel with the most nuts when winter hits to secure yourself a victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Challenger: Ultra Modern Wargame Rules for Battle Group Level Games 1950 to 1995
description: A simulation wargame rules book based on the supposed escalation of the NATO/WarPact Cold War to a point where hoards of Soviet Armoured Divisions roamed into Western Wargamerland.

name: British vs Pirates: Limited Edition Captains
description: This is a promo package of 3 captina cards for use in Britih Vs Pirates. These is one each for the British, Spanish, and Pirate factions.

name: British vs Pirates: Limited Edition Ships
description: This is a promo package of 3 ship cards for use in British vs Pirates. These is one each for the British, Spanish, and Pirate factions.

name: Das große Literaturquiz von A-Z
description:
With this entertaining quiz you can playfully test your knowledge about literatur. From the bestseller to the biography - there are over 300 questions waiting for you to be answered.
Lots of entertaining knowledge for everyone who likes to read!

—description from the publisher

name: Match Madness: Extreme
description:
Enjoy the Match Madness Extreme frenzy! Recreate 60 new pattern cards by adding a 3D cube to your set of blocks. The ingenious the pattern matching race is on!

Each player receives a set of 5 blocks (numbered from 1 to 5) from the base game and 1 cube block (numbered 6) from the expansion. Leave the Match Madness base game cards aside and take the cards from the expansion box (level 6 cards).

Try to Match the cards using the new cube that comes with the expansion and experience all the fun of Match Madness again with 60 new puzzles!

-description from publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Slot Brothers
description:
A cards and dice game based on 3 side characters of the famous RPG EarthBound.

Throw the 3 dice and try to win the matching cards. After winning a card, you can bet your cards to get a forth die and try earning more cards, or lose them... Other players may try to steal your cards, so be careful and protect them with the useful "Sombrero" card.

Join the Slot Brothers, Pancho, Pincho and Poncho, in this fun party game!

—user summary
categories: American West, Dice, Humor, Video Game Theme

name: Lanterns Dice: Lights in the Sky – Early Release Promo Tiles
description: Lanterns Dice: Lights in the Sky – Early Release Promo Tiles are four additional tiles for use in Lanterns Dice: Lights in the Sky offered as a special promotion for those purchasing the game in local game stores two weeks before the official worldwide release date.

name: Zen Monkeys
description:
The Monkey King Sun Wukong has decreed that his disciples, the monkeys of Flower and Fruit Mountain, must create a kingdom worthy of his status as Great Sage, Equal of Heaven. To do so each monkey must tame the mountain by following the Six Principles of Zen; forging paths, directing streams, and arranging features such as fruit trees, lanterns and statues that will most please King Monkey. In addition, Sun Wukong demands that all monkeys must help to build him a shrine on top of the mountain. Not all of the mountain monkeys agree with Sun Wukong however and some patrol the forest, ready to catch unwary monkeys.

In Zen Monkeys players each have a monkey Disciple, creating their part of Sun Wukong's kingdom on the mountain. Each round player monkeys search the Wilds for placeable 'feature' resources or collect landscape tiles to shape their forest into a puzzle-like network of paths and streams. Searching along paths in the Wilds has a noise penalty that triggers the approach of the grey guardian monkeys who will chase and eject any monkeys found collecting. Sneaky monkeys will be able to collect and place these resources in their landscapes to best please King Monkey, following the set of objectives he has set them for the game. Collectable resources are scarce so the monkeys will have to landscape their part of the forest carefully and be ready to grab point-scoring features before their rivals can.

After two full moon phases, the game ends and King Monkey appears to judge the most impressive landscapes of his new kingdom. Points are scored on the sets of features placed in each area, the adherence to the 6 zen principles and for the specific tasks assigned by King Monkey.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Dust 1947: Avatar of Cthulhu
description:
The Great Dreamer is back. A catastrophic chain of events started under the sands of Babylon has brought back one of the most terrific foe Humanity has ever faced: the mighty Cthulhu. A part of this creature's essence has materialized in the form of an Avatar, a powerful representation of the Deity on Earth. After centuries of slumber, it can once again advance the cause of the Mythos forces on our planet, getting ready for a final battle it knows is coming.

The Avatar of Cthulhu has been sculpted by Joaquin Palacios, one of the World's most famous sculptor. This reference comes with its own Dust 1947 unit card, for the Mythos Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Mercenary Wrecker/Demolisher/Obliterator
description:
Mercenary walkers are made of whatever the Sisters can get their hands on. But thanks to the top mechanics in their ranks, they make some of the most awesome war machines on the planet!
The Wrecker is a dedicated anti-aircraft walker made from SSU and Axis parts, with a Mercenary twist.
The Demolisher has identical weapons, plus a little extra, and is the personal mount of ace Mercenary pilot Luisa.
The Obliterator also combines SSU and Axis weapons, but this time to blow up tanks! Or anything on the ground that foolishly gets too close.
This reference allows you to field one of these three variants.

As with any Mercenary units, these walkers can be attached to any force in Dust 1947. Please note that all weapons options are included in this box, as well as the pilot (in resin) and the recoiless gun.

This reference comes with three Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already pre-assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Jagdluther/Jagdloki/Jagdwotan
description:
The JagdLuther is armed with a pair of 7.5 cm FpK 42 L/70. It’s a longer version of the old 7.5 cm gun, much more deadly and accurate. It’s even more powerful than the first “8.8” used on early Tiger tanks! With its weapons the JagdLuther can destroy armored targets up to two kilometers away. It’s the bane of all armored vehicles.
The JagdLoki is an efficient antiaircraft walker, armed with four 5cm rapid firing guns, it can easily take down any flying enemy coming your way.
The JagdWotan is one of the deadliest walker on the planet. With its four laser guns, it can punch through any armor the Allies or the SSU might have, at middle range. This vehicle will surely serve the Axis for many years to come.
All variants have a “belly” mounted machine gun. Although unable to target enemy aircraft, it's deadly against infantry. This reference allows you to field one of these three walkers.

This item comes with three Dust 1947 Unit Cards, for the Axis Bloc. These miniatures come already pre-assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over them, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin: Mat of Mayhem
description:
The Munchkin Mat of Mayhem is a Level tracker with a twist: every space (except lowly Level 1) has a game rule! Choose your path carefully to get the right bonus at the right time.

This 24-inch square neoprene playmat will look fantastic in the middle of your game table, with your favorite miniature (or Munchkin pawn) showing your hero's rapid progress to Level 10... and victory!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Viking Fury
description:
"Viking Fury" is a strategic level solitare wargame covering the initial Viking expansion into western Europe in the late 8th-early 9th century. The player controls the Viking side and attempts to acquire treasure for his home location, while potentially planting new settlements across the sea. Each game turn represents a variable amount of actual time. The object of the game is to bring as much treasure back home to Scandinavia (and establish settlements over the sea) within a set number of expeditions.

Components
Viking Fury comes with eight pages of rules, a game map, and a game counter set. You will also need one six-sided die, and a standard deck of playing cards (52 cards with no jokers) to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civilization, Medieval, Nautical, Territory Building, Wargame

name: North Cape
description:
North Cape is a strategy solitaire or two-player wargame simulating the Battle of North Cape in 1943 between German and British naval forces.

North Cape uses the rules of Advanced Salvo! European Theater, as modified for this particular engagement.

Components
North Cape comes with a set of counters, a Sea Display and Game Tables and five pages of rules. You will also need three six-sided dice, and paper and pencil. It is recommended to mount the North Cape counters.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: sheepworld: Mau Mau
description:
The popular card game in sheep's clothing!

Who will be the first to get rid of all the cards?

Not easy, if "Doppelböcke" or "Jammerhammel" repeatedly prevents playing the cards!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das beliebte Kartenspiel im Schafspelz!

Wer schafft es als Erster alle Karten los zu werden?

Nicht einfach, wenn Doppelböcke oder Jammerhammel immer wieder das Ablegen der Karten verhindern!

—description from the publisher)

name: Fall of Ming: Jisi Incident
description:
Fall of Ming: Jisi Incident is low-complexity wargame on the Jisi incident during ancient China. This is a 2 players wargame. One player control the army of Qing dynasty and one player control the army of Ming Dynasty.

The goal for army of Qing dynasty was to occupy the cities of Hebei Province.

—description from the designer

name: Dust 1947: Königsluther/Sturmkönig
description:
The KönigsLuther is a formidable walker, easily among the most fearsome on the planet. The heaviest variant of the Luther, it sometimes wins battles even before firing a shot. Its raw firepower is so terrifying that many enemy tank commanders simply refuse to fight it without heavy support. The SturmKönig fills the air with such a sheer volume of fire that few aircraft can withstand its sustained barrage. Capable of dealing with any kind of threat on the battlefield, it's a favorite of Axis armored regiments all around the World.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Hamburgueria Maluca
description:
A simple children’s game where you are trying to build your hamburger before every other player.
In your turn you roll a die to determine the movement of a pawn used by all players. The pawn moves around a reach that show ingredients for your hamburger. There are 4 categories of ingredients and you want one of each category. If the pawn end his movements in one ingredient you don’t have, you pick the new ingredient. Otherwise you just pass.
There are also some fields in the track with a roulette symbol. If the pawn stop there you must roll a roulette where you can receive new ingredients, lose some of them or even steal from your opponents.

—description from the publisher

name: Unruly Bastards
description:
Unruly Bastards is the hilarious party game of competitive inappropriateness. It's simple to learn, insanely fun to play and unique every time.

200 Cards. 10,000 combinations. A lifetime of hilariously unforgettable moments. 3 or more players are recommended. The game is 17+ so rounds can get as unruly as you and your friends choose to be.

You are about to embark upon an epic battle of imagination. Each and every card inside this box has been delicately crafted to create an environment for you and your friends to compete using nothing more than your sense of humor and terrible judgment.

A brief word of warning: This is a game where horrible thoughts are oftentimes rewarded. The more you embrace your inner bastard, the more likely it is that you will be crowned CHAMPION.

That being said, you can play this game as clean or as dirty as you want. In either case, we always recommend that you stop just shy of your friends and family permanently disowning you.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Me, Myself, and Ice Cream
description:
Me, Myself, and Ice Cream is a light mix-and-match strategy game that can be played as a solitaire game by adults, or cooperatively by kids. You play as a dessert chef working in a kitchen to make the foods desired by your customer.

At the beginning of the game, choose a character to be your customer.

Shuffle the 15 food cards and deal them face up in three columns of five cards each. Then shuffle a standard deck of playing cards and deal six cards into play and draw a starting hand.

To create a food, you match the suits found on the food with the suits on your cards. Then you collect it and feed it to your customer, gaining its sweet reward.

When you can't make a match, you can deal more cards, but be careful not to run of out cards before creating all of the foods that your customer wants.

Once you've created all the foods your friend is hungry for, you win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Risco
description:
The 1960's French game of Risco is based on the successful launching of satellites into space.
Players move a coloured token around a board by the throw of two dice to collect a scientist, the required fuel and 4 stages of a rocket described as similar to launch Explorer or Sputnik satellites. Timing of the launch and other external events are determined by a rotating disc on the board that rotates when a double is thrown with the dice. Once all the required components and 25,0000 litres of fuel is collected a player launches a satellite.
A successful launch is determined by throwing a number greater than 6 with the two dice. If the total of the dice is less than 6 then the launch fails and all is lost. An exception to this is if a player obtained life insurance for the scientist and fire insurance for the rocket whilst moving around the board.
The player who successfully launches the most satellites in a set time is the winner.

A Greek version of the game is titled 'Lunik', where 5 playing launch pads are included instead of the typical 4 in RISCO.

—user summary

name: Jump Gate
description:
Developed for being played with the Green Box of Games game system.

Jump Gate is a roll-and-move game where you race your spaceship around the track of tiles to collect your cargo crates. When ever you land on a jump gate you are teleported ahead to the next tile with the same symbol. Every player starts with a set of 9 cards in hand with identical numbers. Use each card once during the game to move forward or back after your regular movement. First player to collect all of their cargo is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dig Dig
description:
In Dig Dig the aim is to get rid of all your cards. Based on a game we played all the time as students. Dig Dig is a strategic but often unpredictable card game. You compete to see who can get through all their cards the quickest.

Dig Dig is quick to learn and easy to play. Each round takes about 5-10 minutes and can be played with 2 to 5 players.

Using power cards at crucial moments to manipulate play, you can get one over on your friends and show them who’s king of the hill!

—description from the designer

name: Galeão Fantasma
description:
Galeão Fantasma (Ghost Galleon)

There are reports of mysterious events at Perna de Pau's Cove.
Are numerous rumors that the Ghost Galleon, with a valuable cargo of gold coming from Spain, has just reappeared by the beach.
Rival area pirates are immediately scheduled on a plank and steal the treasure hidden behind the stories of the ghost of the Blackbeard, who presents himself in its protected and invaluable treasure.
Who is the first pirate with enough courage to go to the Ghost Galleon, search all my treasure chests for the treasure and take him to his hiding place?

Goal of the game
Be the first pirate to return to his hiding place with the gold pieces of the treasure.

How to play

Moving your pirate
Roll two dice and advance as many houses as the sum of both dice.
You can not go to another pirate's hideaway.

Caves
There are four caves on the beach (marked with lanterns) with secret passages between them. Allow skirted the board faster.

The approach to the Ghost Galleon
Follow the black arrow on the beach to opposite black arrow.
Go around the galleon in the same direction as you walked along the beach.

The Ghost of the Blackbeard
You can move it whenever you get a 6 at the die roll. Use it to help you get in the way of the others.
He can never leave Galleon.

Houses with cannon and houses with cannonballs
To shoot a cannon, the Phantom must move to the house directly behind that cannon.

Board
When the Phantom comes home next to yours (he can stop there even if he has not finished the sum of the data), or when you arrive at a house after his, or if you are in a cabin when he enters, you are immediately taken spiritually to walk on the board, Ha, ha, hal !!
When you have recovered from the shock (ie lost in turn), you are saved by a barrel passing through there. Jump to the barrel of your color and start your journey from there.

Search and Obtaining the Treasure
You must keep one or more keys that will open the treasure chests.

Entrance into the Haunted Cabin
Enter the path of the door (marked with an arrow). You can not enter if the Ghost or other pirate there.
Remove the round silhouette from the top of the hill. Hold any key face down or the Parrot with face up in front of you.
Devessair and re-enter the Haunted Cabin in new turns if you want to catch another circular silhouette.

The parrot
When you catch the Parrot, immediately:

withdraws at random any silhouette belonging to another player;
remove a key from the Haunted Cabin, even if there is the Ghost;
look under any of the chests to see which key opens and future references.


In subsequent times, the player who has the Parrot may prefer not to cast the dice, but to repeat 1, 2 or 3.

The Ghost of the Blackbeard and his Parrot
If the Ghost moves to next to the pirate who has the Parrot, the Blackbeard sends the parrot back to the Haunted Cabin, where it is placed on the top of the hill of circular silhouettes. Then the pirate walks on the board!

Entrance into the booths with treasure chests
Enter in the same way as described for Haunted Cabin
The bottom of each ark shows what key is needed to open it. Remember this for future references, or if you already have a matching key (with 2 or 3 teeth) prove it to the other players showing them your key and the bottom of the ark. Then open the ark, secretly remove the silhouette (if you still there is one) look at it and keep it face down in front of you. Replace the lid on the chest and
put it back in the cabin. One of the chests does not need a key - just remove the silhouette.
The split key is unnecessary and does not open any ark!

Duels
Duels are an exciting way to gain weapons, treasure, keys and the Parrot of other pirates.
If you wish to challenge an opponent to a duel, move to the house next to his (do not need to come with exact number) and shout: "Choose the weapons"! You can not challenge him to a duel if he's in a cabin or in his refuge.
Both display the silhouette of a weapon, face up, if you have it. Then roll the dice to decide the outcome of the duel:
* a player with a pistol throws the three dice.
* a player with a sword throws two dice.
* a player without weapons or with a broken sword casts a die.

The highest value of a single dice designates the winner.
The winner removes any of the silhouettes or the parrot (if any) from the loser along with both weapons used in the duel.
The winner can then, if he wishes, change places with the loser.

Winner of the game
The first pirate to arrive at his own refuge, having found the treasure is the winner.

name: The 7th Guest: Infection
description:
Based on the infamous and diabolically challenging microbe puzzle from The 7th Guest, this beautifully designed game consists of a quality 15" x 11" roll-up board, 49 double-sided microbes, 5 anti-bodies (optional play), a black velvet drawstring pouch and instructions. It's a game that anybody can learn to play in minutes but spend a lifetime mastering and will be a great addition to your tabletop strategy game collection.

The board is a square grid divided into 7 rows and 7 columns. Each player begins with two microbes, colored blue or red. The microbes are placed at the four corners of the grid, with blue in the top left and bottom right corners, while red occupies the other corners. Red takes the first turn. During a turn, a player may move one of their microbes one or two spaces in any direction, including diagonally. If the player moves to an adjacent space, a new microbe is created on the space the microbe moved from. If the player moves to a non-adjacent space, the space on which the microbe began the turn remains empty. Any of the opponent's microbes which are in spaces adjacent to the space a player moves onto will be "infected," turning to the color of the player who has moved. Players are required to move unless no legal move is possible. The game is over when either all cells of the board are filled or all microbes on the board are the same color. The player with the most microbes on the board at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Show-Me
description:
Played much like dominoes for points. The twists is that the wooden tiles are labeled like cards. Set of 14 tiles in each of the suits (Hearts, Diamonds, Clubs and spades), and from A to deuce. There are also doubles of the suit tiles. The game is played for points.

—user summary

Show-Me is a game played with Dominocards.

THE NEW MISSOURI GAME OF "SHOW-ME"
Copyrighted 1907

Is played with Dominocards by any number up to 10. Each player draws 5 pieces. The highest double leads, but if no double out, then the highest numeral leads. Plays to left. After first hand lead goes to left of dealer. Second and following leads made with any piece. For player, the double Heart counts 20; Double Diamond, 15; Double Spade, 10; Double Club, 5. Rank of suit is in same relative order. In the end to end matching suit must match suit, but letters and numerals match without regard to suit or color. Matching is done on four sides of first Double played only. The object is to count multiples of 5 by addition of all ends on board, numerals and Doubles only counted, suit and letters same as blank. Each player in turn counts while multiple of 5 appears. Count is forfeited unless claimed in turn of play. Players unable to match must take up to three draws from board, then play or pass. The first player exhausting hand or holding fewest numerals, if play is blocked, exclaims "Show-me," wins the trick and takes credit for total of numerals held by all other players, in multiple of 5. Up to 4 players game is 250; over four 150 points.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Eyedentity
description: Eyedentity is a logo & brand identification game, similar to 'The Logo Board Game'

name: What Ho!: The Skirmish Game
description:
What Ho! is a skirmish game of non-violent conflicts. It is set in the drawing rooms, ballrooms, village lanes and cottage gardens of a rural England of a past age. Players will involve themselves in the farces of P.G. Wodehouse or investigations of Agatha Christie. Unlike many skirmish games which begin with many uninteresting choices and end with a few interesting ones as the game crystallises but combatants are removed in What Ho! breadth of choice remains as their impact comes into view.

Players move miniatures around a playing surface of their choice, gaining plotlines by building up hidden dice and then attempt to complete actions to achieve their plotline objectives. What Ho! is a non-violent miniatures skirmish game based on movement and miniature placement.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Book, Deduction, Dice, Humor, Miniatures, Murder/Mystery, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Command Assets
description:
This deck of 100 additional Command Asset cards is designed to expand upon the 300 Command Assets included with Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. The new cards are divided between universal cards that are usable by any faction, as well as cards that are tailored to each of the individual factions that feature in Apocalypse. Regardless of your allegiance, these additional Command Assets offer a huge variety of new tactical options.

This card set requires a copy of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse to use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Datasheet Cards: Orks
description:
A set of Datasheets specifically designed for using your Orks Citadel miniatures in games of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. Each datacard provides the full rules and profiles for a single unit from the Orks faction. Also included is a Faction card that details the faction rules that apply to Orks Detachments. The reverse side of each card features the faction’s icon.

The set includes datacards for the following units:

- Ghazghkull Thraka
- Warboss
- Big Mek
- Weirdboy
- Boss Snikrot
- Boss Zagstruk
- Deffkilla Wartrike
- Kaptin Badrukk
- Boyz
- Gretchin
- Mad Dok Grotsnik
- Painboy
- Mek
- Burna Boyz
- Tankbustas
- Nobz
- Nob with Waaagh! Banner
- Meganobz
- Nobz on Warbikes
- Kommandos
- Warbikers
- Kustom Boosta-Blastas
- Shokkjump Dragstas
- Boomdakka Snazzwagons
- Megatrakk Scrapjets
- Rukkatrukk Squigbuggies
- Stormboyz
- Mek Gun
- Battlewagon
- Gunwagon
- Bonebreaka
- Killa Kans
- Deff Dread
- Morkanaut
- Gorkanaut
- Lootas
- Flash Gitz
- Trukk
- Dakkajet
- Burna-Bommer
- Blitza-Bommer
- Wazbom Blastajet
- Stompa
- Mekboy Workshop

This datacard set requires a copy of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse to use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: D-Day Utah Beach: Landing & Linkup
description:
The D-Day folio series consists of four separate games, each portraying a portion of the Normandy campaign area. Turns represent two to three days each; the games cover the campaign from the initial landing to the breakout. Each game comes with one map covering a portion of the battlefield at 2.5 miles per hex. The playing pieces represent the regiments and special battalions taking part, plus the multitude of fire support available to them.

The series uses the Fire & Movement system rules, with exclusive rules for each folio. The folios can be combined to display the entire American or British Commonwealth sectors, or into a single giant game on the entire campaign.

Utah Beach, a late addition to the invasion, was envisioned as both flank protection for the main landings and a launching pad for the capture of the port at Cherbourg. The Allied player uses airborne drops and amphibious landings to secure a large beachhead, including capture of the city of Carentan. The German player must use the limited forces available to prevent it.

Contents:
17"x22" terrain map
100 die-cut counters
one Eight page system rule booklet
one exclusive scenario rules
10x13 ziplock
5x3 ziplock

Players: 1-3
Ages: 14+
Hex Scale: 2.5 miles
Play Time: 1-2 hours
Complexity: Low-Med
Solitaire Ability: Medium

name: Im Feuer Vorwärts!
description:
Im Feuer Vorwärts! Ein Neues Kriegsspiel [Forward Into the Fire! A New Wargame] Nr. 102.

Objective: Eliminate your opponent - moving/acting by turns.

Gameboard is a battlefield. You have several different military units with different qualities (range, power,...) at your disposal.

Place your units into the red/blue marked areal.
Advance your units
Attack if enemy is within allowed range & vulnerable by your unit
Remove defeated units.

name: JU87 Stuka Jericho Trumpets
description:
JU87 Stuka Jericho Trumpets is a solitaire card war game depicting in 18 cards only a Luftwaffe Stuka pilot career. During the Missions the player has to try to get Kreuz Punkte (Cross Points) which will deserve him/her the Knights Cross!
While flying toward the OBJECTIVE the player can bomb or strafe the 4 ENCOUNTERS to get more KP but beware the AA fire and the enemy fighters!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Attacco a Suda
description:
Attacco a Suda is a solitaire game on the Italian raid in the English Navy base in Suda, on the northern coast of the Mediterranean island of Crete. With just 6 men and 6 MT Barchini, small explosive fast motorboat, in few minutes a cruiser (HSM York), a tanker and a cargo were sunk, for a total of 23000 tons!

1-COMPONENTS:
A colorful map, a unit BARCHINI, 3 markers TEMPO, ALLARME e BARCHINI DISPONIBILI; 4 markersi BINOCOLO, CHIAVE INGLESE, ARPIONCINO, COPERTURA NERA e PORTAFORTUNA. You just need a d6.

The very first edition was released in 1986!!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Europoly Junior Βόλτα στο ζωολογικό κήπο
description:
It is a Greek board game for kids. €uropoly Junior is a kid's edition of the classic transaction and real estate game,for 2 to 4 players from 5 years old. While roaming around the zoo, the players are trying to build their houses-cash desks at the most posts they can.Then each player who passes by your cash desk has to pay the fair for the ticket.When a player is no more capable of paying for the ticket,then the games ends immediately.The player who managed to gather the most money in the game is the winner. A fun game specially designed for kids. The game produced 100% in Greece from EPA(ΕΠΑ)company,which producing quality games since 1930 .

—user summary

name: Frog Chess
description:
Last Frog to Jump Wins!
Frog Chess is played with either two or three players. The object is to be the last frog to jump. Players start by strategically placing their frogs on the board until all the spaces are filled with frogs. Players then take turns jumping one another. When a frog is jumped, it is removed from the board. Frogs can jump forward, backwards, sideways and diagonally. Frogs can do single or multiple jumps, even jump their own team frogs if needed. It is possible to win the game with fewer frogs left on the board than their opponents. The game moves quickly, and you will find yourself wanting to play again.

Game comes with:

1 beautiful 12″x12″ neoprene board
60 colorful squishy frogs (3 colors, 20 each)
1 set of instructions
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: 大熊山 (Ookuma-yama)
description:
大熊山 (Ookuma-yama) is Big Bear Mountain.

Mt. Big Bear is an economy negotiation game with roll-and-move mechanism.

Each round, one player becomes a food dealer (a grandmother), and the others are food collectors. All food collectors collectively control one pawn climbing up and down the mountain.

During each food collector's turn, that player roll a die and advance the pawn 1-3 spaces. According to the space the pawn landed, the pawn encounters foods or a bear. The player collects the foods encountered. However, if the pawn has encountered several bears, all remaining players discard all food collected and gain nothing this round.

Before rolling a die, the active player may negotiate with the food dealer to offer all foods collected at a discounted price. If the negotiation comes to an agreement, that player gains the price and exits out of this round safely. The dealer pays the price but gains victory points from the foods at full face values.

If the pawn has climbed down the mountain safely by itself, all remaining players gain victory points from the foods collected at full face values.

The game ends after all players became the dealer twice. The player with the most victory points wins the game.

山登りと熊がモチーフの、すごろくをベースにしたゲームです。
複数のプレーヤーが1つのコマを使って進み、「山の幸カード」を集めます。
「山男」役と「おばあさん」役に分かれて、「おばあさん」役を交代でプレーします。「山男」と「おばあさん」の値段交渉が行われる「交渉ゲーム」でもあります。
「大熊山」で熊として表現されているのは、実は価格の下落・暴落といった経済の動き。それらを実現するために導入した「値段交渉」ですが、プレーにも絶好のアクセント。山を登るにしたがって、山の幸が増え、カードの値段は高くなって行きますが、熊カードを引いて「暴落」する危険も高まります。刻一刻と変化する状況に価格は乱高下し、売り手と買い手の駆け引きがゲームを盛り上げます。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Mickey Mouse Snuggle Time
description:
Snuggle up for a calming, co-operative game that's perfect for bedtime, nap time, or any quiet time. Help Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse, and their friends get the farm animals across the blanket game board and into the barn before the sun goes down.

To play Mickey Mouse Snuggle Time, lay out the board, turn the sun arrow to "nine", and place all five animals in the starting area. Each turn, a player spins a spinner, which will either move an animal or count down the sun arrow (in which case the player will spin again). When all animals have reached the barn, the game is over, and the sun arrow points at the players' final score.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Heroes & Treasure: Darkness & Light
description:
A follow-on adventure to Heroes & Treasure, Darkness & Light lets the party of heroes journey into the Elven lands to help rescue captured Elves and solve a dark mystery.

The expansion includes new monsters, map tiles, and treasures, plus a nine-mission campaign, while still being appropriate for children as young as four to play with a parent.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Sweet Success
description:
Become the best baker in town by gathering the most ingredients and baking the most (and yummiest) dessert recipes. Deliver a Sweet Success, and the whole town will flock to you for a taste!

You bake all day every day and have plenty of yummy baked goods for the masses. Delivering these confections to Clients in the Neighborhood is how you gather Ingredients. You do not need any claimed Dessert cards to make a delivery.

The "neighborhood" is made up of a grid of tiles and ingredients will be placed on the roads in the neighborhood as the game goes on. You get to pick up any ingredients you pass along the way to a client delivery. Client cards have various effects that can help you along the way.

As you collect ingredients, you can claim dessert cards from a public "store." These dessert cards are worth points at the end of the game, and all the players can see the available cards. So if there's one you want, be sure YOU get it first by having all the appropriate ingredients.

On a turn you:
Place ingredients onto an empty road in the neighborhood
You MAY make a delivery
You MAY claim a dessert card.

The end of the game is triggered when any player makes a third delivery, leaving three satisfied Client cards in front of them and two Client cards in their hand at the end of their turn (remember only one Client card remains face-up as the satisfied Client, and one Client card from the pair returns to players’ hands at the end of each delivery).

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Attacco a Malta
description:
Attacco a Malta is a solitaire game on the unlucky Italian raid in the English Navy base in Malta on 25-26 July 1941. It can be played solitaire or in two players, each one controlling one of the attacking units, Barchini and SLC.

—description from the publisher

Attacco a Malta è un gioco che simula lo sfortunato attacco effettuato dagli incursori della Decima Mas il 25-26 Luglio 1941 alla base inglese del Mediterraneo. Può essere giocato in solitario, ed allora il giocatore controllerà entrambe le unità Mezzi, oppure in due giocatori, ognuno dei quali controllerà una sola delle unità Mezzi.

—description from the publisher (Italian)
categories: Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Forgotten Chambers: Land of Shadows
description:
Forgotten Chambers is an exploration game in which dungeons are randomly generated through exploration cards. Each game follows a scenario as part of a campaign described in the dedicated booklet. It will be quite possible to create scenarios thanks to the various explorations cards and related events without forgetting encounters and monsters.

When discovering a new exploration card, a player draws an encounter card on which a small ambient text is described and what the heroes discover. When all the players cross an area together we draw an event that we just place on the storyline at the bottom of the board, describing the scenario and its stages. Specific event cards to each scenario are added to the common ones.

The monsters encountered also depend on the scenarios: Kobolds and undead. All monsters (except bosses) are also drawn randomly.
It is possible to change the difficulty of the game by adding events and / or exploration cards to increase the exploration time. It is also possible to play with higher level monsters.

The game offers a great life because of all these elements. Each game will be different even if the same scenario is played several times thanks to all the exploration mechanics of the dungeons.
The core box will propose 4 heroes and several decks of experience cards that will allow you to evolve them. Many treasures and equipment will also be part of the contents of the basic box.

—description from the publisher

name: Trivial Pursuit Questions: Compact Entertainment Edition
description:
600 questions compiled in a book for use with any Trivial Pursuit base game. The questions are all about entertainment in the following categories:

AWARD WINNERS: outstanding films, plays, and TV series which have been honored with Oscars, Tony or Olivier awards

CINEMA: Well-known classic films, blockbusters, and family favorites

TELEVISION: Mostly UK programs and series, but includes US and Australian programs aired on UK networks

THEATER: Stage shows and musicals from around the world, together with classic plays from Stoppard to Shakespeare

PERFORMERS: Famous actors of stage and screen, their roles and achievements

QUOTES: Classic lines from films, plays, and TV shows
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Pinch
description:
Pinch is played on the intersections of a square grid (9x9, 11x11 or 13x13 are the recommended sizes). One player plays with black stones, the other with white stones. The borders of two opposing sides of the board are colored black; the remaining two sides have white-colored borders. (If a Go board is used, mark the ownership of sides as follows: place a black stone near one side of the board and then place another black stone near the opposite side; do the same with white stones and the remaining sides.)

A player’s goal is to connect his/her two same-colored board sides with a group of orthogonally-connected stones of his/her color. On each turn, a player must place a single own-stone on any empty point. If as a direct result of the placement, a player has two own-stones that are orthogonally adjacent to an enemy stone at a right angle, then that enemy stone is converted to an own-stone. If the newly converted stone creates conditions for a similar capture, then that capture takes place immediately, and so on in a chain reaction. A capturing pair (i.e. the two own-stones that bring about a capture of an enemy stone) must contain at least one newly placed or newly converted stone, otherwise no capture takes place.

For examples of captures, see the Rules Forum posting titled “How Pinch captures work.”

In order to offset the first player’s advantage, the PIE RULE applies. (After the first stone is placed on the board, the other player decides which color of stones he/she wants to play.)

-description from designer

name: Marketplace: Business Battle
description:
Doing business means to attract and sell a product/service to customers. As entrepreneurs, we create many strategies to achieve that goal. In the digital era, we enter and seek new opportunities in an online platform called "MARKETPLACE". Among the business war, any company can gain most customer base and capital will win and dominate the MARKETPLACE.

Marketplace: Business Battle is a business strategy board game for 2-4 players. You are an entrepreneur in the ever-changing online market industry, seeking fame and profits. Your company aims to attract potential customers by sending workers to do various marketing activities such as scout influencers, create contents, advertise, develop features, and research the market.

—description from the designer

name: Foodfighters: The Salty Expansion
description:
Another high-sodium expansion faction! The Salty faction also includes nine new fighters tiles, three Salty-only power cards, and a sheet of nine thought bubble clingers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Powered Smash Masters: New Recruits Set
description:
The New Recruits Set is a standalone expansion for two players. It can be combined with the Core Set or with other expansion sets to increase the number of players.

Game Features:

Recruit a team of heroes to battle other hero teams — for no reason! It’s just like comics!
Defeat all rivals to win.
Customize your deck! Choose your best heroes and create a deck that compliments their abilities.
Can be combined with other SPSM sets.
Groups of up to 8 people (or more) can play together!
Fast-Paced Fun! Beat up your friends and still have time for… well… another game of Smash Masters!


Playing Super Powered Smash Masters is easy!

Everyone starts with a team of 6 heroes.
Use Smash Cards, Team Up Cards, Story Cards, or Individual Powers to defeat your opponents.
Be the last player with at least one hero left on the table to win!


—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor

name: Rayguns and Rocketships: "I Shot First" 2017 Promo Card
description:
Who shot first? You did!

"If you are the first player while this card is in play, you may spend one action token to re-energize and shoot a raygun once."

This 2017 convention exclusive card allows players to get the drop on their opponents while they are first player! It's the only way for a player to fire their rayguns more than once during the game and with the three action tokens you get for playing it, you can blast at your enemies at least extra three times on your turn, making it a powerful card to play!

The "I shot first" card was available to the first playtesters of the game and visitors to IDW's booth at Gen-Con 2017 and from designer Scott Rogers who appeared at various cons that summer including Gen-Con, Strategicon and BGG.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Unlikely Allies
description:
An isolated tea house is under attack. The hostess and her clients band together in its defence - peasant and samurai, ronin and priest forced into an unlikely alliance.

Hostess - elegant proprietor - don't underestimate her!.
Ronin Marksman - crack shot with a musket.
Clan Envoy - high-ranking samurai, able to summon reinforcements.
Wise Old Man - with years of experience and local knowledge.
Priest - kneels in prayer to inspire his allies.
Ashigaru Deserter - hated by his former comrades.
Watchman - searches out enemies in the darkness.
Blacksmith - sharpens blades and hits things with hammers!

This set is slightly different to the previous expansions - you can certainly use them together as a complete, and very characterful force, but the individuals are also designed to be added into other forces.

Their abilities tend to help the friends around them. For example, the Blacksmith improves everyone's weapons while the Watchman can remove enemy Cautious markers, and of course helps in night battles!

Box contains 18 gaming cards for Test of Honour and 8 metal character miniatures plus bases.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Prendi il Cucciolo
description: There are four animals (pig, cow, cat and dog) on the table. There are some cards. In each card there is the picture of the animals, or the colour, or the profile or a draw of one of the animal. The first take the correct animal take the card. Who has more cards in the end is the winner. For experts there are also cards with two animals one with correct colors one with wrong ones. You have to catch the animal illustrated with correct colors.

name: Arnold Palmer's Table Golf
description:
A tin board with a felt green tabletop mini-golf game. Endorsed by Arnold Palmer himself, the game was released in the mid 1960s and came with a number of plastic obstacles to create 9 holes of play. The obstacle pieces were brightly colored plastic and varied in various editions of the game, but were primarily yellow, blue, and red components. The tin board had a number of small holes numbered for the various plastic components to recreate each of the 9 holes, as the 1st hole was intended to be a straight shot to the hole. The board also has small indentations for a fairway tee and a near green tee. The game utilized plunger putters to play. The putters could be used with the putterhead on either side to be used in a pushing or striking manner.

—user summary

name: On To Vienna!
description:
On To Vienna! – simulating the Austro-Prussian War (1866) – is a sequel to On To Paris! using a wargame system adapted from Victory Games’ The Civil War. Players familiar with On To Paris! will be immediately familiar with the scale, system, rules and game play of On To Vienna!, taking the action to central Europe and Italy in 1866.

The systems challenge players to control the leadership, organization and military operations of Armies and Corps during the later 19th century, this time between Prussia and its ally Italy against Austria and the independent Federal German States, including Bavaria, Saxony and Hanover, with the exciting possibility of French Intervention.

Designed for two players, On To Vienna! is also suitable for solitaire play. Eleven scenarios include various ‘early start’ situations and the historical start of the war as well as a number of key points with the conflict already underway that can continue past the historical end of the conflict. An introductory “learning” scenario introduces players to the system and several scenarios look at exciting variations such as Austria being able to focus and bring more effort against either Prussia or Italy. Players can also pick any scenario as a starting point and determine their own period of the conflict to simulate. Most scenarios can be played on sections of the maps for smaller, shorter and faster games and as before with On to Paris! many optional rules explore interesting historical options for both sides.

On To Vienna! is a fast moving competitive game where players do their best to control their forces and where every decision creates excitement and tension. The game system features interactive game play with flexible initiative and variable turn length as well as extensive defensive player reaction ability. The game puts players in charge of all the famous Corps and Army leaders of the Austro-Prussian War which are all rated for their individual leadership qualities and occasional unique characteristics like resistance to following orders.

—description from the publisher

name: Sinister Six: Hobgoblin Promo Cards
description: First available at Gen Con 2019. Includes a pack of unique cards for the villain Hobgoblin as well as a punch board of standee tokens to use in game.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: Ultimate Rush
description:
Ultimate Rush is an adrenaline pumping experience mixed with gamer-level strategy. Players create coins and attack points in real time and then attempt to grab a turn order token before they’re all gone!

You can buy energy, power-ups, and upgrades in the Market, then battle INSANE Monsters to help save the Kingdom! Make sure you throw a sweet party or two in between battles and always remember, we fight to become the Most Famous! Live in the moment and finally let everyone know you’re a champion... as if they needed more evidence...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: King of the Roll
description:
King of the Roll is a Brazilian Jiujitsu inspired fighting game. Designed for two players to go head-to-head in a jiujitsu fight. The first one to achieve a submission wins. The players will start each fight standing up and the takedown phase starts. When the fight goes to the ground you will try to improve your position, control your opponent and finally get the submission.

The game consists of more than 50 BJJ techniques and utilizes a combination of Hand Management, Dice Rolling and Dice Modification

It is easy to learn, fun and fast-paced yet has a good depth of strategy as well.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Department of Fabricant Management
description: The Department is a tabletop miniature game set in a near future America where Fabricated Human Simulants, also known as fabricants, walk among us. Players take on the role of agents from the U.S. Department of Fabricant Management, a government department charged with policing fabricants and fighting the increasing instances of fabricant-related terrorism. The Department is a tabletop sci-fi, miniature skirmish game that emphasizes cooperation, and investigation utilizing a unique GMless system.
mechanics: Action Points, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Median
description:
Median is a fast-paced, exciting party game that will have you and your friends laughing, guessing, and strategizing your way to victory! In each round, one player will read a trivia question out loud and then everyone will write down their answer on a piece of paper. Once everyone has submitted their answers, they are organized in ascending order and the player(s) who wrote the answer that's in the middle of all answers (hence the name "Median") wins that round!

But here's the twist: you don't actually need to know the correct answer to win. In fact, sometimes the funniest or least-likely answer will be the one that ends up in the middle! This can add an element of strategy to the game, as you have to think about what other players might write and try to come up with an answer that will put you in the winning spot.

Whether you're a trivia buff or just looking for a fun and lighthearted party game, Median is sure to provide hours of entertainment and laughter. So gather your friends, grab some pens and paper, and get ready to play the game that's all about the middle!

—description from the designer

name: Necromunda Underhive: Dramatis Personae Cards 1
description:
Recruit the most feared names in the Underive to aid your gang in the fight for survival.

This set contains Fighter cards for all of the Dramatis Personae Hired Guns currently available in the game of Necromunda. Also included is a blank Fighter card for creating your own Hired Gun, using the rules presented in Necromunda: Gangs of the Underhive.

Each card is a handy reference , detailing the fighter's profile, weapons, Wargear , skills, and cost.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Potomac
description:
A GAME OF COOPERATION
OBJECT: guide the animals to the forest by crossing the river and the clearing.
Together, the players help the 6 little animals reach the forest without any of them being swept over the waterfall or captured by the wolf roaming the clearing. Roll the dice to determine which path to take, and use your defensive cards against the wolf. When the six animals have reached the forest on the other side of the river, they’re safe and sound!

+++ Can be played with 5 little animals instead of 6 for an easier version of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Curly Fu
description:
Curly Fu is an easy-to learn, yet highly re-playable tile flipping game for 2-4 players, developed by Gérard Pierson.

Your objective is to search the rooms of the old mansion for clues, scattered around the hallways. To do so, you will in turn need to use the power of the old parchments, outsmart your opponents by using secret passages, and lure them into rooms without an (easy) exit. The game evolves differently each time as the tiles are flipped in a non-linear fashion. As Fame can be lost and found in more than one way, only the detective with the most Fame at the end of the search will be declared winner of the game and step into Peanuts’ footprints.

—description from the designer

name: Frog Tag
description:
Frolicking frogs play tag with each other in a pond filled with water lilies.

Frog Tag is a quick, tactical, 2-3 player, analytic game where players attempt to trap their opponents and capture them by reducing the number of moves available to them.

—description from the designer

name: Legends of Wrestling: Expansion Pack I
description:
The first Legends color expansion pack, with a focus on tag teams. This game edition includes 12 new game cards and a printed handbook featuring bios for all wrestlers.

The Fantastics are part of Legends: Expansion Pack I along with the Rock ‘N’ Roll Express, Midnight Express, The Sheepherders Miracle Violence Connection and Heavenly Bodies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Sports

name: Imperial Settlers: Roll & Write – Gen Con 2019 Promosheet
description: Alternative village sheet that was originally given as a promotional item at Gen Con 2019, but has been made available afterwards as a free download on the website of Portal games.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Nebrodensis: the tale of Cremete and the Wolf Cristaldii
description:
In the East of the island of Sicily lived a man named Cremete (similar to Radagast of Lotr), he controlled the animals in the lost woods; this man managed to impress King Roger II (1095 - 1154). In the west of the island of Sicily there lived a wolf (now extinct): the Canis Lupus Cristaldii, a large and fast, lethal blond wolf. This is true the story of a Wolf and a man who lived in the deep European Middle Ages: do you want to be part of it? Nebrodensis is the name of the Sicilian mountains and in this enchanted island the game develops on 8 abstract games 1vs1 (or 1vs2) or other in 8 solitaire games; symmetrical and asymmetrical, strategic and aleatory, german and american, nocturnal or diurnal, pushed into a psychological wood where only fangs and magic win. The only way to survive is to become an extinct Wolf or a magical Hermit really existed: do you accept the challenge or are you too afraid of the moon?

—description from the publisher

name: Gosu: Kao
description: A promo card for Gosu
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Cars 3: Auta do Auta
description:
The time when each journey is an adventure car does not last forever in children. Sometimes it doesn't even come. For these cases, it is useful to have a backup cars in the car.

Traveling game full of fun tasks will save you a long time wherever you are.

Difficulty of tasks is graded for children from 4, 6 and 8 years, just select the cards with the right symbols.

The main goal of the game is to entertain all participants. But victory can look forward to who earns the most points by completing tasks.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Kinderspiele aus aller Welt
description:
Games are connecting people! Everywhere in our world there are exciting and funny children's games. Children play with marbles in Turkey, are clapping hands in Syria, and in Germany they knock down cans. With "Kinderspiele aus aller Welt" children not only get to know many new games from all over the world, they also take a look at other countries, experience a part of different cultures and discover many things in common.

The children look closely at pictures of a country and give a hint on which continent this country could be located. Afterwards everyone plays a mini-game together, which is played in this country. If you guess correctly, are lucky and show skill, you win!

With 24 small games from all over the world, children immerse themselves in other cultures and receive their first orientation on the world map. With vividly illustrated instructions on the playing cards, curious world explorers play independently and with lots of fun. A multitude of different game material makes the journey around the world a varied gaming experience.

—user summary

name: TrioMONSTERS
description:
A fun strategic game with scary monsters from Djeco!

A challenging game where the aim is to make chains of 4 monsters in the same colour, or to surround a black monster with 3 monsters of different colour. Whenever you do one of these, you score the 4 monster cards.

You can play a monster next to any other monster, unless there is already a monster of the same colour on the table, in that case you have to place your monster next to the monster of the same colour (except if the monster is already surrounded by three other monsters). You must playe 1, 2, or 3 monsters each turn, and then refill you hand to 4 cards.

You must plan carefully, so you don't give your opponents an easy play.

The game ends when the last card is played, and the player with the most scored cards wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Sproutword
description:
A compelling word strategy game for 2-4 players, Sproutword is easy to learn but hard to master. The aim is to hold the "Sproutword" - the longest word with more of your colour letters in it than any other one player's colour.

Each player takes a number of letters from their bag and places them face-up for all players to see (for example, it is 8 tiles each for a two player game).

The first player plays a word using ANY player's letters.On following turns, players put down a new word linked to an existing one, or change a word. Again, players may use ANY of the letters from ANY player.

Changed words must be at least as long as the existing one, and changes must not displace another word.

Players replenish their letters only after their OWN turn. Play continues until any player has played their turn and their bag is empty so they cannot even partially replenish. The winner is the player who controls the Sproutword at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Mit År10: Quizzen om 60'erne
description:
A quiz game with a stack of cards each with six questions about the 1960's.

At the beginning of the game, the players decide how many points to play to.

On a player's turn, he rolls the die and the player to his left asks him the corresponding question. If he answers correctly, he gets the card as a point. If his answer is wrong, the other players may hit the bell to answer the question and get the card and the point if correct.

The game ends when a player has the agreed number of points.

—user summary

name: Champions of Legarren
description:
Champions of Legarren is a fun, competitive fitness-based card game for 1-5 players.

In the game, you take on the role of one of five Champions to battle in an epic tournament for the glory of being crowned the Knight of Legarren.

Each character has a deck of ability cards at their disposal. To use those abilities, you must pass an exercise challenge. The better you perform at that exercise challenge, the more powerful that ability becomes!

The game has three modes: Training, Versus, and Tournament. In Training mode, you work your way through your character's deck, practicing the movements and getting a great at-home workout. In Versus mode, you challenge one other player to a duel, battling until one of you is victorious. Finally, in Tournament mode, up to 5 players compete in an all-out battle royale to determine the Knight of Legarren.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Tabula Trivium
description:
Tabula Trivium is an abstract, combinatorial two-player game. Players will take turns moving pawns and stones of their own colour. The goal is to either remove all of the opponent’s pawns or stones or to block the opponent’s pawn movement.

Players will take turns moving pawns and stones of their own colour. Each turn, you first move one of your pawns and then one of your stones.

You must start your turn with a pawn movement before you move any stone.

You must start your turn with a pawn movement before you move any stone.

If you are able to move a pawn you must move. If you can move any of your stones after you have moved a pawn you must move a stone before passing the turn.

You may only move in a straight line, no turns along the path. You move your pawns from node to node (the cross-sections on the board).

You move your pawn one or two steps.

You move your stones as far as you like and are able to along a straight line.

You may not end your movement on an occupied node (cross-section).

If a pawn or stone is adjacent to the pawn this player is about to move, the player may jump over it, capture it and remove it from play, as long as there is a place to land on the other side. This jumping to remove a game piece is considered as pawn movement of the turn. You could jump over both your own and your opponent’s pawns and stones, removing them from play.

If a player is out of stones, loses its last pawn or is unable to move any pawns at all during its own turn, this player loses the game.

—description from the designer

name: Medieval Magic Market: Bajo La Luna Roja
description:
This expansion contains 10 new cards to be used with the basic game. Add 6th player.

—user summary

name: Medieval Magic Market: El Muelle de Niverath
description: This expansion contains 10 new cards. Add 6th player.

name: Build, Piggy, Build!
description:
The big bad wolf wants nothing more than to blow houses down and eat piggies up, but try as he might, he can’t blow down houses made of brick. Be the first to build a sturdy house and win the game!

Build, Piggy, Build! is a family-weight game with two components: a custom six-sided die and a deck of 48 cards. Players take turns rolling the die to determine whether or not (and how many) cards can be drawn from the face-down draw pile or the face-up discard pile. Standard cards depict a one of four parts of a house (of which there are five different constructions). The winning five card hand is comprised of one of each of the parts of a house (all the same color) + one "piggy" card.

Special cards are included to influence gameplay. The "piggy nose" card allows a player to root through the discard pile for a particular card instead of rolling. The "wolf" card can be used to force any player to discard any one card. The "huff-and-puff" card can be used to force an immediate re-roll of the die.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Pizza Connection The Card Game
description:
Play your cards and bake the best pizzas in town!
Points are earned by baking pizzas with ingredients from your hand. Who will be the best baker, who will bake the Super Pizza?

Several pizza cards are open, depending on number of players. Small pizzas worth 5 points, medium worth 10 and large worth 20 points.
Each player holds 5 cards, drawing another at the start of their turn, which could either be ingredients to bake a pizza (collect it if you have the required ingredients) or event cards that must be played to remove them from a player's hand to make room for ingredients.

A player may also discard 3 ingredients to open an event card. After an event a player cannot fill up their hand or play event cards.

If there are no more pizza cards of a single size left, 5 ingredients will be flipped over to create the super pizza.
Once only one pizza type cards are left, or the super pizza has been baked, the game ends, and players count points.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Video Game Theme

name: Raid on Taihoku: Epic Collection
description:
This board game is dedicated to the people of Taiwan and those who care about Taiwan.

In the closing stages of World War II, when Taiwan was still a Japanese colony, more than one hundred U.S. B-24 bombers launched an air raid on Taihoku (Taipei). Political and military facilities were the main targets, but civilians were also affected. Many homes were destroyed, and a large number of people were killed or wounded.

Raid on Taihoku Epic Collection takes you back to two Taiwan cities "Taihoku and Keelung" in 1945. In reloaded version, players will have two maps to assemble including Taihoku and Keelung during playing.
In the midst of war, you must cooperate to survive. You will be fettered and will face difficult choices. We must live until the war is over. To win or to die?
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Mapominoes: Eurail Interrail
description:
It's like dominoes but with maps, as you build a map of the Eurail network, by connecting countries that share a common border. Stay one step ahead of your opponents, as you race to be the first player to play all your country cards on the table and win the game.

This game is not for sale, but has been sent as a gift to travelers who have purchased a Eurail or Interrail pass.

—description from the box

name: Divided America: The Next Civil war
description:
"But, Colonel! You're asking us to attack other US citizens!" "Do your work, soldier! This is Divided America."

Divided America: The Next Civil War is a simulation game of a hypothetical near-future conflict within the once United States. A presidential election has just concluded, and no clear winner has arisen. Martial law is declared, but competing factions on the Joint Chiefs of Staff result in a divided military, and militia forces are popping up in the urban centers.

This is YOUR chance to command one of those military forces, or a militia force, and see if you can overcome your enemies and restore some measure of control over Divided America.

Designed in the classic hex-and-counter style of "military chess" game playing popularized in the 1970s and 1980s, this game lets you decide the fate of the republic.

Battles take place on a brand new original map which has a simplified terrain representation of the lower-48 states. Cities, forests, rivers, lakes, and coasts are among the terrain types represented on the map.

In a civil war, will militia units do well, or run away? Will military units fire on civilians, even if they have taken up arms? What will happen in a Divided America? And over it all hovers the fear of who has the `nuclear football'? Will nuclear attacks happen?

Game Facts: Three sets of double-sided counters made by professional artists, an original map commissioned just for this game, and a comprehensive 60 page rules book.

1-3 players ages 10+ with great solo rules. Game length 45 minutes to several hours Numerous and varied scenarios, from a quick skirmish to the huge country wide game 'when the SHTF'

—description from the designer

name: My Kingdom
description:
