My Kingdom is one of its kind strategic card game. Despite its unique mechanism, it’s a child’s play to grasp the game. With the lucid instructions provided within the box, you can learn the rules as you play. This game runs on three fundamental operations. The first one is to simply build your kingdom using the defense cards you’re dealt with. Next, sabotage your rivals with the attack cards in your hand. The third goal is to simultaneously protect your kingdom from the wrath of your opponents using several action cards. The objective is to defeat your enemies by ambushing their kingdom cards. The player with the last Kingdom standing is the Supreme Monarch!

—description from the publisher

name: You Don't Know My Life
description:
You Don't Know My Life! is the game about the things we all share. Sure, the details may be different...but we all have hopes, we all have fears, we all have mortifying things that happened to us when we were 13. And we all have STORIES.

How the game works:

Everyone writes down an answer to a question card
Shuffle all the answers and deal them back out
Read an answer aloud and sum it up in a funny hashtag
Try to match each answer with the player who wrote it


—description from publisher

name: Rental Rumble
description: Rental Rumble is a casual retro-themed board game celebrating video rental stores and movies from the 80s and 90s. Be the first to rent, watch, and return 3 VHS movies before your opponents to win. Avoid late fees, and always be kind and rewind. Game fits inside a VHS box just how you remember.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: My Shitty Family: Fat Jerry's "Oh Hell No" Expansion
description:
Fat Jerry's "Oh Hell No" Expansion adds 50 new topic/challenge cards to the My Shitty Family base game.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Cleveland Wrecking Co. Game
description:
Aim the wrecking ball, swivel the crane, and score points by knocking down the building like a real pro. Pit your skill and strategy against your friends. First player to score 50 points wins. A fast moving family fun game for 1-6 players.

—description from the box

In short, players take turns using a plastic crane to knock down a building made of plastic blocks.

—user summary

name: Bionicle Quest For the Masks CCG: Bohrok Swarm
description: An addition to the first expansion, the Bohrok (Pronounced Bow-RocK) Swarm focuses on the Bohrok Story arc. This expansion features very similar to the base game, with the addition of a new mechanic called Bohrok Control.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
publishers: The Lego Group, Upper Deck Entertainment

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Maximum Extermination!
description: This expansion adds the Supreme Dalek, Special Weapons Dalek, and the Genesis Ark to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, six Dalek faction cards, and five new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Minute Diktator
description:
A low luck 2-player area majority game. Player play 4 cards from a hand of 8, with each card adding influence to one area and removing (1 less) influence from another area. Then players pick up all 8 cards and swap hands in preparation for the second round. There is also a secret bid between rounds on which areas you think you will have won by the end of the game. Winning majorities and making your bid score you points.

From the Game Box:
You and your rival are each rallying your numerous supporters to be the next and most inspirational commander. However, you must convince the shadowy Council of Five to back you. The Council collectively wield enough power to determine which of you will triumph and which will be ... forgotten. To sway the Council members to back your claim, you and your opponent will each champion a unique series of policies. Each policy will earn approval from one of the Council members, but simultaneously harm your standing with another. Angering any one member too much can result in dire consequences. To gain an additional edge, form secret alliances with Council members and dramatically reveal your plots to devastating effect. A poorly timed decision and cost you everything, but the right ones will see you claim the mantle of Diktator.

name: Dark Woods of Winter: A New Campaign for Five Leagues From the Borderlands
description:
Are you ready for your solo / same-side fantasy campaigns to take the next steps?

After adventuring in the borderlands, gather your sword and torches and venture deep into The Woods seeking fortune and glory.

Dark Woods of Winter is a campaign supplement for Five Leagues From the Borderlands, exploring the deep, dark fey-haunted woodlands of the fantasy world.

Encounter outlaws, vengeful elfin spirits and the horrors of the deep, dark.

This expansion offers the following:


Brand new encounters, creatures and enemies with more detail than ever.



New loot to acquire and new skills to earn.



A new category of encounters: Special Encounters with everything from evil spirits to temporary NPC allies.


You can even get your own wolf cub!


A greater challenge, with more risks (and rewards) than the core rules adventure tables.



More bleak, foggy heavy metal feel than you can shake an over-sized sword at.



* * * *


Dark Woods of Winter is a 32 page campaign replacement, offering a new way to play the game.

It does not replace the original game rules and they are needed to use this supplement.

YOU MUST OWN A COPY OF "FIVE LEAGUES FROM THE BORDERLANDS" TO USE THIS PRODUCT.

This supplement increases the supernatural presence a fair bit. If you prefer a more naturalistic game, it may not fit your intentions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rêve de trésor
description:
This game is about you been the first to find the pirate treasure.
You need to collect the 3 objects: the map, a key and the compass.
Then you need to go to one of the three island to return the treasure card and find the treasure (the 2 others been empty and with the pirate) before the pirate reach the top of the dedicated scale.

Each turn, the player have to roll a dice, and move accordingly on the board.
Depending on where you finish your move, you may collect:

one of the needed object
Relaunch the dice
Move the main pirate
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: SEN: Save The Queen
description:
In medieval times, twin princess rise in power to become queen. They split the land into west and east. Both queens hate each other and feel envious that the opposing land is greater than their land. Then one fateful day, these two queens rally their armies to wage war between themselves.

In SEN: Save The Queen, each player becomes the queen of their respective kingdom and duels to take the lands of the other. Using only eighteen tiles to play, each player must outwit the other to trap the opposing queen. Each player has three types of units: swordsmen, spearmen, and horsemen. The battlefield is a 3x3 grid of tiles, with each player's queen occupying an opposing corner and a priest as a neutral unit in the middle of the battlefield. Then each player in turn, places their units in the available spaces.

Gameplay is simple: There are eight action cards, and each player holds three cards at the beginning of the game. In turn order, each player can play a card from their side or take back two cards to their side of field. Each card affects certain units they control to move or attack opposing units. The player who can successfully occupy two adjacent grids owned by the enemy queen with their healthy units wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Lawn Promo Card
description:
Promo card for Empires of the North.

This card is a promo card made for and available from the Rolling Dice & Taking Names Gaming Podcast

To use this card, give it to the first player at the start of the game.

Card Text-
"Action: Spend 1 worker to gain 1 food and pass the card to the player on your left"
categories: Ancient, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration

name: The King's Guild: Ascend the Dice Tower
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

A new quest card
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – I am The Master
description: This expansion adds five different incarnations of The Master to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, five faction cards, and two new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Developing the Portable Wargame
description: A further book that expands Bob Cordery's Portable Wargame system, featuring small and quick games on square or hex-grid terrain. This contains rules for ancient warfare and aerial warfare in the first half of the twentieth century. It also contains additional and optional rules for the rulesets featured in the previous "The Portable Wargame" book. The book concludes with some example mini-campaigns and scenarios.
categories: Ancient, Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Autarch: The Age of Blood and Glory
description:
The Autarchs are sadistic creatures.
You should know, being one of them. Galactic Wars have made you the rulers of the known worlds, but now the High Autarch is seeking a new, worthy pastime. Welcome to the Age of Blood and Glory, where you and your opponents will send your fighters to the epic re-enactments of the infamous wars, in the hope of finding favour with the High Autarch.

Autarch: The Age of Blood and Glory is an asymmetric PvP arena combat miniature tabletop for 1-4 players, also playable as skirmish, with additional worker placement preparation phase which builds the campaign potential of the game.

With two games in one, your journey will alter between merciless arena battles, based on unique dice-less card combat, providing both a macabre and fun experience; and worker-placement phases, where you will strategize your next steps in a push-your-luck environment.

Battles are played in a modular arena with different fighter races, developed by advanced deck-building through character leveling and equipping different items. Main mechanics which make up the unique and challenging experience of Autarch include:

Initiative Dial mechanism creates a dynamic player order, depending on the played cards;
Threat Level defines how much each fighter is worth in every attack, making it less opportunistic to focus on the weaker ones;
Dice-replacement Power deck represents effort a player is willing to invest in all of his actions. As both the attacker and the defender will have to use Power, you will not only have to make trade offs between offense and defense, but also test your bluffing skills in an effort to read through your opponent’s secret intentions;
Player’s hand being the target of attacks (selected randomly by opponents during successful attacks), with your initial hand being comprised of combat- and defense cards, and clogged with wounds as you get damaged, which may inflict you with permanent injuries.


—description from the publisher

name: Some Submarine Second-Guessing
description:
Trying to decipher the characteristics of modem Russian submarines and their weapons is a tricky proposition. Unlike Soviet-built tanks and aircraft, no Russian first-line submarine has ever been exported to an ally - so no one has ever been captured and analyzed by the Western Powers. And since no Soviet nuclear sub has ever fired a shot in anger, their weapon systems have never been observed under combat
conditions. These factors combine to make anyone's conclusions about the capabilities of Russian submarines subject to considerable debate. Here is an attempt to inflict mine upon the FLEET system.

—description from the publisher

This provides an in-depth look at Soviet submarine capabilities within the FLEET Series, including deep-diving ability, double hulls, titanium hulls, clusterguard, torpedo factors, movement allowance and charts to provide easy to find details.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame

name: Ein Altes Kriegsspiel
description:
A wargame played on a square grid using square cardboard tokens for representing military units. It was played around 1809-1820 at the Plebanischen Institute in Wien and was probably designed by a teacher or student(s) there. The rules were written down by an Austrian army officer A.P Reyer and published under the name "Ein Altes Kriegsspiel" (that translates to "An Old Wargame") in 1858. The rulebook also contains drawings showing an example game board and images that can be used for painting the units, although they are not to scale or complete, so players are expected to construct their own components rather than cut out the images from the book.

The book retained the original theme from the game as played in the 1810's, with images showing Napoleonic war era uniforms and weapons.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Exodus Trading Card Game: The Dimension That Disappeared
description:
The Dimension That Disappeared is the 3rd booster pack and the 5th overall set in the Exodus TCG.

Details

This set introduced the Afterthought mechanic as a new secondary Ability featured exclusively on Chrono creatures. Rares started getting their Ability & Ability Name hot stamped to further enhance their foil treatment. Secret Rares continued with their 3D raised foil treatment and their pull ratio of 1 in every 4 booster boxes, or 3 per case. No new Harmony Rares were introduced as they were deemed exclusive to Set 4 Converging Chasms. The set instead brought massive support for a few Guilds, specifically focusing on Chronos, Treefolk and Shardfolk--even going so far as to mix the latter two's mechanics. This expansion set also assigns the new Box Topper Rare title to the box topper card, replacing its old Secret Rare title; this change was made due to the single SR that always comes as a box topper having a Rare foil treatment rather than the usual treatment for the SR rarity tier. Box Topper Rares have a 'fixed' pull ratio, meaning they always appear at the same rate, 1 per box and cannot be found in packs themselves.

The booster display packaging was overhauled to a shorter 2-column box, doing away with the Styrofoam filler that was found in older booster boxes.

'Scaling' effects are introduced in this expansion; effects & Abilities that become more powerful depending on if the player pays additional cost(s) or is playing with a teammate in Multiplayer format. The set is optimized for both Constructed and Booster Draft formats.

The planet's landscapes shaped themselves into 3 different, massive creatures in an effort to annihilate the legion of Chronos invading from a lost dimension. Eeventide's will manifested in the form of the 3 Harmony Rares during the war, causing temporary alliances between Guilds. But as portals continued to collide and Chronos infected Drifters and creatures alike, Treeforge Guild Leader Oliver Rose fought against the smoky onslaught. He used his Psylerran powers to seal off the dimensional rift between Eeventide and The Dimension That Disappeared...only to discover that another Guild Leader also took it upon herself to dive into the forsaken dimension at the last moment. Crystallus, the Shardveil Guild's tyrannical leader, was exposed as a puppet to the real Shardveil Guild Leader, Lucia Lievdrahs. Together, she and Oliver Rose must navigate the severed dimension to vanquish the source of Chronos' destruction and find a way back to Eeventide before they are trapped for all of eternity.

Set Breakdown:

This set consists of 77 cards, including:
1 Box Topper Rare
8 Secret Rares
27 Rares
18 Uncommons
23 Commons

The 8 Secret Rares have a packaging ratio of 1 in every 4 booster boxes, or 3 per booster case.
The Box Topper Rare (End of the Rift) can only be found as a fixed box topper in sealed booster boxes and not in packs themselves.

Box Toppers

Box Toppers are extra/bonus cards included as incentive when opening an entire booster box or display.
Box Toppers are always Foil.
1 of the 2 Box Toppers in every box is "fixed", meaning it is the same card in every box.
The 2nd Box Topper is a random Foil from the booster set (Uncommon or higher).
A new rule card explaining the Afterthought mechanic is included as a 3rd card with Box Toppers in this set.
The Box Topper Rare rarity tier is the equivalent rarity to a regular Rare, placing it below Secret Rare and Harmony Rare on the rarity mechanic latter.

Sneak Peek Creature Types & Product Pattern

The trend of previewing upcoming factions has continued since the first booster set. However, that pattern has been shaken up with this set; Set 4 hinted at Chronos and Machines being the next fully supported creature types. While this set does contain full support for Chronos, Machines' new mechanic has not yet been spoiled and will see support in Set 6. The sneak preview creature types in this set that will gain full support in a future set are Machines & Leviathans. Additionally, the alternating product pattern of decks & boosters was switched up with two back to back booster releases.

Creature Types

This set introduces the following creature types:

- Crow
- Peacock
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chaining, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Bear Yourselves Valiantly: Look, Sarge, No Charts – Fantasy, Ancient, and Mediaeval
description:
Bear Yourselves Valiantly is the fourth rule set to feature the Look, Sarge, No Charts! rule system. BYV features dynamic mechanics that allow the players to fight the battle, not the rules. In these rules “realism” is gained through simple mechanics that stress the players’ decision making. BYV provides period feel without pages of onerous charts or cumbersome rules.

... And best of all, there are NO CHART CARDS to detract from the fun, clutter the aesthetics of your table, or slow down the game.

Whether you are new to the Look, Sarge, No Charts! rule system or a fan, whether you are an aficionado of the period or a newcomer, when you play BYV, you will be challenged and excited.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Party Bandimals
description:
Have you ever dreamed about starting your own band and living the rock life? Party Bandimals gives you the experience of being the band manager with the important job of scouting out the best talent for your band of animals. You will be playing against other managers who are trying to add the best musical animals to their band, while trying to push the worst musicians to your band.

Party Bandimals is best for 2-4 players and takes about 15 minutes to play, but only minutes to learn! Do you have what it takes to make your band a success?

Goal
In Party Bandimals, you play as the role of a band manager. Your goal is to be the first manager to assemble a band with 11 points. You get points by playing good members into your band but beware other players can play bad members into
your band lowering your score. If the cards run out the player with the highest score wins.

Setup
Deal each player 3 cards. Each player should discard any 'Play When Drawn' cards and draw back up to three cards.
The player who played an instrument last goes first.

How to play
On your turn you must draw up to four cards and play one card. If you draw a 'Play when drawn' card, it must be the card you play. Good members can only be played in your band and bad band members can only be played into another players band. Played cards are placed in front of you, thus forming your band, or in front of another player when adding bad band members to their band.

—description from the publisher

name: It sucks!
description:
A cooperative card game using a standard playing card deck.

When a player draws a card, he can not keep it to himself and has to decide to which other player he wants to give it to.

The game is about all the players helping each other to be sure they can win Goal cards.

—description from the designer

name: This IS Rocket Science
description:
In This IS Rocket Science, players look to become the most prolific space explorer by landing on or orbiting planets. All game cards serve a dual purpose, acting as both the planets for scoring and the rocket fuel used to reach the planets.

On a turn players will draft cards from a central tableau or combine cards from their hands to reach exact target rocket fuel numbers to either land on or orbit a planet in the tableau. To score a planet, a player will discard cards from their hand and multiple the rocket fuel values together to hit the aforementioned target number. Some cards can also be discarded in order to add or subtract from the fuel value.

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Crew Cards
description:
In Aeronautica Imperialis, good crew make all the difference.

Elite pilots, navigators and gunners for your squadron in the form of 6 crew cards that can be combined with your favourite aircraft from Aeronautica Imperialis. Includes cards for both Ork and Imperial squads.

—description from the publisher

Contains the following six crew upgrades:

Imperial Navy Crew Upgrade: Lightning Reactions
Imperial Navy Crew Upgrade: Expert Gunner
Imperial Navy Crew Upgrade: Master Navigator
Ork Air Waaagh! Crew Upgrade: Lightning Reactions
Ork Air Waaagh! Crew Upgrade: Ace Gunna
Ork Air Waaagh! Crew Upgrade: Strategic Bommer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Corridors et Screams
description:
In this expansion of Possession, you build a castle as you explore more and more rooms! Place the locations following the gauntlets’ directions and create a map filled with dangers and many new rewards! Just beware the ghosts and the garrison!

—description from the box

name: Bam Bam Aksara Jawa
description:
Bam-Bam and friends found an old book full of Aksara Jawa. But they don’t know how to read Aksara Jawa at all. Let’s help Bam-Bam and friends to read every phrase of the book! You don’t need to know any Aksara Jawa to play this game. But, you might learn one or two Aksara Jawa after play this game!

In every turn players have to arrange Aksara Jawa Tiles as stated on the Target Cards. The quickest one gains the victory points. Game ends when all of Phrase Cards are accomplished. Player with the highest victory points is the winner!

name: Rebels & Redcoats: Volume III Compilation Edition
description: This three volume set uses the exact same box,artwork, and description as Volume III. It was sold as a special edition that included all three series game sets in one box. The ONLY differentiation is the Gold Sticker that mentions the additional content. If the stickers were gone, there would be no way to tell whether the game was just Volume III or all three volumes.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Civil War, Wargame

name: 18TE: Eisenbahnen im Tecklenburger Land
description:
18TE is an 18xx game in the german region of 'Tecklenburger Land'.

The focus of the game ist to give gamers without 18xx experience a possibility to play an 18xx with easy rules in a short time.

Take it as your first step into 18xx gaming. Experienced players may use it as a nightcap.

No privates, only 5 companies, a small map and 30% president shares make it playable for 2 or 3 players shortly.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Miniversity
description:
A 2-players card-placement micro game, only 20 cards.

Every card is consist of 6 squares, and there'll be 3 kinds activities on the card. The activities are the elements consist a life of miniversity student, which are Studying, Dating, Travelling, Part-time jobs and Hanging out with friends! You need to arrange your TIME efficiently to get better memories during all these activities.

Players each places 10 cards into their own placing zone in real time until each player has placed all their cards in their placing zone, then proceed to scoring points. The player who placed all cards faster get bonus points.

Placing rule:
You only need to overlap the previous card you just played, at least one square. It's no matter how many squares you covered, it's also fine to overlap whole card. It's free to cover any icons, you don't have to stack the same icon in the same position.

Scoring rule:
In Short game, check your 3 biggest blocks, you scoring 1 point for each icon in these blocks. The faster playing get 3 bonus points.

In Full game, check your biggest blocks in each kind of icon, you scoring 1 point for each icon in these blocks. Players get bonus points according to the speed rank.

-description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Racing

name: Tutti in Treno
description:
In Tutti in Treno each player is a little train driver. The player with the lead throws 3 colored dice and combines them to move his train on a modular path with different landscapes (mountains, hills, lakes, snow and deserts), trying to stop at the stations to pick up passengers. Passenger tiles are worth only 1 point, but if players are able to deliver them to the next station, then the tiles are flipped over and may be worth from 2 to 4 points at the end of the game.

The unused dice may be invested in some powerful and surprising bonus tiles to be used any time during the game. The first train driver who arrives at the last station of the path will also get a punctuality bonus, represented by a stationmaster hat.

The mechanics of Tutti in Treno not only are thought to highlight the idea of a path game keeping it always fun, but they also encourage kids to make some basic strategy choices, training at the same time logic and sense of space.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Race

name: Zulu: Rules for Miniatures
description:
Updated and Replaced by "Zulu Skirmish" in December 2020 - Click the "Zulu Skirmish" re-implemented link in header.

Zulu Rules for Miniatures is a Regimental level table Top Game that plays like a Skirmish Game. Use your own 28mm-15mm figures.

Zulu teaches you how to structure your British, Boers and Zulus. It walks you through all games steps by providing you with over 45 pictures and illustrations that will assist you in learning how to build, mount and play your Zulu, Boer or British Armies.

Zulu also includes one page of Tokens and 51 “Copy and Cut” and Cards for Leaders and Units. You can cut them out, fold them in half and slip them into sleeves from your local game store, or simply glue stick them together on card stock.

You will also need a handful of d6 and 10 each d10 dice per Army, a measuring stick and period miniatures to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Crazier Eights: Omniscience promo card
description:
A card to incorporate into a version of Crazier Eights.

Card Text:
At the beginning of your turn, you draw five cards. Then you may discard six additional cards this turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Dive in!
description:
In the game Dive in! players, as divers, will dive into the underwater world. Each time divers go on a new mission, they must take pictures of different sea creatures.
Dive in! is not only a fun pastime, the game develops spatial thinking, attention, sharpness of reaction, motor skills, memory, logical thinking and social skills.

Photography of sea creatures is the main feature of the game process. How does it work?
To photograph animals, place a perforated diver card on the card of the sea creatures. In the windows, you will see the animals that have been photographed. The others managed to hide from the camera lens.

The game process consists of three stages with different rules. You can choose to go through all of them or play one or two of your favorite ones.

—description from the publisher

name: Tanto Cuore: Serena Lavaux
description:
This is a promo card for Tanto Cuore.

It states:
Put this card back to the bottom of the Private Maid pile. Gain 2 servings.

PR25
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Catboop!
description:
Have you ever wondered why cats chase each other around the house? You want to say “Well, they obviously play with each other…” Wrong!! ! We all know that cats are planning world domination, but have you ever wondered how they determine who’s actually going to be in charge?

Cat Boop! - An on-going battle that will separate the strong from the weak, the fast from the slow and prove which one will become the Purrfect Commander in the incoming human enslavement.

In this 3-6 player strategic card game, you’re trying to eliminate your opponents by successfully dealing them 9 boops. However, they won’t simply just take them; by using their unique Cat-abilities and a variety of cards they’ll not only attempt to deflect the boops but also restrict your abilities to deal them.

Additionally to the extensive strategic aspect Catboop has 2 unique features which eliminate the pain points usually associated with card games.

Firstly, a “basket” mechanism, allows you to plan ahead your turns and reduces the luck of the draw by giving you a steady pool of cards to choose from.
Secondly, a “Pooper Scooper” ability, unique to each Cat, provides you with a way to participate in the game, even after you’ve been eliminated, making sure you can still revenge your loss.

All of this in a family friendly setting with a non-standard time frame, meaning you can shorten or expand the game time, depending on how much time you have to play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Das Lampion-Spiel
description:
The players start at the park entrance. Movement is determined by a die. Some spaces hinder or benefit the player. Each pawn has it's own track which intersects with the other tracks on crossroads. The first player to reach the podium, wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Axis & Allies Anniversary Edition: World on Fire
description:
This is a companion to the Anniversary Edition and/or 1942 Second Editions. Each nation gets its own deck of Morale Bonus Cards, and each player earns cards by national objectives (Anniversary Edition) or controlling victory cities(1942). Each card provides a historically accurate bonus or ability when the card is played.

A list of those bonuses and historical reference for each card is posted here: https://gamesmiths.us/Downloads/WF-Historical_Companion.pdf
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Tenth Doctor & Companions
description: This expansion adds the Tenth Doctor and four of his companions to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, five faction cards, and seven new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Paris 1919
description:
A game about treaty of Versailles. 10 country try to win the peace. Each one has to achieve some war goal in three domains SDN, Territories and Reparations. You gain some PV for submitting your propositions to other country after a time of deliberation.

Each turn after a random event, each country decide with which other contry they will talk, talk are secret (you can trade money, territories, votes...). After 10 minutes, all the coutry are around the map and vote for one proposition per player. Player can vote yes or not, or "colère" (worried) to cancel the proposition this turn, but this turn only. You have only on worried token per game per country.

—user summary
categories: Bluffing, Educational, Negotiation, Political, World War I

name: Ocean
description: 2-4 players roll the dice and move around the lake with their boats. If player has moved and there is a fish on the lake he tries to catch it. Both the boats and fish have magnets and the boat either pull or push the fish. If it pulls, the player may take the fish on his boat. The winner is the player who catches the most fish.

name: Big Monster: Promo Monster
description:
A promo monster tile handed out after playing or purchasing the base game at Spiel 2019 in Essen.

The rules where described as follows (from memory):

Placement:
Place the monster tile like any other tile after drafting.

Scoring:
Right before the normal scoring takes place (but after assigning medals), this monster tile can "eat" adjacent monster tiles by jumping on top of them. For this to work the monster tile to be eaten has to be adjacent to this monster (via small or large side) and needs to be fully covered after jumping onto it. Normal building rules apply here, so it is not allowed to create isles of non-connected tiles this way. The eaten monster is removed from the player area and not considered for regular scoring. This eating process can be repeated as long as the covering jump action can be performed as stated or until the player decides to not eat anymore monsters. Each tile eaten this was is scored with 4 points.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Konja: Spin Dähl promo card
description: Extra Relic card, which gives you a gold token.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Gnome Grown
description:
The new development is ready and you and your neighbours can finally move into your lovely new homes. The kitchens are sparkling, but the gardens are bare. Over the fence, you brag about your greenfingers and instantly a ‘friendly’ competition is afoot. Compete with your neighbours to create the best garden and be crowned head gardener before the gnome gets to the end of the garden path.

Bid for turn order, then select actions that enable you to develop and fill your garden by landscaping, adding features and attracting animals. Collect and place sets of tiles to complete hidden personal objectives within fenced sections of the garden to score points. Most points wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Trade-or-Treat
description:
You and your friends just got back from a night of trick-or-treating and it’s time to trade candy! Everyone wants to share their favorite candy with each other. The obvious next step: an unnecessarily complex trading system. Will everyone get to try all the candy before the night ends?

Trade-or-Treat is a cooperative game where players work together towards the same goal of sharing their Halloween candy. Everyone wins if all Kids have one of each kind of Candy.

The randomized grid of Trade and Treat cards determine the ways candy can be traded in each game. Everyone takes turns performing an action to trade candy. Can you solve the puzzle and win before you run out of actions?

This game is part of a thematically linked trilogy of games. In Sweet Dreams, players are adults trying to give away all their candy first on Halloween. In Trade-or-Treat, players are kids trading the candy they got from trick-or-treating. In Cavity Calamity, players are dentists cleaning the teeth of the kids after Halloween.

—description from the publisher

name: Expedition to Newdale: The Pfistries
description:
When playing with character cards, you can add Master Pfister to the pool. When you play Master Pfister, you will need the three Pfistry cards (#211).

The Master Pfister is a new character card that adds three new (Pfistry) buildings to the display. Pfistries are worth 3VP, and they chain grain and coal to make bread.

Promo cards available at Essen Spiel 2019

name: The Way of the Avatar
description:
As the Avatar, it is your duty to serve the reigning Lord of Britannia. It is your passion to strive for mastery of each of the eight virtues. It is your quest to tame the dungeons, each representing its own sin.

The game consists of rounds, each round the player will do the following action items until the end game goals are reached.
Roll four 8-sided die, and three 6-sided die [4D8 + 3D6] then:

Assign one D8 dice value to the list of CITIES. The number rolled represents the city which has called for aid. For example: if you assign a six, Lord British has called for you to assist the city of Skara Brae.
Next, assign each of the three categories, THE TASK, THE VIRTUE, and, THE DUNGEON one of the remaining D8 values. For example: if you rolled a 2 and two 6s, you could assign the 2 to THE TASK, and each of the 6s to THE VIRTUE and THE DUNGEON. This would mean that the Avatar is to complete the task of Deliver a Message, meditate in the virtue of Honor, and battle in the dungeon of Shame. If the dice results do not allow for further progress, simply assign a dice to an already completed option and do not record any outcomes.
To settle the task, refer to THE TASK and TASK RESULT tables, assign one of the D6 values to the result and record the outcome on the play sheet. When a task is successfully completed, the Avatar gains favor with the city from which the task was given. Fill in one square for that city on the map portion of the play sheet to track the progress. If the task is failed nothing is recorded. When all four squares are full the city will offer the Avatar a gift which will provide advantages for the rest of the play, these advantages DO stack. It is not required to complete one of each task.
To settle the virtue, the Avatar simply meditates and gains one point in that virtue. Record the added virtue on the play sheet by filling in a single square next to that virtue on the right side. When all squares are filled, the virtue has been mastered.
To settle the dungeon, refer to THE DUNGEON and DUNGEON BATTLE tables. Dungeon battles will increase in difficulty as they progress; the last stage of the dungeon is the boss. When a dungeon battle is won, fill in a square next to the associated dungeon to show progress. If the battle is lost, no progress is recorded. The dungeon is considered cleared when the final square is filled in. Refer to the Combat section.
A second D6 value is assigned to a randomizer, refer to the RANDOMIZER table.
The third D6 is usually a wildcard but may be used as a task additional result assignment.


Fame and Karma are awarded or taken away depending on the results of THE TASK and THE DUNGEON. As the Avatar increases their Fame, they can use it to increase their power. For every 5,000 points of fame obtained, the Avatar can advance one stat to the next value shown. Refer to the Avatar section for more information. Karma can be traded for combat re-rolls or temporary bonuses, see Karma Allocation. Track the Fame and Karma in the allocated space on the play sheet paperdoll. Karma can be negative, but it does not affect the Avatar.

After all records have been kept and any combat is resolved, start the next round of play.

—description from the publisher

name: Nightshade
description: Nightshade is a single-player game focused on writing a plot for a noir investigative story. The main character in each story (chosen and played by the player) is an investigator, some times a professional and some others a complete amateur. Players must put together all the clues and characters involved in the story to create a coherent plot on a violent mystery!

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Missy & the Cybermen
description:
This expansion adds Missy and a group of cybermen to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes one Missy, twelve Cybermen, and fourteen cybermat miniatures, ten faction cards, and eight new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Victoriana: The Time Traveller Collection
description:
The Time Traveller Collection add-on consists of five brand new cards, all inspired by H.G. Wells’ 1895 novel The Time Machine. The collection includes:

The Time Traveller investigator card
The Time Traveller mastermind and agent cards (from possible, dark futures)
A Morlock henchman card
The Forestall the Future plot card

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Davros & The New Dalek Empire
description:
This expansion adds Davros and a group of Daleks to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes one Davros & twelve Dalek miniatures, seven faction cards, and eleven new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Blight Chronicles: Zoe Abigail mini-expansion pack
description:
Second Agent
- deck of starting agent cards
- set of level up cards for that agent

17 cards!

Came as either an add-on to the Kickstarter campaign or was included in the Deluxe pledge level.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Blight Chronicles: Hideaki Takumi mini-expansion pack
description:
Third Agent
- deck of starting agent cards
- set of level up cards for that agent

17 cards!

Came as an add-on to the Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Fourth Doctor and Companions
description:
This expansion adds the Fourth Doctor and some of his companions to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, five faction cards, and seven new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Eleventh Doctor & Companions
description:
This expansion adds the Eleventh Doctor and some of his companions to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, five faction cards, and seven new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Twelfth Doctor & Companions
description:
This expansion adds the Twelfth Doctor and some of his companions to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, five faction cards, and seven new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Cthulhu The Great Old One: Promo Pack
description:
This Promo Pack Contains 11 Cards for use with the Game Cthulhu The Great Old One. Cards Included are
Herbert West: Reanimator
Ex Oblivione
The Book
The Festival
The Haunter of the Dark
The Tomb
Joe Sargent x2
Robert Olmstead x2
The Voorish Sign
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Memory
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Superfight: The Sci-fi Deck
description:
Star Wars or Star Trek? The Death Star vs. the Borg Cube? Science fiction has always been one of the largest sources of ridiculous arguments. Now you can add this 100-card expansion to your Superfight collection and enter the golden age of absurd arguments.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Hexblitz: Operational Level World War II Wargames on a Tabletop
description:
These rules have been designed to enable wargamers to fight operational-level World War II Eastern Front/Great Patriotic War battles on a tabletop using 20mm-scale figures and vehicles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Mosaic: A maze Racing Game
description: A tile based maze racing game for 2-6 players. Players race across a field exposing new maze tile. Some tiles have special features that speed up, slow down or redirect the players. Players may also use card to help reshape the maze or interfere with their opponents.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Bearscape: Spaceship Octo
description:
Bearscape is not a traditional board game! This game is a journey to escape, and you will do so by solving a series of puzzles. It is ideal for any game enthusiast, families and teachers who want to try a fresh angle on creative problem solving.

'Bearscape combines an escape game with actual academic curriculum taught in Singapore schools, allowing players to put into practice the basic knowledge of the subject matter that was taught in theory.

—description from the designer

name: Miau Miau Bée
description:
An evil little boy has created a machine, the Goatnator 3000, that can turn all of humanity into goats. He successfully performs the first test on his older brother Hamilton. Now Hamilton the goat has to try to communicate with the family's three cats to try and destroy the machine to save the world.

One player plays Hamilton, the other players play the cats. Each player has a card. To destroy the machine, the cats have to position themselves around the machine, and one of them must have a tool card next to them. But only Hamilton knows the necessary position and has to communicate it to the cats. However, the cats can only say "Miau" like a cat (and point to cards), and Hamilton can only say "Bée" like a goat if at least one card is in the correct position. If the players find the correct placement for each card within four rounds, they win. Otherwise the little villain comes back from school and destroys the world.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: De Vloek op de Bib
description:
De Vloek op de Bib (The Curse upon the Library) is an educational game developed at KU Leuven university. The educational purpose is to teach information literacy to bachelor students. The game mechanics are inspired on tabletop escape rooms (Escape Room: the game, Exit).
The story throughout the game is about the curse on the library, cast by an ancient witch. Professor Cipherius has made it his life's work to break the curse, but he dies mysteriously just before announcing the solution. The players discover his notes and have to finish what the professor started.
The game has three parts, focusing on these information skills: finding information, evaluating information and preventing plagiarism.

—description from the designer

name: Warmachine: Two-Player Battle Box
description:
Step into a world forged of iron and tempered by war.

The mighty forces of the northern Khadoran Empire are bolstered by their ideals of strength and resilience in their clash with the devout and zealous crusaders of the Protectorate of Menoth. At the center of this titanic clash, the deadly Kommander Sorscha Kratikoff leads an elite strike force of powerful Khadoran warjacks and soldiers against the holy knights of the Protectorate of Menoth led by their champion High Exemplar Kreoss and his personal retinue of warjacks.

Warmachine is a fast-paced and aggressive 30mm tabletop miniatures battle game set in the steam-powered fantasy world of the Iron Kingdoms. Take control of an elite soldier-sorcerer called a warcaster and his mighty warjacks–massive steam-powered combat automatons–as you battle to destroy the enemy warcaster.

Warmachine: Two-Player Battle Box contains everything that you need for a two-player game: complete Prime MKII rules in a travel-sized booklet (86 pages), an introductory guide, dice, a ruler, and 17 plastic Warmachine models with corresponding stat cards.

name: Divisional Commander: Tactical Napoleonic Wargame Rules
description:
The huge influence of Napoleonic combat systems, tactics and weaponry (the flintlock musket was the standard weapon for all Armies until the later 1840’s), meant that they remained the standard throughout the world until the full development of the rifled musket. This weapon, which used percussion caps rather than a spark from a flint, together with rifled artillery changed tactics and formations, and ended the Napoleonic Era.

Divisional Commander (DC) is a set of Napoleonic rules to cover the whole Napoleonic era, including the British-American War of 1812, the “forgotten” Wars of Liberation in South America, and the last War of the Napoleonic Era - the 1st Carlist War.

The rules are designed to play battles of this period of medium size, involving a division, or a small corps. DC is designed to allow players to represent historical battles or to play balanced games based on a point system that allows them to play fictional scenarios and to run campaigns or championships.

To represent the intense movements and counter movements of the formations in Napoleonic battles, DC (as other Capitan Games rules) uses a system that allows more flexibility in the game rather than an “I go, you go” system.

With the order system and the obligation to choose between different options for units, DC represents the fog of war and the uncertain control a commander has over his troops and his subordinate generals.

Included: Rules, Cover & Back Cover in High Resolution, Tokens & QRS, Napoleonic Army Lists, 1st Carlist War Rules & Carlist Army Lists

—description from the publisher

name: Podróże po Jurze
description:
"Jura" is the highland region - the oldest part of Poland. You can find there a lot of old medieval castles, and ruins, monadnocks, limestones, caves and mystery places full of legends and unexplained stories.

As a player you will travel by car, on big board, which represent the road map of the region, visiting the tourist attractions to collect victory points.
On the beginning of the game each player draw 6 cards from the stack – those are your first goals. You have to plan how to get there, using the network of first-class, and secondary roads. For visiting each place you have got on your “Attraction Card” you receive a reward. There are two kinds of them: victory points (Fossils), and tourist badges, which can make a significant difference if you will be able to collect 5 of the same kind.

Players can supply and exchange the cards, by visiting dedicated places on the map (Tourist Information Points).
You can find also the special cards like: “Scenic Flights”, “Road under construction”, “4x4” and “Tourist Guide” which may change the game’s tides and provide negative interaction.

There are a few variants of the game: from the easy and quick one for children, to much more demanding ones, in which teams, containing of two or three players, can compete, using their own tactics to win.
The dynamics and emotions are increasing during the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Different Dice Movement, End Game Bonuses, Movement Points, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Hail Caesar: Age of Bronze
description:
For two thousand years; from 3000 BC to 1000 BC, warriors fought battles with weapons of bronze. This gleaming red-gold metal is an alloy of copper and tin. The warrior nobles rode into battle in chariots and were clad in bronze armour. Their followers gripped bronze thrusting spears, battle-axes and slashing swords. Battle was a dazzling sight as weapons and armour glinted in the sun amid the clash of bronze against bronze and the clatter of charging chariots. This was the heroic age of legend! When the sand and rubble is cleared away from the mighty ruins of the temples, tombs and strongholds of this time; the tales of these battles are revealed inscribed in stone and on the imperishable tablets of baked clay.

Around the ancient carvings of the warriors, which inspire the model soldiers depicted in this book, are the reports of their deeds on the battlefield. From what they tell us we can recreate battles for our model armies. In this book you will find many battle scenarios and skirmishes all based on real events. We begin with the Sumerians, rival city states. Then we see the rise and fall of the first great empire of the Akkadians. Ancient Egyptians fight to unite their nation and repel Hyksos invaders. The mighty Hammurabi takes on rivals to create the kingdom of Babylon. The chariot Empires of the Hittites and Mitanni clash and try and hold their own against the New Kingdom Pharaohs and the Mycenaeans. Egyptian and Canaanite chariots battle on the plain of Megiddo. Heroes fight duels upon the plain of Troy. Then Sea Peoples and Habiru tribes challenge the chariot lords as we approach the dramatic end of Bronze Age.

Age of Bronze contains 32 scenarios - in addition to the traditional Hail Caesar massed battles we introduce skirmish rules for smaller scale conflicts between warbands so often seen during this period.

—description from Publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Hades Trap
description:
After centuries of machinations, Hades finally defeated the other gods. He is about to drag mankind into the underworld to reign supreme. Only the wise old Daedalus, inventor of genius, still stands against him, helped by a handful of heroes. But these will not cooperate: only one will be the savior of humanity.

Hades Trap is played on a modular board made up of 9 tiles, which allows you to renew your games. Each player plays as a hero who will be able to perform a variable number of actions in turn. You will be able to move around or interact with the square on which you are standing, in order to fight skeletons, activate mechanisms or even knock out your opponents! But beware, if you step on a breadcrumb trail, the Minotaur will be alerted and will run in the direction of its patrol! Maybe this is your chance to pull it towards your enemies?

Collect three of the available medallions and exit the labyrinth to be declared the winner. The medallions can be retrieved in many ways, so you'll need to be resourceful and brave to complete this important quest.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Movement Points

name: Crime Writers: Cerberus
description:
Cerberus – expansion for Crime Writers game

Cerberus is a fictive ‘true crime publication’.
Each card includes an underlined fact presented in the form of a crime-related article’s blurb.
You can score extra points by incorporating this fact into your Crime Writers story…

—description from the publisher (English)

A Cerberus egy “fiktív” bűnügyi újság. Minden Cerberus kártyán az újság egy oldalát látjuk, rajta pedig egy bűnügyi vezércikk kiemelését egy vastag keretben, mely mindig egy-egy kulcsfontosságú elemet ad hozzá a húzott alapkártyákhoz.
Eme fontos elemet a játékosoknak szintén be kell építeniük a történetükbe úgy, hogy az általuk felvázolt bűntény következményeként kialakult nyomozásról szóló cikk állítása igaz legyen…

—description from the publisher (Hungarian)
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: HG Wells' Little Wars
description:
A slightly abridged edition of this classic wargame text with artwork for the Red and Blue armies as individual Paperboys. Plus a working cannon which provides the firepower in the game. It seems that another element wants to join the action from a different Wells book, and that may provide some apocalyptic chaos.

—description from publisher

name: 手札のないトリテ (No Hand)
description:
In 手札のないトリテ (No Hand), a trick-taking game, rather than being dealt a hand of cards, a number of cards are flipped face up to the table and the players then draft which one they have played.

At the start of the game, each player is dealt a card which relates to the conditions for the current hand, such as diamonds are trump, or players do not need to follow suit. Each player also then passes that card to their left.

Play then proceeds through 10 tricks with a dealer setting out cards one trick at a time, and the players marking with a colored cube which card they will have played. Once the 10 tricks have been "played", the players bid on how many tricks they have won, and the condition cards are revealed. Players will score points based upon the accuracy of their bid and which cards they had knowledge of at the beginning of the game.
publishers: 758 Board Game Circle (758ボードゲーム会)

name: Rebisworld
description:
Make and live stories with Rebisworld teaches you how to acquire the skills and behaviours you need to face life.
Learning to guide yourself and others through the solution of internal conflicts, action plans and effective strategies.
Rebisworld is aimed at all those who want to grow and improve their learning of happiness.
Entering the world of 12 souls is a true gym for actions, emotions and sensations.

TARGET
Bring together 2 to 6 participants, not just to tell and write a story together, but to experience it firsthand.

We don't simply put ourselves in the shoes of the main character, but we become one with him through his senses.

MISSION
At the same time, we are the creators and protagonists of the story of one of the 12 souls in the world of Rebisworld, which develops in 4 parts:
The principle
The turning point
The conclusion
The epilogue

At the end of each of these phases there is a vote in which we elect one of the writings. The chosen text becomes part of the story and becomes the starting point for the creation of the following ones.

In Rebisworld the whole process takes about 60 minutes. For each of the 4 parts the estimated time is about 10 minutes for the realization of the three writings and 5 minutes for the vote.

At the end the winner is the one who gets the most number of elected parts of history.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: Penguin Creche
description:
This is a game where you can exchange penguin chicks and find out what is the biggest creche.
Each player has three moves.
In those three exchanges, you need to memorize the numbers that have been moved, guess the numbers that are not visible, and do all the handmade things you need to win at the same time.

It is a game that is chewy even in the lightness of a small component packed with several game elements.

name: Swing and Snap
description:
Each player puts monkey cards in rows of the same colour. The player who places the fourth monkey collects all the monkey cards in that row. But watch out, a crocodile may snap them all up first, or a monkey may stop to eat a banana. Continue until no more cards can be drawn from the deck. The player with the most monkey cards is the winner.

—user summary

name: Pluto Strikes Back!
description:
In 1953 a group of teenagers in a small town in Kansas stopped an alien invasion from Pluto. Now the aliens want to try again, but this time they are plotting to abduct the teenagers so the next invasion can proceed unhindered by those pesky kids!

Players take the role of the aliens in this cooperative game, following in the events of the first game Pluto Attacks. This time the aliens need to resolve a number of town folk and locations to gain the skills they need to abduct the teenagers.

This is a stand alone game set in the same game world as Pluto Attacks.

name: Space Gate Odyssey: Barrau
description:
The surface of Barrau is in perpetual change because of important and very frequent tectonic movements. Rifts, earthquakes and other tsunamis are part of the daily life on this planet. Only a few areas have relative stability.

Rules (2-3 players)
Colonization rules:
For each colonization place your settlers on strictly separate areas
Closing conditions:
All the spots of two of the four areas are occupied.
Influence points scoring:
Each of your settlers on an incomplete area is worth 1 Influence point and 2 Influence points on a complete area.

Rules (4 players)
Colonization rules:
For each colonization, place your settlers on spot outside the one of your color that is prohibited to you.
Closing conditions:
All the spots of one of the four areas are occupied.
Influence points scoring:
Each of your settlers is worth 1 Influence point and each settler on your prohibited area of your color is worth 1 Influence point.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Bomber: The Rock Climbing Game
description:
Bomber is a rock climbing themed push your luck game where two players race to top out on their respective climb. Whilst overcoming challenging route sections, players need to deal with unforeseen events, manage their energy level and gear placement to avoid hitting the ground in case of a likely fall. If you top out first, you win. If you hit the ground when you fall you lose.

First each player decides how much energy they will have and how much gear they want to take on the climb: you can be more risky and have more energy to allow you to climb longer stretches, but the falls also become longer and more serious, whereas having more gear allows for steady progress but you will need more breaks to recover some energy.

Then players take turns deciding how to move along the route, spending energy as they go. For example, it costs no energy to climb across a ledge, but it will take a lot to surmount an overhang or a roof section. Once all energy is spent the player takes a fall. Thus one needs to place gear for protection to prevent falling to the ground (different coloured gear fit only into places with suitable colour, unless it is a bomber placement). When a player places gear, a Place card is taken and the corresponding event is resolved. Every time a player enters a new route tile a Move card is taken and a corresponding event is resolved, which may result in a fall or may replenish some of the player's energy reserves.

name: Troika
description:
Troika is one of several games playable with the Katarenga board and pieces. This game is invented by the author of Katarenga.

In Troika the board starts empty. The first pawn can be placed anywhere. The pawns after the first have to be placed in such a way that they can be captured by the previous pawn (en prise).
The winner is the player who is able to make a troika – that is, a line of three pawns of your own colour in a row, whether horizontal, vertical, or diagonal. They need not be adjacent, but may be any distance apart and lying at any angle relative to the board.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Square Grid

name: Pandora's Box Card Game
description:
Pandora’s Box is the epic strategy game fit for the Gods. This fast-paced, high-energy card game is easy to learn and hilarious to play. As mortals you are trying to reveal your 4 columns (8 cards) to appease the gods while avoiding curses and lock/keys.

The game is simple, match the god character cards, top and bottom, in your columns to cancel out the points. If you match multiple adjacent columns with the same god you score a Midas Touch which gives you negative points. Finally, if you are the first one to reveal all cards in your columns you get negative bonus points. The player that gets the fewest points wins. While that may seem simple, the gods are full of passion and your opponents are full of fury so be ready for curse cards that inflict pandemonium and lock/key cards that stop you from changing the cards in your columns.

The core deck is designed for 2-5 players and the party expansion is designed for 6-10 players. Typical game-play time is 15 minutes per round. Ideal for friends and families that love strategy, laughter, spite, and glory. Appropriate for ages 8 and up.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mythology, Party Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Race, Set Collection

name: 転々と市 (Tentento Ichi)
description:
転々と市 (Tentento Ichi) (Roaming Oichi) is a Japanese card game (English rules are online).

Roaming Oichi is a fast-paced card game based on the actions of Oda Nobunaga’s younger sister, Oichi. You’ll reveal cards from the deck and strategically use your limited Collect actions to take the cards when the time is right. The player with the most points from their cards at the end of the game wins.

日本の戦国時代、兵力を集め、価値ある茶器も集め、より勢力の強い大名になることを目指しましょう。プレイは、カードをめくり場札を増やすか、あるいは全場札を取るかを考えてください。ただし、場札を取る回数には制限がありますので慎重に考えてください。ゲームが終わった時に最も得点が高ければ勝利になるでしょう。
publisher's summary
publishers: ガーデンゲームズ (The Garden Games)

name: Ritual
description:
2-5 minions of evil ancient deities come together to attempt to break the seals keeping them at bay and awakening them in 3 Rituals (rounds of play). Typically this is done by "following the suit" of play, with a twist. If everyone plays ritual chant cards matching the current "spell", everyone gets a point. If, however, someone differs, committing an 'evil act' against the others, the one who played the differing chant (least in kind) ALONE gets a point.

BUT...if everyone plays a different chant spell, you gain Insanity. 3 insanity points and you are out.

One last twist: If everyone IN UNITY plays the same kind of spell chant that is different from the needed spell, you all get a point.

No communication is allowed between players, you just have to use your wits to determine what you will do...

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Deduction, Horror
mechanics: Communication Limits, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Prisoner's Dilemma

name: Black Seas: French 1st Rate
description:
1st Rate ships of the line were extremely large and powerful and were a true display of a Navy's power. They were, however, expensive to operate, so their service use was limited in times of peace. In the carronade era, a 1st Rate ship-of-the-line was defined as mounting no less than 100 guns.

A French Navy 1st Rate can, when using the national special rules, be an extremely resilient foe to dislodge from battle. French ships have access to the 'sturdy' upgrade for a discount, and thus have a significant number of ship point to chew through. Of course, 1st rates are generally very powerful, but point for point, a French 1st rate should be sticking around longer to wreak havoc among your enemy's formations.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Black Seas: Gunboat Squadron
description:
A gunboat squadron is like a gnat in comparison to the larger ships-of-the-line. Nevertheless, they have a useful place in the fleet. A gunboat would typically have only a single mast with square-rigged sails, mounting between one and three fixed cannons.

Fleets of all navies kept gunboats on hand. They could be useful in shallower waters, as with only a single mounted cannon, they were able to manoeuvre relatively easily where a large ship could not. If this cannon was a 32-pounder it could still prove dangerous to larger vessels. For instance, a frigate could easily destroy a single gunboat with a single broadside hit. But if deployed in large numbers, the frigate would struggle to deal with every gunboat before sustaining heavy damage itself. The extremely cheap cost and relative time is taken to build these gunboats could prove a tremendous advantage.

Gunboats were crucial to Napoleon's notion for the planned invasion of England in 1804, whilst the US Navy's policy between 1803 and 1812 focussed its Navy around the concept - this was to prove ineffectual against the British Blockade in the war of 1812.

In the Game

In Black Seas, Gunboat squadrons are tiny vessels. This means that they are extremely difficult to hit, but are vulnerable to collisions from larger vessels, particularly if that vessel was travelling at speed. They mount only a single light cannon and are too small to allow for upgrades - their relative evasiveness, however, means that they will be difficult to deal with in battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers – Big Racer Expansion
description:
Add to your Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers collection with these individual Racer expansions. Each Racer brings unique "Abilities" and "Powers" of their own to the game. Collect ALL 13 Racer Expansions for the ultimate Sonic collection!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Switch-a-king
description:
Deduce, confuse and keep your eye on those goal cards as you and everyone else moves them around the table. Whomever has the king meeple at the end wins.

At the start every player gets a hidden goal card and a hand of actions cards.

On your turn play one action card from your hand on the table and say out loud which of the two actions you want to use: top or bottom. This action is resolved. Play continues to your left.

Keep playing until the last action card is played or the effect of the last round action is resolved. Turnover the goal cards to see who has managed the get the king meeple.

—description from the designer

name: Jeu du Cochonnet
description:
Each player gets a little pig.

The goal of the game is to remove all parts (4 legs, 1 tail, 2 ears, 2 eyes, 1 head) of the pig, then reinstall them, using the dice.
Dice have parts of a pig on each face.

—user summary

name: Their Own Game: Australian Football
description:
Solitaire statistical replay of Australian Rules Football. Charts and dice game. Quick play.
Teams are rated for attack and defence. A comparison is made to arrive at the number of chances a team has to score. Each team has a percentage rating to convert each chance into either a goal (6 points) or a behind (1 point).
A single game takes around 10 minutes to set up and roll out. A season considerably longer.

name: Neues aus Büttenwarder: Das Spiel
description:
Neues aus Büttenwarder is a German boardgame, based on the popular German TV-Series of the same name and released for the series' 20th anniversary.

2 to 6 player are playing against each other, as they try to solve different tasks (for example: pantomime, drawing, answering answers regarding farming or special questions based on the series), to earn one beermat of each kind. Though, if they are lucky and they land on the right field, they might even steal their opponent's beermats.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: Centuria: Miniature Wargaming in the Ancient Period
description:
Centuria is a wargame for two players or more that lets you simulate battles set in the Ancient Period. The game uses our well-known Action/Reaction mechanism but now includes exciting new rules to better simulate the dynamics of these battles and will allow you make many strategic and tactical decisions that will help you on your way to victory. Closing ranks at the right time, charging the enemy when he’s disordered and making the most of his hesitation to break his lines, these are just some of the new ways of fighting that you’ll find in these pages. The system allows you to play with any scale of miniature and keeps the base sizes fixed while just changing the number of miniatures that are on them. As well as a points system to help you balance your games, each unit also has a Training Value, a value that shows its prowess in Melee, an Armour Value and a number of losses that it can take. The rules also contain three classic scenarios, Vanguard, Ambush and Sacking the Camp which will test your command skills. The game is easy to learn and a normal game will last a couple of hours.

—description from the publisher

name: Orages d'Acier
description:
Orages d'Acier is a simple skimish miniature ruleset for combat in the trenches during WWI, at the squad level.

For 20/25mm miniatures.

Game sequence:

Player A

Moral test
Movement
Corps-a-corps
Firing of non-phasing player: B


Player B: repeat sequence inverting roles.

Scale:
1 mini = 1 man
1cm = 2m
1 game sequence = a few seconds
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Orages d'Acier: Les Blindés Attaquent
description: Les Blindés Attaquent is an expansion for Orages d'Acier, adding some small arms, guns and mortars and, most notably tanks (Schneider, St-Chamond, Renault FT, Whippet, Mark IV, A7V) to the rules!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Guerre éclair: ¡No Pasarán!
description:
¡No Pasarán! is the first module for Guerre éclair, simple miniature wargame rules to simulate combats in the first half of the 20th century, where each player handles the equivalent of a division. It uses special command cards and a standard 32 cards deck.

For minis from 1/300 to 1/72

Sequence of play:
Command phase - only beginning of game, then:

activation of units (using the 32 cards)
orders
movements
combat


Scale:
1 cm = 50m
1 mini = ~60 men
1 model = ~10 vehicles

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Tanks!: 2
description:
Tanks ! 2 is an expansion for Tanks ! fast and simple miniature rules for tank battles in WW2.

It adds optional rules and extra tanks data.

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Espionage: the card game
description:
An exciting game of agents and assassins! You act as Spymasters and send highly skilled agents to complete a mission or thwart your opponent's goal.

The main objective is for a player to force his opponent to discard The Target card by playing different agent cards such as Sniper or Assassin card. On the other hand, the player holding The Target card must prevent his opponent from forcing him to discard the Target card by playing agents such as Police or Bodyguard until the game ends.

A player can also win the game by playing The Package card or get eliminated in the middle of the game by losing The Package card if he is forced by his opponent to discard it.

The game is dynamic as your mission may change during the game. You may be trying to eliminate The Target during the start, then may find yourself protecting The Target towards the end. The game ends when the (52-card deck) draw pile is depleted. But be careful, the player holding The Bomb card at the end of the game also loses. Depending on the house rule, a game may have no winner at the end!

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: Dungeon Bastards
description:
Take control of one of the ghouls from Ghoul, then kill and blunder your way through Creepsylvania and throw yourself over the Wall of Death.

Players take turns advancing through a Creepsylvanian map via six-sided dice rolls, and the first one to get to end of the map and jump the Wall of Death wins.

The board for Dungeon Bastards is included on the vinyl album of the same name by Ghoul. Dice and Ghoul miniatures sold separately.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Merriment Mixture -- Categories Game
description:
Clarendon Games' Merriment Mixture is the ultimate boredom killer. Take turns to name items in a given category against the clock. Be warned - take too long or repeat an item and you're out. Last player standing wins the card!

How many Songs by The Beatles can you name when put on the spot? It's a lot harder than it sounds. Eleanor Rigby, Love Me Do, Back In The USSR,... something about a Yellow Submarine? I don't know!

What about Words that End in '-sh'? Think fast! Fish, lash, crash, push,... is bosh a word? As in, 'bish, bash, bosh'? No?!

Can you handle yourself under pressure? Can you remember what has been said before? Keep your wits about you!

—description from the publisher

name: Play the Thirty Years War 1618-1648
description:
Project made possible by the great and beautiful collection of Gianpaolo Bistulfi, who in many years of modelling career has personally painted thousands of toy soldiers. Now these soldiers will be at your disposal to obtain, with little effort, entire armies of battalions of infantry, squadrons of cavalry, batteries of cannons, houses and buildings, trees and much more material needed to create the scenes of your battle. We also explain tricks and modes for a good assembly of the pieces, as well as the official rules for playing wargame. All in 50 pages full of hundreds of soldiers supplied in the standard scale of 25/28mm that you can, for personal use only, photocopy on thicker cardboard and thus get armed with the desired size. So what are you waiting for?
