mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Flicking, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Tracko
description:
Tracko is an adventure game that trains memory and visuo-spatial skills.

Players have a few seconds to observe the map of an ancient Mayan temple and remember the way in and out of the temple while collecting as many treasures as possible.

Thanks to the practical acetate sheets on which each player will have to trace their own path, it will be easy to check on the initial map who managed to collect more coins without ever falling into ancient traps!

How to play

PHASE 1: Observe and memorize the treasure map. The players will have to study the path that allows them to collect the most treasure coins.

PHASE 2: Each player places an acetate sheet over his/her own copy of the temple map, and, with an erasable marker, traces the pathway he/she memorized.

PHASE 3: To verify the correctness of the route and count the treasures collected, each player, in turn, places their acetate sheet on the treasure map. It will be easy to understand who the winner of the challenge is!

The objective of the game is to complete the path collecting as many treasures and points as possible.

-description from designer
mechanics: Line Drawing, Memory, Programmed Movement, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid

name: Зеленый мексиканец
description:
Do you want to make your party unforgettable? For a fun company, the best incendiary board game is best! The «Green Mexican» is exactly that. It is universal for any party and is designed for a company where they like to spend an interesting time:

☑ easy and short rules, time of learning — up to 5 minutes;
☑ the game will decorate any party, even the one where everyone is "driving";
☑ you can play both the three of us and the big company;
☑ the goal is not so much the victory, as an interesting and fun process of the game.

Don (chairman of the Mexican mafia) chooses a successor among the players. But his adviser, who dreams of heading the cartel, constantly arranges pretenders all sorts of tricks, trying to show that they are all only "green" Mexicans, and do not deserve to take the place of the Don.

The set includes cards of two types — 45 orders of the Don (performed by the player), 45 insidious interference of the Advisor (the player transfers their performance to any other player) and the rules of the game.

What if it is impossible to execute two (three) Advisor card tips simultaneously? Hence, you are unlucky and the chances of becoming a "green Mexican" have increased significantly :) For example, if one card says that the left hand should be held at the back of the head, and the other that the left hand should cover the knee, then one must break at least one of the cards of insidious advice.

What if the player can not fulfill the order of Don described in the card? What can not mean?! He does not want to disappoint Don? :) You need to try until it works out. But if, nevertheless, the task is not fulfilled, then such a card goes into a dump, turn the card upside down.

A pause is possible? What pauses? The struggle for the cartel's empire is in full swing! Ordering alcohol, chewing a fragrant shish kebab or answering the phone call, the player is obliged to fulfill all orders of the Don assigned to him or cards with tips of the adviser.

The most enterprising and attentive will win, but everyone will get pleasure and positive emotions!

name: Fortresses & Clans: La lutte pour la liberté
description:
This extension adds two new clans: Orcs of the Glorious Spirit Tribe and Gnomes of the Black Chain Confederation. Each clan comes with its own cards, new leaders, new armies and war machines.

Those two new "factions" allow you to change your strategies to defeat your opponent.

This extension also adds two sets of three rampart cards adding new buildings with their own abilities :

the guard room, that allows you to keep army cards when breached
the stable where you can activate two cards at only one hour cost
the blacksmith, where you can add any type of army cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Fortresses & Clans: La bataille au-delà du grand nord
description:
This extension adds two new clans: Dwarves of the Potentate of the Holy Book and Elves of the dreaded Matriarchy of the Death Purple. Each clan comes with its own cards, new leaders, new armies and war machines.

Those two new "factions" allow you to change your strategies to defeat your opponent.

This extension also adds two sets of three rampart cards adding new buildings with their own abilities :

the inn, that allows you to draw army cards
the gate whose defense depends on the army cards set up on it
the alchemy laboratory, that allows you to change one of your card at your turn
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Action Queue, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Forteresses & Clans: Créatures Légendaires
description:
As the battle was stretching, as the men found difficult to carry their own weapons, a deafening roar resounded, freezing the soldiers on their spot...

This expansion allow to add monsters and ancestral creatures to the armies who tear themselves on the battlefield. This new army cards are extremely powerful and can speed up the destruction of your opponent’s fortress. Their particularity is they can be considered both as troop or warmachine.

Legendary creatures are considered as warmachine or troop. If they are placed on a Warmachine spot, you have to tell if you activate the card as a Warmachine or a Troop.


Colossus: Warmachine: spend 1Hour: put an additional -1 structure token. Troop: spend 2 Hours to activate.
Giants: Warmachine: spend 1 Hour : Put a -1 structure token on a high wall of your choice. Troop: When they are in an assaut area, Giants ignore one opponent card placed on a breach when they resolve their assaut.
Dragon: Warmachine: spend 2 Hours : discard a card in the opponent’ assaut area in the same column as the Dragon. Troop: spend 2 Hours to activate.
Hydra: Warmachine: During the shooting phase, target the high wall of your choice. Troop: the Hydra can participate to the resolution of adjacent assaults.


—user summary
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Action Queue, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Fortresses & Clans: Gloire et honneur
description:
This extension adds new army cards and a new card type : Hero cards. These heroic individuals support the regular troops with their own unique powers and abilities during an assault. What better way to keep an opponent on their toes?

When you want to deploy a Hero card from your hand, you simply place it on top of a Troop card already deployed to one of your Ramparts. When that Troop card is activated, the Hero card joins it in the Assault Area. You cannot deploy a Hero directly to an Assault Area.

The different effects of these Heroes are as follows:

Champion: The Champion increases to 2 Might if a Standard Bearer is present in its Assault Area.
The General: Each Soldier card present in the Assault Area grants the General +1 Might.
Battle Mage: When activated, move 1 Army card of your choice from one of your opponent's Assault Areas to another.
Necromancer: At the end of an Assault, place 1 discarded Army card of your choice in the Necromancer’s Assault Area.
Priest: When activated, select 1 Troop card in the War Priest's Assault Area, this unit gains +1 Might during the next Assault resolution.


In addition to these Heroes, four new Army cards swell the ranks of the mercenaries engaged in the various battles between the clans:

The Cauldron: Cannot be activated. When a Rampart where a Cauldron is deployed is assaulted, destroy 1 assaulting Troop card of your choice. When this card is discarded, move your opponent’s Time token forward by 1 hour.
Knights: When assaulting a Breach, Knights gain +1 Might. Spend 2 hours to Redeploy this card to an adjacent Assault Area.
Command Tent: When activated, choose 1 Troop card in one of your Assault Areas and redeploy it to one of your Ramparts or Breaches.
Veterans: When activated, redeploy 1 Troop card of your choice from your Ramparts to the Veterans' Assault Area. In addition, this expansion continues to expand the abilities of Troops and War Machines.


—user summary
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Action Queue, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Fortresses & Clans: Ainsi vint l'orage
description:
With this very first expansion you will be able to add meteorological events to your battles. Its use is extremely simple but will bring a great replayability forcing players to anticipate or being surprised by some unexpected weather changes.

At the beginig of a game, put 4 meteo cards face down next to the timeline. Each card will have an influence on the 6 time spaces next to it.

Then, the first card is flipped face up and the battle can begin. The other cards will be flipped as soon as a player enter their area. when both players have left an area, the corresponding card is replaced by another from the meteo pile face down.


The rain: when you start your turn in this area, spend 2h to activate a troop card instead of 1h.
Sun shine: when you start your turn in this area, play your turn normally.
Smog: when you start your turn in this area, during a combat, you skip the shooting phase.
Storm: when you start your turn in this area, you can only play your clan cards face down.
Snow: when you start your turn in this area, discard 1 troop card in each of your assault area.


—user summary
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Action Queue, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Blades of Khorne Bloodbound
description:
Those who pledge their loyalty to the Blood God are forever damned, descending into madness and rage. Now, their ranks spill across the Bloodwind Spoil in a tidal wave of slashing axes, frenzied limbs and frothing mouths.

Let slip the unbound rage of the Blades of Khorne with this card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set gives you access to brutal Chaotic warriors in your games. An abilities card lets you use deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of 12 fighter cards provide profiles four types of Blood Warriors, three types of Bloodreavers, two types of Wrathmongers, two types of Skullreapers and Khorgoraths.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as two divider cards to keep track of tokens that apply to fighters in game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Necromunda: Underhive – Corpse Grinder Cult Cards
description:
Expand your games of Necromunda with these 26 cards, representing the myriad tricks and schemes that can be used to gain an advantage in the underhive. As well as cards specifically for the Corpse Grinder Cults, there are also a number of Gang Tactics cards that can be used by any gang.

This set contains:
– 4 Corprse Grinder Cult-specific Tactics Cards
– 16 Universal Gang Tactics Cards
– 6 Blank Fighter cards, each stamped with the Corpse Grinder Cult Logo

You will need a copy of the Necromunda Rulebook and Necromunda: The Book of Ruin or Necromunda: Dark Uprising to use the contents of this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Necromunda: Underhive – Goliath Gang Tactics Cards
description:
Expand your games of Necromunda with these 26 cards, representing the myriad tricks and schemes that can be used to gain an advantage in the underhive. As well as gang-specific tactics cards for House Goliath, there are also a set of blank fighter cards.

This set contains:
– 18 House Goliath-specific Tactics Cards
– 8 blank Fighter cards, each stamped with the Clan Goliath iconography

You will need a copy of the Necromunda: Underhive or the Necromunda: Dark Uprising rulebook to use the contents of this set.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Wargames Rules for All-Arms Land Warfare from Platoon to Battalion Level: 1925-1950 and 1950-2000
description:
In June 1988, the set of wargames rules for all-arms land warfare from Platoon to Battalion level during the period from 1925-1950, written by Phil Barker were published.

They proved very popular and were widely used but have been out-of-print for many years.

They were followed by sets, initially for the period from 1950-1975 and later extended to cover the period 1950-2000. These too have been out-of-print for many years.

Now both sets have been gathered together into a single book and published here.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: Monopoly: MSC Bellissima Special Edition
description: Monopoly themed with MSC Bellissima including the MSC Yacht Club, Popular Cruising Locations and an MSC Bellissima Player Token.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Bedrock U*S*A
description:
Post Bedrock USA Flintstones game.

This game came in three pieces in the Post breakfast cereal. You could also send away for the full complete board game.

Be the first to travel across Bedrock USA (game board).
Use a spinner to move 1, 2, or 3 spaces. Then follow any direction on that space. The first player to travel across the map and land exactly on finish wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: ASL Comp: Afrikakorps – Benghazi Handicap
description:
Benghazi Handicap scenarios take the action from March 1941 - April 1941, right up to and including Rommel's defeat at Tobruk during Easter 1941.
Each scenario includes its own detailed historical summary.

These 8 small scenarios are adapted from the ATS system to ASL.

SEBCHA EL SEGHIRA, LIBYA, 31 March 1941: Shortly after Rommel arrived in Tripoli, offensive action was on his mind—contrary to his standing orders to eschew any offensive action for the time being. The Desert Fox began his first offensive in North Africa with a ‘reconnaissance probe’ on 31 March, targeting the British advanced positions by Maaten Biscer. At 0600 hours a flying column consisting of medium tanks, armored cars, and a single 88mm gun towed by a prime-mover left their assembly area nine kilometers to the west of El Agheila. The scratch-force promptly advanced along the Via Balbia until, at about 0800 hours, contact was made with the enemy. Two troops of British cruiser tanks were encountered near Kilometer 3 on the Via Balbia. The Germans immediately moved into combat formations, the ‘88’ was un-limbered and went into action, dispersing the enemy tank formation without hitting any tanks. A running fight then took place for some six kilometers, concluding after the British made another attack, only to be driven off by the column....

ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS—BENGHAZI HANDICAP is a detailed new ASLComp VARIANT that tells the story of the War in North Africa. It's about time the desert warfare goodness that was spawned by Hal Hock's seminal work TOBRUK back in 1975... was brought to the gaming tables of ASLers. And now it is, in a big way.

ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS—BENGHAZI HANDICAP continues the series with Rommel's push to re-take Cyrenaica in 1941, going against Hitler's orders and confounding Italian Comando Supremo. We know YOU won't be confounded, and are ready, willing and able to go along for a wild ride past Mersa el Brega, Derna, hello Mechili, we're back...and beyond to the gates of the jewel...Tobruk!

You receive a set of 8 scenarios, all depicting actions from the exciting offensive, rife with combined-arms actions. And yes, these are aimed at playability. Slap them down, bang them out, do it again. And again. Please do a little hooting and hollering while you're at it... at least when you roll 'snakeyes' (or the other guy rolls 'boxcars').

ASL Comp Afrikakorps: Benghazi Handicap contains:
8 action-packed scenarios depicting actions from Rommel's drive into Cyrenaica
Color cover sheet
Descriptive back sheet
Ziploc style storage bag
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Bunny Hoops
description:
The day has finally come. The Bunnies Everywhere Show of Talent is here and you, the greatest bunny magician ever to pull a rabbit from a hat, have been training your colony of color-changing, hoop-jumping bunnies all year long.
But you’re not the only one.

The competition is fierce and those other tricksters will stop at nothing to foil your plans and distract your well-trained bunnies. Your reputation, and the Golden Ears award is on the line.
It’s time to get your bun-buns in gear and show the world that those other magicians are just a bunch of flops.

Bunny Hoops is a game with hoops, hops, and pieces that flip-flop. It shares similarities with the classic game of Chinese Checkers: players compete to be the first to move all of their pieces across the board, jumping their own pieces over other player’s in order to do so.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Race

name: Warhammer Age Of Sigmar (Second Edition): Destruction Battletome – Orruk Warclans
description:
In the Mortal Realms, there are those who fight for justice, those who fight for glory, and those who fight to serve the wills of their all powerful gods. Orruks, on the other hand, fight for nothing but the sheer brutal fun of it! Sound appealing? Then Battletome: Orruk Warclans is for you! In this 104-page hardback battletome, you’ll find a complete guide to the vast and brutal warclans of the Orruks – the dead ‘ard Ironjawz, and the tribalistic, savage Bonesplitterz. You'll discover the brutal (and often hilarious) history of the greenskins in the Mortal Realms, and their twin-headed god, Gorkamorka, illustrated with rich art that brings their world to life.

Meanwhile, a set of allegiance abilities allow you to field your Bonesplitterz and Ironjawz models on the tabletop with powerful faction rules of their own that let you master their distinct strategies and ways of war on the tabletop. You can even combine your armies into one massive Big Waaagh! – a combined horde of Orruks with faction rules representing the devastating magical energy created by such a destructive gathering! Warscroll battalions, magical spells, command traits, artefacts and more give you a vast degree of choice for customising your collection – from monstrous cavalcades to armoured hordes, you'll have loads of choice as to how your army looks. What’s more, the book contains painting tips and different colour schemes to inspire your collection, as well as bespoke missions and Path to Glory rules that are perfect for organising your first battles with your Orruk horde.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Double Date Simulator
description:
Double Date Simulator is an 18 card microgame for 2-4 people in which players take on the role of hyper-powered matchmaking algorithms and compete to see who can most successfully organize one of the most elusive of social gatherings, the double date!

Players take turns drafting cards representing different artificial dater personas and placing them into couples, each of which will form a unique scoring condition based on their couples' interests. After three separate simulations, the player with the most points wins, proving once and for all that ROBOTS CAN LOVE. Or, more accurately, proving once and for all that robots who are dating can hang out with other robots who are dating and have a MUTUALLY SATISFACTORY TIME doing so.

-description from designer

name: Table Top Battles
description:
DBA type miniature wargame rules using a grid system.

They cover all periods, including fantasy and science fiction.

For Use with 6, 10, 15, and 20mm Armies Or 28mm Skirmish Games and includes Solo War Game Rules with a Navy Rules Sheet.

Includes rules for

campaign,
solo,
naval,
sieges,
assault,
weather,
air combat...
categories: Age of Reason, Ancient, Book, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mythos: The Dreamlands
description:
Mythos: The Dreamlands (1997) introduced the concept of a different dimension, Dreamlands, with all new Investigators, boosters and starters.

This new expansion to Mythos details the world of the Dreamlands, first recorded by H. P. Lovecraft in The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath, "The Doom that Came to Sarnath", and many other stories.

You'll encounter the fantastic beings that inhabit those lands, including the ferocious Cats of Ulthar, the curious zoogs of the Enchanted Woods, the detestable water-lizard of Mnar, and the corrupt Men of Leng. In explorations that will bring you from the far side of the Moon to the Castle of the Great Ones on Kadath, you'll find new Tomes, new Artifacts, new Spells, and much more.

name: Egemonia: Tebe
description: Three-players expansion scenario for Egemonia. By introducing some small add-ons to the orginal rules, it allows a three-players game set during the wars among City States of Ancient Greece in IV century b.C.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simulation

name: Dice of the Living Dead 2nd edition
description:
Dice of the Living Dead 2nd ed is a free print and play solo game about rolling dice and fighting zombies.

Zombies have overrun your hometown. You and your group of survivors have to make your way to the extraction zone at the outskirts of town. But the streets are swarming with the undead so you'll have to fight your way. Hopefully you have enough ammo and supplies to make it.

Every turn you roll dice trying to find the right balance between moving fast and still having time to fend off the living dead. But just as every roll of the dice can help you, it also holds certain risks.

The second edition features:

Event cards
Modular game board that creates a new path to travel every game.
Playable characters
Exploration tokens
Stress cards to add extra tension


—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: DIEKPLUS
description: These rules may be used to recreate most naval engagements within a period from about 3000 BC to 1000 AD. This covers the birth of naval warfare as such, the Classical Greek era, the Roman era, and also overlaps into the Byzantine period to some extent

name: Graffiti
description:
Graffiti consists of two decks of cards. One deck of 40 cards each have four subjects on one side and a number from 3-8 on the other. Each round one of these cards is turned over to reveal the categories; players have to come up with a word fitting one of these categories of the length shown by the next card.

The other deck contains 52 cards each showing two different letters. Players all draw the correct number of cards and then race to make a valid word. Players unable to make a word can draw and discard.

The player first making a word scores 10 points per letter plus an extra 10 if the word contains a letter that is also in the category. Play continues until someone reaches 200 points.

name: Oh, Whelp!
description:
Oh, Whelp! is a communist-style card drafting game. You play as a dragon and guide them on their journey of self-development. Three Companion cards are drawn each round, each of which offer strengths and weaknesses to your dragon's personality.

Players simultaneously choose the Companion best suited for their dragon's character goals. Points are marked along their own individual trait tracker. The Companion card deck is played through twice (16 rounds). Personality points are tallied and the dragon with the highest-scoring personality wins!

This light party game is an ideal opener at game nights or when playing with folks who might be inexperienced with heavier games. The multiplayer solitaire format easily allows for solo play and up to an unlimited number of players. Oh, Whelp! is a free game to print and play and can be played virtually, making it highly accessible to all. Did we mention it is heavily infused with puns?
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Naruto Boruto Card Game: Hokage Expansion Set
description:
Stand with the legends of the Hidden Leaf Village! Team up with the original Hokage's such as Hashirame Senju, Hiruzen Sarutobi, Minato Namikaze, and more. Naruto Boruto Card Game is a compilation featuring Naruto, Naruto Shippuden, and Boruto! This set includes cards from both Naruto and Naruto Shippuden.

Contents:

54 cards
6 double sized cards
1 Turn Sequence card

name: Fast as Lightning
description:
Use expert fighting and it won't be frightening.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Kung Fu Fighting by Carl Douglas.


Fast as Lightning is a real-time card shedding game in which 2 players compete to get rid of their cards as fast as possible while preventing their opponent from doing the same.


Fast as Lightning is the postcard game from Button Shy's September 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month club.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Trick‘n Trouble: SPIEL Essen promo card
description:
Promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 1/4/0

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.

name: Crazier Eights: Pantheon
description:
A fantasy card game with a Greek mythology theme. It is deck of 33 game cards with unique abilities. The first player with zero cards in hand wins.

This can be played as a stand alone game. It was also made to be mixed with Crazier Eights: Olympus, or any other version of the game other than the first edition.

—description from the designer

name: Asking for Trobils: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Cards
description:
Five new cards for Asking for Trobils: Zeegar-C-a and Tomva-Sel.

Includes:
Su-Zan - When drawing a Riffraff card at Smashed Rock, draw two and keep one. Use this card to cover and replace the Landing Pad on Smashed Rock.

Er-Riic - When going to the Tyson Comet, players may gain two Crystals and one other Crystal, ore, Space Carrot, or Credit. Use this card to cover and replace the Landing pad on Tyson Comet.

Tomva-Sel - When throwing Trobils in for credits, a player may choose to receive ore, crystals, or space carrots instead. What is received must be all the same.

Ma-Ndi - When going to the Nye Asteroid Belt, players may gain two ore and one other crystal, ore, space carrot, or credit. Use this card to cover and replace the Landing Pad on the Nye Asteroid Belt.

Zeegar-C-a - The price for entering the Wormhole is different when Zeegar-C-a appears. Use this card to cover and replace the Landing Pad on the Wormhole.

name: Dice Tetris
description:
Inspired by the video game TETRIS, except you play this version with the use of dice. Each turn you roll 6 colored dice and place them on the drop zone. Instead of having the shapes fall, you will be trying to arrange the dice to fall and make the shapes. There are five colored dice that will be used to match all the similar colored shapes.

As each new shape is discovered, you will be trying to match the dice to these shapes before they move off the board and generate a new shape. Each shape you match with the dice causes the dice to be removed from the board and the other dice to fall down into their place.

You start the 1 minute timer. You can use six actions to manipulate the dice to help you line them up and create stacks to generate the shapes. If you run out of time, the dice fall as they are.

Try to create as many shapes as possible to collect the highest score. Be careful with your actions because if you leave too many dice on the board, they may start to stack too high and cause you to lose the game.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Pattern Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Coal & Iron: Fast Play Ironclad Rules
description:
Coal & Iron: Fast Play Ironclad Rules

Naval Warfare during the European Ironclad Era 1860-1880. Realistic movement rules, no hexes.

Combat cards, speed scales, turning circles and damage cards provided.

Coal & Iron has data for over 220 classes of ships of 18 navies.

—description from the publisher

name: The Lucky Penny Diner
description:
Hey, thanks for picking up a shift or two! It's been busy; guests have been coming at all hours of the day and night to warm their frozen feet and fill up on fries, burgers, and our famous fruit pies. As you can see there are no tables, just the row of barstools there. Guests are everyone's responsibility. We don't split tips here - the person who's served a guest the most food will get everything. Pay attention to what they like, and they'll tip well. Well, I think that's it... go talk to Gus in the back and he'll get you an apron and paper hat. Welcome aboard!

In The Lucky Penny Diner players are the waitstaff in a 24-hour diner, serving orders to guests, and trying to collect the most in tips. Cards are drafted into players' hands, then served to guests by laying the cards in an overlapping fashion beside them, representing how full they are getting.

What you serve, when, and to whom factor into how well you are rewarded. Do you serve dessert to a guest that your opponent is waiting on so that they can't serve them any more apps or entrees? Do you give it to the guy at the end to turn his two courses into three? Or do you serve it to the girl with the sweet tooth who will tip more for it?

—description from the designer

name: Forged in Blood: Rules for Company Level Battles in the Late Renaissance
description:
Forged in Blood' is a Big Skirmish wargame for the Pike and Shot period based on the Song of Blades engine.
Play raids, ambushes and reconnaissance missions, foraging parties, baggage supply raids, and attacks on isolated outposts and vulnerable gun positions.

MID SCALE: an army is 60 to 70 single based figures;

SMALL AREA: a 4’x4’ or a 3’x3’ table;

CAMPAIGN GENERATOR: follow a chosen band through linked encounters;

TROOP CHARACTERISTICS: identify your units with historically meaningful descriptions;

CHARACTER TRAITS: import heroes from Flashing Steel or create them from scratch

RULES: for lighting fires, grenades, demolitions and more!

ARMY LISTS: sample lists with variations for early and late 30YW, Spanish, French, Early and Late Swedish, Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, Wallachian, Moldavian and Transylvanian, Ottoman, English Civil War, Covenanters, and Irish.

FULLY DESCRIBED SCENARIO: with full unit descriptions to give you a head start

QUICK REFERENCE SHEETS.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Kotek i motylki
description:
Gucio - black kitty - is missing. His trail leads us to the meadow. No wonder that the curious and mischievous kitty runs here among the grass, since there are so many wonderful butterflies around. There are so many of them that it seems impossible to count them all. Who of you will be smarter and more perceptive? Find out!

Kotek i motylki is a game that supports counting in a fun and emotional way. In addition, players must demonstrate perceptiveness and reflexes to indicate flower tokens with the correct result as soon as possible.

Purpose of the game: Players count the butterflies appearing on faceup Butterfly cards, and then seal the result token. With the correct calculations, they can get a card. The player with the most Butterfly cards at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Coal & Iron: Scenario Book 1 – The Battle of Lissa: 20 July 1866
description:
Battle of Lissa - 20 July 1866

It has all the set ups for the battle between the French and British.

It comes complete with all the ships that fought in the battle,damage charts for each ship,and notes and rules modifications for the battle.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Tsoukalos the Conspirator Promo Card
description:
A promo card given away at conventions.

At the end of the game you score 1 VP for each gold, 2 VP for each Domain, and 1 VP for every 2 strength / magic.

—user summary

Edit : This card as been banish because of balance issue (too powerful)
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Color City
description:
2 groups are fighting for the domination of Color City. Color City is represented by a grid in the center of the game board. The youngest player starts the game and the players take turns playing until the end of the game.

Each turn is divided in 5 steps:

1) Explore

The player pitches one of the cubes of his HQ, with one of these fingers, towards the city.


2) Power activation (optional action)

Once during each game, each team can decide to use the power of their gang.
To do this, the team checks its power box and applies its effect.
Once checked, a power box can no longer be checked during the rest of the game.
Power of the green gang - Lucky Day: allows you to take back the cube pitched this turn, replace it on its HQ and p it again.
Purple gang power - Purple Pain: allows you to destroy one of the cubes located in an opposing HQ.


3) Fight

If the cube stops outside the city, it is destroyed.
We consider that a cube stops on an area as soon as it covers 1 mm of its surface.
A destroyed cube is placed in the game box and can no longer be used for the rest of the game.


4) Conquer

If the cube has not been destroyed, color the area on which it stopped with your marker and then take the cube back.
When you take one of your cubes back, put it on your HQ.
The city is made up of 81 squares. If a cube covers several boxes, color all of these boxes.


5) Victory check and End of turn.

If no player has won or lost the game, his opponent plays.


End conditions:

A) If a player succeeds in forming a horizontal or vertical line of 9 spaces with his color, he wins the game.

Diagonal lines do not count.



B) If a player succeeds in forming a square of 16 boxes (4 x 4 boxes) with his color, he wins the game.

C) If a player succeeds in eliminating his opponent's 4 cubes, he wins the game.

Reminder: cubes are destroyed when they stop in an area they must not occupy.


—description from the designer

name: 1916: The WWI Card Game
description:
The horrors of trench warfare rage across Europe in 1916. Machine guns are cutting brave soldiers to ribbons when they go "over the top" and are confronted with mazes of wire. Tanks are appearing more frequently on the battlefield, as well as biplanes which seem to evolve every day. The major source of havoc, however, is artillery, which rains hell from above on a regular basis. Not to mention the poison gas.

1916: The Card Game is a tense filler for two players, and includes all of the above. The rules are simple, but the choices aren't. Players represent the opposing commanders of a small stretch of trench line. They draw and play cards from a common deck, but some can only be used by one side. Some cards can be played alone or in combination, and what to play and what to hold in hand can be critical decisions. Some cards have multiple uses. Biplanes, for example, can be used for recon, assault support, or aerial intercept. Victory can be total, major, minor or, rarely, the result can be a stalemate.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, World War I

name: Purrballs: Catventure Card Game – Secret Store Expansion Pack
description:
"Many rumors exist among the chatty Catventurers, but none are as persistent as that of a mysterious store. Some say it moves from place to place, sometimes within the blink of an eye. Others whisper about the cloaked figure seated behind the counter. But all agree on its goods, powerful and valuable beyond compare, with a price tag to match..."

The Secret Store is the first expansion pack for the Purrballs: Catventure Card Game. It introduces Coins, a valuable resource that counts as XP (experience points) at the end of the game. Gain Coins by cashing in Bounties, trading in your valuable Loot cards for a fat purseful. Gather enough, and you can then purrchase Store cards; their powerful abilities are sure to help when you most need it!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: PizzaGross
description:
In PizzaGross you are running a shabby pizza shop, trying to convince your customers that your product is edible enough to justify paying for it. Try to save as much money as possible on ingredients, while keeping the customers happy with their purchases.

PizzaGross is a card drafting game with an economic component. Players must collect sets of ingredient cards to create pizzas of varying qualities. After drafting the ingredient cards, players choose which of them they shall buy. The cheapest ingredients are obtained for no money at all, but higher quality cards require some investment. When selling pizzas, players will face customers of different levels of rigorousness. Rotten ingredients may satisfy some customers, but others will notify the authorities, who will close the business for the day.

After three rounds, the player with the most money is the winner.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Radiation Dust: Fall of the Soviet Union
description:
Radiation Dust: Fall of the Soviet Union takes place in the 1970s in a parallel universe. U.S.-led NATO countries launched a full-scale nuclear attack against the Soviet Union. This game is not pure fiction but instead based on a real-life battle plan from the US Department of Defense.
“Operation Dropshot” was devised in 1949, early in the Cold War, and was declassified in 1975. The plan was to drop 300 nuclear warheads and conduct strategic bombings on 100 cities and 200 targets in the Soviet Union to obliterate 85% of Soviet Union's war making capacity.

In this game, one player plays NATO and the other player plays the Warsaw Pact.

name: SkirmishCampaigns: Belgium '40 – Hunters of the Ardennes
description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Belgium '40-Hunters of the Ardennes is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the opening day of fighting in Belgium in May 1940.

The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of four campaigns. Maximum Replayability: the Skirmish Elite system features a realistic variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information and history on the campaign in the Ardennes in 1940. This book also features a bibliography of sources.

Includes:

12 Scenarios,
4 Campaigns


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Universal Rule: Character Pack #1
description:
This 6-card expansion adds 6 alien races to the game, only 2 of which are used in a given game. Players, in addition to normal actions, may attempt to ally with, or vanquish, the alien races. Allied aliens give you an ongoing effect that modifies other actions in the game, while vanquishing the aliens prevents allied effects and gains you victory points.


These alien homeworld cards are placed in the center of the table and represent the aliens that are currently in place on specific planets. If a player tried to inhabit one of those locations, they must either align with the alien and take a special power for the rest of the game -OR- vanquish the alien to gain additional stars.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Micro Drift
description:
Nanodaption of Turbo Drift.


Description by the designer:

Based on Turbo Drift by Rob Cramer, as part of the September 2017 "Boardgame of the Month."

Based on one of my earliest attempts at game design, Micro Drift has players swerving wildly around an arena to collect a set of four flags. Grab a boost or chevron and watch out for oil. After moving, you steer by rotating a quadrant of the board, which rearranges the paths and can force your opponents to head in different directions.

This comes with 4 two-sided cards and a rule sheet. Cut out the tokens and fold the Car standees to bring the game to life.
mechanics: Pieces as Map, Point to Point Movement

name: Davy Jones' Locker
description:
A VP-collection game with a unique moving-target mechanic that provides a good amount of player interaction, a bit of take-that and just the right amount of luck.
Each player controls two ships: The pirate ship can bury treasure, which becomes a target for other players to dig out, and can attack other ships to steal from them. The sailing ship must move onto landmarks on the board using limited movement dictated by a “wind” die, while being also a target for attacks.
Both the treasure and the actions players can use come from chits drawn from a bag throughout the game.
You win by having the most points in hand, buried under your treasure markers on the board, or from collected landmarks.
The game can be played from 2 to up to 6 players.

—description from the publisher

AWARDS
Finalist in the 2020 Geekway to the West game design contest (convention/contest cancelled).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: The Silent Battalion: Enemy Pack 2 – Five Leagues from the Borderlands
description:
In the dark of night, the Silent Battalion marches to reclaim the world from the living.

This Enemy Pack for Five Leagues From the Borderlands slots right into any campaign and offers:

A new Enemy type featuring skeleton soldiers with 8 entries.
Rules explaining the new Enemy type, how fighting them works and any game changes needed.
5 new Personalities to do battle with.
3 new Skills to obtain.


Whether you are looking for some variation, something new to paint or a chance to use some skeletons on the table, this expansion pack has what you need.

For the Five Leagues 2nd edition rule set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Roads Well Traveled: An Expansion Pack for Five Leagues from the Borderlands
description:
This expansion for Five Leagues From the Borderlands dramatically expands the Roadside Encounters mechanic in the core rules.

The worlds of fantasy tales are always filled with interesting, memorable and occasionally dangerous travelers and our campaign games should be no different.

The existing tables have been expanded to include new results, allowing for more variety and more things the person might want from you.

Some existing results have been tweaked to be more interesting as well.

Players have remarked positively on the ability to make Friends with travelers, but they haven’t been that easy to get an advantage from.

We’ve updated that system to make it a bit more helpful to the player.

There are also more opportunities to have roadside encounters now.

Most excitingly this pack adds 30 unique encounters ranging from a treasure hunter joining you for a bit to the local drunkard wanting someone to hang out with.

These new encounters can grant you rewards, new problems to deal with or a welcome respite fro the merciless world.

Some are simply events that happen, while others give you decisions to make.

The new rules, updated tables and unique encounters are all integrated into the new encounter table, allowing you to take full advantage of this pack.

Players who have their rules printed in a binder can simply replace the Roadside Encounter check pages in the rulebook with the pages from this supplement.

The pack is written for the 2nd edition rules, though it should be usable with 1st edition with very little adjustment.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Vitoria 1813: The Battle for Spain – Six Wargame Scenarios for General d'Armee
description:
Vitoria, 1813, The Battle for Spain is a scenario supplement for General d’Armee.
Provides six iconic actions from decisive encounter at Vitoria in 1813, including

The combat at Osma,
the battle for the Puebla heights,
the fight for the hill at Arinez,
the battle for the Zadorra bridges,
the fight for La Hermandad and
the final assault on the main French position at Vitoria.


This 45 page PDF contains an illustrated historical introduction to the campaign followed by six scenarios which are easily printed out for the game you wish to play and contain complete army lists with unit and commander ratings as well as deployment notes and a breakdown of the terrain. WHat’s more the six scenarios can be played individually or as part of a campaign, with the result of each scenario affecting the next.

If you are looking to game this iconic campaign that sealed the fate, and liberty, of Spain then look no further.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Shitty Mechs
description:
A Roll & Write, for 3 - 6 players, about designing and fighting your very own (sh*tty) mechs.

Each player draws their very own Mech before rolling dice to power it up and throw down with friends. All that's needed is two dice per player, a pen or pencil each and a copy of the Mech Design Document.

Also available in the Files Section, if you want something more family friendly - Rubbish Mechs ;it's the exact same game, just without the big and clever swearing - you can even use the same Mech Design Document!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: The Book of Roman Pop-Up Board Games
description:
Four spin/roll and move games in one book:

Gladiators, Chariot Race, Escape From Pompeii, and Race for the Throne

name: JAMIT
description:
JAMIT is a new game with FILLIT components.
If you have one FILLIT set, you can play two different games!
Enjoy FILLIT & JAMIT!!

FILLIT : https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/262806/fillit

Push coins into game board from around like as pusher game.
You win when you get a certain number points as push coins out.
You should arrange your point coins to be advantageous.
This is very tactical and abstractry game.
You can enjoy this game with only FILLIT components.

—description from the designer

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Gigant
description:
Operation Sea Lion has proceeded, both sides have lost a lot and as a result the remainder of the German forces have been pushed to Kent where they prepare their defences against the inevitable British attack. The German high command refuse to let their blitzkrieg falter at this stage and concoct a brave, audacious and completely unexpected plan...

Operation Gigant is phase two of the theoretical plan to invade Britain that has been brought forward and into action as phase one falters!

Glider borne troops and vehicles are bought in to create a surprise second front in North East England, splitting the British defences still further and driving a steel wedge down through the heart of the British countryside!

Packed with new units to defend (or destroy) Britain's defences, new scenarios on what could of been historical battles, re-construct your whole army with new theatre selectors and more off-the-wall special rules dedicated to the scientific wonders created to invade, and defend, Britain!

This time however, the Panzerbrigades will leave their treads within the mud of the British countryside and over the rubble of humble villages. With the Germans coming into Britain once again but with their complete force, can the British and the remaining Allies hold the Germans off again? Or will the German war machine repeat their success in France and steamroll over Britain?

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Faris
description:
Dedicated to bringing the killer of his uncle to justice, Faris has developed the skills of a hunter. Always patient, a master of tracking, and unerring once the prey is in his sights—all traits shared by the renowned Princess Emerald

CONTENTS:
1x Faris Masterclass Miniature
1x Faris Hero Card
1x 25mm Black Base

Take your Super Dungeon hobby to the next level with Super Dungeon: Masterclass! This premium line of resin models is specifically designed for hobby enthusiasts and gamers alike! Featuring Heroes and monsters from throughout the realms of Crystalia, these finely detailed miniatures bring the world of Super Dungeon to life as never before. Each Masterclass miniature includes cards that allow it to be used in your games of Super Dungeon!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Beyond the Gates of Antares: The Chryseis Shard
description:
The Chryseis Shard - The Ascent of the Locus - describes events taking place in Antarean space since the destruction of the planet Xilos as portrayed in the first Antares supplement The Battle for Xilos.

At the conclusion of that adventure, the discovery of an unborn Builder Gate and its subsequent escape from stasis consumed the planet Xilos and unleashed a new and terrifying power into the Antarean nexus.

Full Campaign. You can play out the entire campaign of six battles using the forces described. Each side’s total score gives it an individual success rating. The score accumulated by the Locus gives a bonus level in the final game, making the Locus easier or harder to defeat.

Modified Campaign. You can also play out the entire campaign of six battles using any forces chosen to an appropriate points value as indicated for each game. You might also reduce the number of battles by just playing the ones that appeal to you.

Narrative Scenarios. You can play any of the six individual scenarios in this book using any forces you wish in the same way as the narrative scenarios already included in the Beyond the Gates of Antares rulebook. Individual scenarios can be played over and over again, with different forces every time if you want. Notes are also included suggesting further variations to try out.

Army List Entries. This book contains additions for existing army lists that either extend existing entries or add new ones. Although introduced here for the first time, these new entries form part of the relevant army lists and can be used in any Antares games. Your Free PDF army lists will be up dated soon!

Characters. Rules for several new Antarean characters that can be used in any games on the same basis as other Antarean characters.

Chryseian Armoury. An introduction to new weaponry and new equipment including a selection of vehicles as well as new squad types for Algoryn and Isorians.

New Variant Forces. This book includes new rules covering drop forces, new force selectors that allow different combinations of troop types, and rules for Ghar Fifth Columnists!

Hazardous Environments. A selection of new rules for fighting in hazardous environments.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: DBM Naval Rules
description:
Rule modifications and naval lists designed for the simple but satisfying resolution of fleet sized naval battles.

Although these rules are grounded on the existing naval aspects of DBM, they are in no way intended as a replacement for the existing rule mechanics used in the land game. Instead the aim has been to create a set of rules appropriate for purely naval battles.

The rules and naval lists have been written with a very specific period in mind, namely 240BC to 167BC. This is the period from the end of the First Punic War to the final Roman destruction of the Macedonian monarchy.

But the rules might be accommodated with further modifications right through the 15th century and beyond.

—description from the introduction (extracted)
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Micro Pack 2: "Hillshire Vale" – A New Location for Five Leagues from the Borderlands Second Edition
description:
The second Micro Pack for Five Leagues From the Borderlands offers a new village you can visit in your campaigns, full of sullen and suspicious locals.

While here you will operate under new restrictions, but also have the chance to interact with 2 new NPC's and pick up some local help.
Micro Packs offer a snack sized bit of gaming you can read on your lunch break, then include in your campaign play without having to sit through a big, long rulebook to do so.

This is a Second Edition supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Micro Pack 3: The Broadhill Ogre – A New Encounter for Five Leagues from the Borderlands Second Edition
description:
Welcome to Micro Pack 3.

This offers a new encounter for Five Leagues From the Borderlands 2nd edition, giving you a bite-sized amount of gaming fun, which can be added to any ongoing campaign.

Within this pack you will find a new village to visit, with an ogre problem.
Track down the beast and slay it, and you'll make new friends in the village.

This pack is intended for use with the Five Leagues From the Borderlands 2nd edition rules and is NOT compatible with the 1st edition (as you need access to the new "Monster" rules to use this encounter).

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Old Kin: Enemy Pack 1 – Five Leagues from the Borderlands
description:
Below the waves and in the marshes lurk ancient things waiting to take their rightful place under the sun.

This Enemy Pack for Five Leagues offers the following:


A brand new type of Enemy, the Old Kin to fight with, perfectly suited for those lizard man mini's you've been waiting to play with.


Features include:

A new Region table allowing you to determine which Threats you wish to face in the campaign.
Rules clarifications on questions pertaining to Threats.
A new Enemy table with 8 enemy types on them, complete with special rules.
3 new evil Personalities to encounter in battle.
3 new Skills for your war band to acquire.
Detail on how to build a campaign map incorporating the new Threat and more.
Everything you need to add a new dimension to your campaigns and delve deeper into the horrors that lurk Five Leagues From the Borderlands.


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Checkmath
description:
Checkmath is an abstract game played on a 10x10 board with spaces numbered from 1-100. Each player has a set of 10 pieces numbered 1-10.

Players set up their pieces on the opposite ends of the board and take turns moving one piece forwards by one row. A piece can only move to a space which is a multiple of its number, but it can move to any such space in the next row (adjacency is not a factor). (In the first version of the game, and possibly others, the "10" pieces were numbered "10/11" and could move to multiples of either number.)

If a piece lands on an opposing piece it captures. If a piece reaches the opposite end of the board it is crowned (flipped over) and can now move one row backwards or forwards.

The winner is the player who captures all the opposing pieces.

name: Clean Family
description:
In Clean Family, players help their families to get what they need in the time of pandemic. There is a virus outbreak and no cure yet. Government issues lockdown and everyone should stay at home to contain the spreading.

Players need to help their Dad, Mom, Brother, Sister, Grandpa and Grandma get what they need. They will have to go to the market to get the items and draw them on their grid and then assign them to each Family member.

Clean Family is a simple flip and draw game for 1 to 4 players. The game is played over a series of round until all players played their cards. At the end of the game, players count all their points that they get from the symbols drawn on their player sheet, and player with the most points wins the game.

Clean Family is a simple flip and draw game but has deep decision making and interesting spatial placement.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid

name: Kintsugi: The Beauty of Scars
description:
Kintsugi is a dice placing game where we will assume the role of Japanese craftsmen under the command of the shogun Ashikaya Yoshimaga during the 15th century and in which we will have to repair their favorite tea cups and turn them into the greatest pieces of art of the Japanese empire . Will you be able to do it?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Dragon Gyas
description:
While Dragon Gyas can be played by 1-4 players, the game is primarily designed to be a two-player game in which one player represents the Hexgyas and its seven supporting knights while the other player controls the Grandragon and its seven Dragonewts. All of the characters are represented by either miniatures or cardboard standees, with the Hexgyas and Grandragon being much larger than the other characters.

What's more, these two figures are the most important ones because if you lose your main character, then you lose the game.

To set up, players choose a starting configuration for their large figure and seven smaller ones on their half of the game board. The Hexgyas and Grandragon stand in one of the five large hexagonal spaces, while their supporting characters occupy the smaller hexes that form a network around these larger hexes. Each player positions three pieces of armor around their large figure, designating two other positions around their perimeter as a weak spot and a critical weak spot. Players also customize a control deck for their large character with three attack cards and three special cards that are added to their six movement cards.

The game lasts at most five rounds, and each round consists of four phases. Players first choose initiative from a hand of five initiative cards and program three control cards for their large figure. During the control phase, players carry out their actions, moving their large figure and attempting to inflict damage on the opponent. The command phase allows the supporting characters to attack one another, but also to infiltrate the opponent's giant to discover weak spots and possibly inflict damage or pull control cards from their hand.

Deal ten damage to the opponent's larger figure, and you win instantly. If no one has been taken down after five rounds, then the Grandragon wins, having overcome the initiative advantage wielded by the Hexgyas.
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Chaos Battletome – Disciples of Tzeentch
description:
The Disciples of Tzeentch take a great many forms, from Arcanite cultists to hosts of gibbering daemons. Amongst their chanting ranks are bird-headed beastmen, horned monstrosities and many-eyed seers, all determined to capsize the reality of the Mortal Realms. Even the lowliest of their number has magical talent – to face them in battle is to face a barrage of lethal spells, fatal transmutations and raw Chaos.

Embrace madness and unleash the myriad cults of the Architect of Fate in Battletome: Disciples of Tzeentch! This tome of arcane lore is your complete guide to one of Warhammer Age of Sigmar’s most unpredictable armies – a coalition of magic wielders, monsters and cultists with the power to manipulate fate itself. In this book, you’ll discover the hidden world of the Disciples of Tzeentch, from concealed covens to the Crystal Labyrinth itself, all illustrated with gorgeous art, before taking to the battlefield with an army of your own.

Allegiance abilities, sub-faction rules and more let you get the most out of your Disciples of Tzeentch army. Control fate with the Destiny Dice system, dedicate yourself to the Change Covens, summon hordes of Daemons to the battlefield, pursue hidden agendas – how you harness Tzeentch’s boons is up to you! To help you in your ascension to glory, this book also contains collecting tips, with example armies, stunningly painted miniatures, painting advice, Path to Glory rules and more.

This 120-page hardback book contains:

The history and the origins of the Disciples of Tzeentch – from the countless cults that exist in the backstreets of Sigmar’s cities to the Daemons of the Realm of Chaos
Lore and art that brings the world of the Disciples of Tzeentch to life
Tips for collecting Disciples of Tzeentch, and rules that allow you to fight battles with them on the tabletop
Allegiance abilities that bestow a wide selection of battle traits, command traits, artefacts of power and unique spell lores upon your army
A battleplan representing a secret rite conducted by the Disciples of Tzeentch
Rules themed around the six most famous Change Covens, offering new ways to use your collection


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Subterfuge
description:
Subterfuge is played on a 9x9 grid with Geneva in the center and home cities for players in the corners. The remaining squares are numbered. Each player has a copy of the sheet.

On a turn a player either bribes an agent (by writing an amount in their square and deducting it from their total) or moves the secret papers. The papers start in Geneva and move to adjacent agents. A move may be challenged by players with bribes on the agent relinquishing control of the papers; there is a sort of bidding procedure to resolve challenges without revealing too much information.

The object of the game is to move the papers to your home city.
publishers: Dover Publications, Games and Puzzles (magazine), Thomas Nelson & Sons Ltd

name: Ninja Chef
description:
Good day, ladies and gentlemen! And welcome to our brand new cooking show — Ninja Chef: The place where true masters of nunchucks and razor claws compete against the great and glorious Octo Zamzey for the title of "The Best Rice & Sushi Chef!" The drama is hotter than wasabi, the plot rapid as a flying onigiri! Sounds intriguing, huh? Then let’s roll it!

In the family board game Ninja Chef players participate in a cooking show not as regular folks, but as animal ninjas! There's more: the animals in the game are not just random characters, but the very last of their species in Japan. At Cosmodrome Games, we appreciate the diversity and fragility of nature, so we decided to create a special board game that will help you not only enjoy your time with family and friends, but will also tell a story about unique and endangered species.

How does it all start? The show host and main jury is the famously beloved Octo Zamzey. He’s become extremely tired of untalented participants and decided to get the fastest, bravest, and most nimble creatures in the whole universe. You might think at first that it’s all about ninja turtles, but nope, that’s a completely different story. Octo Zamzey called for Japanese ninjas! Why them? It’s simple: our heroes share not only the ninja’s path but also a hobby—they love to cook!

Octo Zamzey is super hot-tempured and an explosive slime ball at the same time (he’s an octopus, duh!). It gets really spicy in the kitchen when he’s angry. And, Octo is up to no good and has an axe to grind with the ninjas. His tentacles are always aiming to strike their heads and miso-souped their plans!

Move around the kitchen and collect the essential ingredients you need to cook up a fantastic presentation. Roll out your creation to the jury so they can taste your masterpiece—and select the winner!

In this game, you need to escape Zamzey’s wrath while competing with the other players! Move around the kitchen and collect the essential ingredients you need to cook up a fantastic presentation. Roll out your creation to the jury so they can taste your masterpiece—and select the winner! For greater variety, the game has several modes—just choose yours:

Yakitori duels: Play in teams of 1-3 people with friends and family.
Single Taiyaki: Solo mode to fight alone against Octo.
Together we are strong as sashimi: Fight together as a team against Octo Zamzey.


In each mode, use the special abilities of each ninja and don’t forget about basic skills like kicking ingredients above the tables. And be careful! The kitchen floor is full of obstacles that can influence the cooking process.

Ninja Chef will surprise you with its unique mechanic of cooperative worker-movement that allows you to make splendid combos by interacting with the other players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Events, Hand Management, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Chaos Battletome – Skaven
description:
Red eyes and chisel fangs glint in the gloom. A terrible chittering fills the air. Then, from the darkness they come – the skaven have arrived to blight the Mortal Realms!

Chaos Battletome: Skaven is your guide to the evil ratmen who gnaw at the very fabric of reality. Serving the Chaos deity known as the Great Horned Rat, these sinister creatures seek to undermine the Mortal Realms, conquering with raw cunning, overwhelming numbers, and strange inventions.

In this 128-page hardback battletome, you'll learn about the history of the Skaven in the Mortal Realms – from their origins in Blight City to their role in the Soul Wars, all illustrated with stunning and evocative art. You'll also find lore on their many clans and the brutal inner workings of skaven society. The battletome goes on to cover how the skaventide goes to war, showcased by several warscroll battalions, and all the warscrolls needed to field a force of ratmen on the tabletop. You’ll be able to mix-and-match a variety of skaven clans to build a killer army to suit your tastes – slaying your enemies with endless hordes of Clanrats, blasting them apart with the terrible technology of the warp lighting-wielding Stormfiends, and unleashing vile monsters of arcane science like the Hell Pit Abominations. All are goaded into battle by the scheming, backstabbing members of the Masterclan!

Battletome: Skaven lets you customise the leaders of the skaven with a selection of warpstone-infused artefacts and cunning sorceries. Their spells come from the Lore of Ruin, a collection of sinister curses, and the Lore of Warpvolt Galvanism, arcane arts that enhance Skyre units and incinerate your foes. The book is also a great resource for collectors, packed with examples of different colour schemes to inspire your own projects, as well as painting tips. The section on Path to Glory rules and a pair of bespoke missions are great for organising and playing your first games with this insidious army.

This book contains:

Allegiance abilities for skaven, including a variety of battle traits – 6 separate types of artefacts of power and 6 types of command traits
2 spell lores – the Lore of Ruin (for use by Grey Seers) and Lore of Warpvolt Galvanism (for use by Clans Skryre Wizards)
2 battleplans
Path to Glory rules for creating a skaven warband for Path to Glory, including Champion and Followers Rewards Tables
8 warscroll battalions
40 warscrolls, 3 endless spell warscrolls and a warscroll for the Gnawhole scenery piece.
Pitched battle profiles for all units and Endless Spells featured in this battletome


If you’re starting a new skaven army or bringing your classic collection into the Mortal Realms, this battletome is your essential companion.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Crystals
description:
Crystals is played on a square grid - 21x21 is a suggested size. Players take turns marking squares with their symbol (e.g. X and O). These are called "atoms."

When a player can form a "crystal" they outline it, shade it, and score as many points as there are squares in it. A crystal is any shape that has at least four atoms of one player in it, none of another player, has reflective symmetry about both orthogonal and both diagonal axes, and obeys a few other rules.

The winner is the player with the most points once it is no longer possible to form new crystals.
publishers: Dover Publications, Games and Puzzles (magazine), Thomas Nelson & Sons Ltd

name: クロノコレクション (CHRONO COLLECTION)
description:
クロノコレクション (CHRONO COLLECTION) is an auction game from Japan.

In Chrono Collection, players make successful bids for luxury watches exhibited at a specialised auction. All the watch collectors are aiming to increase their collection.

Due to multiple auctions taking place at the same time, you must make good use of your limited time and bid higher than other participants.

The player wins who has both the highest score and also assists the collaborators at the venue and collecting brands quickly.

Please don't make a mistake in how you use your time....

「クロノコレクション」は時計専門のオークションに出品された高級時計を落札し、自分のコレクションを増やすことが目的のゲームです。

複数の競売が同時に行われるので、限られた時間をうまく使い、他の参加者よりも高い値を付けなければなりません。

会場にいる協力者の力を借りたり、いち早くブランドを集めたりしながら、最も点数を獲得したプレイヤーの勝利です。

どうか、時間の使い方を間違えませぬよう……。
publisher's summary

name: Modern Period Rules
description:
Yes, the Yanks are gonna screw it up for us again with this 1955 to Armageddon set. After all, the Yanks were late for the first two world wars and are going to make up for it by being really prompt for the next one. Fast, realistic play in real time (but usually faster).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Numbo
description:
Numbo is played on a 6x6 grid. Players take turns entering numbers from 1 to 36 in empty spaces of the grid. Each number must be in the same row or column as the previous number, with no intervening numbers.

Whoever enters the last number scores it. A player may resign rather than playing in order to deny their opponent points.

A number of rounds should be played. Each round is started at the number after the last used in the previous round, cycling back to 1 after 36.

The first edition of the game (Numerate) used a 5x5 grid and had the cyclic number usage as a variant.

name: Krynea Battlefield: Expansiones 3 y 4
description:
Lords of Magic and Mercenaries factions are expanded with 25 new cards per faction, 50 total, with 10 action cards, 14 troop cards (including 1 new Champion and 1 Magic Item) and 1 new exclusive ability for each faction.

The two expansions are presented together in a single cardboard box, in the most classic style of traditional poker cards. Sizes 63x88mm, finished in 300gr with casino varnish, packed in a 50 card case.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Ambuscades & Affairs of Outposts: Being a Pike & Shot Supplement for Knyghte, Pyke, and Sworde
description:
''Ambuscades & Affairs of Outposts
This supplement for Knyghte Pyke and Sworde expands the rules to cover the beginning of Pike&Shot warfare in the late 1500s.

This is a period of transition from medieval warfare to the era of gun powder, where armored knights and archers were making their last desperate gestures, rubbing shoulders with musketeers and cannon.

Included is an overview of the period, new rules for pike blocks and pistol armed cavalry, 6 scenarios usable with any armies as well as a collection of ready-to-play profiles (with points values) for the following armies:

Spanish,
Dutch,
Huguenots,
French Catholics,
English,
Irish,
English Sea Dogs and
Spanish Colonial Troops.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Scout and Doodle: The Forest of Mist
description:
Scout and Doodle: the Forest of Fog is a flip and write game, in PnP version, part of the universe Rodentia: the board game, where rodents have united and managed to expel their predators, after the war control the wolves consequently the ancient forests were destroyed because of the battles and the hobby of the beavers for cutting them down, the scouting squirrels are trying reforest the Mist Forest of ash, oak, lime, elm and carpes.

Doodling on the map we represent a group of squirrels reforesting the Forest of Fog, while we face a Beaver, who does not stop cutting down trees and making dams.
We will cooperate to remember compasses. In turns, we will choose and flip a compass token, we will move around the map and draw trees / be careful with turning a compass with a beaver, anger for you and cut down trees.

At the end of the game we can be a swallow, a scout or a ranger, depending on the number of trees we have planted.

—description from the designer

“Scout and Doodle: el Bosque de la Niebla” es un juego de Flip and Write, en versión PnP, parte del universo de Rodentia: el juego de tablero, donde los roedores se han unido y logrado expulsar a sus depredadores, después de la guerra control los lobo, en consecuencia, los antiguos bosques quedaron destruidos a causa de las batallas y la afición de los castores por talarlos, las ardillas exploradoras están intentado reforestar el Bosque de la Niebla de fresnos, robles, tilos, olmos y carpes.

Al dibujar en el mapa representamos a un grupo de ardillas reforestando el Bosque de la Niebla, mientras nos enfrentamos a un Castor, que no para de talar árboles y hacer represas.

Cooperaremos para recordar la ubicación de las brujulas. Por turnos, escogeremos y voltearemos una ficha de brujula, nos moveremos por el mapa y dibujaremos arboles / cuidado con dar vuelta una brujula con un castor, el ira por ti y talara arboles.

Al final del juego podremos ser un golondrinas, scouts o rangers, según la cantidad de arboles que logramos plantamos.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Map Reduction, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Palaeo Diet: Pulp
description:
Palaeo Diet: Pulp is the dino-hunting, mummy-wrangling, Nazi-punching expansion for Palaeo Diet: Eat or be Eaten, the solo and co-operative game of survival in a savage prehistoric world.

Palaeo Diet: Pulp includes:

New rules for modern pulp adventurers with all new weapons and traits;
New landscape types including buildings, quicksand and carnivorous plants;
Four new beast reactions;
Eight new beast profiles including witch doctors, mummies and raptors;
Three new scenarios to showcase the new rules.


THIS IS NOT A STAND ALONE GAME - A copy of Palaeo Diet: Eat or Be Eaten is required to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Unlikely Heroes: Pharaohs
description:
Unlikely Heroes: Pharaohs is a puzzling narrative adventure game in which the unlikely heroes must adventure through three unique quests of undead, magic, and mummies: The Lost Mummy, The Desert Bride, and The Sphinx.

Unlikely heroes must explore the map, encounter challenges, and ultimately save the day. Start the game by flipping the first map tile and exploring each corner of the map. As more and more tiles are uncovered, your team will encounter puzzles, enemies, treasures, tools, weapons, and allies. Decipher the narrative and explore the map accordingly for victory.

Box contents
50+ page Adventure book
200+ Gamecards
20 x Acrylic cubes
4 x Meeples
Rulebook
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Exploration, Humor
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Map Reduction, Move Through Deck, Multiple Maps, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults – Twin Attack Armory Pack: Knight Trebuchet vs. Orc Mortar
description: Expand your Knights vs Orc Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults battles with this three expansion for the Battleground: Crosbows & Catapults game.

name: Lampogo 3
description: Collect as many cards as you can by solving the maths puzzles. You can play with the SUM cards, the DIFFERENCE cards or the MIX cards, which combine the two in a single puzzle. There are also three ways to play, race, team or solo.

name: Wyvern: Chameleon
description:
Changing the Kingdom of Wyvern.
The Chameleon Expansion Set adds 90 common and uncommon cards to the Kingdom, and features colorful and captivating original artwork.
As you dominate your vast empire, you will want to collect all 90 Chameleon cards to strengthen your army of Dragons, enhance your Battlefield position, and increase your Treasure hoard.
Be warned...both your Battlefield and your opponent's Battlefield will be constantly changing with the Chameleon Expansion Set!
NEW RULES: Native Terrain & Chameleon Reaction
Plus rule clarifications.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Bang!
description:
