It is the last day of school before the holidays. After a long nap in history class, you are shocked to find that you are suddenly sitting alone in the classroom - and all the doors to the outside are locked!

Why didn't anyone wake you up? And how do you escape on vacation now? You have to find out in this exciting escape game. Now you and your fellow players have to show talent for combination, creativity and team spirit in order to solve the encrypted messages and tricky puzzles in this game. And against time!
So get started right away! Who wants to spend their vacation at school?

name: Broken Skies
description:
Broken Skies is a game for two or more players. A standard game will generally consist of 2-3 models per side. Players first choose the faction they want to play and select a force up to the agreed points value.

When selecting your force, you start with selecting your aircraft. These may then be upgraded by adding pilot skills or aircraft upgrades. A player may choose a maximum of one Pilot Skill upgrade and one Aircraft upgrade for each model.

Broken Skies is all about fun customisation of your list to make it uniquely yours! Of course, you don’t have to customise with skills and upgrades. You can just take the basic model as listed on the stat card. These represent the basic rookie pilots that has yet to win glory in the skies.

With this in mind it’s also possible to play a series of friendly games in which your force builds their skills and upgrades over the course of the campaign.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Sudden Death Ending, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Warhorn
description:
Heed the mighty WARHORN and charge into battle! Warhorn is a fast-paced timed deck-building battle game where horned creatures from the same clan grant cumulative power values of creatures or that creatures clan members that charge into battle. Warhorn has a companion mobile application where players access the WARHORN which is a digital timer that has large buttons where time can be added and subtracted when prompted by certain clan abilities.

When the war horn sounds players unleash their army (play their deck in its current state) trying to deploy their entire army of creatures as efficiently as possible by matching clans in a bid then match or exceed clash. Players whose clan cards are “defeated” go back into the Discharge pile which is later shuffled to create the communal Draft pile.

During the Draft Players will use their time as they see fit to build up their current army for crushing victories, sabotage, and Interfere with their opponents draft or diversify their forces for varied strategic outcomes.

Players may choose to stall during their turn and run down the clock in order to gain strategic advantages forcing other players to play clan abilities to force a turn pass, add or subtract time to or from the Warhorn, or ultimately cause the WARHORN to sound.

Players can choose to hold onto creature cards to create an active hand while the WARHORN is ticking down and Interfere with their opponents all while attempting to adapt to the clans drawn during their turn in order to build a powerful army deck from the communal drafting pile.

Clan cards will have different amounts of troops on them complimenting their clan abilities. The first player to deploy all their creature cards into the fight wins the battle. The first player to win 3 battles wins the war.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fighting, Math, Memory, Real-time
mechanics: Action Points, Action Timer, Closed Drafting, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Open Drafting

name: The Millennium War
description:
Once in a Millennium, when all the elements of the Universe are aligned, the Millennium gate emerges and releases powerful cosmic energies in the form of mythical beasts, sacred weapons and spells. This is an opportunity to harness the cosmic energy and win the prolonged war between 2 powerful forces: The Virtues and The Sinners.From around the world come the most powerful heroes from both spectrums. They travel to the dangerous shadow realm to claim the power and to keep it from falling into the enemy’s hands. Whoever shall claim the millennium gate shall win the war, the Millennium War.

In the Millennium War, there are two game modes: competitive mode and cooperative mode. In competitive mode, players go head to head while building their strategy by selecting teams of legendary heroes, buying items, preparing passive spells to counterattack, and most importantly planning their actions by managing mana resources and movement across the Millennium Arena.
There are 3 ways to win in competitive mode: eliminate all your opponents' teams of heroes, destroy all your opponents' ancient structures or claim the Millennium Gate by hunting powerful mythical beasts.
Millennium War's competitive mode is inspired by the popular MOBA games but adjusted to be one of a kind as a board game. You don’t win by speed and accuracy, or control of your keyboard, but by how you think and plan your strategy with a combination of choices. Similar to Chess but way more fun. Whether crushing your enemies with extreme power, trapping them with self destruct explosives and sacrificing one of your hero's for a few of theirs, brain controlling enemy hero's or even switching positions, there are endless ways to gain a strategic advantage. Build combos with 35 special Millennium Hero's and their endless combinations of weapons and spells.
In contrast to the swift pace of Competitive mode is the journey to the Millennium world in Cooperative mode, where players must work together to defeat Millennium Bosses. Each Boss presents a unique way of attack and has its own topography that’ll require the entire team to solve the puzzle to defeat the powerful Boss.
The game offers countless excitement, it’s fun and full of surprises, easy to play and tracks game play because of uniquely designed and patented smart dials, dealer shoes, hero cards and icons. Offering a supporting website featuring hero skills diagrams for easy learning, along with in depth character design inspired by world cultures and game mechanics. The game miniatures are lovingly made with highly detailed craftsmanship by talented artists from around the world. They also magnetically attach to the smart dial.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology

name: Lose Your In-Laws
description:
Lose Your In-Laws is a fun card game specially made to test your 'in-law dodging skills'.

The goal is to keep all your in-laws out of your house! If there are three or more in-law cards inside your house, you'll lose the game. But, it gets even worse! If the mother-in-law has entered your house, you'll lose immediately!
So make sure your front door is always closed!

Use 'trouble cards' to open the doors of other players and keep your own door closed with 'action cards'. Get rid of in-laws in front of your door with good 'excuse cards' or send someone away with a 'get out card'.

Are you the last player standing? Can you resist your visiting in-laws? Then you'll win the game!

—description from the designer

name: Divided Cities (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: With this new designed city tiles you can divide cities to keep the majority or make it at least more difficult to take over your city. On the other hand you can use them to invade. ;-)
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Dyad
description:
A traditional deck trick-taking game that is rare for its use of playing paired cards rather than a single card at a time.
The game uses values 2-7 in a 2 or 3 player game, 2-9 in a 4 player game.

Lead Pairs consist of
A matched pair: Two cards sharing a suit - totaled and requiring others to follow suit.
An unmatched pair: Two cards that have different suits - totaled but not requiring others to follow suit.

Following Pairs consist of

A matched pair: Same as above.

An unmatched pair following an unmatched pair: cards are totaled.

An unmatched pair following a matched pair: the lowest card is considered the total.

A double - An unmatched pair containing a 2, following a matched pair. The higher valued card is doubled.

The highest total takes the trick; the player who takes the trick retrieves an opponent's card played to the trick and leads the next trick.

After a number of tricks (4 in a 3 or 4 player game; 6 in a 2 player game) players total the cards remaining in their hands. This is their score for the round.

At the end of the round in which any player has scored at least 50 points, the highest score wins. If tied, the tied player with the highest score in the last round wins the game.


Dyad plays with a number of variants:

Cipher - (Usually with 3 or 4 players) A player may choose to cipher prior to the start of a phase. If that player takes 0 points, the player scores 20 points.

2's - If a player ends the round with a 2 and any other card, the 2 is subtracted from the score, but having a sole 2 at the end of the round scores 20 points.

Teams - (4 players) Players on a team sit across from one another. Teamed players pass 2 cards to each other prior to the start of the phase. Teams play to score 100 points.

The game generally includes themed decks where themes include new variants.

—description from the designer

name: Shield of the Viking
description:
Game is Free & Available to PnP. Click on Files to download.


WINNER OF “BEST AREA CONTROL GAME” IN THE 2020 BGG SOLITAIRE GAME DESIGN CONTEST***




Shield of the Viking is a solitaire Tower Defense / Tile placement game that sets you as the Jarl of a small Viking village who is trying to survive the nightly raids from "the riders" who live in the mountains to the north.

The game is played on a board made up of hexagonal spaces that narrow down in quantity from top to bottom. Your objective is to defend your fortress at the bottom of the board just long enough for you to put an end to the raids.

Using 4 colored die each round, the riders path down the mountain and through your village is randomized each turn. The rider will follow the colored pattern of the die rolled through colored arrows on each of the board spaces. The result is a snake like path causing destruction as he moves.

In between Raids, you will have the opportunity to place Viking soldiers and build defensive buildings to stop the Rider before he reaches the bottom. However, you must also decide how many Vikings to keep in the village to defend it vs how many you want to send searching for the rider's home base to defeat them once and for all.

The PnP version was originally designed for the 2020 Solitaire PnP Contest by Joe Fontana

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Track Movement, Worker Placement

name: Taxi! Board Game: Great Britain
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: Taxi! Board Game: Edinburgh
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: Taxi! Board Game: Liverpool
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: Taxi! Board Game: Great Manchester
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: Puzzle & Dragons Trading Card Game
description:
Puzzle & Dragons Trading Card Game is the trading card game version of famous mobile game Puzzle & Dragons.
In this game, players need turn beads to gain combos like play the mobile game.
Like most tcgs, players also need use monsters to fight with you opponent and the player makes his opponent's life to zero will win the game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: The Last of Us
description: The Last of Us: The Board Game is set in the world of Naughty Dog's critically acclaimed and best-selling video game series, The Last of Us.

name: Bluff Pirate
description:
A BLUFFING GAME
OBJECT: become a pirate and be the first to find the treasure on the secret island by bluffing your way forward.
All aboard! A race has just begun to be the first to find the treasure hidden on one of the secret islands. To move your “ship” piece forward, you’ll need to play a set of identical cards. You can bluff and hide bits of the set you put down, but be careful your enemies don’t catch you out – that might give them the upper hand! Are you ready for an adventure?

+++ An introduction to bluffing!

—description from the publisher

name: Fight Sequence
description:
Fight Sequence is the tactical reverse action-programming dueling game about psychics THINKING about fighting! Players build sequences of attacks and responses that resolve in reverse order, representing the ebb and flow of a theoretical fantasy fight scene two psychics are projecting into each other's minds. Planning your own moves isn't the only key to victory; you'll also use your psychic and magical abilities to manipulate when - or IF - actions resolve!

Players select one of the four characters in a diverse cast of psychic combatants, using their unique skillsets to emerge victorious. Every character deck has its own strengths and weaknesses, with a depth of tactical play that ensures no two fights are the same.

In Fight Sequence, players take turns playing Actions or passing, building a series of Actions until both players pass consecutively [with passes being forced once the maximum sequence size of 9 Actions is met]. Once that happens, the entire sequence then resolves in reverse order, starting with the last Action played. Timing your Actions for maximum effect is crucial, but every character has some ability to manipulate that timing to work more in their favor. Even the best-laid plans aren't foolproof!

Actions are either attacks or responses - use your attacks to damage your opponent, and your responses to defend yourself from opposing attacks or support your strategy. Every card in the game can be played as either an attack or a response, so you're never out of options. Damage is represented by discarding cards from your deck; no paper, pen, dice, or tracker apps required. Just choose your characters, shuffle your decks, and begin!

In addition to four varied characters with different styles and movesets, The First Chapter also includes the Academy decks, which use a more streamlined subset of cards to help ease players into the reverse-action-programming nature of the game.

-- description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Defence of Ryza
description:
The forge world of Ryza is second only to Mars in its splendour. Famed for its innovative plasma technologies, it is a prime target for the Dark Mechanicum and their ally, the Warmaster Horus. As the forces of the traitor Fabricator-General, Kelbor-Hal, attack, Ryza's defenders prepare to sell their lives dearly for their world.

Discover the dramatic events of the Defence of Ryza in this 108-page hardback supplement for Adeptus Titanicus, alongside a host of new rules to use in your games. Harness the strengths of six different Titan Legions using four new maniples, and bring the might of six Knight Households to bear against your enemies. Create your own Legions, choosing from a massive variety of rules, and declare your allegiance to the Emperor or Horus – or forge your own path as mercenary Blackshields. Play out the story across six narrative missions, complete with new environment rules and stratagems – however you want to play, you'll find new rules for you.

—description from the publisher

CONTENTS
– An overview of the Defence of Ryza
– Background and Legion-specific rules for six Titan Legions: Honorum, Osedax, Crucius, Magna, Vulturum and Mortis
– Four new maniples to use in your games
– Background and rules for six Knight Houses: Sidus, Taranis, Zavora, Morbidia, Ioeden and Oroborn
– Full colour examples of paint schemes and heraldry for Titans and Knights
– Six narrative missions based on the dramatic events of the story
– Three different allegiances for your Titan Legions, and four for your Knight Houses
– Rules for creating your own Titan Legions, including 16 Traits, 15 Stratagems, and 21 pieces of Wargear
– Battle Standards, Lance Standards and High Kings to expand your Knight Households
– New environments: Manufactoria, Plasmatic Infrastructure and Ryza Secundus
– 11 new Stratagems to use in your games

A copy of the Adeptus Titanicus rules is required to use the contents of this book.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Wolfje, Wolfje hoe laat is het?
description:
Wolfje, Wolfje hoe laat is het? ("Little wolf, little wolf, what time is it?") is an education game that helps children reading clocks - both analogue and digital.

In the game, players try to get bring their four sheep home. Each turn, the active player will roll the die, and move one of his sheep forward along the track. If the sheep ends on one of the special spaces, the player draws a card showing a clock. If the player can tell the time correctly, they are rewarded with a "wolf coin". When a player has accumulated ten wolf coins, they can exchange those for a wolf card, which will give some advantage in the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Virallinen MM 97 jääkiekkopeli
description:
The Official 1997 ICE Hockey World Championship game. It is tactical dice driven game for two players.

It has all the main elements of ice hockey. More goals and some times set wins achieved player wins the game. There is also possibility to the stalemate.

Players try to make more goals than opponent. Game is played in special icehockey looking game board with different symbols and places for five icehockey players and goalkeeper in each team. Also board has movement symbols which are used by turns depending to dice rolls. There is some randomness with hidden marks in game board that players try to find. This are shot, missed shot, tackle, offside, break, block, empty, goal , set win and joker.

name: Wizkrieg
description:
Wizkrieg is a fantasy hex and counter game for 1-6 players. There are 10 human clans and 10 other races, total 20 factions in the game world. Each faction has unique heroes with various skills who may lead army in battle or do quests to collect treasures or recruit monsters. There are diplomacy features that players may make alliance. This is more like a sandbox game set in a fantasy world where players may create their own scenarios & campaigns for 1-6 players.

—description from the designer

name: ASL Comp: The Fight for Hue, Apex of the Vietnam War
description: Expansion module for Advanced Squad Leader that covers the Vietnam War battles for the City of Hue in 1968. Produced by Critical Hit.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Digit Draughts
description:
Digit Draughts is a set of three related games played using the same equipment: a standard 8x8 Checkers (Draughts) board and two sets of 12 checkers. Each set of checkers is numbered 1-6 twice.

In each game the pieces are randomly placed in the usual Checkers starting positions. (A variant is given where after determining first player, the second player's pieces are re-arranged to match the first player's.)

Game 1 is played like Checkers except that a piece can only jump a piece with an equal or lower number. The object is to capture both opposing 6s, although a player also wins if their opponent can no longer move.

In Game 2 players score points every time they make a jump - normally the absolute difference between the jumping piece's number and that on the piece being jumped, but if the numbers add to seven or eleven that many points are scored instead. When no captures can be made remaining pieces are added to players' scores.

Game 3 also uses scoring, in a different way. In this game when a piece is jumped the capturing player keeps it in front of them in a scoring area, and when a piece reaches the back row it is removed and added to its owner's scoring area. (There are no kings.) The winner is the first player to reach 30 points.

name: Micro Chapbook RPG: The Card Game
description:
The card game version of the popular solo roleplaying game!

Enter the dungeon with up to 4 heroes! Fight monsters, avoid traps, visit underground taverns and shops, share the wealth, become the heroes of legend. OR, be greedy and keep the gold for yourself, cause disention in the party, come out of the dungeon alone!

Micro Chapbook RPG: The Card Game is a fast and fun dungeon crawler based upon the popular solo roleplaying game system. Play the game solo or invite over some friends for some dungeon crawling goodness. ALSO, use the dungeon cards included here in your normal Micro Chapbook Adventures to help you build interesting new layouts each time!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Count 'em Up
description:
The players help farmer Tim count and feed the baby animals. With a lucky roll of the dice, the players can move Tim’s tractor onto the juicy clover to feed the animals. When a player feeds their last clover leaf to an animal, they win.

During the game, the children work on improving their basic counting skills, taking turns, and a basic understanding of rules. Designed for ages 2 and up, this is a great game to introduce your toddler to the world of gaming while working on key development skills.

—description from the publisher

name: Rules Pack 1: Battle Events – New Rules for Five Leagues from the Borderlands
description:
This expansion pack adds in-battle random events to your games of Five Leagues From the Borderlands.

Applicable to pretty much any campaign, the pack includes 20 random events that can happen during battles, as well as options to tailor the frequency.

Examples include a mysterious scholar wandering the battle field and the battle turning into a three way fight, as well as simpler fare like finding a shiny coin or a deathly fog descending on the battle field.

This is a supplement for Five Leagues From the Borderland 2nd edition and requires the core rules to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Social Responsibility: The Game
description:
The whole point of the Social Responsibility the card game is to never stop having fun. And that’s just what will happen with this game that you can play over and over again. Incredibly fun, this ethical card game offers multiple ways to win. So you can enjoy the fact that no time playing it will be like the last. Get your friends together and enjoy a card game with a theme of social responsibility. Because who doesn’t want to encourage positive conversations with our loved ones? Mixing strategy, luck, and memory, this interactive game engages you in multiple ways. Plus, it even incorporates mini-games, such as Rock Paper Scissors, that everyone will recognize. You’ll laugh so hard you'll cry with this socially responsible card game, and you may even want to play the optional drinking game!

There are many elements in the game that mean the person winning can change in an instant.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Closed Drafting, Hidden Victory Points, Memory, Negotiation, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Speed Matching, Voting

name: Premier Arrivé: Le Moyen-âge
description: Combine battle and strategy and be the first to capture the castle.

name: Monopoly: Elf
description:
“Son of a nutcracker!” Fans of the classic holiday film Elf will be tickled pink as they travel down memory lane in this re-imagined version of Monopoly. With iconic characters, locations, and quotes, Christmas cheer will sure be sung loud for all to hear in MONOPOLY: Elf.

Components:
Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Santa’s Sleigh, Polar Bear Cub, Jack-in-the-Box, Mailroom Coffee Mug, Santa’s Bag, Maple Syrup
28 Title Deed Cards
16 Community Chest Cards renamed Christmas Cheer
16 Chance Cards renamed Christmas Spirit
32 Houses renamed Apartments
12 Hotels renamed Skyscrapers
2 Dice
Rules

-description from publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Universal Rule: The Void
description:
The Void (CPM 0618) is a promo planet (well, the lack of a planet) card for Universal Rule.

This Universal Rule card is a new planet (almost). It's one that is purely planet destruction, and sometimes it's even one of your own.

—description from the publisher


Planet:

CPM 0618



Released in the January 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: The Catholic Card Game: Christmas Expansion
description:
A very special expansion pack all about celebrating Advent and Christmas as Catholics!

This is a 30 card expansion to add in to play with your other Catholic Card Game cards. This expansion does not come with a box, it is meant to be kept in a box with your other cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Religious

name: Brush Brothers Paint Co.
description:
Brush Brothers Paint Co. is a family friendly color mixing card game. Brush Brothers plays in 15 min, is for 2-6 players and is for ages 8 and up.

In Brush Brothers, players are new employees for the Brush Brothers Paint Co. and are seeking to make a good first impression by mixing colors and completing company goals.

In this color based deck building game, players compete to collect paint cards and meet goals before the day’s end.

On a player turn, players may perform a variety of actions including mixing paint, matching paint, and meeting company goals.

To mix paint, players may mix any of the colors in their hand to pick up paint colors from the center row. For instance, I could use red and yellow to create orange.

To match colors players may pick up a color if they already have that exact color in their hand.

To meet company goals, players declare that they are seeking to meet a goal and if they have the required colors in their play area, they may collect the goal card.

Any cards used for an action are then placed in the player discard and can cycle through their deck back into their hand on a later turn.

Players start with an even mix of red, yellow, blue and white and can collect a variety of other colors. In this way every card can help to build your deck. Excluding the starter cards, every card is worth points at the end of the game.

The game ends when the center pile runs out. The player with the most points wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: British vs Pirates: Royal Guard Limited Mini Faction
description:
The Royal Guard is a limited mini faction packed with 2 ship miniatures, 27 Skill Cards, 2 Ship Cards and 2 Captain Cards. This faction adds more variety in the world and gives players the ability to fight with new strategies using their unique skill cards. Welcome aboard, Captain!

"The noble Captains of the Royal Guard were once English aristocrats. They grew tired of the Crown's greedy taxation and began funding their own ventures. The wealth of the Royal Guard attracted many skilled Captains and even better ship builders. All formal factions despise their existence and call them no more than well dressed pirates. They return the hostility in the form of well aimed cannon shots."

—description from the publisher

name: たぎる表裏 (Tagiru Hyōri)
description:
In たぎる表裏 (Tagiru Hyōri), three players each have 1 two-sided card and compete to deduce which card each player holds. Each player is able to see the front of their own card, and the back of the other two player's cards.

The game includes 10 two-sided number cards, and a several of question cards. On a player's turn, they choose one of the question cards and ask it; some will be answered by each player, and some are directed to a specific player.

The first player to deduce the numbers on each side of the three cards wins.

name: Burgeon
description:
Definition: "Burgeon - Begin to grow or increase rapidly"

Burgeon is a solo territory control game where you plant flowers and kill weeds.

The game starts on a 10x10 grid with three weeds randomly planted on the board and a weather token revealed above the board. Then the player draws three cards and uses two of them to plant flowers on the board that can kill the weeds. Careful where you plant the flowers however, some will kill your plants!

Each round the planted flowers and weeds grow, flourishing and spreading across the board depending on the weather. After 10 rounds, the game ends and points are scored to see if you win! The more flowers you have, the better your garden is and you gain more points. But if you have too many weeds, you'll get minus points and your garden will die.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Automatic Resource Growth, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: The Dwarves: The Triumph of the Dwarves
description:
Included inside The Dwarves: The Duel but for use only with The Dwarves.

This small, 21-card expansion allows you to play through the adventures found in the 5th-chapter of the best-selling novel "The Dwarves". It will be the greatest challenge you had to face thus far.

Expansion contains 13 Scenario cards and 8 Special Equipment cards.

Cards are distinguished with the letters 'ToD' at the bottom right for identification.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Wargame

name: Tag Team: Commerce Road Cobra Khans
description:
This is a full extra crew that you can swap in or out of your games (or play with an extra player). You can also mix and match crews to make a custom one. It includes one set of 7 Cobras and 1 Reference Card.

These days it's not enough to be the toughest crew on the streets; you need to make sure everyone knows it, too. Bring enough cans of spray paint to tag walls all over town, and enough muscle to make sure no one else does. There's nothing quite as satisfying as watching little punks drop their spray cans and run at the very sight of you — just make sure that there isn't someone even bigger right around the corner!

In Tag Team, you play as a crew of Eagles, Bulldogs, Alligators or Gorillas, defending your turf by bluffing your way through battles each day. Players simultaneously reveal their leader characters, and, if nobody backs down, their backup characters join the fight. The winner tags their opponent's territory as a reward. In the end, the crew with the most tagged territory wins.

Each version of Tag Team is fully playable and includes two characters. With both versions (and the small Cobras expansion), you can mix and match characters.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series –  Series I Droid Assistants
description:
3 Droid Assistant cards were offered during the original Kickstarter project as stretch goals, each being unlocked one at a time.

After the Kickstarter, the droids are available to buy for an additional $2.

Droids generally help you along the way but with a potential downside if they malfunction! They add an interesting "third character" to any Twin Stars scenario, giving you something else to think about and manage.

The series I droids are:

- C.R.A.N.K.
- MC-CY (Mickey)
- Domino 2-5

The droid assistant cards are "half-sized" cards, measuring at: 2.5" x 1.75" or 63mm x 44mm.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series –  Series II Droid Assistants
description:
3 new Droid Assistant cards were offered during the original Kickstarter project as a "Free Expansion".

After the Kickstarter, the droids are available to buy for an additional $2.

Droids generally help you along the way but with a potential downside if they malfunction! They add an interesting "third character" to any Twin Stars scenario, giving you something else to think about and manage.

The series II droids are:

- F1D0
- T.R.IX
- MANTIS

The droid assistant cards are "half-sized" cards, measuring at: 2.5" x 1.75" or 63mm x 44mm.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series II – SYZYGY Mode II: Waypoint
description:
After getting out of debt, you find yourselves on the other side of the universe. In order to get home, you'll have to use waypoints to jump light years in the right direction. However, waypoint access codes are one-time use, and very hard to come by...

In order to do so, you are trekking across the universe, taking on any job that you can, hoping to earn fast credits, and more importantly, make it out alive.

A new Syzygy Mode campaign booklet were offered during the original Kickstarter project as a "Free Expansion".

"Lost in the Galaxy's outer crust, you'll do anything to find your way back home. Guide 3 characters through a series of scenarios that carry over into each other."

Syzygy Mode is a campaign that allows you to play multiple scenarios one after another, in a nice and interconnected way.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kinswinds
description:
Kinswinds is born of a desire for a deception game that focused more on information control and less on guesswork and odds.

The game attempts to simulate the power of suggestion, encouraging players to invest in the strongest card suits but also encouraging attempts to influence which suits other players believe​ are the strongest, not only through bluffing but also through actions.

Players move together through 5 steps whilst passing, discarding and activating card abilities, all of this giving them several options for altering the distribution of the cards and thus the score value of those cards. Players choose which cards they will score on during the game and in the fifth step can take a small points penalty to force the game to end if they think their chosen cards are worth the most.

At this point all hands are revealed, each player's chosen score cards are revealed and their value is calculated, the highest scoring player being declared the winner.

The game takes seconds to get running and comes in a pocket sized deckbox.

-description from designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Closed Drafting, Deduction, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Invasión
description:
Invasión is a board game for 2 players. Take control of an army of warriors, archers, warlocks and brutes. Take your men to the opposite side of the board eliminating enemy units along the way. Dodge the abominations and achieve the ultimate goal: Collect the most victory points!

During your turn you must use the invasion cards to be able to move your pieces and make close or ranged attacks. Every time you eliminate an opposing piece you will add points and if you manage to reach the opposite side of the board you will add even more.

—description from the designer

Invasión es un juego de mesa para 2 jugadores. Toma el control de un ejército de guerreros, arqueros, brujos y brutos. Lleva a tus hombres al lado opuesto del tablero eliminando unidades enemigas en el camino. Esquiva a las abominaciones y logra el objetivo final: ¡Sumar la mayor cantidad de puntos de victoria!

Durante tu turno deberás utilizar las cartas invasión para poder mover tus fichas y realizar ataques cercanos o bien a distancia. Cada vez que elimines una ficha adversaria sumarás puntos y si logras llegar al lado opuesto del tablero sumarás aún más.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

name: Margin
description:
Margin is played using the 4-8 from two decks of standard cards (40 cards in total) and 20 counters each in four colors.

At the start of the game cards are drawn until there is one of each suit - these go on the table and a color of counters is assigned to each. All other cards are shuffled and each player gets a hand (of 12, 10, or 8 depending on player count). Each player also gets one counter of each color.

On a turn a player may trade, meaning they may turn in any number of counters and then take counters equal in value; the values are determined by the cards on the table. A player also must play a card, which will change the value of the associated color; this can be done before or after trading.

When all cards have been played the game is over. Players score a point for each counter and four more points for each set of all four colors.

name: The New Game of Sky
description:
An early 1900s shedding-type card game where the cards are themed around objects in the sky: the sun, moon and stars.

There are four coloured sets, running from 1 to 10 plus quarter moon, half moon, three-quarter moon and full moon in each colour. The yellow nine is replaced by the Sun, which is a special card that can double winnings if played by the winner to “Go out with the Sun”, but doubles the penalty if still held in the hand at the end of a round.

An ante is paid into the winner’s pool by each player at the start of each round, and the dealer also pays into a separate pool for each phase of the moon, and double for the Sun. The top card is turned over each round to select the winning colour for the round, and any player that plays a moon card in the matching colour gets the contents of the matching moon pool. The Sun pool is only emptied when a player goes “Out with the Sun”, when they also get all winnings from all other coins as well.

name: Safecracker
description:
Safecracker is a simple deduction game played with a standard deck of cards.

To setup, remove all 10s, jacks, queens, and kings from the deck. These cards will not be used. One card in each suit is removed. These cards make up the combination to the safe. The other cards are dealt out to the players. Some may get more than others.

The player with the fewest cards goes first. On a turn, a player asks about a possible combination, i.e. one card from each suit. All other players must announce how many of those cards they have and then show these cards to the active player. At any time, a player may say "stop!" and check to see if they have the right combination.

Optional rules to make the game easier allow calling a specific suit, in which case each player must show you one card of that suit, or, instead, a suit and a player, in which case that player must announce how many cards they have in that suit and then show you all of them.

name: Agile SyS
description:
As new Agile coach you are assigned to 5 squads that are in the middle of their journey to adopt agile.
You have to gain their Trust and increase their Motivation by investing your Time and your Portfolio of skills and tools to create a culture of Collaboration, Autonomy, Mastery and Purpose.

You have 6 months (12 sprints) to make this happen, while squads are facing Antipatterns and eventually Disruptions.

If the above scenario sounds familiar, this is your game. In fact Agile SyS, Support your Squads) is a solo serious game to simulate the difficulties in the journey to agility for a small team of teams and provide a list of possible solutions that could help the coach (here called “The Agent”, aka “agent of change”) to gain the trust of teams (here called “Squads”) he is working with.

Main goal of the Agent is to achieve highest level of trusts with squads while improving skills and tools that help also to face common wrong behaviours happening in squads. Time is the “money” of the game: player is often in the position not to have enough time to gain skills and tools, time to spend in actions, or time to achieve results, because the game ends in 12 rounds.

Agile Sys, has been designed in lockdown time for one player, however you can merge 2 or more decks and play the game with other Agents. This configuration is ideal to understand scaling in large organisation where different coaches are working together in the same program or business function.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Points, Action Queue, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Closed Drafting, Contracts, Deck Construction, Market, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: The House and Temple Of The Flying Blades: 1st Dan Expansion
description:
Ninja techniques have improved since the last skirmish. Now the dojos can use a new set of stealth movements and also a new weapon.

Also the House now has a few columns were the ninjas can hide behind.

This expansion works for any number of players (2-5).

-description from publisher

name: Spot On
description:
Spot On requires a selection of cards from two standard decks: 3 black cards of each value from 3-9 and 12 red court cards. Players also each need a pawn and 12 counters in their color; one side of each counter needs to be marked with a spot.

The cards are shuffled and laid face-up in a 6x6 grid. On a turn a player places their pawn next to a row or column and rolls the die. They count that many cards from the pawn and place a counter on it, spot up, placing on top of an opposing counter if necessary. If necessary the count wraps around to the start of the row/column.

The player may then roll again and place another counter. This continues until they decide to stop or they roll a card which they already have a counter on (from this or a previous turn). In the latter case all the counters they placed this turn are removed. Otherwise they flip over their just-placed counters, remove any opposing counters from these cards, and take any of these cards that are courts. If they have counters on all three black cards of a given number they take those as well.

The game ends when all court cards have been taken. Each set of black cards is worth the cards' number. Each court is a point unless a player has seven or more, which is worth 12 points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Distrix
description:
Distrix is an award-winning game of skill in which two players, Red and Blue, battle to control a 6x6 region called The Matrix. The number in each square of the matrix equals power, and Red and Blue are equally powerful. During the game, players use colored tokens to group the squares into 9 districts, one square at a time. The tokens are not player specific; all tokens are available to both players. As districts are formed, power is unevenly allocated. Red controls some districts, and Blue controls others. The game ends when one token occupies each square and no legal moves remain. Whoever controls more districts is the winner.

The idea is simple, but game play is incredibly challenging. You and your opponent are equally powerful at all times, so victory is achieved by winning many districts by narrow margins and losing few districts by large margins. This is how election districts are rigged, or gerrymandered, in the real world. But, in Distrix, an opponent responds to your every move. Each district is a tug-of-war that you want to win narrowly or lose by a lot. But be careful...you may accidentally win it by too much or barely lose it! Nine districts are in play, so there's a lot to keep your eye on. Spatial awareness is critical because the shape of one district affects another. And there's a special rule that can be highly disruptive at the end: squares may be transferred from large districts to adjacent smaller ones. Overall, it's a stunningly pure battle for power that combines basic arithmetic, spatial awareness, and expert move timing. All games are closely contested, and endgame surprises are remarkably common.

Distrix is for 2 players ages 14 and up and takes 30-60 minutes to play. Each game set includes 36 tiles, 9 home base tokens, 99 expansion tokens, 9 scoring tokens, a scoreboard, a rulebook, and a rule summary sheet.

Distrix introduces a game-based framework for dividing any region into a given number of districts of nearly equal area, one sector at a time. The same framework can be used to form election districts of nearly equal population within US states. Thus, the game offers a potential solution to America's gerrymandering problem. Instead of one political party rigging new election districts to its advantage, multiple political parties could form new election districts in a high-stakes game, one voting precinct (or county, census block, etc.) at a time.

Distrix won the Best New Abstract Game Judges Award at the 2021 UK Games Expo and a silver medal in the 2020 Serious Play Tabletop Game Competition.

The game box, components, rules, and theme were updated in 2022 to enhance player enjoyment.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Number, Political, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Space Travel Dice
description:
“Space Travel Dice: The storytelling game with nine wooden dice.”

“Revive the art of storytelling using these nine illustrated wooden dice to create intergalactic adventures. Includes superhuman powers that will make your heroes utterly invincible! Ideal for playing by a log fire, this game will stimulate the imaginations of children and adults alike.”

Rules:
Any number of players.
Roll all eight of the mainly black-sided dice. Begin telling a story based on the images you rolled. Save the the red-sided die for later rolling and use. Each of the eight mainly black-sided dice have one red ‘@‘ symbol. This allows you to roll the red die and get a super power based on what you roll. You can get multiple powers in a story and the build.

You can try telling the story in single die roll sequence or create the story collaboratively by taking turns rolling and adding to the story.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Party Game, Word Game

name: Campaign Trail: That Geek from the Media
description:
This promo candidate card was made available as part of the Game Boy Geek's 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

It has the following positive and negative special ability:

Place 1 voter from the undecided supply into the state in which you end your turn.

Use an undecided voter token on the track below. At the end of each of your turns move the token to the first action you took on that turn. You may not take this action as the first action on your next turn.
publishers: Cosmic Wombat Games, Grey Fox Games

name: Soccer Brain
description:
Soccer Brain
An outstanding new family game designed to improve a variety of Thinking Skills.
The game begins with a 'cup draw' of eight teams who round by round play the quarter finals, semi-finals and final. With five minutes per half, each player moves across the board, tackling various football-related thinking challenges as they go. There are four kinds of challenge

memory test,
visual perception,
lateral thinking and
Conundrums


If you're lucky, you'll win a penalty and have the chance to 'score from the spot'.
Great fun in a game that really will improve thinking skills!

name: Xing
description:
Master the laws of nature by controlling the elements! Teleport into the astral dimension and choose to control Huo (fire), Shui (water) or Tu (earth). Use your special powers to atomise or fuse your element and create the perfect sequence of five. The winner restores balance to our chaotic universe. So, Spin away and Wu Xing!

Xing is a game of strategy and balance where players are the masters of a single element. They must use the language of the universe - Math - to tactically position their elements in a sequence and gain victory over others. Spin, pick a card and solve the question to find your position(s) on the board. Place your element token using strategy and planning. Master basic concepts of factors and multiples and gain critical thinking skills in this epic battle of minds!

In Xing, players master the laws of nature by controlling the elements - Huo, Shui and Tu. Each player picks one element and collects 14 tokens of that element. The game board and action spinner are placed in the centre.
Shuffle the fuse and atomise card decks separately and place them beside the game board.
On your turn, spin the action spinner.
If you get Fuse, pick the top card from the fuse deck.
If you get Atomise pick the top card from the atomise deck and,
If you get Pick Any, pick the top card from any deck.
After you pick a card, read what is said and solve it. then choose where you want to place one of your element tokens
For example, if the card reads, ‘multiple of 4 between 35 to 55’, then you can place your token on 36, 40, 44 or 48.

Remember, you can place only one of your element tokens per turn
You must place the element based on the solution of the card you picked.
If the card has more than one solution, pick one of them and place your token there
If a location already has a token then you cannot place another
If you cannot place your token on the game board, you pass your turn

In each deck, there are 2 Wu (the spiral symbol) cards and 2 remove cards. These are special cards.
The Wu card allows you to place one token on the wu symbol on the board. The ‘remove’ card allows you to remove one token of an opponent from the board. when a token is removed it goes back to that player. Once all your element tokens have been used, then you can move them around on the board. just take it from one spot and place it on another, as per the card you pick. Remember, you can place an element token to create your sequence or block an opponent. choose your strategy! The first player to create a line of five of their own element tokens, wins the game. This could be horizontal, vertical or diagonal. Xing can also be played with 6 players split into 3 teams of 2.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Map Reduction, Pattern Building, Take That

name: Reavers of Midgard: Mara Promo Cards
description:
A set of 3 Promotional cards offered by the "Man Vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter".

Mara is a Sea Witch that can be battled in the Sea Battles section of the board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Follow, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Myth: World of Myth
description:
This Kickstarter release for MYTH contains three items

1) The World of Myth Lore Book
The World of Myth is based on the highly sought-after Myth Limited Edition book. It shares the same high-quality leather binding and gilded pages, as well as much of the exceptional art and lore from the original. However, it also includes dozens of pages of brand-new content!

2) Heirloom Pack #1-3: 14 unique items, one for each Myth Hero class.

3) Monster Variant Card Pack #1-3: 6 monster variant cards

(2) and (3) were designed to work with previous Myth releases as well as with the upcoming Myth: Dawn of Heroes release.

PDF versions were released on www.drivethrurpg.com
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Oak Warriors
description:
Oak Warriors

These rules enable fast play games set in the Age of Sail.
Optional rules are included to cover early steam ships.
These rules can be used with any models.
The required templates are available as a separate free download.
The rules provide an engaging and interactive game with the correct period feel.
The system enables players to interrupt their opponent's actions so both players are fully engaged for the whole turn.


For a game of a few squadrons a typical dining room table will be sufficient (roughly 5ft x 3ft). For bigger fleet games, a table of 6ft x 4ft is recommended.
Standard D6 dice are used and a ruler with inches is required.
You will also need models and terrain to represent the scenario you wish to play.

Movement is managed through a system of signals passed at two distinct levels within the game. The top level is the Fleet Commander's. Below that is the level for Squadron Commanders. Ships are allocated several signals; these can be influenced by higher level commands.
categories: Age of Reason, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Pirates, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Parable Parade
description:
In this exciting game, players must collect complete sets of Parable Cards. You can draw as many cards as you like, but be careful. Draw an Oopsie! Card and you will pay the price! Will you be bold and fearless? Or will you be conservative and cautious?

Jesus was a masterful storyteller. Using common objects like sheep and seeds, Jesus told short but powerful parables to help His audience grasp important spiritual truths. This game features 12 of Jesus’ parables.

The objective of the game is to form complete sets of Parable Cards. Each set comprises 4 cards of the same parable and is identified by a colored title bar on the top-left of the cards. The first player to form 2 complete sets of Parable Cards wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: タングルウィード (Tangleweed)
description:
The game name pronunciation in Japanese is タングルウィード (Tangleweed) which translates into Tumbleweed. (The publisher gives the full title as タングルウィード～緑をかけぬけうまれる種～ (Tanguruuido-midori wo kakenuke umarerutane-) meaning Tangleweed - the seed that runs through the greenery -).

Welcome to the West. As a tumbleweed farmer you want to become rich by growing your tumbleweed. Roll the tumbleweed down the land, and let it grow. Gain more money so you can buy more land.

At the end of the 7th round, the farmer who earns the most with the tumbleweed seeds through the final market price of the tumbleweed is the winner.

This is a engine-building game to grow the weeds that you often see tumbling in the wind in Western films. In the world where Western films are all the rage, there is a surge in demand for tumbleweeds!

You have started a new career as tumbleweed farmers. Grow and sell tumbleweeds to make a fortune! Read the wind and make the weeds tumble as they drop seeds on their path! Make use of the help effectively to grow rich!

The players lay tiles to expand their farmlands. The tumbleweeds (felt balls) tumble on the farmlands and drop seeds on their path. As the game proceeds over a number of rounds, the seeds grow into new tumbleweeds.

西部劇でよく見る転がる雑草を育てる、転がる拡大再生産！
ここは西部劇が大流行した世界で需要が急増したのは、タンブルウィードだった！
あなたはタングルウィード農家に転身した。
タングルウィードを繁殖させ、売ってお金を稼ごう！
風を読み、雑草を転がそう！ タンブルウィードは通り道に種を落とす！
助っ人の力を巧みに使い、大金持ちを目指そう！

プレイヤーはタイルを繋げ、農地を広げます。
その上をタンブルウィード（フェルトボール）が転がり、タネを落とします。
タネはラウンドが進むと成長し、新たなタンブルウィードになります。
categories: American West, Economic, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Market, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Muse: Game Boy Geek Season 8 Kickstarter Promo Card
description:
Available from the Game Boy Geek Season 8 2020 Kickstarter.

New art card to mix in with the base game. Has no special ability.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Los Amos del Horizonte
description:
It is a system that simulates the fighting between galleys in the 16th-17th centuries and which pitted various Christian powers against the Ottoman Empire and its tributaries of the Maghreb.

This game was included in the Alea 35 magazine Italia 44.

Fun and simple game, designed for two or more players, to easily represent these exciting naval battles.

Age: 12+
Player: 2-4
Time: 60+

name: Klingon Armada: Unity Edition
description:
The Klingons are coming and they are loaded for bear!

A meeting of empires as a famous game system joins the Star Fleet Universe. Klingon Armada was done as a joint venture between Amarillo Design Bureau and Majestic Twelve Games. This 86-page rulebook includes the Essential Starmada Rules, 46 starships (Klingon, Federation, Tholian, Orion, Kzinti), and complete rules to bring the Star Fleet Universe alive in the Starmada game system.

This fast-playing game easily handles squadrons of ships as they encounter their enemies and battle to see who is indeed the best commander.

Ships included are the Federation dreadnought, battlecruiser, heavy cruiser, old light cruiser, command cruiser, and frigate; the Klingon C8 dreadnought, C7 heavy battlecruiser, D7 battlecruiser, D6 heavy cruiser, D5 war cruiser, F5 frigate, and D7C command cruiser; Kzinti dreadnought, battlecruiser, and frigate; Tholian patrol corvette, Orion Raider, and many other ships. (There are a total of 46 ships.)

This book is complete and ready to play.

This edition unifies the previous Nova and Admiralty editions, so there will no longer be Starmada fans who cannot game together. The new rules preserve the best of both previous systems, and add dynamic seeking weapons rules that do what seeking weapons are supposed to do: force the enemy to move out of key areas or shoot his way through a swarm of drones.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Majestic Twelve Games

name: Master Entretenimento
description:
The "Master Entretenimento" covers 1,955 questions divided into 5 topics that will challenge everyone in this fun contest!

Before each answer, the player must bet the amount of points he wants to walk on the board, if he gets it right.

In some moments, the players will be able to choose the theme that most appeals to them and thus have greater chances of shooting towards victory.

In the end, whoever correctly answers a question chosen by the other players wins. So having a good sense of all the themes will make all the difference.
Ready for this duel of knowledge?

5 themes:

TV & Series
Songs
Movies
Games & Games
MIX

name: トポロメモリー２ (Topolomemory 2)
description:
トポロメモリー２ (Topolomemory 2) is a stand-alone expansion to トポロメモリー (TOPOLOMEMORY). It follows the same gameplay but introduces more complexity to the shapes. The game also has an improved quality cardstock. It can be played alone, or mixed in with Topolomemory, and/or Topolomemory 3.

トポロメモリー (TOPOLOMEMORY) is a Japanese card game based on the traditional matching game Karuta.

Topolomemory is a concentration game in which you have to match shapes using the principles of Topology. In it's basic form, topology shows us that a doughnut is the same as a coffee mug.

Lay out the tiles with various images on them and whoever most quickly identifies pairs that match topologically gets to collect the pair. The player with the most pairs wins the game. The game game be played by more than five players, especially in teams.
User summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Party Game
publishers: Banso Inc. (株式会社バンソウ)

name: Ancient Warfare Army Lists suitable for Fast Play Rules & Big Battles
description:
"The Army Lists in this booklet have primarily been compiled for use with the Fast Play Ancient Warfare Rules published by Newbury Rules. They may also be used in conjunction with other rules including our own 'Warfare in the Ancient World', though some amendment of the troop descriptions and figure points values will be required. The novel format of the Lists is designed to enable the player to devise his model army quickly and simply whilst ensuring a realistic balance of the component troop types, this is of course in keeping with the concept of the Fast Play Rules themselves." - Ancient Warfare Army Lists suitable for Fast Play Rules & Big Battles, R. G. Boss & T. J. Halsall, Newbury Rules, 1985, p.1

Additional section (pages 35-36) on converting these lists for other rules, in particular WRG War Games Rules 3000 BC to 1485 AD, 6th Edition.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: カルマノルマ (Karman Norm)
description:
The explosive population growth of human beings in modern times was caused by "insufficient extinguishing of the light of life" by the young Grim Reapers who still have to learn.
Again today, young Grim Reapers go out in the city in search of the "lights of life".

The players become Grim Reapers and want to blow the lights out of as many people as possible.
The game is played over a Day and Night phase. In the day phase the players try to collect as many matches (people) as possible and in the night phase the matches need to be blown out in order to score points.

In turn order each player plays a card from their hand and whoever played the highest card can go first and put down the card at any of the available locations. Then, the players check who has the majority in card values on each location and get matches or blow out matches according to what is printed on the location card.

At the end of the game blown out matches are worth 1 point, burning matches are worth -1 point. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Fury Hardball: Expansion 2
description:
Your Fury Hardball league is growing! Expansion 2 offers 18 new teams.

Teams included in Expansion Bundle 2:

Dallas-Fort Worth

Denver

Havana

Houston

Kansas City

Los Angeles (Red)

Mexico City

Miami

Milwaukee

Minneapolis-St. Paul

Montreal

New York (Orange)

Phoenix

San Diego

Seattle

Tampa

Tokyo

Toronto
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fury Football: Expansion Bundle
description:
Expand your Fury Football league with TWENTY additional teams!

Teams included in this bundle:

Minnesota Chill

Seattle Droids

San Francisco Heroes

Cleveland Stevedores

Vegas Bada Bings

Miami Maelstrom

Pacific Dreadnoughts

Phoenix Inferno

New Orleans Big Fun

Chicago Binge

Boston Malcontents

Denver Wild Blue

Dallas TNT

Gulf Coast Splash

Kansas City Drifters

Atlanta Gems

Milwaukee Buzz

Washington Panic

Philadelphia Mongrels

Nashville Twang

name: TWINS: Variety Cards
description: Instead of playing each round with the same payment scheme, use these seven cards and use them as a face down deck to draw a new payment scheme for each new round.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Aye Sea You!
description:
The game pits one visually impaired Captain against his mutinous Crew. The Crew try to exchange Treasure Cards, but if the Captain sees them, he blasts them full of lead at point blank range. If each Crewmember (living and dead) simultaneously reveals a complete set of 4 identical Treasure Cards, the Crew wins! If they fail to do so within 5 minutes (or if they're all dead), the Captain wins!

The game functions differently for 2-4 players than it does for 5-8 players, but the general theme of secretly moving Treasure Cards while the Captain is looking somewhere else is omnipresent.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Houston, We Have a Dolphin!: Cyborg Heroes
description:
After our heroes have bravely sacrificed themselves to decouple the ship modules and avert a dolphin catastrophe... - THEY RETURN.

But there's something odd about them...

Each hero gains a special ability to use after opening a module. While Doctor Sam now revives lost astronauts, Trainer Judy suddenly seems to fight on the dolphins side, disturbing the repairing of the ship.

Discover the enhanced CYBORG heroes, choose between their new abilities and give your game the extra strategy kick!

Includes 5 extra heroes and a new captain.

This is an expansion for the base game game Houston, we have a Dolphin! (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/301317/houston-we-have-d...)
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Science Fiction
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hidden Movement, Voting

name: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic – Dark Keep Supplement
description:
Exploring the dark and foreboding Keep that has been abandoned for countless years, you push through the Sinking Marshlands to descend into the catacombs and crypts in search of The Lost Tomb... and the vital clues it may hold! But, there are many dangers to face in the deep places of the world, and the Flickering Light of your Crypt Lantern threatens to leave you in the dark.

This 15 card Game Supplement for the Dark Gothic Deck Building Game is themed for the Abandoned Keep outside of Shadowbrook and adds new Gear, Allies, Minions, and more, some utilizing the new Roaming mechanic first introduced in the Colonial Horror Expansion. Explore the Dark Keep, but beware the ghosts and vampires that roam its shadowed halls.

-description from the publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Heroes of Baseball
description: 'Heroes of Baseball is a 2-player baseball card game that replicates the real-life game decisions of a baseball manager. The game consists of randomly-generated fictional players, and operates on a d100 (percentile) system.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Dothraki Veterans
description:
The most skilled warriors in the Khalasar.

A Dothraki is effectively born in the saddle. From the earliest age, they learn to ride, becoming the greatest horsemen in the land. After many battles, these horsemen have honed their skills to perfection. Their mastery of swordsmanship, archery, and riding is surpassed by none. In combat, they are a triple threat of strength, speed, and range.

The Dothraki Veterans unit box gives House Targaryen players a multi-faceted new threat to add to their armies. These warriors have trained their abilities to the max, able to perform attacks at range and in close combat. When attacking with their shortbows, they can follow it up with a devastating charge. However, the Dothraki eschew heavy armor, so a good commander will make sure the Veterans are in and out of combat before an enemy has a chance for a retaliatory strike.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Conclave Editora, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series II – Scenario 07: Master the Trials
description:
Master the Trials is a scenario in the Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. The game consists of just 3 cards and players will provide their own dice and coins/tokens. Each scenario comes with 2 all-new characters and can be interchanged with others for a very different gaming experience.


This scenario has been released separately as part of the September 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package and Print & Play, and then included in Twin Stars: Adventure Series II.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Tomb Looters: Live!
description:
In a near-future, slightly magicified version of our world, you've been selected as one of the contestants in a new livecast reality show. You’ll compete against other treasure hunters to explore ancient tombs ripe for looting.

But to up the stakes, the producers have rigged a series of demolition charges and given some control of them to the contestants. Time is running out, and no one knows when the roof might cave in. Will you thwart your opponents and make it out with the most treasure ... or get trapped under a heap of dusty rubble?

With just a pencil, a print-and-play game sheet, and 2d6 for each player, you can play in person or over a video call.

The game plays in phases, and players play out each phase in the dark catacombs simultaneously and secretly, keeping their progress hidden. They move around the catacombs and roll their dice to unearth treasure, all while trying to avoid (or confront) their opponents. Looted treasures are kept secret, but after each phase players announce their positions and collapsed spaces on the map.

With your trusty GLM™ helping stow your treasures, you just might be able to snag the most loot. Oh, and getting out alive would also be nice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Oriental Chess
description: In this abstract strategy game, each player has 8 identical pieces. They move like rooks, but can't jump over any pieces or land on pieces. Instead, you can capture opponent's pieces either by inclusion of a string or by connecting two strings on a line. You win if you reduce your opponent to at most one piece, unless they can reduce you to at most one piece in their very next turn.

name: Pentaquark: Colliders (BGotMC edition)
description:
This is the first post-campaign content for Pentaquark and we have a few more colliders, which generally will help you along the way, but not always (MoEDAL is a neat exception). MoEDAL, CMS and TOTEM join ALICE, ATLAS and LHCb in our collection of player aids.

—description from the publisher


Colliders is a 3-card micro-expansion for Pentaquark that brings a new level of complexity to the game. One of three condition cards are drawn the beginning of the game to aid you in your efforts.


This entry is for the Board Game of the Month Club edition from June 2017 package, which contains CMS, MoEDAL and TOTEM Colliders.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Roberto Chiavini's Horse Racing
description:
Roberto's take on the Sport of Kings - Horse Racing - is a simple, statistically based sports simulation allowing gamers to replay historical Flat, Jump, Steeplechase, and Harness races from 1900 into the 21st century.

Horses are classes A through H and may also have a set of asterisks indicating their chances of winning close races.

The races are run over a number of steps (usually 6 or 10), and each step consists of a dice roll cross referenced to a set of charts which indicate how each horse fares against the pack. Additional rolls are required to determine accidents, and close races lead to an additional "photo finish" step.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fallen knight
description:
Fallen Knight is a 1-4 player cooperative dungeon crawler board game.
Theme, art, and mechanics are deeply connected, and the main character's unique ability is absorbing the memories of others. You can read (relive) people's stories , record their abilities, and find out enemy weaknesses.

The gameplay is focused on strategic, ability based combat and exploring. Each ability belongs to a particular weapon master and class, with specific actions. This gives you a wide range of opportunities to create a character with the desired synergy. Part of our game art is shown in a comic book called the Memory Book. It charters the history of important characters in an uncensored,,18+ comic book format.

Gameplay
If you take our game monsters and bosses lightly, you are likely to get killed mercilessly. Exploit their weaknesses as this will help you win. At the beginning of the game, each player names their Knight and chooses 5 starting abilities. Before entering battle, select 3 of the 5 ability cards and utilize them to transform your Damned Sword. With up to 20+ sub-action cards, you can flexibly tailor your attacks to deal with your immediate foes!. Explore our dark fantasy world and encounter different types of enemies, each with different behaviors. Killing monsters grants you the game's currency, Karma. Karma can be used to record abilities, purchase items, and level up characters. Leveling up your characters gives them more capacity to record abilities and creates more synergies with your ability cards.

Plot
Fallen Knights were created by the Gods to acquire and relive lost memories, though the Gods decided where they went and what they did. The lost memories recovered by the Fallen Knights never lasted long since every time they returned them to the Gods, they were reborn with no memories. This was a never-ending nightmare, a hellish cycle with no escape..
Now, the Gods are gone, the curse is broken, and every memory is available to Fallen Knights.. However, the memories are vague and unclear - like bad dreams - so it’s time to set out. Fallen Knights must forge their own path!

What about the Damned Sword of Fallen Knights?
If the corpse of a vanquished foe contains blood and flesh, the Damned Sword can be used directly to read memories. If the foe is long dead, and only the skeleton remains, then a sacred fire is required to harvest memories. Further still, players can use various abilities to turn their Damned Sword into weapons such as a bow, dagger, and even a Great Sword!

—description from the designer

name: We Have a Problem, Mr. President: Historical Expansion
description:
This product is an expansion to “We Have a Problem, Mr. President…” The base game is sold separately.

Journey back to the past to tackle memorable moments of crisis with the Historical Expansion for “We Have A Problem, Mr. President…” the National Emergency Game. Whether you find yourself guiding the nation through the aftermath of Pearl Harbor, negotiating and problem-solving through the Arab Oil Embargo, or deescalating the tensions of the Cuban Missile Crisis, these new and unique decks will test your skills as the advisor to the president. Clear them and protect your nation’s history!

name: Killer Party: Fangs for the Memories
description:
It's opening night at The Coffin Door, the nightclub run by celebrity vampire Vlad Fanger. Vlad is the vampire all the other vampires want to be and mortal wannabes wannabe bitten by. But his body was just discovered in the VIP section. Now He's not the Undead, he's just dead.

Killer Party is a series of Social Mystery Party Games for adults. Do crazy stunts and challenges to earn clues. Get points for scratching off the right answers. Score the most points to solve the murder.

Includes: 3 killer envelopes with introduction sheets, 12 clue cards, 12 scratch-off investigation cards, 1 killer conclusion envelope.

name: NATO, Nukes & Nazis: The Lutwaffe Strikes!
description:
"NATO, Nukes & Nazis: The Lutwaffe Strikes!", published by XTR inside the issue #10 of his "Command" wargaming magazine, is an expansion for the alternative-history simulation wargame "NATO, Nukes & Nazis".

In this variant the German economy of the "NNN" world did better during the 1980's than what was first postulated in the original wargame: this resulted in greatly increased production of tactical aircraft types, which in turn will dramatically increase the German offensive potential making it, in some ways, similar to that employed in the 1940 BlitzKrieg against Holland, Belgium and France.

13 new Nazis' counters:
- 9 Tac Air
- 4 Helicopters
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points

name: The Drowned and the Damned
description:
Set in the same universe as the skirmish game Pirates of the Dread Sea, this game pits squadrons of warships belonging to different fantasy races against one another.

There's a dedicated line of 1:600 models, initially dwarves and elves, with more to come.

name: Cheeseboard Deluxe
description:
There’s no appetizer so mouth-watering as a good cheeseboard. There’s a pleasure to timeless foods—meat, cheeses, fruits and grains—spread out like a savory work of art. These morsels combine in endless ways—do you want cheese and crackers? Crackers and meat? Cheese and fruit? Do you want to stack one of everything into a giant charcuterie sandwich?

But the real question is: can you make a good cheeseboard? The party is barely an hour from now! You have the ingredients, but they still need to be cut and served. It’s time to find out if you’ve got the chops to make a cheeseboard deluxe.

Cheeseboard Deluxe is a solitaire roll-and-write for one player, originally developed for the 2020 Solitaire Print-and-Play Contest. Your goal is to build a jam-packed cheeseboard, leaving as few empty spaces as possible at the end of the game.

Each round, you draw shapes representing food onto each of your cutting boards. When you can’t draw another shape onto a cutting board, that board is done, and when every board is done, the number of empty spaces remaining becomes your score. The more spaces you manage to fill in, the lower your score—and the better!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Necromantic Horror Team Card Pack
description:
