Redesigned with the Second Season ruleset in mind, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Necromantic Horror teams.

CONTENTS
– 5 Player reference cards for Zombie Linemen, Ghoul Runners, Wraiths, Flesh Golems, and Werewolves
– 3 Star Player cards for Frank ’n’ Stein, Wilhelm Chaney, and Bryce ‘The Slice’ Cambuel
– 8 Random Event Special Play cards
– 8 Magical Memorabilia Special Play cards
– 19 Blank Player cards: 11 Zombie Linemen, 2 Ghoul Runners, 2 Wraiths, 2 Flesh Golems, and 2 Werewolves
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

You’ll need a copy of Blood Bowl: The Official Rules and Spike! Journal 11 to make full use of these cards.

name: Lost Worlds: Lizard Man With Scimitar and Buckler
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Emithill Ltd., Nova Game Designs, SoftBank Corp.

name: Simulator
description:
The game for tacticians.

Simulator is a driving trainer for 1 to 4 players. The aim of the game is to find the ideal line on one of the four possible routes through skilful steering and choosing the right speed, i.e. to be the fastest on the course. The players can use their pieces to perform acceleration, braking and steering maneuvers. The schedule grid and the rotation of the schedule by 90 ° each result in 16 different route variants.

name: La Bataille de Belle-Alliance
description: New maps and scenarios for "La Bataille der Ligny" and "La Bataile de Quatre-Bras".

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Aircraft and Aces – T'au Air Caste Cards
description:
Keep track of all the new aircraft, high-tech upgrades, weapon options, ground defenses and ace pilots with the Aircraft and Aces – T’au Air Caste Cards.

This pack contains the following cards:

- 26 T’au Aircraft cards that are ideal references for use in-game for your Barracuda AX-5-2, Barracuda AX-5-3, Barracuda AX-5-4, Tiger Shark AX-1-0-2, Tiger Shark AX-1-0-3, Tiger Shark AX-1-0-4, Tiger Shark AX-1-0 and Remora Drone aircraft. Also includes the Red Horizon and Dawn Sword named aircraft.
- 18 Aircraft Upgrade cards (including Decoy Drones, Defensive Drones, Infra-red Targeting, Armoured Cockpit and Ionic Afterburners)
- 28 Aircraft Weapon cards (including Cyclic Ion Blaster Drones, Long-Barreled Burst Cannon Drones and Seeker Missile Bays)
- 6 Ground Defences cards (including Skyfire Platform and Stormfury Platform)
- 8 T’au Aces cards, including Dor’n O’ka, Kae O’ar and 6 T’au Ace Ability cards

You’ll need a copy of the Aeronautica lmperialis: Skies of Fire boxed set or the Taros Air War Campaign book to use the contents of this card pack.

name: Rail Raiders Infinite: El Cola
description:
Rob the rails with this all new Raider! No one knows where this mysteriously furry swashbuckling hero comes from, but everyone across the space rails knows not to get in his way - unless they want to suffer a flurry of blindingly quick rapier slashes!

Contents:
1 El Cola Assembled Model
1 El Cola Card
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Trains
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: War Patrol
description:
War Patrol is a 2-player fantasy battle game. Each player creates a squad of 5 warriors from a selection of 50, then squares off against the enemy in a furious close-combat fight.

After each player deploys their warriors, the members of each squad are revealed and the battle begins. Each warrior has a unique ability, realm traits, and a racial restriction. Players alternate turns with one warrior acting at a time based upon the order determined in their deployment. A warrior can use their turn to attack the enemy squad by rolling a d10 and allocating damage (called a Standard Attack) or by using their warrior ability or realm ability as an alternate way to deliver damage or otherwise alter the flow of battle.

While many warriors have offensive abilities, many others have defensive, retaliatory, healing, summoning, or a wide variety of other abilities. The interactions and synergies of the warriors each player selects for their squads will have a major impact on the battle. The first player to reduce all enemy warriors to zero health wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Nihilus – Vigilus Ablaze
description:
War continues to ravage the sentinel world of Vigilus, yet the fighting is about to escalate to a whole new level. The dreaded Warmaster himself, Abaddon the Despoiler, has arrived at the head of a vast Chaos fleet. Even the tactical genius of Marneus Calgar will be tested to its limits if he is to ensure the planet’s survival, for the Black Legion have consigned worlds beyond counting to slavery and death.

Imperium Nihilus: Vigilus Ablaze is packed with exciting background and new rules that enable you to refight the exciting events described in the book. Here’s what you will find inside:

- Background of the War of Nightmares – the thrilling final stage of the war on Vigilus – leading up to its epic climax of as one of the Imperium’s greatest champions faces its most terrible foe in personal combat
- Detailed accounts of the major events and battles that took place across Vigilus as the Warmaster’s forces sought to bring the world to its knees, including campaign deployment maps and details of key environmental features
- Details of the various armies that fought in this campaign, including descriptions of key actions, illustrations of major figures, regimental breakdown of battlegroups, heraldries, and deployment maps
- Campaign rules allowing you to bring the narrative of this book to life on your tabletop
- Guidance on organising and running a Vigilus campaign, including an extra layer of rules specific to the narrative: a Nihilus Events table and 12 narrative play missions (6 Crucible of War, 6 Echoes of War), as well as additional special rules and Stratagems based on the events of the War of Nightmares
- Six exciting battlezones to use in your games of Warhammer 40,000, each offering new tactical challenges and rules to represent varied battlefield environments, including rules for fighting battles aboard spaceships, amid raging infernos and more besides
- New and updated datasheets for 12 Daemon and Chaos Space Marine units (including Abaddon the Despoiler, as well as the Noctilith Crown and Skull Altar scenery pieces), 6 Prayers to the Dark Gods for use by models with the Priest keyword (and an additional Prayer for each of the four Chaos Powers), army abilities common to many of the Chaos units, as well as weapon profiles and points values
- Eight Specialist Detachments, each including Warlord Traits, Relics, and Stratagems unique to each Detachment
- Rules for the Black Legion, including eight bespoke Stratagems as well as six Relics, Warlord Traits, and Tactical Objectives unique to Abaddon’s traitor Legion
- Rules for Renegade Space Marine Chapters that have thrown in their lot with the Warmaster, including eight bespoke Stratagems as well as six Relics, Warlord Traits, and Tactical Objectives
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Spitfire Ace: Air Defence Over Britain, 1940
description:
Spitfire Ace: Daylight Air Defense Over Britain: 1940 is a solitaire, tactical level game which places you in command of a Royal Air Force fighter during the Battle of Britain. Each turn consists of a sortie in which a contact interception mission will be flown from one of many bases in South-East England, attempting to destroy incoming German. Spitfire Ace is based on the popular, action-packed Nightfighter Ace / Interceptor Ace game system by Gregory M. Smith with a strong narrative around the pilot as you look to increase your prestige, earn skills, and rise in rank through promotion (if an officer) and receive awards.

The objective of the game is to conduct numerous sorties in the role of an R.A.F. fighter pilot and rack up kills. Pilots may use the experience gained to improve their odds of success by purchasing skills. As their prestige increases, they may pull strings to arrange a transfer to other fighter bases in an attempt to get "closer to the action" or use their influence to adopt more effective tactics. Awards and ace status help to narrate the player's eventual goal – to become the bomber killer of the Battle of Britain.

Where many air combat games focus on accumulating hardware, the emphasis in this game is on developing the skills and tactics that will enable you to (a) survive and (b) shoot down enemy aircraft. Your approach in the game is characterized by various skill and benefits including Pilot skills, Wingman skills, tactical changes, and Prestige Level.

Game play moves quickly, following a set sequence of events that are repeated until the end of the game. Once you have your initial pilot, squadron and aircraft type, play proceeds by checking for incoming raid information. Play proceeds by flying to the area you expect to intercept the German raiders. As location boxes are entered, you will roll for possible intercept in which combat may ensue. Combat may consist of numerous rounds after which returning to base and landing operations occurs, with the possibility that your airfield may have been bombed while you were engaging the enemy. When the mission is completed, you will ascertain any awards, Prestige points, or Experience points gained prior to you next sortie. Here you can also spend Prestige and Experience points if desired to gain skills, request a change of tactics, or request a change of base. You will repeat this process by going to your next sortie until shot down and killed, or until end of October 1940 should you make it through unscathed.

Product Information:

Complexity: Medium
Time Scale: 3-4 days per turn
Map Scale: abstract
Unit Scale: individual aircraft, weapon systems, crew members, ammo rounds
Players: 1 (with option for 2 or more)
Solitaire: High
Playing Time: 2-3 hours

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Het Deventer Spel
description: You will make an exciting and informative stroll, by rolling dice to move, through Deventer where you ultimately have to collect three eagles. By answering questions, collecting properties and some luck you can earn enough money to buy the three eagles. Which player will win the game after several strolls through Deventer and deliver the three eagles at the missionary of the Lebuïnus Church?

name: Speedstream
description:
In Speedstream, up to six pilots compete in their superfast vehicles on a hi-tech track.

The main goal is, as always, to be first, but in Speedstream being first is not an easy task, but can be achieved by any means necessary. Staying first is even harder.

Players have full control over their vehicles starting from statistics to behavior on track. You can go slow and safe and never roll a dice, or push your luck and attack aggressively, and put your fate on a dice roll.

Take corners fast and risk losing control over speeder! Push your opponents on track wall, to slow them down or even destroy. Fight your way to the first place using extra equipment for your vehicle like shields, tractor beams, EMP discharges, or even seeking missiles. All means necessary allowed!

Each player pilots one speeder, steering it through obstacles, blocking other players, and collecting boosts. Speeders are customizable, and during the progress of the game they get upgrades, and the player decides how to tune the vehicle. Board is modular, allowing players to build unique tracks for each game.

There are also sponsors available, giving additional upgrades to your speeders. Lots of negative but fair play interaction between players, course-plotting, and risk-taking. Speeders can be damaged and even crashed, but even then you can still get to the end line first.

This is a downloadable product, to be printed and cut on an A3 format paper or cardboard sheet. It still needs additional elements like tokens, dice, and speeders models.

—description from the publisher’s website
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Warhammer 40,000: Crusade Mission Pack – Beyond the Veil
description:
This mission pack is a narrative play expansion for the Warhammer 40,000 Crusade campaign system.

Within, you’ll find the rules required to play games of Warhammer 40,000 set in the mysterious region of space known as the Pariah Nexus. This mission pack has been specifically designed for use in narrative play Crusade games, where your armies will find themselves beset by the unsettling effects that earned the Pariah Nexus its ominous name. But whilst there is great danger to be found here, for those who are successful, the rewards are well worth the risk.

Inside this 112-page mission pack you will find:

- Six new missions each for Combat Patrol, Incursion, Strike Force and Onslaught sized games
- A selection of new Battle Traits and Crusade Relics
- A swathe of gaming material, including a new Theatre of War and a glossary

The pack itself is presented in a full Canadian wiro ring-bound book for easy use and reference on the tabletop during games, and comes with an elastic closure.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Victory at Sea: HMS Dido
description:
The first WWII mission of Dido was the escort the carrier, Furious to West Africa in November 1940, before spending four months on convoy escort duty in the Atlantic. She then joined operations in the Mediterranean in 1941, assisting in the evacuation of British forces from Crete in May. Badly damaged in these efforts she spent the latter half of that year in the Brooklyn shipyard of New York.

She would return to service in the East Mediterranean, being a key component with only four British ships covering the area. She later served in the Western Mediterranean and supported the Normandy landings in 1944. Her final mission of WWII was to travel to Copenhagen to accept the surrender of the Kriegsmarine. Along the way, she fired the final naval shot of the war in Europe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Personal Space: The Commerce Moon
description:
The Commerce Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Commerce Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 12:00-1:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Squid Exchange
Local Cuisine: Inkydrink

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

Cloud Razzle
Dash Brookmoore
Octo Jigglebrook
Pearl Peirene
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Guadalcanal: Supply and combat
description:
In August 1942, the US Marine Corps suddenly landed on Guadalcanal Island in the Solomon Islands. The success or failure of supply by sea transportation was crucial.

For the first time in history, this game recreates Guadalcanal's land and water battles on the same map!
Both games can be played individually or can also be linked. In the land-sea game combined play, the naval battle determines the amount of supplies arriving on Guadalcanal and also the success or failure of land artillery. Artillery greatly influences the land battlefield.

Number of counters:

land: about 50 units + 50 markers
sea: 120


Map: 1 full size
Game period:

land: September-November 1942 (7 turns)
sea: 1 turn 5 minutes (6 to 16 turns


Unit size: 1 unit = 1 battalion or 1 ship
Map area: North coast of Guadalcanal Island and near the north
Play time: About 1 to 2 hours
Number of players: 2 people
Play time: 1-3 hours (depending on the scenario)

adapted from publisher's website

name: SS Panzer Division Kommandeur
description:
This is the second release of the popular "German Armored Division Commander" series.

The stage this time is the Western Front. The player is a SS Armored Division Commander and battles on the Western Front in 1944.
Can you lead the SS Armored Division and use the more powerful Tiger tanks to stop the overwhelming Allied invasion ?

In this series, there are four types of units: tanks, self-propelled artillery, infantry, and artillery. The appropriate tactics differ depending on when you can shoot.
In particular, the difference in flexibility between the rotating turret tanks and self-propelled artillery with a fixed barrel is simulated.
The battlefield will be greatly influenced by the timing and effect of its appearance.
The series "German Armored Division Commander" rules have been modified. For instance, the range of the anti-tank gun is 2 and effectiveness is increased. The operation plan is improved by distinguishing movement and deployment mode. The rating of weapons and the open top tanks are revised

Number of counters: 252 pieces
Map: 1 full size
Game period: 1-2 days (16 turns)
Unit size: 1 unit - 1 platoon-company
Game range: Operation area of ​​one armored division
Play time: About 5-8 hours
Number of players: 2 people

name: Personal Space: The Zoological Moon
description:
The Zoological Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Zoological Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 3:00-4:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Wild World Zoo
Local Cuisine: The Beast of Pizza

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

Dr. Agaz Morravel
Istra Zo Gluxan
Jol Varoneth
Tarra Mothrek
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Personal Space: The Theatrical Moon
description:
The Theatrical Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Theatrical Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 2:00-3:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Marga's Playhouse
Local Cuisine: To Brie Or Not To Brie

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

Deniz Bellax
Dorado Kuston
Leena Zyzum
Nadia Chindam
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Escape Game Spécial Famille: Attaque Viking au Puy du Fou
description:
A complete kit to organize successful escape game parties with the family.

You have one hour to escape from the village you have just looted and which is surrounded by your enemies!


—description from the publisher

Contents:
- A booklet with indications on the scenario, reminders of the rules and answers to puzzles and other games.
- 72 puzzle cards
- 10 envelopes to hide in the room

name: Micronations
description:
Players lead groups of kids in building micronations that will fight for economic and territorial supremacy of the neighborhood. The game takes place on a map made of hexagons. During the game players can have their kids build forts or work at headquarters to grow their economy and gain resources. Supply lines must be maintained to transfer this wealth. Each micronation can also print their own currency which they can use for trade or negotiations with other micronations. The value of this currency can be brought up or down for manipulative purposes. Other optional strategies involve combat or social infiltration to convert kids from other micronations. Aside from these challenges kids must avoid parents who randomly wander the map in attempts to make them go home. The player with the most stored resources at the end of the game is the winner.

—description from the designer

NOTE: The first edition of Micronations was named Neighborhood Conflict. It was known under that name in years 2011–2013.

Not to be confused with first edition of Tactical Friction, which was also named Neighborhood Conflict, but got renamed to Tactical Friction in 2008.
Not to be confused with Neighborhood Conflict.

name: Los Sitios de Zaragoza
description:
This strategy game from los sitios was published it in 1990 by the now defunct Ya newspaper.

The French player must destroy 2/3 of the pieces of the Spanish player or starve the defenders of Zaragoza.
The latter is achieved by keeping the city with its defenders completely under siege for five consecutive turns.
The Spanish win if they avoid the French player to win.

The city is completely besieged by the French when its counters completely surround the perimeter with their squares of influence for a full turn.

The game is played in 16 turns.

A turn consists of alternate movement and combat of the two sides.
The French player begins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Rory's Story Cubes: Doraemon
description:
Create new Doraemon stories with this 50th aniversary special edition.

2020年に原作50周年を迎えたドラえもんの『ローリーズストーリーキューブス』
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: No Quarter
description:
"You are captain of a well armed ship, caught in a broadside battle against an enemy vessel captained by your opponent. As you race forward, you fire at the other ship and bark orders at your crew!"

Each round you will secretly rearrange your weakest and strongest areas amongst 3 different zones of your ship. Then you will declare what part of your opponent's ship you are targeting and roll dice. Did you get a hit? They adjust the amount of damage downwards. Did you miss entirely, then you adjust downwards. If a section of a ship goes below 1, then the ship sinks.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Undead Outlaws and Undead Gunslinger Deluxe Enemy Pack – The Lost Marshals Enemy Record Sheet
description:
Available from the promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

This is an enemy record sheet representing The Lost Marshals.

name: Duello
description:
"In this tense game of give and take, you must know when to attack and when to guard. Boost your own score or steal from your opponent? Only one you is left standing in the end!"

This is a game of taking turns swapping locked dice to try and achieve the highest sum. It's actually clever in that it uses both a single die and your opponent's rolled dice as potential locking mechanisms.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Dungeon Dash!: A Hero Kids Dungeon Crawl Card Game
description:
Dungeon Dash! is a push-your-luck card game set in the world of the Hero Kids Fantasy Role-Playing Game. Each turn you can venture further into the dungeon in search of gold and magic items. Be careful, though, because traps and fierce monsters are in these dark tunnels too!

The print-and-play version of the game comes with rules, 77 dungeon cards, 12 character cards (with color art from the Hero Kids game) and 8 magic item cards. You’ll need to supply some six-sided dice and about 10-15 chips per player.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ANZAC Fleet
description:
ANZAC Fleet is based on the Victory Games (and now Compass Games) 'Fleet' series of modern naval warfare games.

This game focus is on modern naval operations in the Java Sea.

ANZAC Fleet features forces from the US, Australia, New Zealand, Indonesia, and others. This includes naval surface forces, submarine, and air forces.

name: Turducken
description:
A dastardly game of deception all in the name of a great dinner! Watch out for your fellow hunters and drive them into the rails as fast as you can so you can be the one feeding the family!

Turducken is a fast paced game that focuses on player interaction with a "take that" game style. The game is for 2-6 players that are 10+ years old and usually takes anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour to play. Winning the game is the name of the game, hunt and kill yourself a Turducken. One chicken, one duck, and one turkey is all you will need to win. Your chosen hunter has special abilities and you can gather and play action cards to help yourself or damage your opponents ability to hunt. A great family game with high replayability from multiple hunters to control and very dynamic game play from player interaction.

The rules are pretty simple, you can shoot at a bird (but make sure to name it first!), reload, draw /play action cards. You have a likelihood to hit that is different for each hunter that you have to roll above and each hunter has a special ability. Each hunter has a number of hits each bird must take from their weapon before they are dead. The action cards can be bonuses, minuses, or ways to mess with your opponents.

-description from designer
mechanics: Interrupts, Kill Steal, Race, Take That

name: Ball Shoot Launch 4
description: Shoot your balls into the holes to drop down and create a line of 4 balls before your opponent. Basically it's connect 4 with launchers, balls instead of disks, and simultaneous play.

name: Morph
description:
Morph is a simple but challenging set collection, pattern matching game with the goal of being the first player to create a number of sets of 3 cards with the same shape. To do this, you must morph your hand by matching a card by color or shape with a card on the table. If you matched a card by color, you must match said card to a second one by shape, and viceversa.

—description from the designer

AWARDS
3rd place Best Solo Game in the 2021 54-Card Game Design Contest
Additionally:
5th place Best Game Using Only Cards
9th place Best Overall Game

name: Of Silence & Shadow: A Dark Fantasy Skirmish Wargame
description:
Of Silence & Shadow is a skirmish wargame set in the realms of dark fantasy.

What is a skirmish wargame?
A skirmish wargame is a type of wargame that uses relatively few figures compared to larger more boastful wargame battles. Skirmish wargames focus on individual models and their abilities, rather than large units of soldiers.
In this game, each unit moves, acts, and fights on its own.

Dark fantasy is a type of fantasy where horror trumps the majestic.
Where fire spells burn their casters and getting sliced by a sword causes more injury than just a few hit points.
So, frame your mind around the darkest parts of fantasy, where life is horrific, knights do not always save the day, and princesses may be monsters in disguise.

—description from the publisher

name: アルス・ノタリア (Ars Notalia)
description:
アルス・ノタリア　～君は魔法陣クリエイター～ (Ars Notalia -You are a magic circle creator-) is a drawing game from Japan. Players are students of magic, having taken up a 4 week internship at a magical research company. Their goal is to improve their grades and hopefully gain full-time magic work.

Each week they complete a magical research on a particular. A spell is formed from a combination of two word cards (English included). Players use agreed symbols to represent the components of the spell (water, fire and so on). Each player draws a version of the spell from the symbols required.

At the end of the course, each player studies the spells drawn by the other students, and casts a secret vote on how well they have been drawn. Players are looking for how easily the drawing is to read, and how well it matches the requirements of the spell.

Once all the votes are cast, the scores are revealed and totalled up. The best score wins the game and a new job.

Players must try to draw out on paper a spell, decoratively and cleverly. But it must be recognisable as the spell, and not too difficult to read and interpret correctly. A spell that is too easy, or too obscure, should score lower marks than a more finely crafted work.

The game has been presented as a Print'n'Play, with the black & white files online under a password, being released for the low price of ¥ 500.
user summary

name: UNO: Incredibles 2
description: This special deck includes the Wild Screen Slaver Card, which hypnotizes cards and adds a fun twist to the game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: UNO: Finding Dory
description:
The search for excitement is over with the Finding Dory edition of UNO! Play the Just Keep Swimming Card to keep the action moving! Use the Customizable Cards to create your own memorable rules! And don't Forget to yell "UNO!" before you play your last card!

—description from the back of the box

Details about the two unique/new items in this version:

Just Keep Swimming Card – acts as a wild where the next person in order has to keep drawing until they pick a blue card.
Blank Cards – allow you to create house rule cards.


Both card types are worth 50 points if they are in your hand at the end of the round.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Mafia's Night: Citizen Expansion
description:
Citizen expansion adds 3 new citizen roles to help them cast out mafia members.
It also adds a small module, named "Representative".
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Mafia's Night: Contagious Expansion
description:
A new expansion which adds a totally new independent party: Coronavirus!
This expansion adds 6 new (and some upgraded) roles and a wholly new faction with a unique win condition.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: UNO: WWE Card Game
description:
UNO game with the WWE wrestling heroes from 2010.
The game is player with the normal rules except 1 special card the "Card Royal Rumble".
If 1 player plays this card like the color choice card, but each other player tries to play one card of this color as fast as possible. The player who is the fasters puts his card on the discard pile. The next player is the one left to the "Card Royal Rumble" player.

name: The Ultimate Drinking Game: Core Edition
description:
72 cards combining new and classic drinking games with a nasty twist.

At the start of the game, players draw 5 cards and declare a "Captain" to settle any or all disputes.
Players can choose to play a card on themselves, allowing the card to be removed from or play it on another player, returning the card to the bottom of the draw deck, before drawing back up to 5 cards.
Once the draw deck is depleted, the player who discards all cards from their hand first is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Lose a Turn, Move Through Deck, Take That

name: Runes of Zun: Shadow Tactics
description:
The Shadow Tactics Expansion will transform how you play Runes of Zun. There are five new action types (good and bad), a new reaction type, and a new and unique modifier type. Mix them into your original game for a total of 78 cards. If you also mix in the original Action Packed Expansion you'll get a total of 96 cards in your deck! New tactics will emerge and game-changing combos will win out. Are you ready?

New action cards:


Curse (x1): takes away 1 HP at the start of each of the target's turns but whoever targets the player next becomes cursed.
Slow (x2): prevents the target from playing more than one action card.
Punish (x3): deal 1 HP damage to a player for every ongoing card affecting them.
Stash (x2): hide a card from your hand for later use by you or another player.
Purge (x2): remove ongoing effects like Defend or Slow and even works against Banish


New reaction card:

Fizzle (x3): prevent an action from targeting you and forces the targeter to discard a card.


New modifier card:

Misdirect (x2): play an action and have another player suffer any consequences.


Also includes 2 extra Boost cards and 1 extra Reserve card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Events, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Hivernation
description:
Hivernation is a two-player, tabletop strategy game based on actual bee behaviour. Every year, just before winter, hives around the world kick out all the Drone bees so that the Workers and the Queen can survive through the winter and come back strong in the spring. The game is based on this.

In Hivernation, two players (or two teams of two players) receive a stack of 20 double sided, hexagonal bee tiles (one side Workers, one side Drones) as well as 3 specialty tiles chosen at random (or, for fairness, 2 flower tiles and 1 bear tile).

The Queen Zizi Tile is placed in the center of the play space and players take turns playing tiles from their stack. They can attach to Queen Zizi or their own bees but not directly to their opponents bees. When the two sides meet, each player, on their turn, can start converting their opponents tiles to their own by sandwiching their opponents tiles between two of their own and flipping the tiles in between to show the opposite side. There are opportunities to flip tiles in multiple directions at once as well. When a player does this they've made a multi-directional play and they're awarded another specialty tiles chosen from the stack at random.

Or they can modify game play by using one of those specialty tiles to flip tiles in a ring, stop tiles from being flipped or removing them from the game completely. The winner is the player with more of their tiles face up when the first player runs out of bee tiles to play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Tile Placement

name: Face to Face at Antietam
description:
"Face to Face at Antietam" is a 2 player American Civil War Card-Wargame, players make decisions for general Robert E. Lee or general George McClellan as they guide the Army of Northern Virginia or the Army of the Potomac in America's deadliest day of combat at Antietam. An Event card is drawn each turn that simulates real historical events then each side commands infantry, artillery, cavalry and their generals within three terrains and two flanks. Dice rolling keeps a degree of randomness in an otherwise tactical battle.

Be the first to capture two of the three terrains and drive General Lee away or change history and crush General McClellan.

-description from designer
categories: American Civil War, Card Game, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Oshigatari
description: Social deduction game where some players describe their favorite thing and one tries to hide their favorite. A topic is selected and hidden role cards distributed. One player will be the 'know-it-all' who deliberately chooses not to go with their favorite thing, but in a convincing way. The other players do describe their favorite things. After a chance for questions all players simultaneously point to who they think was the know-it-all.

name: De Hartenkoningin
description:
De Hartenkoningin (The Queen of Hearts) is an educational game with different maths games such as: addition, subtraction, grinding tables, surface area...

For Example:
You roll the three dice, look witch numbers you rolled. Afterwards you can choose in witch order you want to place them and then you can begin to add up to 100 or to subtract to 0. The player who gets to 100 or 0 first is the winner and wins a heart.

You choose for yourself or with your partner how you want to play this game.

There are 5 different game suggestions in the box. Other games can be downloaded from the Website.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Starmada
description:
Starmada is a simple (but not simplistic) board game of starship combat, in which players square off in a general attempt to blast each other's fleets into just so much space junk.

While the universe of the Imperial Starmada and its major adversaries is fully detailed in the rulebook, Starmada is much more than just another game, tied down to its own background. Instead, Starmada can be played in just about any science fiction setting you can imagine. There are dozens of optional rules, exotic special equipment and menacing weapons that can be used or discarded at your discretion, to create the type of game you want to play!
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Relentless Onslaught
description:
Solo or 2 Player Co-op/Competitive.

Play as 1 or 2 Deck Officers aboard the S.S.C.R.O. (Sol Space Command "Relentless Onslaught"), affectionately called simply “The Crow” by its crew.

Use worker placement to claim ship resources and then allocate those resources to various weapons systems. Spend these resources to fire weapons and launch missiles & fighters at increasingly difficult waves of incoming enemy ships.

Target the correct enemy ships first to earn rewards, trigger combos and prevent certain types of incoming damage.

Enemy ships will damage the Crow’s energy shields and armour plating so some resources will have to be diverted from offensive systems to make repairs.

Upgrade your deck officers capabilities and the Relentless Onslaught itself to survive 6 waves and complete the game. Every wave is randomised so no two games are the same.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Finale Ending, Worker Placement

name: Schoolyard Tricks
description:
Remember the days of the old schoolyard... endless hours spent competing against your buddies in various childhood games; often resolved by Rock-Paper-Scissors or a simple Coin Toss.

Schoolyard Tricks is a trick-taking micro card game for 2 players that will help you to relive some of that old school fun in around 10-20 mins.

From a deck of just 15 cards, each player is dealt 6 cards in 3 suits (Rock-Paper-Scissors). Players will try to win up to 6 “tricks” each round. But the twist is that each time both players play Odd numbered cards, the Flip Card swaps to the opposite side - meaning the loser of the trick could win the points. And with just 15 cards, ties are resolved using Rock-Paper-Scissors - all recorded on a tug-o-war style board.

At the end of the round, the winning player adds their points to their total. Rounds continue until one player reaches 5 points, and are crowned the Schoolyard Champion.

Schoolyard Tricks contains a surprising level of strategy and decision-making for a quick, addictive, and highly portable, 15-card microgame.

-description from designer

name: Residuel
description:
Residuel is played on a rather egg-shaped arrangement of rhombuses. Players take turns placing a piece of their color that covers three mutually adjacent rhombuses. When there are no moves left, the player with the higher score is the winner.

The general idea behind the scoring is simple: You get 1 point per empty cell that is orthogonally adjacent to more of your pieces than your opponent's pieces. Two measures are taken to exclude all draws in as fair a manner as possible:

1: You get an extra point every time you make a placement that closes off an odd number of tied cells. (A cell is closed off when it is adjacent to no cell that can be occupied on a future turn.) This is equivalent to dividing tied cells between you in a "one for me, one for you, one for me"-fashion as they are closed off.

2: You get an extra point if your opponent has made more placements than you at the end of the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: Deep of Mine: Life is Not a Pancake
description:
Humanity is extinct. All the ordinary worries, half-finished things, accumulated stress in search of a new host, went deep down into the wilderness. And who did they found? Of course, cute forest animals! How will these innocent, fluffy little creatures deal with mental illnesses that came from nowhere and had previously been completely unknown to them?

Be a part of their everyday lives as the rest of their lives start right now, but it could easily end in psychiatry. It's all up to you! (Evil laugh)

How to play? It's easy!

The table before the player is the player's Mind. Here you have to play and collect your Moment cards, like Video Gaming, Unkept Promises, Mowing the Lawn. You can play negative cards (like Phobia, Illness - eg. Coulrophobia, Insomnia) to other player's Moments, or positive cards (Recovery - eg. Aversion Therapy, Faith in the Future) to your Moments. These cards will affect your Mentality value plus or minus. There are immediate cards like Impact cards (eg. The Swamp of Sorrow, Salmon of Doubt), which will alter the gameplay a bit by the card effect, and Fracture cards (eg. Bipolar Disorder, Panic Disorder), which will drive a punch into your Mentality.

This is a turn based game. One turn has 3 phases. Phase 1 is your card's "beginning of your turn" phase. Cards have effects, so some of the cards will apply their effect here. Phase 2 is Defragmentation Phase. The player has got 2 Fragments, and a Fragment can be redeemed into Actions, like DRAW a card or PLAY a card from the hand. The last Phase is the end Phase, the player has to keep the hand limit.

You can STEAL, ERASE, LOCK, etc. a card(s) from your so called friends' Mind. You may decide to be evil - it never hurts. When you erase a Moment, it goes into that player's own Subconscious discard pile.

The player who first collects 7 Moments in his/her Mind and his/her Mentality reaches or exceeds 15 (in a positive direction, of course) wins the game. It's that simple and great.

-description from publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: REMember
description:
Welcome to the dream centre of the brain. You are a member of the REM team: your task is to enter the confusing world of dreams, find the memories hidden within, and move them to long term memory storage. You must develop your brain by storing as many memories as you can. But be careful: if you cause a nightmare whilst you’re in your dreams, then you’ll forget everything…

REMember is a push your luck game. Each night for one week you will enter your dreams, sort cards to match memories and move them to long term storage. You must store as many memories as possible over the course of the week. Whilst you’re in your dream you can prepare as many memories for storage as you want: but you can only move memories to long term storage once per night.
But be careful: the longer you stay in your dreams, the higher the chance you'll cause a nightmare, losing all the memories you have prepared.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Matching, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Black Stories: Poznanski
description:
black stories - that stands for macabre puzzle stories, lots of black humor and a bit of creepiness. The black and red card sets have been among the bestsellers in the games sector for many years. Now the moses. Verlag has been able to win over bestselling author Ursula Poznanski for the black stories.

The 50 brand-new mysterious puzzles from the pen of Ursula Poznanski are a successful mixture of human abysses and humor - typical black stories. In her stories, the truth is multi-layered, man and machine collide with disastrous consequences, and seemingly harmless games turn into deadly danger. Each mystery is a whodunit, where questions, guessing and fiddling must be used to uncover the secret.

By the way, Poznanski's favorite puzzles from her own edition are "Ungeworfen" and "Das Letzte!"

iddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: El Fantasma Travieso
description:
El fantasma travieso is a fabulous game of association and visual deduction, where the ghost Crispin challenges you to discover the traps in the images captured on the cards, you have to be faster than your opponents to obtain the correct object and overcome the challenge of El Fantasma travieso.

Each card in the deck shows pictures of two objects, with one or both objects colored the wrong way. With all players playing at the same time, someone reveals a card, then players grab for the "right" object – but which object is right?

If one object is colored correctly, then players need to grab that correctly colored object.
If both objects are colored incorrectly, players need to grab the totally opposite one.

The first player to grab the correct object keeps the card, then reveals the next card from the deck. Once the card deck runs out, the game ends and whoever has collected the most cards wins!

Contents: 60 cards, 5 plastic figures
(White ghost, red truck, whirligig blue, gray soldier, green tree).

name: Auf Zack: Ergänzungsset
description:
Over 500 new words for the game Auf Zack on 176 cards.

For the game Auf Zack (1992).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: My Hero Academia: League of Villains
description:
Super Heroes vs, Villains in a Plus Ultra game experience that contains nearly 300 cards!

In My Hero Academia: League of Villains you must recruit super-powered Students and Heroes to your Agency. Select the best combinations of Quirks(super-powered abilities) to complete challenging Missions, defeat deadly Villains, save the world and become mightiest Agency around!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: RISE: A Game of Spreading Evil
description:
RISE is a dungeon map drawing game that channels the mischevious spirit of Dungeon Keeper, War For The Overworld, and Overlord.

Put into the blood encrusted boots of a Dungeon's Keeper, you will have to build your dungeon, hire minions (and keep them happy), and face all manner of generated nastiness on your way to the surface.

As you explore, you will create a unique dungeon map that builds up organically through prompts and challenges. You will have the chance to raid other realms, fight generated heroes, and chronicle the saga of your rise to power or embarrassing destruction.

On a turn, you explore the map by drawing a playing card to determine what you find, if there is combat, it's simple and turn based. After exploring, you can trade your resources and build your dungeon (rooms, traps and barricades), then you can recruit new units. All of this while keeping your minions' hapinness high enough so there's no mutiny. You win by finding the surface.
categories: City Building, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: Ten Suns: Gank Crossover Promo Pack
description: This pack is a Limited Edition crossover of 4 characters from another game by Medieval Lords studio titled Gank, to be used in the game Ten Suns. Includes Monk as Dharma, Alchemist as Wenchang Wang, Pugilist as Peony Fairy, and Hydra as Xiang Liu.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: SOPWWID
description:
SOPWWID, a Solitaire One Page World War I Dogfight game has an extremely low footprint, minimal components, and simple rules. The entire game fits on one piece of paper, front and back. Also needed are 11 coins (1 penny, 5 dimes and 5 nickels or any other set of coins), and 1d10. Alternately, you may print plane images (included) instead of using coins.

The goal is to shoot down as many enemy planes with your Sopwith Camel before being shot down yourself.

Each turn, you'll maneuver your Sopwith by selecting from 1 of 31 hex movement options. Then the AI will maneuver each enemy plane (both Fokkers and Pfalzes) by a roll of a die. Although random, the available movement options vary given the relative position of your Sopwith to the enemy. As a result, the enemy AI is eerily accurate, meaning the enemy is quite effective at hunting you down.

Then every plane shoots in a straight hex row if it has an enemy in its sites. Your Sopwith has a range of 4 hexes, the Fokkers may shoot 3 hexes, and the Pfalzes shoot 2.

Every plane is shot down on it's second hit. Fokkers are worth 10 points, Pfalzes 5 points, and if your Sopwith is shot down, you are out.

If you survive the first wave of 1 Fokker and 1 Pfalz, each successive wave adds 1 additional Fokker and 1 additional Pfalz. [The designers record is 55 points!]
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Template, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dragons Wild
description:
A fast playing card game based on Rummy, with a deck of 1-8 number cards in 8 suits, each a different mythical creature, plus 6 wild Dragon cards. Play a set or run of cards (meld) or play onto another meld. Score points for the number of cards you play - the multiplier decreases each round, so play as soon as you can for maximum points. The hard part is only being able to put cards in/on one meld each round. Buy the card you need by taking a penalty. Slap down a Wild to finish a meld or for extra points, but don't get stuck with one at the end!

Family friendly and a light game that can be played while waiting for takeaways or another game to finish. Play with two packs to expand to 7-10 players!

—description from the designer

name: Monopoly: Louvre
description:
Be the first to buy a Louvre masterpiece!

Organize exhibitions and attract as many visitors as possible over the course of the game.
Outbid your opponents during auctions and negotiate artworks that you wish to acquire.
In a word, take risks, clinch art deals and win the game.

The Musée du Louvre throws open the doors of its collections !
It's up to you to get people to come and discover world-class artworks.
Organize exhibitions at home or around the world with Michelangelo's Dying Slave or the Law Code of Hammurabi.

--description from publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading
publishers: Editions de la Réunion des musées nationaux, Hasbro, Winning Moves France

name: Caps And Stones
description:
Caps And Stones is a fast paced 2 player abstract game that focuses on trying to think 5 moves ahead with an ever changing play area. Games normally take 5-15 minutes to play and it only takes about 30 seconds to learn. Once you get the hang of the basic rules of play, an advanced twist on the rules is available to incorporate into your gameplay for truly mind bending games!

Caps And Stones is a print and play game that only consists of 1 playing piece and you will need to print out about 30 pieces (3 sheets of paper). One person picks the pyramid side (Caps) and the other person picks the rubble side (Stones). Then players take turns drawing from the same pile, aligning, and stacking pieces until a player gets 4 of their side lined up in a square looking down on the play area. The first one to do that wins!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Robble
description:
Robble is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. The recommended board sizes are between 5x5 and 9x9. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.



DefinitionsIn these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a stone along with all other like-colored stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent stones of its color. The size of a group is the number of stones in it.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty square. Then,

- for every stone 'A' that is adjacent to your newly placed stone in one direction and to an empty square 'B' in the opposite direction, move stone 'A' to empty square 'B';

- for every stone 'A' that is adjacent to your newly placed stone in one direction and to the edge of the board in the opposite direction, remove stone 'A', and

- for every stone 'A' that is adjacent to your newly placed stone in one direction and to another stone in the opposite direction, replace stone 'A' with a stone of the opposite color.

The game ends when the board is full. Then, the players jointly remove pairs of opposite-colored groups of the same size from the board until there are no more such pairs to remove. The player with the biggest group left over wins. If the board is empty, whoever made the last move before the game's end loses.

If the same board position appears for the third time with the same player to move, the game ends in a draw.



Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.



NotesRepeating a position is very hard on a 5x5 board, and it is believed to be impossible on bigger boards.

Robble was inspired by Gekitai and Pathwayz.

-description from designer
mechanics: Chaining, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Slide/Push, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Stadissimo Rugby
description:
Stadissimo Rugby is a trivia game about rugby.

Goal:
Similarly to a game of rugby, players / teams need to score tries, penalties and conversions by answering questions.

Questions cover (8 categories of 100 each):

rules of the game of rugby
1st French league teams
2nd French league teams
History, geography of cities and countries playing rugby
5 nations tournament and International rugby
glorious rugby players
80/90 seasons and part of 1991
special questions for conversion, penalties and drop kicks

name: Gunfight at O.K. Corral: October 26, 1881
description:
Gunfight at O.K. Corral simulates the most famous gunfight in the Old West, when the Earp brothers and Doc Holliday dispatched the Clanton-McLaury gang in Tombstone, Arizona Territory, in 1881.

The solo game allows you stand in the boots of the participants (you play the lawmen, the system handles the outlaws) during this “30 shots in 30 seconds” encounter in history.
The individual men are rated in variety of categories (gun speed, accuracy, experience, etc.) so the stage is set as you walk shoulder-to-shoulder down Fremont Street… toward destiny.

10 pages of rules, 27 counters & markers, game tables, Historical Placement map, optional rules, Designer's Notes.

NOTE: The PDF edition is identical to the edition published in Panzerschreck #18 (though it does include an extra small map, and roster sheet); those owning the Panzerschreck edition do NOT need to buy this game.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Perplexus Revolution Runner
description:
Motorized Moving 3D Maze: Perplexus Revolution Runner is a motorized, perpetually moving 3D maze! Twist, spin and turn to navigate the ball through the track and ever-changing obstacles to keep up with the maze’s movement without falling into the trench!
As the track inside moves, the obstacles are ever-changing for a constant challenge of agility and speed!

4 speeds to master: Master the first speed, then step up your difficulty level to faster speeds for even more thrilling, high-tension challenges!

—user summary

name: Recollect?: Through the Ages
description:
One of a series of Recollect? games with the theme of past civilizations, great leaders, and significant events in history.

The aim of the game is to collect the most cards by completing all three challenges correctly:
1. For the first challenge, players have to draw a card and find four items in the image within the given time limit
2. For the second challenge, players have to memorize the image and answer a question based on a roll of the dice (total of five questions; rolling a six gives the player an extra chance to answer the question)
3. The third challenge is a trivia question.

Failing to complete a challenge will give the next player a chance to 'steal' the card. The said player starts from the first challenge.

Once all the cards have been played, the player with the most cards wins!

Contents: 30 game cards, Dice, Sand-timer, and rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Real-Time, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Raising Chicago
description:
During the 19th century, the elevation of the Chicago area was just a few feet higher than the shoreline of Lake Michigan. For many years, there was little or no naturally occurring drainage from the city surface, and this lack of drainage caused unpleasant living conditions. Standing water harbored pathogens that caused numerous epidemics including typhoid fever and dysentery, culminating in the 1854 outbreak of cholera that killed six percent of the city's population. The crisis forced the city to take the drainage problem seriously. In 1856, engineer Ellis S. Chesbrough drafted a plan for the installation of a citywide sewerage system and submitted it to the city council, which adopted the plan.

However, due to the minimal elevation above the lake, the sewer could not be built underground and had to be built at street level. The city council then decided to implement a radical idea: Prevented from digging down, they instead decreed the buildings of the city would be raised to allow the new sewer system to be hidden under the new street level. Representing one of the four companies that were created to tackle the problem of raising the buildings of Chicago, it's up to you to gather resources, take on the most attractive projects, and help solve the sanitation crisis of the city.

On your turn in Raising Chicago, you place a tile on a resource slot associated with one of five building projects, then claim the resource you covered. After all players have placed tiles, each project is evaluated. The winning player pays resources to complete the project, claims the project reward, then places all of their tiles associated with that project as levels underneath the building onto a space on the board. Players earn points for placing buildings cleverly, doing the most work in a ward, and meeting the demands of council people.

Only the most successful player will win, so play strategically to prove you can raise buildings the best in Raising Chicago!

—description from the publisher

name: Pay Off
description:
Pay Off is played on a 6x6 grid where the spaces are labeled with all the possible rolls of two standard dice. On a turn a player rolls three dice and chooses two of them to designate an uncontrolled space, which they mark. Rerolls are done if necessary and rolling triples lets a player take any open space.

When a player takes a space adjacent to spaces they already control, they score points based on the number of such spaces. When all spaces have been marked off the player with the most points wins.

name: Colours and Guns
description:
Colours & Guns an 80 page set of land based rules system designed for 10 mm Napoleonic figures. They will whet your appetite for Napoleonic wargaming in our speciality scale, 10 mm. The rules are simple enough to get a grasp of quickly but have enough variety and complexity to make it a game you'll want to play again and again. With so many nations to choose from where will you begin……? The rules are choc full of photos, diagrams, army lists and sketches of some of the most famous Commanders of the day. We've placed the quick play sheet on the back cover, so they don't take up much room on the table and the spine of the book stays neat. Units are infantry battalions, cavalry regiments or batteries of guns.

—description from the publisher

name: Last Ditch: A Strategy Game
description:
Last Ditch is played on a free-form "board" made of intersecting straight lines with a closed border - the lines are the "ditches" of the title.

On a turn a player "fills" a ditch by scribbling over it, but if the ditch being filled intersects an already-filled ditch, it stops there.

The player filling the last ditch wins the game.

name: In Side Out
description:
One player shuffles all the cards, put them in a stack face down in the center of the table, and draws the top three cards and lays them face up around the center stack. He then begins the first round by turning the top card of the deck face up. Every card has one large symbol in the center and one smaller symbol in a ring around the center. There are 10 different symbols and may be in one of 8 different colors. The task of all participants is to search for the icon from the center of the final flipped card on the outer circle of the other three visible cards. The paired cards must match in both shape and color. As soon as one of the opponents finds such a card, he must quickly slap his palm on it and take the card.

It can very easily happen that there is no matching card on the table. In this case the next player add the central card to other three and flips over a new card to be matched with those four.

The game continues by replenishing cards so that there are always at least three on the table for searching. The game ends when one player collects a specified number of cards.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Order Battletome – Lumineth Realm-Lords
description:
Lumineth are masters of magic. Through their immeasurable skill, they will save the Mortal Realms from disaster – no matter the cost. Only the Lumineth would be arrogant enough to claim the title of Realm-lords, yet such is the close bond they have forged with Hysh that they have earned that right. Their immaculate shining companies fight as one, whilst the devout warriors of their aelementiri temples call upon the war spirits of the elements to lend them supernatural powers and even battle alongside them.

Master a new generation of aelves with Battletome: Lumineth Realm-lords – your guide to the light-wielding, elemental-mastering inhabitants of Hysh. Whether you're a veteran of the world-that-was looking for the spiritual successors to your High Elves of yore or a new player looking for a rewarding, tactical and powerful army, this book is your complete guide. Discover the history of the Lumineth Realm-lords with rich lore and beautiful art, get inspired for your own personal hobby with a showcase of stunning miniatures and painting tips, and field an army with warscrolls, allegiance abilities, spell lores and more.

This 90 page hardback book contains:


Allegiance abilities for Lumineth, including a variety of battle traits
2 spell lores
2 battleplans that allow you to fight thrilling narrative battles that suit the Lumineth Realm-lords ways of war
Rules for creating a Lumineth warband for Path to Glory, including Champion and Followers Rewards Tables
4 warscroll battalions
13 warscrolls, and 3 endless spell warscrolls
Pitched battle profiles for all units and endless spells featured in this battletome


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Order Battletome – Seraphon
description:
Seraphon strive to enact the Great Plan of the Old Ones, their ancient and mysterious creators. They are utterly dedicated to the destruction of Chaos, and will show no mercy to any who stand in their way. Commanded by the slann, cohorts of brutal saurus are bolstered by swift skinks and towering reptilian behemoths. Those who stand before them soon find themselves met by the unfeeling wrath of the cosmos.

In Battletome: Seraphon, the might of the heavens is yours to command! This tome of rules, art and lore is your complete guide to these avenging lizardmen and their monstrous armies. Discover why the Seraphon came to the Mortal Realms, how their society works, from the celestial beings known as the Starborne to the savage reptilian Coalesced. Learn their lore, get inspired and field an army for yourself with a suite of powerful and thematic rules, including allegiance abilities, spell lores, artefacts and more.

Maybe you'll field a magically charged force of Starborne Seraphon, teleporting around the battlefield, blitzing enemies with spells and summoning reinforcements from the temple-ships to battle. Or perhaps you’ll field a hardened force of Coalesced, tearing the enemy apart in close combat with savage fury. Or you might just field loads of Stegadons and call it a day. It’s up to you! To help you with your army, this book also contains collecting tips, with example armies, stunningly painted miniatures, painting advice and Path to Glory rules.

This 104 page hardback book contains:

The history and origins of the Seraphon – from their discovery in the aetheric void by Dracothion to their conquest and terraforming of the Mortal Realms
Lore and art that brings the world of the Seraphon to life
Tips for collecting Seraphon, and rules that allow you to fight battles with them on the tabletop
Allegiance abilities that bestow a wide selection of battle traits, command traits, artefacts of power and unique spell lores upon your army
A battleplan representing a sudden intervention from above by the Seraphon
Rules themed around the four most famed Seraphon Constellations – sub-factions with their own additional special rules


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Vendetta: Melissa and Kevin Promo Card
description:
A Kickstarter promo Victim card for Vampire: The Masquerade - Vendetta featuring the two hosts of Tantrum House to be shuffled into the main Victim deck.

1 Influence, 1 Blood per turn.
When drained, provides 3 blood.
No special ability.

name: Wtht Vwls
description:
Wtht Vwls is a simple word game for any number of players. At the start of each round each player thinks of a word and then writes the consonants in that word, in order, on a slip of paper for each other player.

After all slips have been distributed the players all try to come up with the longest possible word for each set of consonants; they may add any number of vowels before, after, or in between the consonants, but no consonants may be added and the order cannot be changed. (Y is always a vowel in this game.)

When one player has finished they announce the end of the round immediately. Players score a point for every letter in the words they found. An agreed-upon number of rounds is played.

name: Luminous Ages: Dragon Mode
description:
Luminous Ages is set apart from other trading card games. Aimed at the veteran and the apprentice Luminous Ages can be played by young and old with any level of experience. A tabletop dragon mode with cooperative and competitive play allows you to play with friends and will become a favourite on family game night. In dragon mode, a player can become the DRAGON MASTER controlling the Dragon Gods unleashing their armies against cooperative players set on the Dragon Master’s defeat. The Dragon Mode game is also a DECK BUILDING GAME for 2 players with many cards and so many options.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy

name: The Farm Game
description:
Take on the role of a farmer trying to build up your farm with pigs, cows, chickens, and sheep

Compete with your fellow players doing the same thing. Try to disrupt their farms while protecting your own.

Collect all three pairs of one kind of farm animal to win the game

Use other card types to buy, sell, trade, and support your farm - or to sabotage your neighbors

Make blind trades with your neighboring farmers to get what you need. Trades are limited only by your creativity

You can choose to be honest in your business dealings, but there is no guarantee other players will!

—description from the designer

name: Micro Mariners
description:
Welcome, researchers!
An unusually high amount of rare marine life has been spotted in a nearby cove. Whether you are an amateur or an expert diver, you cannot pass up the chance to research these amazing creatures. Make new discoveries to gain points, but don’t be naive, many of these creatures still pose a threat to those who wander too carelessly into their home!


Contents

8 Amateur Diver Tokens
8 Expert Tokens
2 Dice
16 Creature Cards
1 Rules Card
1 Research Vessel / Reference Card



How to Play

SETUP - Place the Research Vessel (RV) card to the side of the playing area. Spread the remaining cards face-down. Each player receives either the Red & Gold, or Blue & Silver set of diver tokens. Gold & Silver are experts, and let you adjust your dice roll by +/-1 on the turn they are added to a card.

ON YOUR TURN - The lowest dice roll goes first. Place 2 amateurs or 1 expert token on any face-down card (or face-up card that you control) per turn. Roll both dice. If either dice matches the back of the card, flip it and place your token on a free square. If the roll total matches any face-up cards with your diver on them, take the action shown and end your turn.

DISCOVERIES - Each player may have a diver on a card back, however only the player who discovers it may add their tokens once the card flips. The losing player’s token is returned to them. If you place divers on all available spaces on a card, on your next turn you may take the card as a Discovery Point, and retrieve your divers.

INJURIES & ACCIDENTS - Dangerous creatures can injure your divers and send them to the RV. Once ‘healed’ after 3 turns for injuries, or 1 for accidents, they can be placed again.

HOW TO WIN - Collect 8 Discovery Points to win. Deduct 1 point for each diver still in recovery at the end of the game.

name: Agrarian
description:
Agrarian is an economic farming game in which farmers go through a land bidding phase and then followed by a growing stage. During the bidding phase, different parcels of land will come up for auction in which all the farmers will put in a blind bid on each parcel of land. The highest bid gets the land.

During the second phase, farmers get a weather prediction and then have to decide what crops to grow. The more of one crop the group as a whole grows the less valuable it becomes. Weather also affects each crop differently. Once farmers decide what crops they are growing, the weather is decided by a dice roll that affects all farmers equally. Then crops are revealed and the value of the crops are adjusted based on the number of fields grown.

Farmers collect the amount of money they have made for each crop and then start the second round. 3 rounds later the game ends and the farmer with the most money wins.

-description from designer

name: Spielbox-Almanach 25 Jahre Hans im Glück Beilage
description:
This punchboard which was sold with the spielbox-Almanach "25 Jahre Hans im Glück" contains five tiles for Carcassonne (old design) Carcassonne: The Cult and six tiles for Stone Age (Stone Age: The New Huts).
.
publishers: Hans im Glück, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Blood Angels
description:
The Blood Angels are the beatific sons of Sanguinius, the Great Angel. Inside this 80-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Blood Angels in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

- The history of the Blood Angels, with a look at how their valiant defence of Terra and loss of their Primarch at the hands of the Arch-traitor Horus forever changed their fate
- A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
- A Blood Angels bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
- A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
- Rules for units that are only available to the Blood Angels Chapter and their successors – including 18 datasheets
- Stratagems, the Sanguinary psychic discipline, Relics, and optional secondary objectives that define the ways that the Blood Angels wage war
- Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics that are unique to the Blood Angels
- And more!

You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Colonialism to Revolution: Fast Play Rules for 1870-1927 Grand Army Battles
description:
Colonialism to Revolution rules are designed to provide a simple but thematic games from the start of the Franco Prussian War (1870) till the Italian colonial wars in Libya (1927).
The rules provide an interactive game that keeps the players engaged through a turn sequence.
The playing space uses a grid/hex format, but players can easily adapt to a more traditional open space without a grid/hexes.
Unit bases are grouped into command groups and stratagems can be played during the turn to give a specific feel the different armies.
Artillery is considered off board and is represented through a sub set of rules.
Gas attacks are included in the artillery sub set rules.

Ideal rules for remote game play

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Open Drafting

name: Strategeme: Three Kingdoms
description:
Stratagem is a series of paper and pencil wargame. The first volume is Three Kingdoms. There are six regions in ancient China. Twelve warlords and their loyal generals struggle for victory of China during 190-220 AD.

In Stratagem, player writes the commands on strategic paper secretly and reveals the commands simultaneously. There are five phases in a round. Recruit, Strategy, Move, Battle, and Victory. Player has several commands in the strategy phase. Each cube represents army of different powers. Each command can move 1-3 cubes. Player win the battle by owning more cubes in one area.

After controlling one area, player gains victory points. Player needs to plan the strategy ccarefully and gains victory points to win the game.

name: Absolute Zero Junior
description: In this precursor to Absolute Zero, the objective is the same but numbers are smaller and ten frames are added for visual support.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Caravan of Sundust (砂塵のキャラバン)
description:
Become the captain of the caravan corps, plan the route, return with trade items, and develop your base!

Items that can be developed are decided according to the combination of traded goods brought back. Pick and delivery goods can also strengthen your caravan and help you acquire additional abilities.
mechanics: Market, Pick-up and Deliver, Square Grid

name: Ex nihilo
description:
Ex nihilo is a highly tactical and quite novel stack-fighting game with an emergent checkmate-esque win condition. The novelty of this game lies in its central gimmick: Every move consists in moving a stack. In this sense it is a pure movement game. Yet, the game features both placement and captures.

Rules:
The game is for 2 players and is played with stackable pieces of two colors on a hexagonal arrangement of hexagons (a hexhex board). The board starts out empty. The game is over as soon as one player is unable to make a move. The other player is then the winner.

Movement – overview:
Stacks move along straight open lines and grow when they move away from the center cell. This game is unusual in allowing movement of stacks containing 0 pieces. It is by growing these that pieces get onto the board in the first place.

Movement – details:
On your turn, you must move a stack not topped by an enemy piece to an empty cell reachable through an unbroken line of empty cells. By convention, a single piece is considered a stack of size 1 and an empty cell is considered to contain a stack of size 0.

If, after you have moved a stack, it is farther away from the center cell than before it was moved (measured in number of steps), its size is increased by 1 per step further away from the center it now is. This is effected by adding pieces to the top of it from your hand.

You may move a proper part of a stack by splitting it. That is, if a stack contains several pieces you can choose to only move the top n pieces, given that you do not change their order, for any number n less than the number of pieces in the stack.

You may also move a whole stack, but only on the condition that you move it farther away from the center cell. A consequence is that moving a whole stack always results in its size increasing. Together with the convention that empty cells contain stacks of size 0, this also has the consequence that you can effectively place a new stack on the board by moving a stack of size 0.

Note that nothing special happens to the cell you moved the 0-stack from – it still contains a 0-stack.

Capturing – overview:
Flanked enemy stacks are captured by being taken hostage for a move. Capturing is obligatory: If a capturing move is available, a capturing move must be made. The winner will be the player who manages to force their opponent to capture an immovable stack.

Capturing – details:
If (and only if) the top piece of a stack is of your color, it is said to partake in flanking an enemy stack if (i) this enemy stack is exactly in the middle of a line of otherwise empty cells going from the flanking stack to another one of your stacks, and (ii) all three of these stacks are of the same size.

If, after you have moved a stack, it partakes in flanking one or more enemy stacks, you must immediately move one of these enemy stacks. Except for the obvious difference that you are moving an enemy stack, all normal rules apply to this move. For example: If the captured stack grows (if you move it farther away from the center cell, that is), it grows by the addition of pieces of your color, so situations where this hostage move must itself be a capturing move are possible.
