Such chaining of captures must continue until you capture a stack that is not in a position to continue the chain. Growing captured stacks is the only way to take ownership of them more permanently.

-description from designer

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Skaven Team Card Pack
description:
Redesigned for the Second Season ruleset, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Skaven teams.

– 5 Player Reference cards for Skaven Clanrat Linemen, Gutter Runners, Throwers, Blitzers, and Rat Ogres
– 2 Star Player cards for Glart Smashrip and Hakflem Skuttlespike
– 8 Random Event Special Play cards
– 8 Dirty Tricks Special Play cards
– 20 Blank Player cards: 11x Skaven Clanrat Lineman, 4x Gutter Runner, 2x Thrower, 2x Blitzer, and 1x Rat Ogre
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl: the Official Rules to make full use of these cards.

-description from the publisher's website

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Skrull Halfheight – Star Player
description:
Every once in a while, a player appears that breaks the mould. Skrull Halfheight was a Dwarf blessed with a prodigious passing ability. Unfortunately for Skrull, his receivers were Dwarfs, and as he waited for one of them to trundle slowly into position, the opposition executed a career-ending tackle on the unfortunate Thrower. This beautiful game wasn't done with Skrull, though, and he was resurrected by none other than famous Necromancer coach, Tomolandry, eager to try out a long game for his own Champions of Death.

A Dwarf Thrower, they ask with eyebrows raised incredulously? Your opponents won't underestimate him more than once... This unconventional Star Player can be Induced by any Sylvanian Spotlight and Worlds Edge Superleague team to add a frankly impressive passing strategy. As befitting a player with no flesh and blood, Skrull is cool under pressure and very survivable (so to speak, anyway) – ideal for mixing it up on the Line of Scrimmage and then sending the ball sailing out to a breakaway catcher on the other side.

This finely-detailed resin model is supplied in 7 pieces, and comes supplied with a 32mm Round Blood Bowl Base. You can find all the rules you need to use Skrull in Blood Bowl – The Official Rules.

-description from the publisher's website

The 2016 edition rules to use this player can be found in Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): 2019 Blood Bowl Almanac
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Zolcath The Zoat – Star Player
description:
Zoats are an exceptionally rare sight, and to find one on the Blood Bowl pitch is all but unheard of. Zolcath seems to play as much for his own amusement as anything else, he will only allow a team to hire him once they find his hidden lair.

Not only is Zolcath a strong player in his own right, with the stats and skills to dominate the gridiron, he’s a Zoat! Your opponents will gaze in awe when you put him on the table, and so will the players lining up against him on the Line of Scrimmage.

This finely-detailed resin model is supplied in 16 pieces, including a 40mm round base. Zolcath the Zoat is available to play for Lustrian Superleague and Elven Kingdoms League teams. You can find all the rules you need to use him in your games of Blood Bowl in the Second Season Official Rules.

description from the publisher's website

The 2016 edition rules for this Star Player can be found in Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): 2019 Blood Bowl Almanac

name: Recycle!
description:
A new day begins, the peaceful town is getting noisy. As life changes with each passing day, the town radiates vitality all the time. However, tons of garbage are ruining the environment. In order to improve the situation of this, an increasing number of waste disposal factories have been erected.

As the engineers of the factory, you are not only responsible for maintaining the daily operation of the factory, but also have to help the factory to become the top one out of all the other factories. Are you ready for the new events and the recycling work you promised?

In the game, you need to earn resources by collecting garbage, and then put the resources in the factory to be converted into Guokr coin. The event cards of each round will affect your work efficiency. Upgrading the factory level allows you to get points faster for the game. At the end of the game, the player who has the highest points will win.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Environmental, Industry / Manufacturing, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Movement Points, Role Playing

name: Manhattan
description:
Manhattan is a unification game that always ends with one player (the winner) gathering all their pieces in one group.

Rules:
The game is played on a 6x6 square board covered in a checkered pattern of pieces of two colors, except the the 4 central squares are empty. On your turn you have two options: Move or remove. If you cannot do either you automatically pass. (One player will always have a move.)

• Move:
With one of your pieces that is not part of a group, take the first orthogonal step of the shortest possible walk along a clear path that leads to a friendly piece. That is: Of all clear paths to all friendly pieces, you must choose the one that consists of the smallest number of orthogonal steps, and reduce it by 1 orthogonal step.

• Remove:
Remove one of your pieces that belong in a group of same-colored pieces. You may not make a removal that will split the group the removed piece was part of.

name: Monopoly: Disney Villains Collectors Edition
description:
Monopoly; Disney Villains Edition Game lets you relive the excitement of all your favorite Disney villains -- from Chernabos to Ursula -- with this very special edition of the classic Monopoly; board game. Magic Mirror and Cauldron cards might make your dreams come true or they might bring an unexpected trip to jail. Use your Wishes wisely to collect the deeds to Disney Villains belongings; increase their value on your way to victory!

The game board is different from Monopoly: My Disney Villains.
mechanics: Auction: English, Bribery, Income, Negotiation, Player Elimination

name: SwiftWave: the turn-cutting action card game
description: A turn-cutting action card game for 3-8 players where the fastest to discard all their cards wins. There are only two actions in the game: wait for your turn to play, or wave cut to steal another player’s turn. Swiftness is key; your turn and the opportunity to win may just pass you by.
mechanics: Real-Time, Speed Matching, Turn Order: Random

name: Scotland Yard: Venice
description:
Scotland Yard: Venice is a limited edition version of the classic game, only it is set in Venice, Italy. Chase Mr. X through the canals of the lagoon city, using gondolas and speedboats instead of taxis and subways.

The rules of the base game are unchanged.
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Dungeon Storming: Mostri Erranti
description: The box contains a die, rules, 10 monster sheets and 30 miniatures, to add to every game in the Dungeon Storming series, to add variability and new challenges.

name: Tanto Cuore: International Promo Set
description:
A Kickstarter was opened to help get funding to release Tanto Cuore in other languages. With this Kickstarter there were 10 promos released featuring private maids from different countries around the world. Each card was in the maid's native language. English translated cards of each of the promos were released as well.

PR28: Aino Svensen (Norway)
PR29: Celia Forestwood (Canada)
PR30: Olivia Wallace (Australia)
PR31: Consuela de la Fuente (Spain)
PR32: Denise Brondiel (France)
PR33: Pierra Allegrini (Italy)
PR34: Ursula Fassbender (Germany) - Requires Oktoberfest/Beer cards
PR35: Sadie (United States of America)
PR36: Minamo Kaibara (Japan)
PR37: Tamara Orlova (Russia)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: 紅茶ロマン紀行 (Romantic Tea Trip)
description:
Romantic Tea Trip is set in early modern England. You are a merchant who trades in black tea. Make your business a success by growing black tea around the world, such as Darjeeling and Assam, and promoting new methods of drinking tea, such as Earl Grey and the use of tea bags!

Your goal is to become the King of Tea.

In this game, you move your rabbit piece forward one to three steps and perform the effects of the card you land on to collect Tea Chests or increase the value of the Tea Chests you already have.

You use Tea Chests you have collected in this way to acquire cards. The victory points awarded are written on the acquired cards; the first player to reach 100 points is the winner.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Colonialism to Revolution: Game Cards – Nation Set 1
description:
Nation stratagem cards for:
France
USA
Russia
Autria-Hungary
UK
Prussia
Germany
Ottoman Empire
Zulu Nation
Colonial Italy
Irregulars
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I

name: Warmation: Simple Napoleonic System
description:
Light game system for playing battles set in the Napoleonic era. Warmation does not include components, but just a ruleset allowing to reenact any battle of the Napoleonic era. This game system allows players to invent and experiment their own battle formations, up to 64 possible formations, with few rules. Suitable also to less experienced players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Connections, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Lose a Turn, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: The Adventures of Tennessee James
description:
Tennessee James, along with other archaeologists and adventurers, are leading expeditions to find their own fortune and glory. While searching pyramids, temples, and ruins for riches, the expedition teams must watch out for traps, such as snakes, arrows, and giant boulders. Archaeologists must also beware of native tribes, cultists, fascist soldiers, and even each other. Survive the traps, take the riches (from other archaeologists if necessary), and get out alive to gain your fortune and glory!

The Adventures of Tennessee James is a board game for 1-4 players 8 years and up and can be played in 30 to 45 minutes.

Players begin the game with an Archaeologist of their choice and 3 Team Members. Players can spend up to 5 Actions per turn, and can either move 1 space or draw 1 card per Action. Players can repeat Actions during their turn and may also discard cards for extra Movement Actions.

Each temple contains an entrance and 24 spaces. Each space contains a face-down tile which could either be a treasure or a trap. If a player finds treasure, they keep it as a reward. If a player finds a trap, they must play cards to defeat it. If the trap is not defeated, the player loses a Team Member, which reduces how many Actions they can perform per turn. Make sure that you have enough cards to defeat traps because other players can play cards that make traps more difficult to defeat. If you run out of Team Members, and you can’t defeat a trap, you lose the game. Find the most treasure and escape the temple to win the game, but don't stay too long or the temple will become your tomb.

—description from the publisher

name: Battle of Yūki
description:
Battle of Yūki is a two-player game of Yūki Ujitomo's rebellion against the Ashikaga shogunate from 1440 to 1441.

FYI:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yūki_Kassen_Ekotoba

Issue game of "Bushi Life" #2.

name: Crimibox: Dossier Macdeath – Episode II
description:
Solve your own murder mystery. With the help of a chat bot you investigate police files, photo's and evidence. Search the internet and use social media to unravel the secrets of your suspects.

On the stage the actors play Shakespeare's Macbeth, but behind the scenes another tragedy takes place. The final curtain falls for the young Maarten.

Unravel the mystery in the second episode of this gripping trilogy. With each episode you advance further in your investigation until you reach the final epilogue in the third episode.

Unmask the gruesome murderer before he strikes again!

Some of the features included in this game:
- Analyse police documents
- Watch video footage
- Send e-mails to witnesses
- Search police databases
- Scour social media for clues

And much more!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: メイドマフィア！(Maid Mafia!: Maid x Gun x Tea)
description:
A long time ago, Japan was banned from black tea due to the war with Britain.

But people couldn't resist the charm of black tea.

Beautiful colors peeking out of the cup, unique scent, and noble and mellow taste...

The rich people raised a lot of money in search of black tea, and some people tried to fulfill their wishes.

That was the moment when the mafia organization "Yokohama Syndicate" specializing in black tea was born in the port city of Yokohama.

And time has passed and it is modern.

Black tea has not been lifted yet, mafias continue to carry it...

Times have changed, but things haven't changed, and people call them wearing maid clothes and paint guns, Maid Mafia!

Maid Mafia! is a game of smuggling. Each player moves around Yokohama city, gathers armed maids (fifteen in total) and traffics in black tea. A player who got three victory point cards first wins, but if the police act a certain number of times, all the players lose.

name: シブヤ ストラグル (Shibuya Struggle)
description:
Each turn you send workers on different locations. When they're all on the board, if there are multiple players on the same location, they fight (sum of dice rolling depending on their number of workers + cards effects + paid money + combat stat...)

The winner resolve the location (typically get cards, or increase your stats (income, workers, combat, luck)). Then players may claim one of the four bosses if they control two given areas (depending on the boss). They will help for the final fight.

When the four bosses have been claimed, the central tile become a location to fight KING. If you manage to beat him (he's like a super strong player), you win the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement
publishers: DELiGHTWORKS, Jelly Jelly Games, Kanai Factory

name: Crimibox: Dossier Macdeath – Episode III
description:
In the final episode of Macdeath, all the pieces of this gruesome investigation finally come together.

As you get closer than ever to Maarten's killer, one thing becomes more than clear to you: this monster cannot be caught just like that.

At least not without a final fight.

Some of the features included in this game:
- Analyse police documents
- Watch video footage
- Send e-mails to witnesses
- Search police databases
- Scour social media for clues

And much more!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Crimibox: Dossier Rhetro Virus
description:
In 1999 a professor was murdered. Howeve, his murder was never solved.

What happened all these years ago? What was the professor secretly investigating? What has it to do with the horror unfolding now? Your source tells you that this murder is just the beginning.

Can you act fast enough to stop the bloodshed? Or does this mystery also end in horror and death?

Some of the features included in this game:
- Analyze police files
- Watch video images
- Send emails to witnesses
- Search police databases
- Analyze samples

And much more!

-description from the publisher's website (translated)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Exploradores
description:
In Exploradores, players lead teams of explorers into Mayan temples to find golden and silver skulls for display in their museums.
When removing a skull, the playing field changes, as other tiles slide into place (similar to Candy Crush).
When the board is empty, the player with more valuable tiles wins the game.

name: Harvest Crunch
description:
It's harvest season! Put your tractors to work, be savvy and cash in your valuable crops at the end of harvest to finish on top! In this card drafting game, you must judge the market and predict what your fellow farmers will do as you try to collect the best hand of valuable crops!

Harvest Crunch takes the card drafting of Sushi Go! and gives it a twist, as different types of crops are worth different amounts each round. Select valuable crops and cash them in but, only if you can sell them before your opponents take up all the room in the elevators! To guarantee you can sell your crops, collect tractors. If you have the most tractors you get to sell your crops first!

Collecting combines doubles the amount you receive for crops. Collecting silos allow you to save crops until they are at their most valuable. Have the most money by the end of the game to win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sow Seed
description:
A game in the mancala family for the Shibumi game system.

The game is aimed at collecting balls in a special area to the right called a kalah. On each turn, players pick up all the balls on an available row on their side and sow them counter clockwise, one in each available side making sure to put one on your kalah.

Unlike a traditional mancala game there is no capturing, and game spaces are opened and closed because they can be filled up.

—description from the designer

name: Sharks
description:
It's 1927. The streets of Sydney, Australia, are rife with thugs, hustlers, dealers, forgers, bookies, pimps, working girls and hard men. Sharks.

Do you have what it takes to secure your place as a crime lord of Sydney? Manage your cash, fuel your determination, build up your street gang and plan for the day when you finally take on one of the kingpins. And don't let your determination wane, lest the street sharks devour you.

Sharks is a deck-builder in only 9 cards, but featuring 36 real-life criminals from 1920s Sydney. Your hand of 4 comprises your gang, and you must use their resources to avoid, recruit or crush the adversaries you meet in the street. As you recruit better members to your gang, your adversaries also grow in strength. To win the game you must confront and crush one of the four acknowledged crime lords of the era: drug lord Charles Passmore, club king Phil Jeffs, sly grog queen Kate Leigh, or the formidable madam Tilly Devine.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Blam! Blam! Argh!
description:
In BLAM! BLAM! ARGH! you get the chance to move and lay down impressive amounts of fire with a handful of soldiers, to compete against your opponent in a bidding mechanism, and complete defined objectives to win victory.

As the subtle title suggests, these rules are inspired more by comic book heroics than history or science. As part of the abstracted game play, a gridded table is used as this simplifies movement, ranges, line of sight, and the effects of terrain.

I designed these rules so that I could use diverse small collections of my ‘shooty’ models in a game without needing to build up larger squads or invest in new, page-heavy skirmish rules. This has been a nice way to introduce some of my non-miniatures gamer friends into a game with my miniatures.

The intended setting is near future and Sci Fi military or policing actions involving around a Squad’s worth of models (usually ten or so), however I’ve also used them for the Weird Wild West and Weird World War Two skirmishes so the rules are really usable across any gunfight setting. Occasionally, the rules have had a run out for a standard Dime Fiction Wild West shoot-out, Hollywood Colonial adventure or World War Two section-level encounter, using Primitive weapons and no armour (except for Clint Eastwood’s boiler plate).

The rules are simple to pick up, but the turn sequence is a little unusual compared to many games: make sure you understand this before playing. You’ll need a couple of dozen tokens for Initiative Points, and a few markers to place beside Stunned models. In addition, you will need a handful of six-sided dice, and if you’re not using a gridded tabletop, a ruler marked in 6” lengths.

—description from the designer
categories: American West, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight

name: Gotcha!
description:
Gotcha! is played on a 5x5 grid. Each player has a set of pieces numbered 1-25.

On each turn one player places a piece face-down in a column or row and the other then places a piece face-down in a row or column so that the intersection of the two is an empty square. The numbers are revealed and both pieces are placed in the square with the higher on top, indicating that it won. (A tied square is unowned.)

When all pieces have been played players score a point for every square and bonus points for orthogonal lines of at least three squares.
mechanics: Constrained Bidding, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Fubnub
description:
Fubnub comes part of a single deck of cards that offers up a number of different game options. The two primary game options the deck allow for are Fubnub and a game called Bad, Bad, Turtle.

Fubnub is a strategy based, trick-taking, card game primarily designed for team play. Loosely inspired by the game of Euchre. Fubnub introduces some unique dealer advantages and a variety of point cards that help to make the game easy to learn, fun to play, and a fresh new challenge with every hand.

Designed for 1 to 4 players ages 10+. The average Fubnub play time is about 20 minutes. The winner is the first team to collect 8 of the 15 point cards.

name: ASL Comp: GWASL I – Tankschrecken!
description:
This expansion contains special rules (Jam Tin Bomb, early Stosstruppen flamethrowers...), geo boards and counters for the British / German (inc. AFVs) in WW1.

Scenarios:

Save The Gun – La Cateau, France, August 26th 1914
The First Showdown – Villers-Bretonneux, France, April 24th 1918
The End Of Idealism – La Boisselle, France, July 1st 1916
Spare a Thousand – the Ypres Salient, Belgium, August 16th 1917
Stars of Mons – Obourg, Mons, Belgium, August 23rd 1914
Cavalry At Cerizy – Cerizy, France, August 28th 1914
War Cars – Foucaucourt, France, April 29th 1918
Liquid Fire At Hooge – Hooge, Belgium, July 30th 1915
Landships – Flers, France, September 15th 1916
Kaiserschlacht – Jussy, France, March 23rd 1918
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Teddy's Adventures: Buttons & Write
description:
The life of the little stuffed Teddy comes to life at night, his duty is to take care of the dreams of his child, throughout the hours of the night he must go through a series of adventures with the aim that his child wakes up as calm possible, but you must be careful, the world of nightmares is open and Little Guss is prowling the room, you will have to collect as many magic buttons as possible to help protect your child's dreams.

The Teddy's Adventures is a roll & write style game but with buttons instead of dice, it is played by taking colored buttons out of a bag, from these buttons the active player will choose which buttons will be painted in each section of his game sheet and which button It will be eliminated, in addition to which button the other players will paint, the game sheet will fill with colors as the rules explain, and you will have to check the progress of the board of the world of nightmares that can trigger the end sooner than provided. Once the end of the game is triggered, points will be counted in each section of the sheet and the player who scores more points than the others will win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bayamigo
description:
Bayamigo is a game about buying and reselling fruit and vegetables in local markets. The goal is to achieve the greatest profit of all players, surviving unexpected obstacles in transport and price levels while facing fierce competition from other players.
Bayamigo is played over three days (different lengths can be agreed on). At the beginning of each day, players buy goods in bulk, and rent motorcycles or vans for the transport. Then they begin a journey through different markets. At each market, players can announce that they want to sell goods there. All players who want to sell, pay the required tax, then dice are rolled to determine the selling price. Each market has a maximum capacity, so turn order is important. Players who are not happy with the price can move on, but won’t get their taxes back. At the end of the day, vehicles have to be returned, and interest has to be paid on any debts the players may have. Obstacle cards can get in your way, reflecting the risks that small-scale resellers face in their trade.
The player who has made the greatest profit during the three days, wins the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Kroma
description:
Kroma is a color-blending strategy game for two or three players.

Gameplay takes place on a triangular playing board that has a light behind it so that you can better see the colors created by the game pieces during play. On a turn, you draw a playing piece from the bag — feeling for a desired shape, if you wish, but not knowing the color of the piece — then place that piece in any legal location on the board. Pieces come in yellow, cyan, and magenta, and initially you must play these pieces on the lowest level of the game board. If you can play a piece so that it's entirely supported by other pieces, then you can play on the second level of the board; by doing this, you can create the secondary colors green, orange, and purple — and this is what you'll need to do to win.

Each player in the game is assigned a secondary color, and at the end of a three-player game, whoever has more spaces of their color showing wins. In a two-player game, the player with the largest contiguous block of their color wins, so the game is more about blocking than simply creating your color wherever you can. If you're green, for example, you want lots of yellow and cyan on the bottom level so that you can potentially transform it into green later, while magenta is useless to you and ideally you can stack magenta pieces on top of one another to put them out of play altogether.

The game ends once all the pieces have been played or when no piece remaining in the bag can fit on the board.

name: Alterra: Age of Exploration
description:
Age of Exploration is a rules-light open-license tabletop RPG made for experienced Role players, who want to share role-playing with someone new.

Card-based: Every spell, weapon, and item has its own card - combat moves fast because players can see what their available choices are right in front of them.

Noble-Bright: Action takes place in tactically rich outdoors scenes, not cramped dungeon corridors.

Rules-Light: Everything players need fits on a 2 page Quickstart Guide. Whether it's your first time leading an RPG or you're a veteran DM introducing role playing to the next generation, learning to play is a snap.

Open-License: meaning you can write and publish your own adventures, and even sell them!

—description from the publisher

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Depths of Darkness Game Supplement
description:
Exploring new lands and voyaging across the sea into the unknown can yield treasures beyond imagination. But it can also awaken dark dreams and eldritch nightmares unfathomed by the sheltered worlds of mankind.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Darkness cards for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around the terrors awakened by the Norse Vikings and Spanish Conquistadors setting out to explore the unknown reaches of the world…and beyond.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Pier 1
description:
Pier 1 is a Cat Sudoku card game for one talented pier master. In the game, the player is building Pier 1 on a beautiful coast. The goal is to arrange market aisles with unique fish vendors to increase foot traffic. Yes, cats are the ecstatic fish vendors. The player will receive points during construction and more after the final inspection. Beware of cute rodents! They are negative points. When the game ends, the player will receive a star rating based on the points received. The more points you score the higher rating you will receive. Are you ready to be a 5-star Grand Pier Master?

-description from designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hein?: Famille & Culture Pop
description:
In the game Hein? Famille & Culture Pop ("Huh? Family and Pop Culture"), you try to describe songs, people, places or professions in strange and funny ways. Word, mime, song ... describe your films or your personalities as you want. Because your goal is simple: that as few players as possible understand what you are talking about!

The fewer players who understand, the more points you score. But at least one player must understand!

Be careful not to say too much at the risk of a detail giving the answer to too many players and find around the table which players seem to understand you so that you know when to stop. And above all have fun listening to the absurd descriptions of other players.

name: Star Fleet Marines: Battle Manual
description:
Improvise, Adapt, and Overcome!

The pirates have beamed down to the planet. Do they have a secret base? Are they holding hostages? Time to send in the Marines!

The Star Fleet Marines Battle Manual has all the published rules for Star Fleet Marines and the scenarios from the rulebooks in Assault and Last Stand.
But wait! There’s more!
Every additional scenario written for Star Fleet Marines to date is included.
Questions and answers about the rules are compiled.
Find articles on tactics.
And all of this is in one handy volume instead of paging through magazines or newsletters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mixtape Massacre: Bad Dad Booster Pack
description:
After making a “killing” on Wall Street, Joe decided it was time to take a break from big city life and settle down. Within a year of his arrival to Tall Oaks, Joe met Gwen and her two daughters and decided maybe he’d take a stab at family life. Three months into the marriage, family life quickly grew dull, and Joe was itching to have some fun again. It was time for a night on the town… right after he put Gwen and the kids to bed.

WHAT’S IN A BOOSTER PACK?
1 New Slasher character piece
1 Character profile card
1 Special Ability Token (unique to the character)
3 New “Killer Scenes, Dude” cards themed to the character
1 Special Ability reference card"

-description from publisher's website

name: Sudokan
description:
Sudokan is a flip and draw thinky filler game, with a unique twist fighting mechanism.

The players are Daimyos who are summoned by the Emperor to protect the kingdom from the barbarians. They must use the Sudokan, a forgotten art of encrypted military strategies and send it to the Emperor to be evaluated.

Players must draw monks, clans and Toriis to create the best strategy. Every round will have battles and they need to choose carefully which regions they want to fight to win. Because you can´t win it all.

Besides that, the Daimyos must pay attention to the Emperor impositions which along with battles, also give victory points.

In the end of the game, the player with the most victory points wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Line Drawing, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Not Alone: Sanctuary – Minerva-MK18
description:
Promo Monster card for Not Alone: Sanctuary
Issued with Plato Magazine #133 (March 2021) for the French version.
The English version came with the kickstarter campaign.

Avatar card
Minerva-MK18
Cyborg
Not Alone icon

EN :
Phase 3 : The lost of your last Will does not move the Assimilation counter forward.
FR :
Phase 3 : la perte de votre dernière volonté ne fait pas avancer le pion Assimilation.
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Summit 2030
description:
Summit 2030 is a board game where players reflect, discuss and vote to bring the issues of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development to global attention.

The 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda, together with their 169 goals, address the issue of sustainability from different points of view taking into account, for example, education, health, gender equality, job opportunities, climate change, environmental protection.

By playing Summit 2030, participants will be able to identify with some of the stakeholders involved in the Agenda implementation process. The main purpose of the game is to bring the SDG of one’s chosen role (stakeholder) to the highest level of discussion, that is global attention.

Using cards you move your SDGs up on the scale. When an SDG reaches the top step, a vote begins. If all the players vote in favor, the round ends and the points are calculated. If even one player votes against, the SDG is placed on the lowest step and the round continues. Players have a limited number of votes against in each round.

The game ends after completing the third round, or at the end of any round chosen as the last one. The player with the highest score is the winner. In the event of a tie, the players share the win.

Summit 2030 is freely inspired by Stefano Luperto’s “King Up”.

—description from publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Educational, Environmental, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play

name: Orcs! Dicing with Death
description:
Orcs! Dicing with Death is a push-your-luck gambling dice game designed by The Guild of Good Games primarily to be played in the live action roleplaying world of Empire by Profound Decisions. No knowledge of LARP or Empire is required to play or enjoy the game.

The game starts with a “Pit Fight” set-up phase during which players determine the order of play for the main “Battle” phase. The Battle consists of several rounds during which each player in turn rolls dice to try to defeat barbarian orcs and collect coins as booty, before either taking casualties or deciding to withdraw from battle in order to avoid casualties. Whoever has collected the most coins when all the barbarian orcs are defeated wins the game.

-description from designer

name: Wargame for Kids
description:
A free print & play wargame suitable for kids age 7+. Your goal is to destroy the enemy army.
The game starts with both players roll one 6 sided die with higher die-roll moving first. The winner moves one unit of his choice. If the winner’s die roll result is twice than opponent’s roll the player can move 2 units instead of one or move one unit and fire one shot with the Catapult.
At the end of movement the player resolves combat between adjacent units.
After combat resolution the players re-roll again for who goes first.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Square Grid, Turn Order: Random

name: Quaxtep
description:
IntroductionQuaxtep is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white. The board squares alternate between a light and a dark color in a checkered fashion. On odd-sized boards, the center square must be light-colored.



PlayBlack starts the game by performing one action. From then on, the players alternate performing two actions per turn. The available actions are:


Placing a friendly stone on an empty light square.



Moving a friendly stone from a light square to an adjacent empty dark square.


You can only pass your turn, or the second action of a turn, if you have no legal actions available. There will always be a legal action available to at least one of the players.

The game is won by the player who completes a chain of stones of their color touching the two opposite board edges of their color. A chain is a set of mutually connected stones. Two like-colored stones are connected if they occupy orthogonally adjacent squares or diagonally adjacent dark squares.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Rebis: Elixir
description: This mini-expansion is part of the Matchbox Collection Encore series; it introduces three powerful one-time effects that are obtained when players close one another's shelves.

name: Pokémon TCG: Detective Pikachu Expansion
description:
The game is most definitely afoot—because there's an amazing Pokémon detective in town! Celebrate the POKÉMON Detective Pikachu movie with a special Detective Pikachu expansion for the Pokémon Trading Card Game.

In all, there are 27 cards inspired by the movie. Cards numbered 1/18 through 18/18 are available in special Detective Pikachu 4-card booster packs. The remaining promo cards are available at in-store events or in specific Detective Pikachu collections.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Hidden Fates Expansion
description:
A wild set loaded with all-time favorites, the Pokémon TCG: Hidden Fates expansion is a collector's dream and a player's paradise! Soar to new heights with the first TAG TEAM trio, Moltres & Zapdos & Articuno-GX, as well as Gyarados-GX and more than 75 Pokémon in their Shiny forms—including Mewtwo-GX and Charizard-GX! Reach out for the unusual, astonishing power of Pokémon, and discover your own Hidden Fates!


Over 150 cards
1 brand-new TAG TEAM Pokémon-GX trio
8 more new Pokémon-GX
15 Trainer cards
Over 75 Shiny Pokémon


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Charadon – Act I: The Book of Rust
description:
Forge world Metalica is the furnace heart of war production in the Charadon Sector.

Upon the orders of Abaddon the Despoiler, Typhus leads a vast invasion into the Charadon heartlands, seeking to besiege Metalica and infect it with Nurgle's plagues. Beneath his foetid banner fight not only the forces of the Death Guard, but also warbands from the Black Legion, Word Bearers, Alpha Legion, and countless others. Alongside them come twisted Chaos Knights, endless tides of mutants, cultists, daemons, and even the towering abominations of the Legio Morbidus.

Yet against this invading horde stands an Imperial alliance between the armies of the Adeptus Mechanicus, the Adeptus Astartes, the Astra Militarum, and many more. Fighting to dominate the systems of the Lirac and Obolis Sub-sectors, these mighty forces unleash their deadliest weapons in a war that threatens to annihilate the very worlds over which they fight.

Inside this 96-page hardback book, you'll find:

- Riveting background that reveals the sheer magnitude of the threat descending upon the Charadon Sector. The thrilling narrative details the opening gambits and developing war fronts that will push the Imperial defenders to their limits and beyond.

- An in-depth campaign system you can use to join the war for the Obolis and Lirac Sub-sectors on the side of the Imperial defenders, Chaos invaders, or anarchic xenos raiders.

- A wealth of Crusade campaign content, including unique relics and advancements for your units to reflect your Crusade force's participation in this sprawling war.

- Rules and matched play content including Armies of Renown – exciting themed forces that provide a whole new way of mustering a Warhammer 40,000 collection – and codex supplements for the Adeptus Mechanicus, Imperial Knights, and Drukhari.

- Additional content, including all new Legendary Missions, which enable you to refight iconic missions that are key to the narrative of the story.

This hardback book also comes with a black 1/4" ribbon marker.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this book.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Eiyo: Adversity
description:
This mini-expansion for Eiyo is part of the "Achievements" series of Matchbox Collection mini-expansions, and as such should only be opened and used once the 3 criteria on its envelope have been met; because of this...

SPOILER ALERT:

This expansion adds 5 new "Adversity" cards to the base game of Eiyo; each Adversity card changes the rules of the game for one type of enemy card, making the game more challenging.

name: Rebis: Golden Book
description:
This mini-expansion for Rebis is part of the "Achievements" series of Matchbox Collection mini-expansions, and as such should only be opened and used once the 3 criteria on its envelope have been met; because of this...

SPOILER ALERT:

This expansion adds a new set of 9 Golden Book cards (numbered 1 to 9), as well as a Homunculus token, to the base game of Rebis; these new Golden Book cards can be drafted to players' shelves during gameplay, and when they are placed, they also increase the multiplier of that shelf by placing the Homunculus token on the 2x multiplier space, permanently pushing any existing mixture tokens to the right.

name: Diver Down Deep
description:
A competitive card game for 2-4 players played over a number of 6-card hands until one player achieves the required gold to win.

Each player is a deep sea diver trying to find one of many sunken Spanish Galleons which may or may not have gold. Each diver is dealt 6 "Depth" cards and given two single coin treasure cards. The "Depth" cards consist of two suits - Octopus and Anchor and are numbered from 1 to 16 (meters). There are also two wild cards which are equal to zero meters of depth and may be used in forming discount hands or to deceive your fellow divers as to how many total meters may be in your hand.

Through discarding sets of two or three cards, the diver lowers the number of total "meters" held in their hand. Once the total is below 8, the diver may opt to declare "diver down" and claim the top most Treasure card. But be careful, another diver may have a lower amount of meters in hand and declare "Diver Down Deep" and claim that treasure instead, as well as claiming a single gold coin treasure card from the original declarer.

First diver to obtain Treasure cards totaling 10 gold coins is declared the winner.

name: Afterglow
description:
Afterglow is the hyperlight space skirmish wargame set in the far future. The players assume the role of STARCORE Commanders, a hybrid of human sentience and an alien supercomputer, and control a task force of hyper-sophisticated warships in objective-based battles.

Players design their task force of one to three ships using cards, then plot their actions against one another simultaneously. There is no randomization and every action pushes a game towards it's definitive conclusion. Every attack is potentially lethal and there is no armour. The only protection is for the ships to briefly travel back through time and space to a safe location: this is known as the Afterglow effect.

—description from the designer
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Afterglow: Outer Dark
description:
Outer Dark is an expansion for Afterglow, the hyperlight space combat game. In Outer Dark, humanity is being pushed to the brink of extinction by advanced spacefacing Bioships of an unknown origin. Rather than continuing to war with each other, STARCORE Commanders are being called upon to fight to protect the human race as a whole in a rearguard battle while a solution to the crisis is found.

Outer Dark introduces the Biocraft, which are fully controlled by an automata. This allows for a solitaire or cooperative experience for players. The Biocraft may be engaged in one-off battles, or players can use the rules for the campaign where players maintain a persistent fleet of ships. They're also required to manage the strategic resources of a sector while managing it's evacuation as the Biocraft assault the sector.

-description from designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: 黄衣の王がやってくる前に (Koui no Ou ga yattekuru mae ni)
description:
Five characters mysteriously vanish while shooting a movie of the infamous play, “The King in Yellow”, only to find themselves in a strange place. Based on their testimonies, try to find a way out of this domain.

Before the King in Yellow Cometh (黄衣の王がやってくる前に), another title in ARCLIGHT’s Mystery Portable Series, is a cooperative deduction game set in the Cthulhu Mythos, with simple rules just by flipping cards.

Compared to the previous game, Letter from Innsmouth (インスマスから届いた手紙), in which players unravel horrifying childhood memories, this work is a suspense thriller – a tense escape drama set in a another world.

The ending may change depending on the number of cards flipped!

name: The Watcher
description: Allison Zeller has a secret admirer. She thinks the mysterious guy is sweet enough at first until his behavior escalates past simple admiration and spirals into full-blown obsession. Someone is stalking her and growing impatient that they can't have her. This infatuation culminates in a full-blown attack on Allison's life, leaving her at death's door. It's likely that whoever did this to her will come back to finish what they started. Can you find out the identity of Allison's stalker before it's too late? Can you unmask The Watcher?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Black Hats
description:
Forget about range, cover, and terrain - on this virtual battlefield you trade trenches for subnets and fire support for computer daemons. The battles on the network aren't fought with soldiers, they're fought with runners: hackers who compete over lucrative data servers, filled with corporate secrets.

Black Hats is a head-to-head skirmish-sized tactics game. Players take turns commanding their runners, spending crypto to support them with cards from a custom-built cyberdeck, and hacking the network upon which you play. There are dozens of runners and cards to choose from in deck building, allowing you to craft a strategy that feels unique to you and your crew.

The tactical core of the game revolves around the hacking mechanic. Territory on the board is defined by connecting groups of same-colored hexes into "subnets," but both players can change the color of any space at any time, reshaping the board as you play. An enemy that sits across the board may be absolutely unreachable or just a single space away and, if you can outsmart your opponent, you control which.

Hire your crew, customize your cyberdeck, and hack your way to an early retirement. This is Black Hats!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Variable Set-up

name: SUPPLY LINE
description:
A one- or two-player card-based wargame.

There is always one common element between adjacent cards, and when you put them together, the connected elements activate each other.

As you collect these cards in your hand, you combine them to form units to fight for the 11 frontline cards of the two armies lined up in one dimension. The cards in your hand, when lined up and tabbed, create attack power and special effects, so they must be "exactly" the same as either the temporary "repel" value, which makes the front line temporarily yours, or the "dominate" value, which gives you complete control of the front line, making it impossible to ever get it back, and which you can use as a new weapon repeatedly.

The elements are divided into four categories: Land, Sea, Air, and Supply. The Army can only attack frontline cards adjacent to their own territory, while the Navy can only attack blue frontline cards with an anchor symbol. Because of the restrictions on the attack range of the army and navy, you can't attack deep into enemy territory very well, so you must first "repel" the middle of the enemy's front line with auxiliary range enhancing effects from the air force and supply operations to convert it into your territory.

The designer notes that the game's cards were inspired by Dobble/Spot-It.

name: DeckBones
description:
The Whispers of Qaeos & Classic Solitaire"The kingdoms of The Gar worked peaceably together for thousands of years, building trade, prosperity and respect ... then came Qaeos, the Dragon Queen.

Qaeos and her minions ravished the land, plundered its resources and enslaved its people, aided by allies within the ranks of the kingdoms themselves.

You have three days to outwit the forces of Qaeos, free the royals, nobles and subjects of the kingdoms, restore order, and collect your reward."

Klondike Solitaire - Unplugged



GO OFFLINE
Step away from your phone
Close your laptop
Walk away from your desktop
Ignore alerts & messages
Tune out and dive in


DeckBones let you play classic solitaire (and other card games) offline using LESS SPACE than a full-sized deck of cards, with LESS FIDDLING, flipping and aligning of slippery card stacks.


NEW lore
FUN gameplay variants
UNIQUE Insurrection expansion




FEATURES
Available in NANO tiles (3/4″ x 1/2″)(19mm x 12mm) or MICRO tiles (1-1/8″ x 3/4″) (28mm x 19mm)
Ergonomic ‘bone’ shape — easy to pick up, manouver and manipulate
Play card games in extremely tight spaces
Use anywhere — coffee shop, lap desk, brief case
Pocket-sized, light-weight


—description from the designer
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Phrase Maze
description:
Players try to exit the maze board by answering clue cards that have rhyming answers. There are four categories available for play: Their Flair (People), Sports Shorts (Sports), Creature Feature (Animal) and Hodge Podge (Variety). Each card contains four numbered clues which determine how far a playing piece may move (e.g. - answering clue #3 means a player can move three spaces). There are three sub-categories in the game: Think Wink, Thinky Winky and Thinkety Winkety. These designate two-word answers of one, two or three syllables per word, respectively. However, since Thinkety Winkety cards are harder, they are treated as Wild cards that allow for moving five spaces on the board.

When a player gives an answer, opponents may either pass or challenge the answer. While there is one answer per clue, it is possible to have more than one correct answer. If a player passes, they accept the given answer. If they challenge, they consult the Challenge Card and check the answer given. If the answers don’t match, it’s an automatic wrong answer. Once a team is correct, they can move their piece the number of spaces the clue stated, or they may hinder opponents by moving their piece farther from the exit. Moves are also not limited to completely one direction. For example, a move of three could be played as two backwards and one to the left.

The first player or team to get their piece to the exit on the opposite side where they started, wins the game.

name: Party Planner: Prepare for happiness
description:
Collect resources to arrange venues and invite people for the best parties in town.

Each turn you select one of two drawn resources. When you have enough resources you can use them to either prepare for parties or move to/arrange new venues.

You score points based on the number of invitations sent during preparation and the number of venues arranged.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bingo, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

description:
The Soviet Union lasted 74 years.

In the mid-1980s, a board game was created in one of Moscow intelligentsia circles, the participants of which found themselves in the center of the events of Soviet history, which was not yet over. Only the board was left of the game. Thirty years later, we found it in the International Memorial Museum.

The game was recreated, made more dynamic and modern. 74 models the stories of several families in the 20th century. The heroes of the game get married and fall into insanity, get an education and meet celebrities, sit in gulag camps and try to survive the war.

148 historical events presented in the game paint a comprehensive picture of Soviet life and tell about culture and science, wars and economic breakthroughs, political terror and international relations. Each event has a different effect on the characters, depending on their class (worker, peasant, "former", security officer, military, specialist, enemy of the people and informal) and how their personal life develop.
When moving along the board, player pick a card for their character personal life and another for the USSR.

The game ends when one of the players gets to 1991, the end of the Soviet Union.

The winner is the one who scored the most points by participating in various historical events, as well as the achievements of the Soviet country, in which his/her characters participated.

– mostly translated from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Salvo! Denmark Strait, 1941
description:
Salvo! Denmark Strait is a solitaire WW2 naval war game containing rules, game tables and war ships simulating The Battle of Denmark Strait in May, 1941. You'll need three dice (d6), paper and a pencil to play. Ship counters are included.

Extra warships allow for various "what if?" situations to be explored.

This game is part of Minden Games' 4 Naval WW2 Solitaire Games Bundle and is a companion game to Minden's Salvo! River Plate.

name: Ninja Panda
description:
Roll-write game in which we play the role of a ninja-panda warrior.

During the game we operate with a pool of dice, with which we use on two levels simultaneously: on the character card (which we develop and generate actions) and on the mission card (where we fight and perform tasks)

Each turn we use a pool of 6 D6 dice.Using them we learn new styles of fighting (e.g. with daggers, swords) - where later we can use dice with certain values to create attacks. We can use the dice to learn new skills that will help us, for example, to manipulate the results of the dice or strengthen our attacks. We can also get secret ninja weapons, which are disposable. At the same time there is a mission card game where we use our character to fight other ninjas and complete missions. For example, to defeat the fox ninja we need 2 fire attacks, which are created on the character sheet from the dagger fighting style and certain dice. We can also collect bamboo which activates certain abilities. After 8 turns of the game we count up the points and choose the best ninja panda.

-description from designer

name: Master Your Castle
description:
Roll&write game in which our task is to build a castle and set the inhabitants in it. Use the dice pool to build rooms and recruit residents in such a way as to earn as many points as possible.

Each turn we roll a pool of D6 dice. Then we use them as currency to build different segments.

When you own a certain castle segment (e.g. a wizard's tower) you can recruit a certain character (in this case a wizard) to your castle. Individual characters can also be strengthened which will give us more points and invest in building an underground vault.

After 8 turns the game ends and the player with the most points wins, taking into account point bonuses (e.g. having the highest castle, the greatest number of knights etc.)

-description from designer

name: Имаджинариум: Гармония (Imaginarium: Harmony)
description: This is an expansion to the game Imaginarium (Имаджинариум) which adds 98 new thematically cards designed for players as young as 6 years old.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Wakening Lair: The Dark Forest
description:
In Wakening Lair: The Dark Forest, 1-6 players must cooperate against overwhelming odds to rid a classic fantasy themed dark and spooky forest of its assorted ne’er-do-well monsters and haunts. Should they succeed, songs will be sung of their noble exploits for generations to come. If they fail, then the Dark Forest’s evil will spread across the realm.

Wakening Lair: The Dark Forest is a 1-6 player fully cooperative dungeon delve which plays in 45-60 minutes. Each player assumes one of nine heroes forming a party which must explore the forest disturbing and vanquishing its denizens. As they do, they’ll receive treasure in the form of weapons and magic items. Eventually, one of six monstrous terrors will awaken and try to escape the dark forest. Victory is achieved by defeating it before that happens!

Wakening Lair: The Dark Forest is a standalone sequel to the original Wakening Lair and the components of both games can be swapped for unique and new game combinations.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling

name: Bandits
description:
After a successful heist. Divvying up the bounty is always a fight. Who gets the largest portion? All Hands In but who will emerge victorious? In Bandits wager, bluff, double-cross your former allies, and win great riches in this game of skill and strategy for 2-4 Players.

Setup
All Blinks begin as Bandits, which swirl and pulse with their team color. Each player should take a single Bandit from the set of Blinks and set it to their chosen team color. Each time you double-click a Bandit, it will change team.

Once everyone has a Bandit in their color, take another Bandit and triple-click it: this will transform it into a sparkling diamond. Place the Diamond in the center of the table, then begin the game.
Gameplay (First Turn)
Bandits is played in turns, with each turn broken into three phases: Bidding, Results, and Cleanup.
Bidding
Each player secretly bids a number between 1 and 3 on their Bandit. To do this, single-click your Bandit to see the current bid. Once it’s revealed, you can single-click again to cycle through the three possible bids. A Bandit will automatically go back into its hidden state if you don’t click it for 2 seconds.

After everyone has chosen their bid, players take turns placing their Bandit onto the Diamond, starting with the first player and then going around the table clockwise. On the first turn, the player with the most money in their pockets goes first.

On the first turn, all players will attach their Bandits directly to the Diamond. When a Bandit is correctly attached, the face touching the Diamond will sparkle white.
Results
After all Bandits have been attached, it’s time to see the results. In Bandits, the highest unique bid is the winner. For example, if one player bids 3, another 2, and another 1, the player who bid 3 would be the winner. If, though, two players bid 3 and a third player only bids 1, the bid of 1 wins because it is the highest unique bid. If there is no highest unique bid, no player wins, and the turn moves immediately to cleanup.

To see the results, double-click the Diamond, which will begin calculating. After a few seconds, the winning Bandit will sparkle with victory, then receive their points. A Bandit that steals directly from the Diamond receives a number of points equal to 6 minus their bid, so 3 points for a bid of 3, 4 for a bid of 2, and 5 for a bid of 1.
Cleanup
After the results have been handed out, the losing players remove their Bandit from the Diamond. The winning player, if there is one, leaves their Bandit on the Diamond, extending the board outward. That player retrieves a new Bandit from the pile and sets it to their team color, and bids first in the next round..
Gameplay (Following Turns)
After the first round, there will be at least one Bandit attached to the Diamond permanently. This Bandit will display the number of points it earned, and will sparkle like the Diamond on its outside edge. This extends the Diamond itself, and changes the way that players bid for the rest of the game.

During betting, instead of attaching to the Diamond itself, a player can place their Bandit onto the outside edge of the scored Bandit. They must attach directly opposite the Diamond, and their Bandit will sparkle as if attached to the Diamond itself to show that this was done correctly. Because they can only be attached in this way, the number of available faces is always 6, even after multiple Bandits are stacked outward.

If a player wins a round by attaching to another Bandit, they also score differently. Instead of taking points directly from the Diamond, they steal points from the Bandit they attached to equal to half its points, rounded up. For instance, if you win a round while connected to a Bandit that had scored 3 points in a previous round, that Bandit would lose 2 points and you would gain 2. Points will only be stolen from the Bandit on the outside edge, meaning once a Bandit has been stolen from it will keep the remaining points for the rest of the game.

In a typical game of Bandits, players can only build out to a distance of 3 from the Diamond.
Win Condition
The game ends when no more bids can be made. This might be because there aren’t enough Bandits left to play a full round, or because the Diamond has 3 scored Bandits attached to each face.

When the game ends, each player adds up the points they scored on each of their scored Bandits. The player (or players) who scored the most points is the winner!

Long press any Blink to reset all connected Blinks back to unscored Bandits.

name: Neurojackers
description:
In the future, hackers have kept ahead of cyber security by augmenting their bodies and minds to physically integrate with computer networks in order to subvert them. They’re known as Neurojackers.

You’ll lead a team of Neurojackers against a Corporate AI, or you can duel with a rival team for supremacy in this solo or 2-player card and dice game.

Roll dice and match the combinations to your ‘Contact’ cards in order to attack. Cards have a unique flipping mechanism that reveal additional actions you can take on future turns using the 'Protocol' side of the cards. Some Protocols have actions that you can use during your opponent’s turn, or the AI's turn when playing solo.

When playing solo, you'll go up against a Corporate AI that will attack you and protect itself. You'll need to use your available actions to maximize your dice rolls, counter-attack and defend yourself against the brute force of the AI's systems.

If you take your opponent offline, then you win!

-description from designer

name: Monopoly: New York City Edition
description:
Since Peter Minuit bought the island of Manhatten from the Manhatten Indians in 1626 for about twenty dollars in beads, cloth and trinkets, New York City has been one of the most exciting cities in the world. There's an undercurrent of energy that keeps the city growing and changing. It is home to leading artists, writers, and performers. It is the center of commerce, culture, and communications.
Although the great hall on Ellis Island is now a museum, New York remains America's gateway to the world. And everything about New York is world class. From the famous flagship Bloomingdale's and Macy's stores to Madison Sqaure Garden. And if there is anyone with world class pride, it's a New Yorker. If you have any doubt, just look at the way they root for their Knicks and Rangers, or consume the Sunday New York Times.
It's the city that never sleeps... but when you need to, there are premier hotels fir for kings and queens... The Essex House, The Regency, and The Plaza. It's the city with th unforgettable skyline: the Empire State Building, the World Trade Center, and, of course, the Statue of Liberty.
Now you can capture the excitement and feel the energy of New York City, from Grand Central Station to Central Park, from the ultimate Fifth Avenue toy store, FAO Schwartz, to America's premier public television station, Thirteen/WNET, as you travel around the game board of the New York City Edition of Monopoly® buying, selling and trading some of the most vluable real estate in the world.

Buy! Sell! "Pass GO and Collect $200!" Or "Gp directly to Jail!" All the fun and excitement of Parker Brothers classic real estate trading game is here in the New York City Edition. Buy railroads, utility companies, and properies of all types - including the valuable Trump Tower and Tiffany and Co. Increase the value of your properties by adding houses and hotels. Amass the greatest fortune in money and property and ou're the winner!

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Income, Investment, Loans, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: 舞妓ジャングル (Maiko Jungle)
description:
This is an irregular sugoroku game for two players who are trying to get to the goal before their opponents in Kyoto, which has suddenly turned into a jungle.

It's sugoroku, but without dice.

When you move forward, you reveal all of your cards to your opponent. If the cards in your hand meet the requirements of the next square (e.g., you have a "5" in your hand, two red cards, etc.), you can advance to the next square.

If you can create a hand that can meet the conditions of multiple squares, you can advance to several squares at once in one turn.
It's hard to decide whether you should have all the cards in your hand and move forward at once or chop them up into small pieces.

Since the sugoroku squares are cards, the board changes every time you play, and the best way to make the best hand changes every time, so you can play with a fresh mind as often as you like.

In addition, each card is a real-life jungle of tourist attractions in Kyoto (Kyoto Tower, Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine, etc.).
It is also fun to see the beautiful maiko pieces you use strutting around the exotic Kyoto.

The game takes about 15 minutes per game, and is a game for two players that can be played easily while worrying.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Pass the Deck: A party starting drinking game
description:
Pass the Deck is a fun party-starting, friend-making, villain creating drinking game.
How to Play: Players compete in various mini-games like "naming Disney movies" and "having a strip off". The goal of the game is to be the first person to win 3 Golden Beer cards.

Unique Game Play: Secret Cards are kept secret until someone unknowingly completes the action on the card ("Next person to use the restroom drinks"), and Rule Cards which force you to do something ("Grab drinks for anyone that needs one until the end of the game").

Includes 112 unique cards, 13 blank cards for your own hilarious ideas, and a koozie for the winner (to remind the others who the ? is).

Perfect for tailgating, college parties, 21 runs, bachelor/bachelorette parties, camping, pre-funking / pre-gaming, white elephant / secret Santa gift for those that love drinking games.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Connections
description:
Based on the Granada/ITV game show that ran from 1985-1990, in which players score points by by answering general knowledge questions and make connections from letters, numbers and picture clues.

The game is divided into six rounds: Connect the Clue, Link the Letter, Find the Figure, Link the Letter, Find the Clue, and Connect the Clue.

Connect the Clue involves answering questions and figuring out the connection between the picture clues that go with them.

Link the Letter involves answering seven questions, with the first letter of each answer being placed on the board. Players win the round by unscrambling those letters and coming up with the correct word.

Find the Figure involves solving a long math equation. Again, players answer questions, with parts of the equation being placed after each answer. The first player to solve the equation wins the round.

Scoring for each round is 10 points per correct answer, and a bonus of 100 points for making the connection, except in the final round, where it’s 20 points per answer and 200 bonus points for making the connection. The player with the highest score after six rounds wins.

name: Tumble Tumble
description:
Tumble Tumble is a wooden block stacking board game requiring skill, strategy and dexterity. The aim of the game centres around building a stack of wooden blocks to create an unstable tower and making sure you dont make it TUMBLE TUMBLE. If you cause the tower to TUMBLE TUMBLE you lose the game. Players need to assess tilt angles, leverage, surface friction, weight and positioning and possess manual dexterity skills. The game has simple rules and a short playtime of under 15 minutes. It can be played from 1 to 5 players and is ideal for ages 6 and upwards. Game contains 60 hardwood blocks, base board and instructions.

—description from the publisher

name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Clan Invasion Cards
description:
Alpha Strike is BattleTech’s fast-playing game of armored combat. Alpha Strike Clan Invasion Cards contains the ‘Mech Units that sprung from the distant Periphery to terrorize the Inner Sphere and ‘Mechs designed to repel them. Full-color, poker sized, and laminated for dry-erase use, you just need miniatures and dice and you’ll be battling for control of mankind’s tenuous future.

98 double-sided, dry-erase cards expand players’ available ‘Mech roster.
10 double-sided combat command cards include special rules to play units of renown from BattleTech lore.
Includes all the ‘Mechs from Technical Readout: Clan Invasion
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: It's Alive!: Monster-Making Mayhem
description:
Be the first to assemble a monster from different body parts and bring it to life!

A monster must have the following body parts: A head, a torso, a left arm, a right arm, a left leg and a right leg.

Use power cards to improve your chances or to hinder your opponents! This is where the game really comes to life. From creating monsters with different background colours to stealing cards from your opponents or destroying their power cards, you'll find many fiendish ways to give yourself an advantage - but beware, your opponents will be trying to play the same tricks on you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Race

name: Act One
description:
'"For sheer fun, it's one hard act to follow . . ."

Act One is the exciting game where players do "almost anything" to try and get their teammates to guess titles of popular movies and TV shows. You'll laugh your head off (until it's your turn) watching your teammates do their best to act or read famous lines from movies and TV shows while they try to beat the clock (actually it's a sand-timer). The sooner teams guess titles correctly, the more points are scored! (But, who cares who wins, when it's this much fun).

No batteries necessary . . . Teammates not included.

Almost two thousand movie and TV moments from the 70's, 80's and 90's. Great party game.

Games Magazine Top Games Selection

Now includes: 25% more cards & the new "Almost Anything Goes" round!'

—description from the back of the box

name: Goons: The Junkyard Expansion
description:
The Junkyard Expansion for Goons introduces a brand new Junkyard location to finally give players a chance to do something useful with all those annoying junk cubes laying around! Just snatch a junk cube, take it to the Junkyard and trade it for something useful! Just keep in mind that the Junkyard might want a little something in return...

The expansion also introduces 5 new Items to throw your money at. Get a hold of a super gnarly skateboard, badass nunchucks, a can of refreshing Knuckle Soda, gloves or a butterfly knife!

And of course, 4 more zany Villains with new Schemes presenting new risk, rewards and challenges! Will you throw your support behind Big Carls wacky wildlife shenanigans? Join Aztro’s psychedelic pattern based schemes, support Teresas explosive plans, or help The Void perform his uncanny rites?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Angry Birds Go! Jenga: Pirate Pig Attack
description:
The popular Angry Birds app comes to life in this epic Pirate Pig Attack Game! Can you triumph in this fast-crashing game? Launch your birds to take down the dastardly pirate ship and topple the swashbuckling piggies on their perches! Load your kart and target the pigs just right with your launcher. When you take out the pigs' sailing vessel, you'll become the feather-flying champion of the Pirate Pig Attack Game!

Pirate Pig Attack Game challenges you to take out a Jenga pirate ship with your bird and launcher

Topple the ship for the Angry Birds win

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: 80': the Eightieth Minute
description:
A solo soccer storytelling game.

Experience the last minutes of the last match of a grueling soccer campaign, the glory or the heartbreak of an all-or-nothing result. Ten minutes plus stoppage time remain. All still to play for.

It is the 80th minute . . .

To play you will need:

10 to 20 minutes
two 6-sided dice
a standard 52 card deck
a 20-sided die (or pen and paper)
some way to narrate the events as they unfold on the pitch


Flip a card representing a minute of time and roll to see if your team has the grit to weather the late pressure, if the referee is going to add more time.

Narrate the play on the field (for a radio, blog, or newspaper audience) based on prompts tied to each card.

If the last card is discarded before a goal is conceded, your team wins the title (or avoids relegation, or qualifies for the World Cup)!

—description from the designer

name: Delenda Roma
description:
It's the end of the Roman Empire: barbarians at the gates, rebels inside the empire, fighting in the senate.
Will you be able to avoid fate, or will Rome be destroyed?

Delenda Roma is a single player board game when you try to stop the inevitability of the history.

At the start of the game player get a limited amount of gold and armies to be placed on roman provinces, then gameplay is divided in phases:


Event phase: from a deck of cards a new challenge is revealed ( like for example new barbarian invading from outside of the empire or a rebellion on the roman provinces).
Battle phase: for provinces with enemy armies a deterministic fight occurs
Upkeep phase: determine for provinces who is in control and apply consequences
Enemy phase: every enemy units move according to their type
Player phase: player can spend gold to move armies (by land and sea), recruit new armies, placate rebels or bribe the senate
Senate phase: from another deck of cards a senate card is revealed and player has limited turns to fulfil the mission


Player lose when barbarian or rebels take control of Roma and win if they can survive at least 20 turns.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Die Schotterbande
description:
Die Schotterbande, a co-operative board game for children from 6 to 10, teaches the handling of money in a playful and realistic way, and this is the story behind the game:

A group of friends overhears a secret conversation. Villains want to steal all the money in town! The children want to prevent this at all costs. In just 10 days, they must become superheroes to protect the city's money bunker.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Set Collection

name: Fan Fu Football
description:
Fan Fu Football is the live action fantasy football card game designed to play along with live or recorded football games.

Fan Fu Football brings 1 - 4 players into direct fantasy competition at every kick-off. Football is a game of "Touchdowns" and "First downs". Our simple game mechanics grant our players drive by drive action without infringing on watching the game.

Turn on a game, deal 5 cards, and on kick-off put fantasy cards "In Play". Immediately redraw to a 5-card hand (draw after every card put in play).

On every subsequent first down, put more cards in play. The first "Drive" always begins with a kick-off and player also play on first downs, so each game usually starts with two plays, to start a "Drive". Stack your cards of the same position or diversify your position cards to get maximum points on each drive of the game. Star and Rookie cards can be played at any time and can perform different actions and bonuses, as well as score points.

A "Drive" ends with a punt, turn-over, field goal or touchdown. If a "Drive” ends with a punt or turnover, score the points for the cards in "In Play" and discard them. When a "Drive” ends with a field goal or touchdown, score the points for the cards in "In Play", discard them, as well as your hand, and draw a new hand. It's just that simple.

Pick up and play on certain drives, per quarter, half, or a whole game. The easy scoring system helps keep track of the score.

Are you a gamer who loves sports too? This game was built by gamers and requires strategy. Gameplay is based on live events, guaranteeing each round of Fan Fu Football will be unique. Whether the game is high scoring or low scoring, the proper strategy will allow players to score fantasy points. Players can utilize both offensive and defensive cards during a drive, adding flexibility to strategic play.

From youth to professional, play fantasy football with any game, anytime. The portability of Fan Fu Football makes it easy to take to a friends' house or to carry when traveling. Great for game watching parties or family gatherings, combine multiple decks to add more players. You can also play a solo version, where you log your score for every solitary game and try to beat your high recorded score.

Fan Fu Football brings an extra level of fun and excitement to any game.

—description from the publisher

name: Mini Express: Map Pack 1 – Taiwan & United Kingdom
description:
Mini Express Map Pack 1 - Taiwan & United Kingdom contains a double-sided game board with new and challenging rules for Mini Express.

You conquered the Wild West.

You conquered the Old World.
