Players are each dealt a hand of cards and one command card. Players have two options on their turn: play a card in the field or declare "abduction!" and collect cards from the field to get out of the round.

If you play a card in the field, you need to match the colors or numbers of the adjacent cards vertically and horizontally, or match the colors with multicolored cards. If you declare "abduction!", you can select one row vertically and horizontally and collect up to 5 cards from the edge. You can only abduct once, then you are out of the round.

Abducted cards that match the color of the command card will be scored, and leftover cards in hand will be negative points.
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Black Party: Dying at the Discotheque
description:
In "Black Party" the players embody characters who are involved in a spectacular murder case. One of the players is the murderer. But the others also have their dirty secrets or a motive and each of them have an extra task that only they know.
The group decides by guessing and reconstructing the crime who is the murderer and afterwards the players see if the group was on the right track. So it's about getting away with life. Because what good is it to be innocent if the others think you are guilty?

In "Black Party - Dying at the Discotheque" the players are famous pop stars, hip artists, and corrupt politcians partying at a 1980s disco in New York City. They have to try to find out who murdered real estate tycoon by letting the giant disco ball crash down and hit him...
categories: Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Farting Frenchies: Kickstarter Exclusive Cards
description:
A set of six cards only available during the Kickstarter.

1X Professor Stink Brain
1X Frenchie Fizzle
1X Toot-i-chu
1X Fart-a-saurus-Rex
1X The Wet Willy
1X The French Fry Farter
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Chrome Hammer Ascension: Ride or Die
description:
The first expansion to Chrome Hammer Ascension includes the following new features:

A new Role for your Crew:
The Jockey sends their specialized Mini-Drones ahead of them to take on the Corporate forces. This includes new Edges for the Jockey, four different types of specialized mini-drones, and a drone-specific cybernetic implant.

New Enemies:
The Corp Jockey remains hidden, and can't be found until the drones that they're sending after your crew can be traced.
The Sensha tank drone is nigh invulnerable, requiring a lucky hit to take down, but bragging rights for the 'Punk that does.
The Corpomancer is a magical unit that uses the spell rules to throw fireballs at the 'Punks.

New Scenarios:
Welcome Wagon has you hacking turrets before the VIP gets home. Surprise!
Distraction is a balance between drawing attention to your Crew and calling down the entire Corp on your heads. Also, exploding barrels!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ASL Comp Afrikakorps: Operation Torch
description: ASL conversion of an expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war in October 1941. Adds 8 scenarios. Comes in a ziploc bag.

name: ASL Comp Afrikakorps: Combined Arms
description: ASL conversion of an expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war in October 1942. Adds 8 scenarios. Comes in a ziploc bag.

name: ASL Comp Afrikakorps: Second Time Around
description: ASL conversion of an expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war in October 1942. Adds 8 scenarios. Comes in a ziploc bag.

name: ASL Comp Afrikakorps: Hellfire Pass and Beyond
description: ASL conversion of an expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war in June 1942. Adds 8 scenarios. Comes in a ziploc bag.

name: Don't Look Back: The Gourd Reaper Expansion
description:
Pumpkin Head's name was said three times, in three different mirrors, in three different houses on All Hallows Eve. It's now bound to this neighborhood. Now you have to destroy his soul pumpkins before his grim harvest continues.

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 1 Gourd Reaper Killer miniature, 4 Pumpkin Marker miniatures, and 1 custom scenario to the base game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: MAGICSPORT Magnetfussball
description:
Collectible Football (Soccer) game with comic style animal teams.

Can be played on any even underground (i.e. table or smooth floor) or on the Football field mat included in the main package.

The figures were included in the known „Kinder Überraschung“ („Kinder Surprise“). These chocolate eggs were very popular in Germany and other countries.

They alway had a yellow capsula inside, which contained some small toy - about 1/7 to a certain campaign theme, like Asterix, the Smurfs or - in 2006 - before the Football World championship in Germany: Comic animal footballers with a magnetic bade.

They could be used to „push“ around the metall „football“ to score goals,

There were 5 teams (Yellow / Red / White / Blue / Green) and some accesories to be collected. Each complete Team had 1 goal keeper and 2 field players. But even with only 2 players one could have a little soccer game on any table etc

name: Ratingen-Spiel
description:
This is a game about the German city of Ratingen, and was likely part of a radio promotion (Radio Neandertal UKW 97.6).

The board is divided into districts. Players place tiles representing a different industry (service, trade, hospitality, leisure, residential) into matching districts and score points based on which where it was played and how many other tiles had been played there. There are also three, black-bordered wild plots that can be from any industry. The game comes with 60 tiles and show actual companies and organizations from Ratingen ... or at least were in Ratingen in 1998.

To begin the game, the tiles are shuffled and placed face down in a general supply. Each player draws 6 tiles and places them face up in front of them.

On each turn, the following may happen:


Exchange: The active player may give two tiles to another player and take one of their tiles. This cannot be refused.
Place Tiles: The player may place as many tiles as they want onto empty plots in one district. Tiles much match the plots by color. The player then scores points according to what is printed on the board for that district and the number of tiles placed there.
Draw Tiles: The player draws 0-3 tiles from the supply. This number must be announced before the first tile is drawn.


Each action is optional, but they must be performed in the above order.

The game ends when all plots have been filled, or if one player has placed 5 sets of tiles on the board (i.e. placed tiles on 5 separate occasions during the game). If that happens, all other players get one more turn each. Each remaining unplayed tile is -5 points for the player holding them, and then whoever has the highest score wins.

—user summary

name: Critical Mass: Power Transceiver promo card
description:
Promotional card for 'Critical Mass' available via the Dice Tower and the BGG Store.

Text on the card reads "All your (electrical) weapons gain +1 firepower".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Critical Mass: Reinforce promo card
description:
Promotional card for 'Critical Mass' originally available the BGG store.

The card text is "Put back into play any of your destroyed armor plates whose combined durability is 3 or less".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Peekaboo sesamstraat
description:
Peekaboo sesamstraat is a memory game with pictures of sesame street.

6 colored tiles with small holes are placed over the sesame street pictures. The player on turn trows the 6 colored die and has to guess which picture is under the corresponding colored tile.

In the end the player with the most correct guessed pictures wins.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Legacy Quiz
description:
The fun part in each trivia game is answering new questions. So gather cards from your trivia games and let's start having fun.

Players ask questions from various trivia games. The first player answering the question correctly gets a point.
When all questions on a card are asked this card will never be needed again. So destroy the card.

After all questions have been asked exchange the coins into dice. Throw the dice. The higher result wins.

The legacy part in this game is not only that the cards are destroyed but that rules may change over time as they have to be adapted according to the used questions cards and your gaming group.

—description from the designer

name: Give me A++
description:
Brrrringggggggg (School Bell Rings)

The exam is going to start in 5 minutes. This is a game that every student will try to take a exam in the same classroom. Whoever can get the 100 points (A++), he/she will be the winner of the game.

Before the game starts, players need to choose which colors they would like to represent. There will be a surprise if you can win the game.

During the gameplay, there will be two phase. First phase is [Card Placing]. Players need to take turn placing one of the card on the empty seat. How many turns to play is based on how many players in the game, 2/3/4/5/6 players, 4/3/2/2/2/ cards will be on the gameboard.
Second phase is [Resolution], players flip over all the cards on the gameboard and start resolve them by order. Every fun situation will occur during this phase. Players will +/- points by cards effect. Whoever can get the 100 points during the game is the winner.

Early 70's grand-tactical miniatures game of armored warfare on the East Front. Stands and model vehicles are platoons. Sighting rules, simultaneous movement (either via orders or map-plotting) and "Platoon Substitute Markers" provide some fog-of-war.

GDW Command Decision cites this game as an antecedant.
publishers: (Self-Published), (Unknown), Gamescience, The Courier Publishing Co., Inc.

name: Palio: Il Gioco di Carte
description:
Relive the atmosphere of the race but also the rivalry and magic of this extraordinary and unique event through an immediate and fun card game.

The game takes place in 16 rounds represented by 16 Path cards that highlight characteristic features of Piazza del Campo where the famous Palio race takes place. Some sections are repeated because the horses make 3 laps of the square. The first card represents "la mossa" or the start, while the last is "il bandierino" that is the end of the race.

The player who at the end of the last round finds himself with his district (contrada) in first position has won the Palio.

—user summary

name: Shut Out
description:
Players have to play numbered cards sequentially in a tray after placing a marble into a slot on the game. The marble takes a variable amount of time to emerge as there are numerous internal pathways in the game, when it comes out it triggers a mechanism to close a pair of plastic hands over the game tray thereby "shutting out" everyone. Whoever played the last card before the shut out has to pick up all the cards in the tray.

The first person to exhaust their hand wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Blood in the Dungeon
description:
Blood on the Dungeon is a free expansion for Blood on the Blade (BoTB). This rule set includes everything you need to introduce a classic Dungeon Crawl play mode for BoTB.

This set of rules makes it possible to play a BoTB Scenario using “classic” dungeon tiles (rooms and corridors). Every major fantasy game includes standard dungeon tiles and it’s also very easy to find cheap (or even free) map tiles on the web. Playing BoTB using dungeon tiles provides a different mode of play and can be a fun interlude within your Campaign... of course, nothing prevents you from playing a Dungeon-only Campaign either!

You need the Blood on the Blade rules to use this expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Grey Knights
description:
The most mysterious of the Emperor’s servants, the Grey Knights are a unique Chapter of Space Marines. Each is an elite warrior-mystic clad in sigil-scribed power armour and wielding archaic weapons through which they channel their otherworldly abilities. They are a purified order, incorruptible and possessed of iron fortitude. They have to be, for the Grey Knights face down the most nightmarish horrors from the seething depths of the warp: the Daemons of Chaos. Their Brotherhoods use the shifting immaterium to their advantage, drawing on it to direct coruscating energies and outmanoeuvring their foes through pinpoint teleportation. Their warriors unleash a storm of firepower, supported by sanctified battle tanks, gunships, and giant warsuits whose psychic weapons can banish the greatest of Daemons back into the warp.

The secretive and sinister 666th Chapter of Space Marines are a force of elite warriors, even beyond their Adeptus Astartes kin. Each member of the Chapter has an affinity for the powers of the warp, and they can channel their gifts in battle to blast their foes apart with bolts of energy as well as the might of their arms. Clad in power armour of unusual design, and armed with weapons of rare potency, this small but deadly army strikes from their hidden base on Titan, more than a match for the strongest enemies the Imperium must face.

Inside this 112-page book, you'll find:

- The clandestine legacy of the Grey Knights, including their myth-shrouded founding and classified operations throughout the history of the Imperium
- A guide to the unorthodox organisation and heraldry of the Grey Knights and their various Brotherhoods
- A Grey Knights bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
- A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
- Rules for units that are available to the armies of the Grey Knights – including 32 datasheets
- Stratagems, Relics, and optional secondary objectives that illustrate the mystifying goals and remarkable tactics of the Grey Knights
- A Crusade section providing Agendas, Crusade Relics, Battle Traits, Requisitions, Psychic Fortitudes, Honoured Titles, and unique Daemonic Nemesis rules
- Loads more

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Dreadnought(ドレッドノート)
description:
A trading card game designed by SNE group and published by Kadokawa.
In this game, players use two main characters(called Awakening Warlock) and a deck of 50 cards to fight with the opponent. The game introduced a "cross counter system", "Cross Counter System" means that the player's and opponent's rounds are shared, and the order of attack is determined for each round. The player who defeated both opponent's two main characters will win the game
This game has already concluded in 2017.

name: Loco Lama
description:
Each player loads cargo on the back of the llama. If the llama goes beyond the bearable weight, the lama will lie down and won't move. (Llama may spit out to your face!)

In your turn, play a card from your hand and say the current running total. The round ends when the running total exceeds 50. Then calculate the sum of the numbers on cards remaining in hand as score, except for the player who exceeded ‘50’ gets zero points. After the fourth round, the player with the highest score wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Math

name: Trolling for Trouble: Shepherd/Brute
description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Shepherd/Brute. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the October 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Trolling for Trouble: Copper Robot
description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Copper Robot. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the January 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Trolling for Trouble: Changeling
description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Chageling. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the February 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Negotiation

name: Pokémon TCG: V Battle Deck – Venusaur vs. Blastoise
description:
Engage in a Pokémon Trading Card Game battle with the might of Pokémon V on your side in the V Battle Deck—Venusaur vs. Blastoise. This ready-to-play double deck bundle contains two full decks of 60 cards, one starring Venusaur V and one with Blastoise V. You and a friend can jump right into a match to see who will come out on top. This set also includes eight additional Trainer cards that can be used to bolster your deck. Not only that, but there are also useful accessories like playmats, damage counters, metallic coins, and deck boxes to enhance your experience. You can even improve your skills with guides to upgrading your deck and unlocking winning strategies, plus reference cards to make the game even easier to play. Choose your deck and prepare for battle!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Nintendo Co., Ltd., The Pokémon Company International

name: 그라울: 최후의 밤 - 확장 (GROWL: Expansions)
description: 그라울: 최후의 밤 - 확장 (GROWL: Expansions) is a compilation of 4 modules (Curses, Spells, Undead, 7 sins) to GROWL that was previously released separately in two boxes.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Deluxe Domino Dice
description: In Deluxe Domino Dice, each player in turn rolls up to seven domino-style dice — imagine two six-sided dice connected into a rectangular shape — and tries to place as many of them as possible following standard domino rules. The more dice you place, the more points you collect. You can re-roll once during your turn to try to place more dice, but if you can't place any, then you score nothing for that entire turn.

name: The Adventures of Dex Dixon: The Board Game
description:
The Adventures of Dex Dixon the Board Game is a scenario-based strategy game set in a multi-spoked, inter-dimensional, noir, horror world filled with Paranormal Detectives, Monster Crime Bosses and Vampire Torch-Song Singers. Choose your Boss, recruit your Mugs, assemble your gear, and charge your magical powers. Defeat your opponents and obtain your objective by outwitting them with each characters’ unique abilities. No two game sessions will be the same.

A limited area skirmish game with characters that have specific powers and abilities that can be augmented with cards that you draw throughout the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game

name: Evolution: Expansion – Time To Fly and Continents
description:
From the publisher webpage:

Familiar with the basic game, do you want to pursue more evolutionary possibilities? In the Evolution Expansions, you'll find a wide range of different traits and geographical elements to give you more variety in your tactics. The world is now a much wider place to play!

Can be played as a standalone game or combined with the series.

Objectives

Use the traits and characteristics of the creatures to keep their species alive
The player with the highest score at the end of the game wins
Introduction to the rules

The structure of the game is the same as that of "Evolution - Origin of Species", so if you don't understand the basic gameplay, please click on the link first.

New in this version

Each player receives an Evolutionary Isolation Card, which allows them to decide which zone their creature will be born in during the evolutionary phase.
Three Zone Cards are placed between players, each corresponding to the name of the zone on the Evolutionary Isolation Card.
Each Zone Card has a different way of generating food, and during the feeding phase, creatures can only take the food available in the corresponding zone, or hunt for it.
When a creature evolves an 'aquatic' trait, it moves directly to the 'Tethys Sea' area and then removes its aquatic trait, as an animal that is already swimming in the sea does not need to emphasise that it is aquatic.
"Migration" is a very powerful trait and should be used to good effect.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
publishers: More Fun Co., Ltd., Rightgames RBG SIA, TWOPLUS Games

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Pandorax Campaign
description:
A planet in the grip of chaos!

In 959 M41, Abaddon the Despoiler led a Chaos incursion fleet to invade the Imperial planet Pythos in the Pandorax star system. Within days the huge Chaos Space Marine army at his command had overrun the planet and opened a long forgotten Warp portal that unleashed a horde of Daemons upon the world.

In the book you will find:


The Pandorax Incursion which has a detailed history of the invasion
A battle report fought on an Imperial spaceship
A miniature showcase
Rules of Engagement
Datasheets
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Planetary Onslaught
description:
Invade and Conquer

For the war-torn worlds of the 41st Millenium, the question is not if the invader will come - merely when. Rumbling into low orbit over far-flung planets, colossal battleships herald their arrival with ground-ripping bombardments.

Planetary Onslaught provides missions and new campaigns that enable you to recreate each stage of an invasion on the tabletop, with one player assuming the role of attacker and one assuming the defender.

It offers new rules for Planetstrikes, Siege Warfare, and Cities of Death. It also provides datasheets for fortifications and terrain.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Gates
description:
An unusual 2-player abstract strategy game. Start the game by placing pieces onto the board — yours or your opponent’s. Then, guide your pieces to the escape gates before your opponent does the same.


OBJECT OF THE GAME
Score all of your Spikes by getting them to your Gates.

MOVEMENT
Players now attempt to move their Spikes to their Gates while blocking their opponent. The last player to place in Placement gets to move first in Movement. On your turn in Movement, pick any one of your Spikes and move it one space in any direction.

Trapezoids can land on enemy spikes to move them to any empty space.
Triangles move two spaces instead of one.

SCORING
When you move one of your Spikes into one of your Gates, the Spike is scored, removing it from the game.
After scoring, your opponent may then relocate the Gate that you just used, placing it on any empty space.
Your Spikes can’t move onto your opponent’s pieces (except for Trapezoids, which can land on enemy Spikes).
Continue moving and scoring Spikes in turns.

Once a player has scored all four of their Spikes, they win!

name: What Are The Rules Again?
description: A card game where players start with a core set of rules and come up with the rest of the rules themselves as they play. The game breaks rules into categories, requires one player to act as GM, and provides rule guidelines for new players.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Player Judge, Team-Based Game

name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield – Evolving Skies
description:
Feel the power of the shifting winds, and brace for an epic storm as mighty Dragon-type Pokémon make their triumphant return! Rayquaza VMAX leads the surge from on high, and Duraludon VMAX towers above the land in its Gigantamax form, joined by Dragonite V, Noivern V, and more. As the clouds part, Eevee's Evolutions appear in a full rainbow of Pokémon V and Pokémon VMAX to signal a bright new day in Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Evolving Skies!

Over 200 cards

18 powerful Pokémon V and 15 enormous Pokémon VMAX

Dragon-type Pokémon return with a new look

More new Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards

24 Trainer cards and a new Special Energy card

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: The Summoning of Kramdar
description:
The Summoning of Kramdar: A strategy-based board game where players compete against each other to call forth an ancient demon of untold terror.

Players take turns to move towards the altar to make a sacrifice to Kramdar, or they can betray their fellow cult members by sending them instead. Players who make valuable offerings earn more points, while less worthy sacrifices may incur the wrath of Kramdar. Be warned, if an opponent can appease Kramdar, the player who sent them to the altar shall be banished to the Valley of Lost Souls. Whoever has made the most important sacrifices and has the most points by the end of the game is the winner.

A game of wits, deception and sacrifice!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Topo
description:
Topo ("Mole") is a 3-part hidden role-play game with succinct rules that can be learned in just a few minutes. But don't be fooled by its apparent simplicity, to win consistently you will have to control the fine balance between deduction and intuition.

Two participants cooperate to achieve a common goal while the third sabotages their plans from the shadows. Sooner or later where Topo is played someone is going to lie. Can you find out before it's too late?

Social deduction games like this usually require many participants. With Topo we try to reduce that number to the minimum possible without losing the essence of the genre, which is the tension resulting from the balance between deduction and confusion.


Topo is a game for three, where two participants cooperate to achieve a common goal while a third ("El Topo") sabotages their plans from the shadows.

In turns, the players will deposit chips (of three types) in boxes to form different combinations.

The objective of the cooperators is to achieve the five combinations indicated on the board. The objective of the Mole is to sabotage the boxes that may contain these combinations ten times.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game

name: Parachutes: Play in the Dark Card Game
description:
1-6 players must construct a collective landing strip of cards with the aim of creating 'chute' patterns. However, you play in the dark! You must coordinate your effort using the glow in the dark dots on each of the cards corners. The winner is the player with the most 'chute' patterns - parachutes, almostchutes, semichutes - when the lights go on.

Players each receive a deck of cards that they play in turn by adding one card each to the centre of the table. Once all players have placed their cards the lights go on and scores are counted. Multiple rounds can be played and variant rules, such as speed play, can be introduced.

—description from the designer

name: Μαγνητικό Μπάσκετ Τσέπης (Pocket magnetic basket-ball)
description: Μαγνητικό Μπάσκετ Τσέπης (Pocket magnetic basket-ball) is a fun 2 player game themed after basketball.

name: Trzecie Powstanie
description:
In the night of the second to the third of May 1921 began the third Silesia uprising.

Silesia after the end of World War 1 was to be partitioned between Germany and the restored Polish state. The Poles however were not satisfied with the suggested partition, which would result in keeping by the Germans of a huge area which was primarily ethnically Polish.

The game released by Pospolite Ruszenie Szlachty Ziemi Krakowskiej is primarily an educational tool, designed to commemorate the 100'th anniversary of this successful Polish uprising.

It is a game for 2 players using two separate decks of cards and a board, depicting the area, where the fighting took place.
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management

name: ENIGMAS
description:
A multi-layered Puzzle Hunt experience within a luxury deck of playing cards. Solve puzzles, crack codes and discover secret messages!

ENIGMAS combines all of these exciting and intriguing worlds. Puzzles within puzzles within puzzles, within a luxury deck of custom playing cards. And all of this is themed on an estate shrouded in mystery called Riverbank ...

Included within this fully functional, seemingly regular deck of playing cards are four very special cards, each with its own puzzle for you to solve.

Solving all four puzzles will unlock an incredible, multilayered, eight-step puzzle hunt expertly designed by Dave Shukan, master puzzle-maker. Combine answers from every puzzle you've solved along the way and you will reveal the final, meta-puzzle answer. A true puzzler’s paradise!

ENIGMAS are themed on a fascinating historical place -- a mysterious estate outside of Chicago called Riverbank. Over one hundred years ago, the scientists at Riverbank worked on cryptography projects: the estate was filled with secret messages and codes. And exotic animals like alligators, peacocks, monkeys and bears roamed the property!

Illustrator Billy French has masterfully captured all of these bizarre and beautiful elements into the ENIGMAS design. The card backs are adorned with historically accurate imagery from the Riverbank estate, like its windmill and lighthouse. Owls, representing wisdom and learning, are perched on the bookshelves, guarding its secrets.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Pizza Puzzles: Meat Lovers
description:
Pizza Puzzles bring delicious art and a fun jigsaw puzzle experience to your table. Our pizzas are silly and fun to look at, but more importantly, they're puzzles you can build with your friends and family. A single slice is just one of eight smaller puzzles in the box. As you complete each smaller puzzle, you can assemble the entire pizza by slice. On each pizza you'll find countless toppings - the more you look, the more details you'll find!

Puzzles come with symbols on the back of the pieces, allowing you to assemble your puzzle by slice! Pick your preferred slice (maybe the one with your favorite topping) and chow down. Friends and family can race to finish their piece of the pie.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Monsterjäger Erweiterung
description: Monsterjäger Erweiterung contains four new "monster-thwacking" devices and 27 "shadow" monster cards that depict the 27 possible monsters from the base game, but only in silhouette. The rules in this expansion include two variants, one allowing you to play solely with the shadow cards and another that combines the two decks of monster cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Party Game, Real-time

name: Take That Towers
description:
Take That Towers is a tactical card game centered around dual-use cards with delayed effects.

Players build skyscrapers together. Each turn they'll play cards from their hand face-up to construct floors and face-down to stake their claim on the resulting real estate. Once a tower is completed, the effects of each floor will occur and players score points based on the arrangement. Score the most points before the deck runs out to win.

The game plays using a single 65 deck of square cards, and plays in a consistent amount of time regardless of the player count.
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Ownership, Take That

name: Sul'Bord d'la 20
description:
Put your knowledge of Quebec to the test. Charades, songs and multiple choice questions are on the menu. Are you ready to have some fun on Highway 20?

In the game, you have to answer questions with your team and the first that answer correctly 20 questions win the game.

Note : Game only in French
--
Mettez vos connaissances du Québec à rude épreuve. Charades, chansons et choix de réponses au menu. Êtes-vous prêts à vous divertir sur l’autoroute 20?

Dans ce jeu, vous devez répondre à des questions en équipe et la première à répondre à 20 questions gagnent la partie.

name: Terrain de Jeu: L'Asie
description:
Monsieur Olivier, also known as “le prof nomade” has two passions: traveling and teaching! He already shares memories of his journeys with young people through his videos and books. He now offers you to accompany him a little further in his adventures in Asia. Are you ready to become his travel partner, traveling the dusty roads between Turkey and Japan or the hazy seas between Indonesia and Russia? A stroll in the heart of the knowledge of these countries that you will not soon forget ...

To play : you have to roll two dices (a themes dice and an actions dice) and with the result of the dice you answer a question of one of the six themes.

To win :Be the first to complete your map of Asia (6 differents themes) by answering questions about this continent.
Only in French
--
Monsieur Olivier, aussi connu sous le nom de «le prof nomade» a deux passions : voyager et enseigner! Il partage déjà les souvenirs de ses périples aux jeunes par ses vidéos et ses livres. Il vous propose maintenant de l'accompagner un peu plus loin dans ses aventures en Asie.
Êtes-vous prêts à devenir son partenaire de voyage, en parcourant les chemins poussiéreux entre la Turquie et le Japon ou encore les mers brumeuses entre l'Indonésie et la Russie ? Une balade au coeur de la connaissance de ces pays que vous ne serez pas près d'oublier...

Pour jouer : vous avez à rouler les 2 dés (1 dé de thèmes et 1 dé d'actions) et avec le résultat des dés, vous répondez à une question d'un des six thèmes.
Pour gagner : Soyez le premier à compléter votre plan de l'Asie (6 thèmes différents) en répondant aux questions sur ce continent.

name: HARDCODED
description:
Hardcoded is a simultaneous action-selection fighting game, where players secretly program their characters to perform special moves in an attempt to outmaneuver and ultimately knock out their opponents. The game can be played free-for-all (2, 3, or 4 players), in teams of 2 (4 players), or against an AI opponent.

The game is played in rounds. Each round consists of several parts:
1. roll for speed (simultaneous, secret);
2. select actions (simultaneous, secret);
3. reveal actions;
4. player turns (each player in speed order move on the board and attack if possible);
5. pass priority tracker and start the next round.

Each character starts with 5 HP. When a character is dealt damage, their HP is reduced by that amount. A character reduced to 0 HP is Knocked Out (KO’d). A KO’d character respawns at the end of the current round. The player that KO’d them receives 1 point, and the first player (or team) to reach 2 points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: HEKKspedisjon: Ekspedisjon Europa
description:
HEKKspedisjon - Ekspedisjon Europa is a competition driven, mid level strategy game.

You play as one of six characters, traveling around Europe. Each character has his own strengths and weaknesses. You will encounter people that may help or hinder you along the way and you will rely on getting your hands on the best expedition-gear to stay in front. Both regular shops and the black market is available to you as long as you have cash in hand. Both competitions and individual expedition-goals will drive you towards your goal, but don't underestimate the power of gaining knowledge of places and people you encounter.

Each turn consists of 4 phases.
First phase is "Adjusting hunger". The player adjusts their hunger bar according to their placement on the board.
Second phase is "Shopping phase". Players may do repairs on their vehicle (if applicable) or buy food. Players may also buy items from the black market (if in a city) or from the shop.
Third phase is "Action / work". The player chooses whether they will do a job to earn money or draw a city event/travel event card.
Fourth phase is "Movement / work" The player chooses whether they do a job to earn money or if they want to move towards their next expedition goal.

The game ends when the first person enters the "End" position on "The winning track".
To win you need to collect expedition points and/or knowledge points. The first player to gain enough points to enter the "End" position of "The winning track" is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Evil In The North
description:
Evil In The North is a solitaire adventure game that is set in a dark wintry realm. The player oversees several game characters as they fulfill missions in this challenging environment. These characters represent a declining pagan population that is caught between the New Religion and the spiteful counter-religion known as the Growing Evil. This latter division includes ruffians, malicious necromancers, the infamous NecroFiend occultists, and demons from foul depths.

Player guided characters will travel on a map that consists of card tiles. These tiles require various checks as the characters move from turn to turn. At the same time, game controlled characters known as NecroFiends will be spawned; eventually traveling the tile map through an automated movement system. When player characters run into a NecroFiend, conflict is likely to occur. Opposition can also emerge through the Occurrence deck (from entering a tile) or through the Demon deck (upon exiting a tile). These encounters gnaw away at a character's vital resource --their followers. A lack of followers makes a character extremely vulnerable and will often lead to elimination from the game if more followers cannot be acquired soon.

Combat in the world of Evil in the North is resolved through two means, Brute Conflict and DarkArts Conflict. The former combat type is associated with physical conflict and uses a Combat Results Table involving up to three 4-sided dice. The latter combat type is associated with sorcery and uses a simpler system involving the combatants' INSIGHT ratings and a single 4-sided die.

The game is divided into 3 stages to represent the different missions to be undertaken. To win Evil in the North, a player must fulfill every mission started. The game is lost if all player characters perish during the performance of a mission, regardless of how many missions have been completed. Without losing, you may end a game after any mission (but before another has begun).

ABOUT THE REIMPLEMENTATION:
This game builds on Black Metal by offering a whole new map treatment. Rather than building the tile map as you play, Evil in the North uses a preset tile map that is arranged prior to play. The preset tile map constrains player movement to a 7 x 7 grid (removing the chances of a run-away tile map). Furthermore, additional map tiles have been added to create the vast Ice Sea; a central area of the tile map consisting of 9 map tiles. Additional rules have been created to serve this new aspect of the tile map.

Unlike Black Metal, a regular game of Evil In The North is played with full map disclosure (all map tiles are displayed face-up from the onset).

Other changes/additions include:
--Updated text on many cards (mainly to accommodate the new tile map)
--An updated and consolidated rulebook (integrating the Mission booklet)
--New and updated rulebook diagrams
--New rules and sections within the rulebook (including a new Q&A and Card Clarifications section)
--An official variant sheet for an advanced game
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ich fahr' voll ab auf Österreich
description:
Travel bloggers stage a challenge throughout Austria: Each player gains goal cards which depict beautiful places and nice vacation spots in Austria.

Who is the first to fulfill their goal cards and get the blogger pairs to their favourite destinations? Not easy, since the bloggers are traveling undercover. It's important to remember the last location of the blogger and be faster than the other players.

—decription from the back of the box (translated)

name: Dag en Nacht
description:
"Dag en Nacht" is Dutch for "Day and Night."

The board is an nxn squared board, where n is an odd number between 11 and 19. A 15x15 board is considered average. The board is laid out in a checkered pattern of black and white spaces. The white spaces are the most numerous, with the four corners all being white. The board starts off empty.

The players are Black and White, with Black going first. Each has a supply of stones in her color that fit the board spaces.

On a turn, a player takes one of the following two actions:


Drop a stone of her color onto a black space — a stone may never be entered in a white space.



Shift a stone of her color already on the board a single space orthogonally — in other words, move a stone from a black space into a neighboring white space.


The winner is the first player to get five of her stones in a row horizontally or vertically, or four stones in row diagonally on white spaces. Stones on black spaces cannot win with a diagonal line.

Optional rule: Players may decide to help mitigate Black's first move advantage by adopting a rule prohibiting Black from winning with the easier B-W-B-W-B orthogonal line and only allowing Black to win with the harder W-B-W-B-W orthogonal line.

name: Prognosis Death
description:
St. Muerte Hospital 10:00 pm -
A patient is admitted to the emergency ward with rapidly developing symptoms. Doctors rush to see the patient with morbid curiosity on the otherwise dull night...

Prognosis Death is a set-collection card game where each player is a doctor who is trying to take the credit for curing a patient. You’ll collect symptoms and use them to construct a diagnosis. You’ll challenge and outwit your rivals, and you’ll get the recognition you deserve – at any cost!

Your objective in Prognosis Death is to either have the lowest score remaining in your hand when the patient is discharged, or the highest score in the case that the patient succumbs to their illness and perishes.

At the start of every turn in Prognosis Death you’ll add symptoms to your hand by either drawing an unknown card from the deck, or by taking a card from the public discard area. At the end of every turn, you’ll have an opportunity to remove symptoms from your hand either by making a diagnosis, which consists of a set of matching symptoms, or by discarding a card to the public discard area.

Every symptom card has an effect that will either trigger when that card is discarded, or when you make a diagnosis with that card as the top-most card. Symptoms also have effects that will trigger when they are retrieved from the public discard area. Whether these effects help or hinder you will depend on the card!

Throughout the course of the game cards in each player’s hand will become revealed and will become accessible to players who can see them. For the most part you can use accessible cards in any player’s hand as though they were in your hand, but beware, cards that you have revealed become inaccessible to you - if it is still in your hand at the end of the game it will count towards your score.

—description from the designer

name: AirWar 1940: WW2 air combat rules (1939-1945)
description:
AirWar 1940 is the latest in our series of fun, fast play air warfare rules that cover the spirit of air combat whilst being a set that would be good for a newcomer to aerial wargaming, or for a more experienced “old hand” who wants a simple yet enjoyable set of rules to introduce new players.

After a couple of games reference to the rule book will become occasional with players concentrating on shooting down their opponents rather than ploughing through the sub-minutiae of clauses and appendices. The requirement for our rules is to provide a game that met the “5 minute rule” for explanation and the “45 minute rule” for game play.

The 41 page rulebook includes rules for aircraft characteristics, movement, special manoeuvres, dog fighting, ground attack, AA fire and even “auto-pilot” bomber formations so you can concentrate on the more fun aspect of shooting them down!
There are also ratings for 254 aircraft era aircraft from thirteen nations, from the last bi-planes of the 1930’s though to the first jets of the late 1940's and early ’50's.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stag knights
description: The Knights of the Stag are among the most prestigious Barathéons fighters, equipped with heavy armor and powerful two-handed weapons.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon card update pack
description: Find all the cards from the 2021 update in this pack of cards intended for Maison Barathéon players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Piedras del Universo
description:
Piedras del Universo is a game based on the mythology of our region, the Argentine Litoral. The theme is aimed at redefining natural spaces and putting players in contact with legends, customs and characters from native cultures.
The objective of the game is to obtain the 4 Stones that are originally located in the center of the board and are represented by pyramids. This is achieved by entering the box where the stones are or by taking them away from the other players, using the same method.

On each turn, a player can move their avatar, use nature powers, or change nature cards to summon one of the 4 animals on the board, so that more than one avatar can be used per player. If a player is caught, he loses the elements that he has been adding in his game (cards, powers, stones, animals) and returns to the origin, from where he re-enters the board.

The game ends when a player manages to collect the 4 Stones of the Universe

Throughout the game we can find sacred spaces of protection, with characters known to all such as the flap, the pachamama, the salamanca, native animals and the use of powers of nature to achieve objectives.

Piedras del Universo invites meeting, collaboration, concentration and strategy development, in addition to training adaptation to the unexpected and problem solving. Its instruction manual is at the same time, the construction of a story full of characters and situations that help us learn more about our own mythology.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Korea Solitaire
description:
Korea Solitaire covers the first year of the war.

Three types of naval units: gunfire, transport, amphibs. Amphibious invasion have to be planned two turns in advance.

Air units represent two groups each: tactical air, B-29s, F-86s, airlift. Communist airpower is represented by an AA track (interceptors+flak) which "fires" at UN Command air. You can knock down the AA level by air superiority missions. Other air missions include close support and interdiction. Interdiction is against the Communist logistics level. The lower the level, the less likely the Communists will go on the offensive. Thus, you have to allocate your airpower for what you think is thebest strategy.

Two random events table: one for the North Korean invasion, the second kicks in when the Chinese enter. One random event is Soviet air intervention, which raises the Communist AA level considerably. Reinforcements: these come in on randomly determined turns, mainly to show fog of war and vary each game. You can also bring in US units from the strategic reserve, at a cost in victory points (these include elements of the 2nd Armored and 82nd Airborne divisions).

Special rules:
US mechanized task forces (you can form them from divisions).
Chinese logistics surges (gotta do more interdiction to counter this!).
Eighth Army commander: either Walker or Ridgway, each with their own advantages.


Published in Strategy & Tactics #349

name: F.C.M.T.: Fighter, Cleric, Magic User, Thief
description:
A competitive, press-your-luck dungeon delver. FCMT is set in a magical dungeoneering competition where each of the legendary RPG classes will compete to determine who is the greatest adventuring class ever.

Players will face dangerous encounters, seek loot and weigh risk in an attempt to win dungeon tokens. These tokens are turned into dungeon gems. The first player to collect 3 dungeon gems is the winner.

FCMT uses the novel Fate Deck system for determining encounter outcomes. Instead of rolling dice, players draw fate cards that can be fueled by resources to increase their chance of success.

A new dungeon is created before each game by placing out a grid of face-down dungeon cards. Players progress through the dungeon by peeking at cards, revealing cards and trying to overcome the challenges they encounter.

By overcoming these challenges, which include traps, monsters and more, players will be rewarded with dungeon tokens. Each time a player earns 5 tokens, they are awarded a dungeon gem.

As soon as a player has 3 of these gems, they are declared the winner and the greatest dungeon delver of all time.

name: Catwalk
description:
The players have to move their cat from the starting field to the target field and walk around their territory.

Catwalk is a dice game in which the players have to walk along their territory. According to the result of the dice, you can move to fields in the territory and thus get closer to the goal. The player who does this first wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Chonkers
description:
Chonkers is an original game using a traditional deck of cards. Players play cards from their hand in an attempt to win cards from a central display which are dealt out at the beginning of the game. The won cards are combined with any cards left in hand. Hands are revealed. Best poker hand wins.

This is a light family-style card game comparable to Knizia's original Poker games found in Blazing Aces! Like those Knizia games, this is not a Poker variant, but an original game using poker rankings.

name: מספרים ואתגרים (Numbers and Challenges)
description:
The board is filled randomly with tiles with numbers on them. Some are positive and some negative.
One player uses columns and the other uses rows. When a player takes a tile, the next tile must be from the same row or column. When no tile is available to take, the game ends.
The player with the highest numerical total score wins.

—user summary

name: Cardline: Animaux mini-extension
description: The magazine "Manga Kids" N°44 (July-August 2013) offers an unpublished "sample" of cardline animals, which contains 32 cards different from the basic box.

name: ¿Qué País Soy?: Europa
description:
Trivial type game, with questions and challenges about the 50 Eurasian countries.

The game consists of 100 cards, 1 dice and 100 videos on YouTube.
Capital, language, currency and other questions about countries are what you will have to get right to accumulate cards and beat your rivals. The player with the highest number of cards wins the game.

The game has questions in QR codes that link to videos in which the location, anthem and images of a country will appear that you will have to get right before a countdown ends.


Juego tipo trivial, con preguntas y retos sobre los 50 países euroasiáticos.
El juego está formado por 100 cartas, 1 dado y 100 vídeos en Youtube.
Capital, idioma, moneda y otras preguntas sobre países son las que tendrás que acertar para ir acumulando cartas y ganar a tus rivales.
El juego tiene preguntas en códigos QR que enlazan con vídeos en los que te aparecerá la ubicación, himno e imágenes de un país que tendrás que acertar antes que finalice una cuenta atrás.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
